Title contains numbers at the end: Building another IPA server 42041352
string(11516) "{"id":2645,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Building another IPA server","slug":"building-another-ipa-server-czC","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-bu\">Operations Team : Building another IPA server<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-bu-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-bu-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Building another IPA server\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/span> on Nov 21, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-ipa03-host-had-p\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The ipa03 host had problems and became corrupted, so we needed to build another.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Since ipa03 was corrupted, I followed the process at:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/solutions\/626303\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/solutions\/626303<\/a><\/p><p>It said to remove current replication agreements<\/p><p>On ipa01 I did:<\/p><p>ipa-replica-manage del ipa03.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/p><p>This command also seemed to remove the DNS entries for ipa03<\/p><p>Next I logged into vcenter and took the old definition for ipa03 and removed three of the four drives and created a single 400GB drive.&nbsp; I booted with the normal RHEL7 server iso and built the system.<\/p><p>I logged in on the console and had to manually add IP info.<\/p><p>ip address add 10.192.0.3\/16 dev ens160<\/p><p>route add default gw 10.192.0.254<\/p><p>Add something to the \/etc\/resolv.conf:<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>search int.aci.ics.psu.edu<br>nameserver 10.192.0.1<\/p><p>nameserver 10.192.0.2<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I added the proper info the ifcfg-ens160 file in \/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts so things would come up correctly and changed the hostname from localhost.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I logged into the redhat site and found the info for ipa03.int.aci.ics.psu.edu and grabbed the consumerid from there to use to register the rebuilt system:<\/p><p>subscription-manager register --consumerid=7759cf5a-ac12-4881-b019-4c4b454c0ccf --name=ipa03.int.aci.ics.psu.edu --baseurl=<span class=\"nolink\">https:\/\/cdn.redhat.com<\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>It asked for my redhat login and password.<\/p><p>I ran yum update after that and it grabbed a lot of updates from redhat.<\/p><p>I then needed to install the ipa-client software:<\/p><p>yum install ipa-client<\/p><p>Since the DNS info was removed when removing the replication agreements, I used --enable-dns-updates.&nbsp; Since the other IPA servers are running ntp rather than chrony, I also added the --force-ntpd option. From the rebuilt ipa03 host I ran:<\/p><p>ipa-client-install --enable-dns-updates --force-ntpd<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>It asks for my IPA username and password and then installs the client info.<\/p><p>I copied over the ossec.repo and duosecurity.repo, but I needed the keys so redhat wouldn't complain when I tried yum update.<\/p><p>I grabbed wget to get the keys:<\/p><p>yum install wget<\/p><p>wget -q -O - <span class=\"nolink\">https:\/\/updates.atomicorp.com\/installers\/atomic<\/span> | \/bin\/bash<\/p><p>I removed the atomic.repo file and left the one I had copied from ipa02.&nbsp; The keys all worked out and the geoip stuff got installed.<\/p><p>I added security keys for duo and installed duo_unix:<\/p><p>rpm --import&nbsp;<span class=\"nolink\">https:\/\/duo.com\/RPM-GPG-KEY-DUO<\/span><\/p><p>yum install duo_unix<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I took a look at ipa02 and ipa04 in the yum history to see what other stuff was installed...<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Taking a look at ipa02 in the yum history, I see:<\/p><p>yum install vim<\/p><p>yum install ossec-hids-agent<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I copied the login_duo.conf file from \/etc\/duo on ipa02 to ipa03 and added:<\/p><p>ForceCommand \/usr\/sbin\/login_duo<\/p><p>to the bottom of the sshd_config file on ipa03<\/p><p>I restarted sshd and tried ssh to ipa03 and got the duo prompt.<\/p><p>I copied:<\/p><p>-rw-r--r-- root\/root 1510 2015-04-17 14:09 usr\/lib\/python2.7\/site-packages\/ipalib\/plugins\/icsaci.py<br>-rw-r--r-- root\/root 1244 2015-04-17 14:09 usr\/share\/ipa\/ui\/js\/plugins\/icsacigroup\/icsacigroup.js<br>-rw-r--r-- root\/root 1143 2015-04-17 14:09 usr\/share\/ipa\/ui\/js\/plugins\/icsaciuser\/icsaciuser.js<\/p><p>from ipa02 to ipa03<\/p><p>yum intall ipa-server<\/p><p>I wasn't getting the home directory, so I ran:<\/p><p>ipa-client-automount<\/p><p>yum install ipa-server-dns<\/p><p>I did:<\/p><p>kinit admin<\/p><p>and then:<\/p><p>ipa-replica-install --setup-dns --forwarder=10.192.0.1 --setup-ca<\/p><p>Unfortunately, I got an error:<\/p><p>ipaserver.install.server.replicainstall: ERROR Could not resolve hostname <a href=\"http:\/\/ipa03.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ipa03.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> using DNS. Clients may not function properly. Please check your DNS setup. (Note that this check queries IPA DNS directly and ignores \/etc\/hosts.)<\/p><p>It turned out that ipa04 was having a problem at the time.&nbsp; I did ipactl restart on ipa04 and it got back in sync with the other servers and found ipa03 again.<\/p><p>Next I saw:<\/p><p>Checking DNS forwarders, please wait ...<br>Run connection check to master<br>Your system may be partly configured.<br>Run \/usr\/sbin\/ipa-server-install --uninstall to clean up.<\/p><p>ipapython.admintool: ERROR Connection check failed!<br>See \/var\/log\/ipareplica-conncheck.log for more information.<br>If the check results are not valid it can be skipped with --skip-conncheck parameter.<br>ipapython.admintool: ERROR The ipa-replica-install command failed. See \/var\/log\/ipareplica-install.log for more information<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>It turns out that firewalld was in the way. I stopped it and disabled it.<\/p><p>Ran the ipa-replica-install command again and it ran for several minutes.<\/p><p>After the sync, the web-ui doesn't have all of the titles for some of the fields.&nbsp; I tried copying over:<\/p><p>-rw-r--r-- root\/root 1842 2017-05-08 16:01 etc\/dirsrv\/schema\/60acigroup.ldif<br>-rw-r--r-- root\/root 1397 2017-05-08 15:33 etc\/dirsrv\/schema\/60aciperson.ldif<br>-r--r----- dirsrv\/dirsrv 1842 2017-05-08 16:01 etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/schema\/60acigroup.ldif<br>-r--r----- dirsrv\/dirsrv 1397 2017-05-08 15:33 etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/schema\/60aciperson.ldif<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I did \"ipactl restart\" but they still don't show up.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>A quick ldap search shows the appropriate info to be the same between IPA servers.<\/p><h5 id=\"bkmrk-more-stuff-to-try...\">More stuff to try...<\/h5><p>The UI stuff isn't there on the new install on ipa03.&nbsp; It turns out that the location of the plugin has changed to ipaserver\/plugins\/ and ipaclient\/plugins\/ rather than ipalib\/plugins<\/p><p>There were some differences between the versions on ipa02:<\/p><p>diff -u .\/ipalib\/plugins\/icsaci.py .\/ipaserver\/plugins\/icsaci.py<br>--- .\/ipalib\/plugins\/icsaci.py 2015-04-17 14:09:12.000000000 -0400<br>+++ .\/ipaserver\/plugins\/icsaci.py 2016-11-14 12:21:42.472267522 -0500<br>@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@<br>-from ipalib.plugins import user<br>-from ipalib.plugins import group<br>+from ipaserver.plugins import user<br>+from ipaserver.plugins import group<br>from ipalib.parameters import Str<br>from ipalib import _<br><br><\/p><p>I put the file in both the ipaserver and ipaclient directory.&nbsp; after running \"apachectl graceful\" as root on ipa03, the webui stuff looks OK.<\/p><p>I suspect there's more to restart to get the client stuff working:<\/p><p>I tried: \"ipactl restart\" but still no luck on the commandline stuff.&nbsp; I rebooted the ipa03 and it seems OK now.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>-----<\/p><p>END<\/p><p>-----<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Install the TSM Client<\/strong><\/p><p><strong><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Linux+Client+Install\">Linux Client Install<\/a><\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Other crontab entries<\/strong><\/p><p>55 20 * * * ls -rd \/var\/lib\/ipa\/backup\/ipa-data-* | sed '1,3d' | xargs rm -Rf<br>0 21 * * * \/sbin\/ipa-backup --online --data &gt;&gt; \/var\/log\/ipa-backup.log 2&gt;&amp;1<\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-other-stuff-that-loo\">Other stuff that looks like it was installed on other IPA servers:<\/h4><p><br><\/p><p>yum&nbsp;install aci-ipaschemaextension aci-ipawebplugin aci-ipaplugin<\/p><p>install ipa-server ipa-server-dns<\/p><p>install sos<\/p><p>install lsof<\/p><p>install gskcrypt64-8.0.50.78.linux.x86_64.rpm gskssl64-8.0.50.78.linux.x86_64.rpm TIVsm-API64.x86_64.rpm TIVsm-BA.x86_64.rpm<\/p><p>install -y splunkforwarder-7.0.2-03bbabbd5c0f-linux-2.6-x86_64.rpm<\/p><p>install gdb<\/p><p>install sosreport<\/p><p>?install bash-completion screen<\/p><p>?install net-snmp net-snmp-libs net-snmp-utils<\/p><p>?install iniparser<\/p><p>install gdb<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":715,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:45.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:45.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(16625) "{"id":2646,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"VMware   Veeam Backup   Mount stor as 006","slug":"vmware-veeam-backup-mount-stor-as-006-hZK","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm\">Operations Team : VMware - Veeam Backup - Mount stor-as-006<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div         <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n             <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Veeam Backup - Mount stor-as-006\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Feb 01, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-problemveeam-uses-an\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-problem\">Problem<\/h3><ul><li>Veeam uses an NFS share on NSD 24.<\/li><li>If the VMware looses its connection sometimes it does not come back gracefully or at all.&nbsp;<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-fix\">Fix<\/h3><ul><li>If you are going to work on NSD 24, consider shutting down Veeam ahead of time.<\/li><li>Once the NFS share is stabilized most likely the ESXi hosts we need to remount the NFS export.<\/li><li>To avoid remounting the export as a new name you have to go through a bit of a process.&nbsp; This will avoid accidentally mounting the export as two different names.<\/li><li>First shutdown I6-VEEAM-0003<\/li><li>Remove from inventory&nbsp;I6-VEEAM-0003<\/li><li>Put stor-as-06 into maintenance mode<\/li><li>Unmount stor-as-06<\/li><li>Once stor-as-06 is removed from all hosts, its configuration is gone too.<\/li><li>So you have to add it back in as a new datastore stor-as-06<ul><li>stor-nsd-024.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Add I6-VEEAM-0003 to inventory<\/li><li>Most likely Veeam cannot find its backup disk.<\/li><li>So you need to remove it from the VM and add \"Existing Disk\"<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-remove-from-inventor\">Remove from inventory<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image confluence-thumbnail\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854538.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854538.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854538\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2020-7-6_16-12-44.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"81854533\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"11\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-unmount-stor-as-006\">Unmount stor-as-006<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854539.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854539.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"81854533\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"11\"><\/span><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-configuration-info-f\">Configuration info for adding a new datastore<\/h3><ul><li>Make sure you review notes below and use the correct information.<\/li><\/ul><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854537.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854537.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854537\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2020-7-6_16-10-50.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"81854533\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"11\"><\/span><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-you-can-also-look-at\">You can also look at the host profile for NFS configuration information.<\/h3><ul><li>Please note that if you do not match the configuration in the host profile the compliance check will fail.<\/li><li>I unwittingly remounted it with the FDQN instead of IP.&nbsp; So not it does not match the profile and I need to update the profile.&nbsp;<\/li><\/ul><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/81854533\/81854560.png\"                    <p>Core network problems caused VM and filesystem problems<\/p><p>We needed to reboot the login nodes and most of the other VMs that had root filesystems on the NFS server.<\/p><p>The problems lasted around 6-7 hours.<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n Title contains numbers at the end: Generating Missing Scratch Folders 18222190
string(6671) "{"id":2648,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Generating Missing Scratch Folders","slug":"generating-missing-scratch-folders-Jz3","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ge\">Operations Team : Generating Missing Scratch Folders<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ge-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ge-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Generating Missing Scratch Folders\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span> on Jun 04, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-process-used-when-a-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Process used when a large number of scratch files are not being generated. This would typically only need to be done if scratch folders are not being generated for a long time such that doing it by hand would be cumbersome, and should be done after the issue with scratch generation has been resolved. <\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-step-by-step-guide\">Step-by-step guide<\/h2><p><br><\/p><ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Generate a list of home and scratch directories<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@stor-nsd-001 ~]# ls \/scratch &gt; scratch_list.txt\n[root@stor-nsd-022 ~]# ls \/home &gt; home_list.txt #There will be some \"extra directories that don't really need scratch directories. Stuff like \/exceed or \/d. These can be weeded out later<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Generate a list of the directories in home that are not in scratch, there is a script that will do this with the output 1diff2.out<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[dth5124@dth5124-ws ~]$ scp root@stor-nsd-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:~\/scratch_list.txt .\n[dth5124@dth5124-ws ~]$ scp root@stor-nsd-022.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:~\/home_list.txt .\n[dth5124@dth5124-ws ~]$ .\/1diff2.sh home_list.txt scratch_list.txt\n[dth5124@dth5124-ws ~]$ scp 1diff2.out root@stor-nsd-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:~<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-error confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>You'll need to look through the diff and remove any unnecessary entries. Mainly <span class=\"confluence-link\">\/[a-z], svc accounts, and stuff like \/stackstorm. <\/span><\/p><\/div><\/div><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><p class=\"title\">1diff2.sh<\/p><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p><span>The 1diff2.sh shell script can be found here along with a script to generate scratch folders based on that diffed list: &nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/browse\/SUPPORT-215?jql=text%20~%20%22generate%20missing%22\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">SUPPORT-215<\/a> <\/span><\/p><\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Run the generate_scratch_directories script using the absolute path to the diff output.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@stor-nsd-001 ~]# .\/generate_scratch_directories ~\/1diff2.out<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li>You can redo steps 1 and 2 to verify, or ls \/scratch and grep for the entries in the diff file. Home will always have more directories than Scratch, but as of June 4th 2018 the difference should be about 100 directories (26 directories \/a-z, about 50 upmri### directories, 4 svc-... directories, and a few other directories for ACI accounts\/services)<\/li><\/ol><p>&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":718,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:45.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:45.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: rc xdmod authentication with simplesaml and Azure AD authentication 131368708
string(10303) "{"id":2655,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"rc xdmod authentication with simplesaml and Azure AD authentication","slug":"rc-xdmod-authentication-with-simplesaml-and-azure-ad-authentication-4TC","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-rc\">Operations Team : rc-xdmod authentication with simplesaml and Azure-AD authentication<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Roar-Collab-xdmod-configuration_131368704.html\">Roar Collab xdmod configuration<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-rc-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-rc-2\">\n                            Operations Team : rc-xdmod authentication with simplesaml and Azure-AD authentication\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-robert-sa\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Robert Sand<\/span>, last modified on Oct 05, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-xdmod-software-r\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The xdmod software requires either a local user authentication or an SSO authentication.&nbsp; The Azure-AD saml<\/p><p>authentication was used because rcportal uses the CiLogon service provider (sp) which uses the PSU Azure-AD as<\/p><p>the identity provider (idp).&nbsp; In the case of rc-xdmod the service provider (sp) is the xdmod simplesaml software<\/p><p>which goes out to the Azure-AD identity provider (idp) to get the userid and other information to populate the<\/p><p>mariadb database on proddb for the first connection to the xdmod software and after that as only an auth source.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>In the configuration of the Azure-AD service for xdmod the two AD groups for Roar Collab (2e-Users and 2e-Admins)<\/p><p>were used as the groups allowed to authenticate to the server.&nbsp; The fields needed from Active Directory include<\/p><p>userid, email address, first and last name.&nbsp; These items are stored in the user tables for future queries to get job<\/p><p>efficiency and other information provided by xdmod on the users jobs submitted to the cluster.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>The main configuration files reside in the simplesamlphp\/config and simplesaml\/metadata directories.&nbsp; Inside the<\/p><p>config directory there is a main config.php file that needs to be configured for the installation and the<\/p><p>authsources.php file which tells the simplesaml plugin which service and identity provider to use and what data<\/p><p>will be returned by the idp with the auth token.&nbsp; Below shows the main piece of the authsources.php file.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>authsources.php<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">$config = array(\n\n    \/\/ This is a authentication source which handles admin authentication.\n    'admin' =&gt; array(\n        \/\/ The default is to use core:AdminPassword, but it can be replaced with\n        \/\/ any authentication source.\n\n        'core:AdminPassword',\n    ),\n\n    'xdmod-sp' =&gt; array(\n        'name' =&gt; array(\n            'en' =&gt; 'xdmod authentication',\n        ),\n        'saml:SP',\n        'host'=&gt; 'rc-xdmod.2e.hpc.psu.edu',\n        'entityID' =&gt; 'https:\/\/rc-xdmod.2e.hpc.psu.edu\/simplesaml\/module.php\/saml\/sp\/metadata.php\/xdmod-sp',\n        'privatekey'  =&gt; 'private.key',\n        'idp' =&gt; 'https:\/\/sts.windows.net\/7cf48d45-3ddb-4389-a9c1-c115526eb52e\/',\n        'signature.algorithm' =&gt; 'http:\/\/www.w3.org\/2001\/04\/xmldsig-more#rsa-sha256',\n        'authproc' =&gt; array(\n          40 =&gt; array(\n            'class' =&gt; 'core:AttributeMap',\n            'email' =&gt; 'emailaddress',\n            'firstName' =&gt; 'givenname',\n            'middleName' =&gt; 'middle_name',\n            'lastName' =&gt; 'surname',\n            'personId' =&gt; 'person_id',\n            'orgId' =&gt; 'organization',\n            'fieldOfScience' =&gt; 'field_of_science',\n            'itname' =&gt; 'username'\n          ) \n        ),\n      ),\n);\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Not all of the items in the authproc array needs to be sent by the idp to the sp in order to add the user into the<\/p><p>database but the itname is necessary and the firstName and lastName are nice to have since they cannot be<\/p><p>modified except by directly changing the table fields.&nbsp; the entityID field tells simplesaml which metadata will<\/p><p>be used to connect to the idp.&nbsp; The metadata information of the sp is provided by simplesaml and is needed<\/p><p>in setting up the Azure-AD authentication service for the server.&nbsp; Once Azure-AD is setup it gives you the<\/p><p>metadata information needed for the metadata file shown below:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>saml20-idp-remote.php<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">&lt;?php\n    \/**\n    * SAML 2.0 remote IdP metadata for SimpleSAMLphp.\n    *\n    * Remember to remove the IdPs you don't use from this file.\n    *\n    * See: https:\/\/simplesamlphp.org\/docs\/stable\/simplesamlphp-reference-idp-remote \n    *\/\n$metadata['https:\/\/sts.windows.net\/7cf48d45-3ddb-4389-a9c1-c115526eb52e\/'] = array (\n  'entityid' =&gt; 'https:\/\/sts.windows.net\/7cf48d45-3ddb-4389-a9c1-c115526eb52e\/',\n  'contacts' =&gt; \n  array (\n  ),\n  'metadata-set' =&gt; 'saml20-idp-remote',\n  'SingleSignOnService' =&gt; \n  array (\n    0 =&gt; \n    array (\n      'Binding' =&gt; 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect',\n      'Location' =&gt; 'https:\/\/login.microsoftonline.com\/7cf48d45-3ddb-4389-a9c1-c115526eb52e\/saml2',\n    ),\n    1 =&gt; \n    array (\n      'Binding' =&gt; 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST',\n      'Location' =&gt; 'https:\/\/login.microsoftonline.com\/7cf48d45-3ddb-4389-a9c1-c115526eb52e\/saml2',\n    ),\n  ),\n  'SingleLogoutService' =&gt; \n  array (\n    0 =&gt; \n    array (\n      'Binding' =&gt; 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect',\n      'Location' =&gt; 'https:\/\/login.microsoftonline.com\/7cf48d45-3ddb-4389-a9c1-c115526eb52e\/saml2',\n    ),\n  ),\n  'ArtifactResolutionService' =&gt; \n  array (\n  ),\n  'NameIDFormats' =&gt; \n  array (\n  ),\n  'keys' =&gt; \n  array (\n    0 =&gt; \n    array (\n      'encryption' =&gt; false,\n      'signing' =&gt; true,\n      'type' =&gt; 'X509Certificate',\n      'X509Certificate' =&gt; '\/b0oU2Ybdo5yvN9LN4aKez+SyggEknXTlhmWuBQYGDRVyDcRo7fitzzc9xBb8r1qVaYOH+zR4ilHvxa9WrTWE4XqDvHeLzUqyx\\/jk56ren2kq9adKdCsFX0dmlze1+83jLEaX+p+IPzNHyOtjg8sY+bjBgxhEh4vGfgu9SNtqAK3KyZAshBQW6ro2kp8EWhBrnpn7T6VXYMnDPuXP4Vb3JEgZdvAKSSGjlmeBNcno7F4Qwb3uyeQKp\/Ok3UWNExl4\/LQa7oPEb5ny4cCF0\/z1cjKeHocdZFz8SvUJeWrfrOI9EQZQqFwxCtgPKeMNHCOl6',\n    ),\n  ),\n);\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":725,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:46.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:46.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Veeam Backup - Troubleshooting<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Veeam Backup - Troubleshooting (Detailed)\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span> on Apr 02, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-here-is-a-list-of-is\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-here-is-a-list-of-is-1\">Here is a list of issues we encountered at Outreach.<\/h3><p><br><\/p><h3 style=\"text-align: left;\" id=\"bkmrk-troubleshooting\">Troubleshooting<\/h3><p style=\"text-align: left;\">For each failed non-success (warning or failed)<\/p><ul style=\"text-align: left;\"><li>Have we had a successful backup since the error. Often errors clear themselves. If it happens on a Fri, typically it works on Sat.<\/li><li>Does the VM have a snapshot? They are often the source of issues.<\/li><li>Have we seen the error before? Check the error list.<\/li><li>If it is a new error add it to the list.<\/li><\/ul><h3 style=\"text-align: left;\" id=\"bkmrk-specific-errors\">Specific Errors<\/h3><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTh\"><p>Symptom<\/p><\/th><th style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTh\"><p>Resolution<\/p><\/th><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Veeam Cannot find VM's that are in backup job.&nbsp;<\/p><p>\"<span class=\"small_label\">Task failed Error: <em>NAME OF VM<\/em> not found.<\/span>\"<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Remove and Re-add the VM's back into the jobs.<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">&nbsp;Job hangs with no specific error.<\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>&nbsp;Try stopping job. (usually fails or hangs)<\/p><p>&nbsp;Try restarting veeam services if this fails reboot ots-vbr-01.(verify all other jobs have finished except ones hung.)<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Need to create new *.vbk file<\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Click on Backups, Right click on job, Remove from backups NOT Delete from backups, Move *.vbk to new folder so current folder is empty<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Cannot use CBT: Soap fault. Error caused by file<\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>-On first warning can be ignored.<\/p><p>This is expected after changes to disk.(size, snapshot, etc.)<\/p><p>- Remove snapshot <br class=\"atl-forced-newline\">- If that does not work reset CBT, requires powering off VM, <a style=\"text-decoration: none;\" href=\"http:\/\/www.veeam.com\/KB1113\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.veeam.com\/KB1113<\/a><br class=\"atl-forced-newline\">- Seems like this might happen the day after another error occurred<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Error: Client error: Failed to open VDDK disk [[PLUN 304 OTS Prod] OTS-DOCUSHARE\/OTS-DOCUSHARE.vmdk] ( is read-only mode - [true] ) Failed to open VMDK. Logon attempt with parameters [VC\/ESX: [<a href=\"http:\/\/ots-vcenter-02.outreach.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ots-vcenter-02.outreach.psu.edu<\/a>];Port: 443;Login: [****];VMX Spec: [moref=vm-3743];Snapshot mor: [snapshot-90946];Transports: [hotadd:nbd];Read Only: [true]] failed because of the following errors:<\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>error occurred over weekend cleared itself, need to research next time it occurs on a weeknight<\/p><p><em>Appears to be related to UCS host updates and failover of fabric interconnects.&nbsp; VMotion appears to resolve the issue if it does not resolve on its' own.<\/em><\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Error: VSSControl: Failed to freeze guest, wait timeout (double check if snapshot exists)<\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>error occurred over weekend cleared itself, need to research next time it occurs on a weeknight<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Unable to release guest. Error: VSSControl: Failed to freeze guest, wait timeout<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>VSS timed out.&nbsp; Typically will work the next night.&nbsp; No action needed unless this happens several times in a row.<\/p><p>If this&nbsp;error appears for OTS-SQL-08-01 see this article: <a class=\"unresolved\" href=\"#bkmrk--1\">CONFIG - Veeam Backup of OTS-SQL-08-01<\/a><\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"small_label\">PrepStorageForWriteEx failed 'F:\\VeeamBackup2\\2.4-Win2008R2\\2.4-Win2008R22013-01-16T073135.vbk' Client error: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process. Failed to create or open file [F:\\VeeamBackup2\\2.4-Win2008R2\\2.4-Win2008R22013-01-16T073135.vbk]. <\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Look at backup time. Late backup job. Files copy to vnxe already has files locked.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"small_label\">Error: Client error: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process. Failed to create or open file [F:\\VeeamBackup2\\3-Win2008\\3-Win20082013-01-17T054206.vbk]. Failed to backup text locally. Backup: [<a style=\"text-decoration: none;\" href=\"http:\/\/veeamfs:0:055786cd-acf0-4aeb-8ccd-ff3a958717c8\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">veeamfs:0:055786cd-acf0-4aeb-8ccd-ff3a958717c8<\/a> (vm-3740)\\summary.xml@F:\\VeeamBackup2\\3-Win2008\\3-Win20082013-01-17T054206.vbkVBK: '<a style=\"text-decoration: none;\" href=\"http:\/\/veeamfs:0:055786cd-acf0-4aeb-8ccd-ff3a958717c8\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">veeamfs:0:055786cd-acf0-4aeb-8ccd-ff3a958717c8<\/a> (vm-3740)\\summary.xml@F:\\VeeamBackup2\\3-Win2008\\3-Win20082013-01-17T054206.vbk']. <br><\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Look at backup time. Late backup job. Files copy to vnxe already has files locked.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"small_label\">2\/15\/2013 10:35:30 AM :: Failed to delete oib '[vmname=CRM-TEST-GI:creation_time=2\/14\/2013 10:20:23 AM:alg=Syntethic:id=7a94fd1d-2e0b-404c-<a href=\"http:\/\/a235-21a799e38656point_id%3Dea87dae6-43a0-4a3a-b5c0-0b6ca3f3aed2storage_id%3D0759ea34-d9a1-429b-8984-2872de61daa5\/\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">a235-21a799e38656:point_id=ea87dae6-43a0-4a3a-b5c0-0b6ca3f3aed2:storage_id=0759ea34-d9a1-429b-8984-2872de61daa5<\/a>]' <br>from 'E:\\VeeamBackup\\2.3-Win2008R2\\2.3-Win2008R22013-02-14T101948.vbk', <br>redo 'E:\\VeeamBackup\\2.3-Win2008R2\\2.3-Win2008R22013-02-13T025451.vrb'<br>TextToTar failed<br>Client error: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process.<br>Failed to create or open f<\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>File copy to VNXe was NOT the problem...?&nbsp; Could not figure out what had the file locked.&nbsp; Rebooted server.&nbsp; Jobs running fine now.&nbsp; But I mistakenly interrupted the VNXe copy jobs that were running.<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"small_label\">Error: Not enough licenses. <\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Revoke License from host and run job again. License is added automatically when job runs against the host.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"small_label\">AgentManagerService: Failed to start agent, Host 'OTS-VBR-01' Error code: 0x80040154 Failed to create instance of DOMDocument <\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Retart Veeam Backup Proxy Service on OTS-VBR-01.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Job stalls at&nbsp;\"waiting for backup infrastructure availability\"<\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">&nbsp;Happend on proxy-01 and 06. Removed proxyies from job and from VBR then readded to resolve issue.(2\\17\\13) Unkown underlying issue possible.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">&nbsp;<span class=\"small_label\">Failed to prepare guest for hot backup. Error: Failed to connect to guest agent. Errors: 'Cannot connect to the host's administrative share. Host: [172.29.128.43]. Account: [WINDOM\\svc_vss]. Win32 error:Logon failure: unknown user name or bad password. Code: 1326 ' Error: Failed to connect to guest agent. Errors: 'Cannot connect to the host's administrative share. Host: [172.29.128.43]. Account: [WINDOM\\svc_vss]. Win32 error:Logon failure: unknown user name or bad password. Code: 1326 '<\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Some CRM RDP VM's are being added to the DCE domain and the service account for vss is unavailable. Disable application processing to allow backup.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"small_label\">There is no action lease with same id. LeaseId [63153bbd-78ec-4e84-affe-298fa549879f]&nbsp; <\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Restart Veeam Services. unknown cause, lesase id varies.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>There is a locked session from a failed or improperly stopped backup that is preventing backups from running.&nbsp; This requires an SQL script to be ran to clear the locks in the Veeam DB.&nbsp;<\/p><p><strong>Error vib locked by running session. 4\/1\/2015 7:36:53 PM :: Error: Storage 'BH 4.3 Win 2008R22015-03-31T184004.vib' is locked by running session 'BH 4.3 Win 2008R2'<\/strong><\/p><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>&nbsp;Run the following SQL script against the VeeamBackup DB on <strong>OTS-SQL-12-01<\/strong><\/p><p><em>delete from [Backup.TrackedActions.Leases] delete from [Backup.TrackedActions.LockItems] delete from [Backup.TrackedActions.Locks]<\/em><\/p><p><br><\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span>vSphere HA cannot reset OTS-VBR-PRXY-XX<\/span><\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><ul><li>Edit Settings on each of the Proxies and look for disks that are connected<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Click the OK for remove the redo log<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Wait for Proxy VM to reboot<\/li><\/ul><ul><li>Remove each extra disk (non-os\/disk1) from the Proxy VM (do not delete from disk)<\/li><\/ul><ul><li>Right click on the real VM, Snapshot-&gt;Consolidate<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>The yellow triangle and ! should go away and the Consolidate nastygram will disappear from the VM<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Create a Snapshot on the VM<\/li><\/ul><ul><li>Do a Delete All to remove the snapshot you created<\/li><\/ul><\/td><\/tr><tr><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">An alarm appears that the Virtual Machine needs consolidation<\/td><td style=\"text-align: left;\" colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>This can happen when the backups aren't completed successfully. To correct the issue, do the following:<\/p><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Go to the affected VM and click Migrate.<\/li><li>Select Change Datastore<\/li><li>Select the datastore with the largest free space<\/li><li>Click Finish. Wait for it to be migrated.<\/li><li>Once complete, right click on the VM and go to Snapshot--&gt;Consolidate<\/li><\/ul><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><h3 style=\"text-align: left;\" id=\"bkmrk-restores%3A\"><span class=\"small_label\">Restores:<\/span><\/h3><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><br><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTh\"><p>Instant VM restore:<\/p><\/th><th style=\"text-align: left;\" class=\"confluenceTh\"><p>\"Error Checking free disk space available to vPower NFS server\" (*if you right click and past message into&nbsp;notepad it give you the following extra information.)&nbsp;<\/p><p>10\/15\/2013 3:08:18 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Starting VM \"EIA-11G-DEV\" recovery 10\/15\/2013 3:08:45 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Connecting to host \"<a href=\"http:\/\/ots-esxi-10.outreach.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ots-esxi-10.outreach.psu.edu<\/a>\" 10\/15\/2013 3:09:02 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Checking if vPower NFS datastore is mounted on host 10\/15\/2013 3:09:02 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Locking backup file 10\/15\/2013 3:10:40 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Cancelling VM publication 10\/15\/2013 3:10:42 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Canceling backup file lock 10\/15\/2013 3:10:42 PM Fail&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Failed to publish VM \"EIA-11G-DEV\". &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; \"standard\" for the node feature.<\/p><p><span class=\"c-message__sender c-message_kit__sender\"><a style=\"text-decoration: none;\" href=\"https:\/\/app.slack.com\/team\/U7PT1QV54\" Title contains numbers at the end: Storage   Monitor NFS 85328002
string(20812) "{"id":2659,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Storage   Monitor NFS","slug":"storage-monitor-nfs-W6i","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-st\">Operations Team : Storage - Monitor NFS<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Storage---GPFS---Archive---ZFS_18223014.html\">Storage - GPFS - Archive - ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-st-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-st-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Storage - Monitor NFS\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span> on Sep 16, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-lindsay%2C-you-asked-t\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Lindsay, you asked this morning about how I figured out what was causing NFS traffic on the system.<\/p><p>I\u2019ve tried to watch the network traffic and NFS traffic on the CNFS nodes using Grafana: <a href=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/d\/C-JW6PyWz\/cnfs-status?refresh=5m&amp;orgId=1\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/d\/C-JW6PyWz\/cnfs-status?refresh=5m&amp;orgId=1<\/a><\/p><p>If you look at things over the last few days or so, you\u2019ll see times when indicators go way up.&nbsp; It\u2019s not consistently a problem though.<\/p><p>Unfortunately, there aren\u2019t good analytics on the server side to tell me who is causing things to be busy.<\/p><p>One thing to try is:<\/p><p>pdsh -f 100 -a \"\/storage\/work\/gbs35\/src\/cleanup\/nfsrw\" | less<\/p><p>This nfsrw script reads the nfsV4 traffic info from \/proc\/net\/rpc\/nfs, sleeps 10 sec and reads it again to subtract the counters and get an I\/O rate.&nbsp; if the read and write are more than 500 for the 10 sec, then the script prints out the total read and write values. [pdsh -f 100 -a means run ssh at 100 connections at a time (-f 100) to all nodes (-a) in the \/etc\/genders file].<\/p><p>So, in theory, if someone is doing lots of NFS I\/O over a 10 sec period, it\u2019ll be flagged.<\/p><p>I pipe the output to less, since there are bunches of nodes down for various reasons and the pdsh output gets cluttered with other less useful info.<\/p><p>Once I have some candidate nodes (in my less window)&nbsp; I can login and check the node.<\/p><p>One command I use to see what\u2019s happening is collectl:<\/p><p>[gbs35@comp-bc-0312 ~]$ collectl -sdnmcfx<\/p><p>-sx disabled because no interconnect hardware\/drivers found<\/p><p>waiting for 1 second sample...<\/p><p>#&lt;--------CPU--------&gt;&lt;-----------Memory-----------&gt;&lt;----------Disks-----------&gt;&lt;----------Network----------&gt;&lt;------NFS Totals------&gt;<\/p><p>#cpu sys inter&nbsp; ctxsw Free Buff Cach Inac Slab&nbsp; Map KBRead&nbsp; Reads KBWrit Writes&nbsp;&nbsp; KBIn&nbsp; PktIn&nbsp; KBOut&nbsp; PktOut&nbsp; Reads Writes Meta Comm<\/p><p>&nbsp; 66&nbsp;&nbsp; 0 17063&nbsp;&nbsp; 2478&nbsp; 98G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp;&nbsp; 9G&nbsp;&nbsp; 8G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp; 15G&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 44&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 597&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 598&nbsp;&nbsp; 1166&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1134&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 123&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 18&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1<\/p><p>&nbsp; 65&nbsp;&nbsp; 0 19469&nbsp;&nbsp; 4039&nbsp; 98G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp;&nbsp; 9G&nbsp;&nbsp; 8G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp; 14G&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 296&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 24&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 821&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 748&nbsp;&nbsp; 1167&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1193&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;181&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 18&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1<\/p><p>&nbsp; 66&nbsp;&nbsp; 1 21314&nbsp;&nbsp; 2035&nbsp; 98G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp;&nbsp; 9G&nbsp;&nbsp; 8G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp; 15G&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 658&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 519&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 71&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 369&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 146&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0<\/p><p>&nbsp; 99&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0<\/p><p>&nbsp; 65&nbsp;&nbsp; 1 33795&nbsp;&nbsp; 1239&nbsp; 98G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp;&nbsp; 9G&nbsp; &nbsp;8G&nbsp;&nbsp; 1G&nbsp; 15G&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 52&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 99&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 35&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 95&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 0<\/p><p>Ouch!<\/p><p>It\u2019ll print a line each second until you hit ctrl-C. If you run that on a node without IB (like I did above), it\u2019ll complain that it can\u2019t find IB (leave off the \u2018x\u2019 and it won\u2019t try IB.&nbsp; On IB nodes the \u2018x\u2019 shows IB traffic.&nbsp; On this node you can see some NFS traffic and it stopped after a bit. In this case it\u2019s probably intermittent traffic and not something to worry much about.<\/p><p>One of the jobs I looked at earlier today showed more consistent traffic, and from the CNFS graphs it had been going for hours.<\/p><p>[gbs35@comp-bc-0186 ~]$ collectl -sdnmcfx<\/p><p>-sx disabled because no interconnect hardware\/drivers found<\/p><p>waiting for 1 second sample...<\/p><p>#&lt;--------CPU--------&gt;&lt;-----------Memory-----------&gt;&lt;----------Disks-----------&gt;&lt;----------Network----------&gt;&lt;------NFS Totals------&gt;<\/p><p>#cpu sys inter&nbsp; jxs1363&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; open&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; CuC2all&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 127983&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 8gb&nbsp; 48:00:00 R&nbsp; 12:53:06&nbsp;&nbsp; comp-bc-0186\/0-7<\/p><p>There were two nodes called out when I ran this morning.&nbsp; Both of them had a job by the same user.&nbsp; I tried suspending the jobs to see that the traffic went away when the job was suspended.&nbsp;<\/p><p>[root@moab01 ~]# qsig -s suspend 22396361 22396504<\/p><p>The traffic stopped.&nbsp; If Moab sees jobs suspended that it thinks should be able to run, it seems to resume them.&nbsp; I contacted this user last week and asked them not to do this. (using an iask ticket).&nbsp; I contacted them again today and explained that this wasn\u2019t appropriate and suggested again, that they use scratch for this.&nbsp; I then cancelled the jobs and the traffic went back down.<\/p><p>There are likely better ways to do this.<\/p><p>-----<\/p><p>Gary Skouson<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":729,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:47.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:47.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: GPFS   DataMgr Node   Clustering 34963460
string(8371) "{"id":2661,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"GPFS   DataMgr Node   Clustering","slug":"gpfs-datamgr-node-clustering-tSJ","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp\">Operations Team : GPFS - DataMgr Node - Clustering<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Storage---GPFS---Archive---ZFS_18223014.html\">Storage - GPFS - Archive - ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"18225088.html\">GPFS \/ DDN<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-2\">\n                            Operations Team : GPFS - DataMgr Node - Clustering\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Aug 15, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-you-can-login-to-one\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>You can login to one of the datamgr boxes and as root run 'pcs status'. You can see that they're running stonith (Shoot The Other Node In The Head) over ipmi to the other nodes in the cluster.<\/p><p>You can use things like \"pcs cluster [standby|unstandby] {node}\" to put one of the nodes in a \"standby\" state or to recover it. You can also enable or disable services with \"pcs resource [enable|disable] {resource}\". Running \"pcs resource help\" or \"pcs cluster help\" should provide more info. You probably want to look at a corosync\/pacemaker tutorial before doing too much to change things. Looking with 'pcs status' should be fine.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Current config looks like (with passwords replaced by XXXXX):<\/p><p><br><\/p><pre>[root@stor-datamgr-001 ~]# pcs config export pcs-commands\n[needlexml2pcscmd       ] xslt: NOTE: cluster infrastructure services not enabled at this point, which can be changed any time by issuing `pcs cluster enable --all`\n[cib2pcscmd             ] xslt: WARNING: dropping non-whitelisted cluster property: `have-watchdog`\n[cib2pcscmd             ] xslt: WARNING: dropping non-whitelisted cluster property: `dc-version`\n[cib2pcscmd             ] xslt: WARNING: dropping non-whitelisted cluster property: `cluster-infrastructure`\n[cib2pcscmd             ] xslt: WARNING: dropping non-whitelisted cluster property: `cluster-name`\n[cib2pcscmd             ] xslt: WARNING: dropping non-whitelisted cluster property: `last-lrm-refresh`\n#!\/usr\/bin\/sh\n# sequence generated on 2019-08-15 14:26:50 with: clufter 0.77.0\n# invoked as: ['\/sbin\/pcs', 'config', 'export', 'pcs-commands']\n# targeting system: ('linux', 'redhat', '7.5', 'Maipo')\n# using interpreter: CPython 2.7.5\npcs \\\n  cluster auth stor-datamgr-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu \\\n  stor-datamgr-002.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu \\\n  stor-datamgr-003.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu &lt;&gt; \/dev\/tty\npcs cluster setup --name production-datamgr-cluster \\\n  stor-datamgr-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu \\\n  stor-datamgr-002.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu \\\n  stor-datamgr-003.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu --addr0 10.110.7.1 \\\n  --mcastport0 5405\npcs cluster start --all --wait=60\npcs cluster cib tmp-cib.xml\ncp tmp-cib.xml tmp-cib.xml.deltasrc\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml property set stonith-enabled=true\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml stonith create stor-datamgr-001-stonith fence_ipmilan \\\n  lanplus=true pcmk_host_list=stor-datamgr-001 ipaddr=10.111.7.1 login=stonith \\\n  passwd=XXXXX privlvl=Operator \\\n  op monitor id=stor-datamgr-001-stonith-monitor-interval-30s interval=30s \\\n  name=monitor\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml stonith create stor-datamgr-002-stonith fence_ipmilan \\\n  lanplus=true pcmk_host_list=stor-datamgr-002 ipaddr=10.111.7.2 login=stonith \\\n  passwd=XXXXX privlvl=Operator \\\n  op monitor id=stor-datamgr-002-stonith-monitor-interval-30s interval=30s \\\n  name=monitor\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml stonith create stor-datamgr-003-stonith fence_ipmilan \\\n  lanplus=true pcmk_host_list=stor-datamgr-003 ipaddr=10.111.7.3 login=stonith \\\n  passwd=XXXXX privlvl=Operator \\\n  op monitor id=stor-datamgr-003-stonith-monitor-interval-30s interval=30s \\\n  name=monitor\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml \\\n  resource create stor-datamgr-lbip-vsftpd-datacommons ocf:heartbeat:IPaddr2 \\\n  ip=192.5.158.180 cidr_netmask=24 op monitor interval=20s\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml resource create vsftpd systemd:vsftpd \\\n  op monitor interval=20s\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml \\\n  resource create stor-datamgr-lbip-external ocf:heartbeat:IPaddr2 \\\n  ip=192.5.158.170 cidr_netmask=24 op monitor interval=20s\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml resource create haproxy systemd:haproxy \\\n  op monitor interval=20s\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml \\\n  resource clone stor-datamgr-lbip-external clone-max=3 clone-node-max=1 \\\n  globally-unique=true\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml \\\n  resource clone haproxy clone-max=3 clone-node-max=1 globally-unique=true\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml \\\n  constraint colocation add vsftpd with stor-datamgr-lbip-vsftpd-datacommons \\\n  id=stor-datamgr-lb-with_vsftpd\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml constraint order stor-datamgr-lbip-vsftpd-datacommons \\\n  then vsftpd kind=Mandatory symmetrical=true \\\n  id=stor-datamgr-lbip-vsftpd-datacommons_before_vsftpd\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml constraint order stor-datamgr-lbip-external-clone \\\n  then haproxy-clone kind=Mandatory symmetrical=true \\\n  id=stor-datamgr-lb-clone_before_haproxy-clone\npcs -f tmp-cib.xml \\\n  constraint location vsftpd prefers \\\n  stor-datamgr-003.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\npcs cluster cib-push tmp-cib.xml diff-against=tmp-cib.xml.deltasrc\n[cmd-wrap               ] output: &lt;stdout&gt;\n\n<\/pre><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n I'm trying to make sure I understand the requirements and what we've agreed to do for this system.<br> <br> It's currently in the colocation space at the data center.&nbsp; It needs to be on the research network.&nbsp; They want to be able to have it access the datamanager nodes if they want data from ACI.<br> <br> My understanding is that we've agreed to bring the system up with the installed OS that Nvidia installs on these boxes.&nbsp; It's some version of Ubuntu.&nbsp; We'll want to update it to make sure it has reasonable security patches installed.&nbsp; Not having looked at the Nvidia documentation, I'm not sure if there are things to watch out for with conflicts between Ubuntu stuff and the Nvidia software.<br> <br> I don't want to not allow remote root access.&nbsp; I'd rather we have some ICS people that can login and then they can sudo to get root access.<br> <br> We also need to configure it to allow a few specific people to login (Chris Milito cjm46, Adam McMillen atm135, and Cindy Titsler cxt23).&nbsp; These users won't have root access.&nbsp; If they need root access, we need to consider backing out and not providing support.<br> &nbsp;<br> We'll want to configure login to use the normal university access (normal single sign-on with duo etc.)&nbsp; I'm not sure how that's currently done on other systems that don't use IPA, or if there's another university provided way to provide host based ACLs to allow particular people to login to these systems.&nbsp; I'd like to make sure we do this in a standard way and document what happens so we can more easily do this next time.<br> <br> They'll login directly and run whatever it is that they're planning on. There's no expectation of any kind of batch system. They'll just play nice together in their sandbox.<br> <br> I'm guessing they'll want ongoing support for installing new software that resolves bugs etc.&nbsp; I'm not sure what that support will involve, or what the time expectation for that is.<br> <br> We have no uptime agreement or any level of service agreement.&nbsp; Just work on it as needed on a best effort basis as we have time.<br> <br> Is there anything else we need to understand about this system or what you've agreed that we'll do for them?<br> <br> -----<br> Gary Skouson<\/span><\/p><p>--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<\/p><p><span>Just a follow-up on this note.<br> <br> You'll need to check with Derek where the node was installed, so you can go over and connect a keyboard etc. to get things up and running.&nbsp; I'm not sure how the IP addresses are assigned over in the data center for the research network.&nbsp; It may have needed to be a service request to someone in the data center.<br> <br> Ryan said that we may be able to use the user managed groups to set up access to the system.&nbsp; Something similar was done on the LIGO system, but I'm not sure how that was done.&nbsp; You may want to talk with Adam or Matt to get more info on that.<\/span><\/p><p>--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Some Documentation for DGX Boxes are if:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Can we physically reach the node - <strong>The node is in rack BG52 behind a standard rack key lock<\/strong><\/li><li>The node has power - It does<\/li><li>Is cabled to the network - Cables exist, does not seem to actually be networked<br><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Is accessible via RN<\/li><li>what is the hostname\/ip<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What's the bmc status? - Not connected\/setup will probably leave as is<\/li><li>Has an OS installed - Ubuntu,<br><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>If so what is the version:<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info Xerus)\"<\/p><p>ID=ubuntu<\/p><p>ID_LIKE=debian<\/p><p>PRETTY_NAME=\"Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS\"<\/p><p>VERSION_ID=\"16.04\"<\/p><p>....<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/div><\/div><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>What Cuda Version\/NVIDIA drivers are installed - DGX_SW_BUILD_VERSION=\"3.1.6\"<\/li><li>Is there already a user\/password setup? - No<br><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>If one is made put it in lastpass - Created Shared-ICS One-Offs Folder in lastpass for this and future ones. I currently have admin priv on it but I will switch that to Matt and anyone else needed when complete.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Is the box registered with NVIDIA? - Didn't prompt us during initial startup. So not yet.<br><br><\/li><\/ul><p>Following that we'll have to work on providing access. Will try to use UMG in a manner similar to Ligos, something like:<\/p><p>up_ics.dgx1-ist&nbsp; - General User Access, users can be added by the designated point of contact and anyone else they determine<\/p><p>up_ics.dgx1-ist-admin - General User Access, but users can be added by admins with ICS<\/p><p>up_ics.dgx1-ist-root - Administered by ICS, allows root usage.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>When making the groups use the following settings:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Functional<\/li><li>University Park (Maybe this will depend on if they need branch campuses)<\/li><li>inclusive Membership<\/li><li>Securtiy (Both Enterprise AD and PSU Directory)<\/li><li>Add whoever is in charge of security to these groups and make them an admin or at some point owner.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p>As of 3\/4\/2019 the links should be setup and are pending Ken Millers action to actually reach anything:<\/p><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>The two cables on eth 1 and 2 coming out of that machine are now plugged in to the ports on the research network switching. I just did it that was as I was testing stuff out.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Setting up ntp:<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo env http_proxy=<a href=\"http:\/\/proxy.aset.psu.edu:3128\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/proxy.aset.psu.edu:3128<\/a> apt install ntp<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo timedatectl set-ntp no<\/p><p>&nbsp; timedatectl<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo ntpq -p<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo vim \/etc\/ntp.conf (Comment out any default pools and add \"server 128.118.25.3\")<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo systemctl restart ntp<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo systemctl status ntp<\/p><p>&nbsp; sudo ntpq -p<\/p><p><br>Although the ENCS NAT was set up it didn't seem to allow for updates to be pulled from outside of the PSU network so I reached out to ENCS again and at some point that was opened back up:<\/p><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p><span>Hi Chad,<br> <br> Can you look at this EFW NAT rule again?&nbsp; It should be 192.5.160.21 translated to the 172.29.208.0\/24 network.&nbsp; 172.29.208.10 is the IP of the machine we're trying to get to the outside for updates.&nbsp; <br> <br> Thanks,<br> Ken<br> <br> <br> -----Original Message-----<br> <\/span><\/p><p><span>From: \"Haigh, Derick Thomas\" &lt;dth5124@<a href=\"http:\/\/psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">psu.edu<\/a>&gt;<br> Date: Friday, March 29, 2019 at 9:13 AM<br> To: Kenneth Miller &lt;kdm193@<a href=\"http:\/\/psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">psu.edu<\/a>&gt;<br> Subject: Re: IST DGX box in Co-lo space at the DC<br> <br> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ken, <br> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thanks for the update on the status.                           Operations Team : Restoring dse.ldif\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Aug 18, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-i-noticed-that-ldap-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>I noticed that ldap wasn't functional on ipa04.&nbsp; I logged in and tried to restart it, but it complained:<\/p><p><br><\/p><pre>[root@ipa04 ~]# ipactl restart\nStarting Directory Service\nFailed to start Directory Service: Command '\/bin\/systemctl start dirsrv@INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU.service' returned non-zero exit status 1\n\n<\/pre><p>Checking log files I saw:<\/p><pre>[root@ipa04 ~]# journalctl -f \n-- Logs begin at Mon 2020-08-17 12:42:31 EDT. --\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ds_systemd_ask_password_acl[6547]: grep: \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/dse.ldif: No such file or directory\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ns-slapd[6553]: [18\/Aug\/2020:09:09:31.014065041 -0400] - INFO - dse_check_file - The config \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/dse.ldif can not be accessed. Attempting restore ... (reason: 0)\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ns-slapd[6553]: [18\/Aug\/2020:09:09:31.014185451 -0400] - ERR - dse_check_file - The backup file \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/dse.ldif.bak has zero length, refusing to restore it.\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ns-slapd[6553]: [18\/Aug\/2020:09:09:31.014197070 -0400] - ERR - slapd_bootstrap_config - No valid configurations can be accessed! You must restore \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/dse.ldif from backup!\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ns-slapd[6553]: [18\/Aug\/2020:09:09:31.014203749 -0400] - EMERG - main - The configuration files in directory \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU could not be read or were not found.  Please refer to the error log or output for more information.\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu systemd[1]: dirsrv@INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=1\/FAILURE\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu systemd[1]: Failed to start 389 Directory Server INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU..\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu systemd[1]: Unit dirsrv@INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU.service entered failed state.\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu systemd[1]: dirsrv@INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU.service failed.\nAug 18 09:09:31 ipa04.int.aci.ics.psu.edu polkitd[812]: Unregistered Authentication Agent for unix-process:6541:7362001 (system bus name :1.398, object path \/org\/freedesktop\/PolicyKit1\/AuthenticationAgent, locale en_US.UTF-8) (disconnected from bus)\n\n<\/pre><p>I thought it interesting that dse.ldif couldn't be accessed and that the dse.ldif.back was zero length.&nbsp; I decided to grab the latest copy from backup:<\/p><pre>[root@ipa04 slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU]# \/opt\/tivoli\/tsm\/client\/ba\/bin\/dsmc restore -subdir=yes -pitd=8\/17\/2020 \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/dse.ldif.bak \/tmp\/\n.\n.\n.\n[root@ipa04 slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU]# \/opt\/tivoli\/tsm\/client\/ba\/bin\/dsmc restore -subdir=yes -pitd=8\/17\/2020 \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/dse.ldif.bak \/tmp\/\n.\n.\n.\n\n<\/pre><p>I copied the restored files from \/tmp\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU to the proper directory (\/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\/) and ipactl restart seemed to work without problems.<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":733,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:47.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:47.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
