id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-em-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-em-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Email Communications and Alerts System\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-matthew-a\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MATTHEW ALEXANDER HANSEN<\/span>, last modified on May 18, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-roarcollab-uses-penn\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>RoarCollab uses Penn State Enterprise Active Directory (EAD) for user accounts and the common Penn State email and collaboration platform is Microsoft Office 365.<\/p><p>This email alerts and communication system uses EAD user groups as a mailing list and an Office 365 Shared Mailbox to send.<\/p><p><strong>Moderation<\/strong><\/p><p>Moderation is enabled for ALL mail enabled EAD groups (authorized send is not possible due to Azure\/EAD limitations). Contact Penn State Office 365 team to add\/remove moderators.<\/p><ol><li>Sample moderation email format:<ol><li><p><strong>Your decision is requested.<\/strong><\/p><p>H6-Icds-Alerts has asked you to <span class=\"mark17z3hd8ol\" style=\"color: inherit;\">approve<\/span> the attached message for delivery to:<\/p><p>&lt;name of group(s)&gt;<\/p><hr><p><br><\/p><p>A preview of the message is below. To view the complete message, open the attachment<\/p><\/li><li>Buttons to Approve or Reject (appear in OWA and Outlook applications but not 3rd party clients)&nbsp;<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p>Moderator list: mah60, cpb11, wzh5214<\/p><p><strong>Groups<\/strong><\/p><ul><li>H6-allusers (h6-allusers@psu.edu)<ul><li>Note: Email go to members of child groups, but users of multiple groups should NOT get duplicate copies<\/li><li>OU Path:&nbsp;<\/li><li>Members: H6-2eusers, H6-1eusers<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>H6-2eusers (h6-2eusers@psu.edu)<br><ul><li>Note: Production user group for RoarCollab&nbsp;<\/li><li>OU Path: &nbsp;<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>H6-1eusers (h6-1eusers@psu.edu)<ul><li>Note: Import\/sync group for 1E users from IPA, only used for this purpose<\/li><li>OU Path:<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>H6-mailadmins<ul><li>Note: Access control group for Office 365 Shared Mailbox <a href=\"mailto:icds-alerts@psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">icds-alerts@psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>OU Path:<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><strong>Office 365 Shared Mailbox<\/strong><\/p><p>Alerts are sent from:&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:icds-alerts@psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">icds-alerts@psu.edu<\/a><\/p><p>Access is granted with &nbsp;EAD group with full access (granular options available by contacting O365 team).<\/p><p>Email should be sent BCC: to mask EAD groups<\/p><p><strong>SOP<\/strong><\/p><ol><li>Login to Office 365 Web Interface - <a href=\"https:\/\/outlook.office365.com\/owa\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/outlook.office365.com\/owa\/<\/a><\/li><li>Click \"New Mail\" button<\/li><li>Set \"From:\" to <a href=\"mailto:icds-alerts@psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">icds-alerts@psu.edu<\/a>&nbsp;(if not shown, check your H6-mailadmins membership and\/or follow steps to Add Shared Mailbox below)<\/li><li>Click \"Bcc:\" button<\/li><li>Add \"<a href=\"mailto:h6-2eusers@psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">h6-2eusers@psu.edu<\/a>\" or <a href=\"mailto:h6-1eusers@psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">h6-1eusers@psu.edu<\/a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;\"<a href=\"mailto:h6-allusers@psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">h6-allusers@psu.edu<\/a>\"<\/li><li>Compose Message (consider using standard templates)<\/li><li>Click \"Send\" button<\/li><li>Wait for moderation email to be sent to list of moderators via personal email (NOT H6-mailadmins, see above)<\/li><li>Review email preview and approve when ready.<\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Adding Shared Mailbox to OWA<\/strong><\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);text-decoration: none;\"><span class=\"ui-provider ayh ayi c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t ayj ayk w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak\">1. Log into Outlook Online in the Web Browser<br>2. On the left hand side close all folders until you see &gt;Folders<br>3. Right click on Folders, Left click on Add shared Folder<br>4. A box will open up, in the Box type the email address or the Name of the shared mailbox you want to add.<br>5. Then click on Add<\/span><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Notes<\/strong><\/p><p>The EAD groups are mail enabled (mail attribute) allowing them to sync with Azure AD and become available within Office 365. Benefit is this is a 1:1 list of actual active users without syncing or extra effort. There are a number of limitations to using EAD groups and we should continue to investigate options to improve . Specifically, sponsored accounts may lack email (O365), native O365 groups have much more functionality (like restricting senders) but require manual add\/remove by request from O365 team. It may be possible to automate this better with Azure resources or future changes to Azure AD. There are no advanced mailing list features (analytics, templates) that may be useful to Communications Team but layering 3rd party tools or other Azure integrated applications might be possible in the future.<\/p><p><strong>Useful Links<\/strong><\/p><p><strong><a href=\"https:\/\/learn.microsoft.com\/en-us\/azure\/active-directory\/enterprise-users\/groups-dynamic-rule-member-of\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/learn.microsoft.com\/en-us\/azure\/active-directory\/enterprise-users\/groups-dynamic-rule-member-of<\/a><\/strong><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":754,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:49.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:49.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

VMware - Auto Deploy - Boot Process\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Jul 24, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-after-all-the-bios-a\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-after-all-the-bios-a-1\">After all the BIOS activity with no pings returned.&nbsp; The host has recieved an IP and Next Server from the DHCP server.&nbsp; And it configures a NIC with the IP and presumable talks to the TFTP server.&nbsp; It started pinging about 1\/2 way through the dotted line.<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854838.gif\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854838.gif\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854838\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"AutoDeploy-2.GIF\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/gif\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"81854836\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"2\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-then-it-stops-pingin\">Then it stops pinging again.&nbsp; And seems to drop of the network for a while.&nbsp; Once it starts pulling down packages from vCenter the pinging resumes.<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854839.gif\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854839.gif\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854839\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"AutoDeploy-3.GIF\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/gif\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"81854836\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"2\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-then-as-esxi-boots-i\">Then as ESXi boots it stops pinging again.&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854840.gif\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854840.gif\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854840\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"AutoDeploy-4.GIF\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/gif\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"81854836\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"2\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-then-most-of-the-way\">Then most of the way through the boot progress bar it starts pinging again.<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854841.gif\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854836\/81854841.gif\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854841\"                              <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-2\">\n                            Operations Team : 2020-01-27 OOD CNFS problems\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Jan 28, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-we-had-users-report-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>We had users report problems with OOD shortly after noon on Monday, Jan 27, 2020:<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>The stats from this time period can be seen at:&nbsp;<\/p><p><a href=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/dashboard\/snapshot\/hOKa67OY7ybUHhQamsk54HbeAekAIeGN\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/dashboard\/snapshot\/hOKa67OY7ybUHhQamsk54HbeAekAIeGN<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image confluence-external-resource\" draggable=\"false\" src=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/render\/dashboard-solo\/snapshot\/hOKa67OY7ybUHhQamsk54HbeAekAIeGN?orgId=1&amp;from=1580140887327&amp;to=1580158985975&amp;panelId=2&amp;width=1000&amp;height=500&amp;tz=UTC-05%3A00\" data-image-src=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/render\/dashboard-solo\/snapshot\/hOKa67OY7ybUHhQamsk54HbeAekAIeGN?orgId=1&amp;from=1580140887327&amp;to=1580158985975&amp;panelId=2&amp;width=1000&amp;height=500&amp;tz=UTC-05%3A00\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>From the load average, it's obvious that something happened shortly before noon.&nbsp; People looked at some things, but team leads were in a team-lead meeting until 13:30.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>When I looked at things after getting back to my office, I found that the load average was still higher than normal and there were lots of tasks waiting on I\/O.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I took a look at the CNFS servers for \/storage\/home and \/storage\/work and found that the load average for stor-cnfs-003.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu was over 200, so I rebooted that node at arount 13:45.&nbsp; The NFS traffic seemed to fail over to stor-cnfs-004.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu.&nbsp; Although the load average on the cnfs-004 went up when cnfs-003 was rebootes, once the node came back up, things seemed to stabilize.<\/p><p>Once I felt that the CNFS issues were resolved, we let users know that things seemed to have stabilized.<\/p><p>Unfortunately, Will from iASK let us know that he was having problems getting jobs to start through OOD.&nbsp; I did some more investigating and some of the comp-ic nodes were reporting \"Input\/output errors\" when trying to read files on \/home.&nbsp; I ended up offlineing comp-ic-[0004,0017,0019,0022].<\/p><p>I also found a couple of nodes (comp-ic-000[2-3]) were having problems with name resolution.&nbsp; The network stuff hadn't completed correctly and they weren't getting the proper nameserver info in the \/etc\/resolv.conf file.<\/p><p>Overall, the impact was mostly to OOD and interactive sessions.&nbsp; I didn't see any real impacts to the login or other batch compute nodes.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-findings%3A\">Findings:<\/h2><p>It was nice to have some load\/memory\/etc. data from ood-poc-01 in grafana, so we could see when things started and ended.<\/p><p>It would have been nice to have a notification prior to the users finding out about the problems<\/p><p>It would have been nice to see the load average from the cnfs servers.&nbsp; That info gathering has been turned on.&nbsp; You should be able to go to&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/d\/C-JW6PyWz\/cnfs-status?refresh=5m&amp;orgId=1\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:3000\/d\/C-JW6PyWz\/cnfs-status?refresh=5m&amp;orgId=1<\/a>&nbsp;to see cnfs statistics jumbled together.&nbsp; Maybe not all that useful initially, but may give insights for future events.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                           <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-re-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Remotely Restarting OpenVPN Part Deux II (Restart the Service)\n       <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-stepsssh-to-a-submit\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-steps\">Steps<\/h3><ol><li>SSH to a submit node<\/li><li>SSH to something on the \"inside\" (<a href=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>)<\/li><li>SSH to&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/access.admin.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">access.admin.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>Check Service<\/li><li>Restart Service<span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><br class=\"_mce_tagged_br\"><\/span><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-1.-ssh-to-a-login-no\">1. SSH to a login node<\/h3><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" src=\"attachments\/18225170\/150340944.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/18225170\/150340944.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"150340944\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2023-6-9_8-58-3.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"18225170\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"6\"><\/span><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-2.%C2%A0ssh-to-something-\"><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\">2.&nbsp;<\/span>SSH to something on the \"inside\" (<a href=\"http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/\" style=\"font-size: 14.0px;\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/gbs35-grafana.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>)<\/h3><h3 id=\"bkmrk-3.-ssh-to%C2%A0access.adm\">3. SSH to&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/access.admin.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">access.admin.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/h3><ul><li>access will send you a push to login<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk--2\"><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" src=\"attachments\/18225170\/18225175.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/18225170\/18225175.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"18225175\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2019-1-29_14-34-23.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"18225170\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"6\"><\/span><\/h3><h3 id=\"bkmrk-4.-check-the-service\">4. Check the Service<\/h3><p>Service broken:<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@access ~]# systemctl status openvpnas -l\n\n\nneed to copy next time it fails<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h3 id=\"bkmrk-5.-restart-the-servi\"><br>5. Restart the Service<\/h3><ul><li>Switch to root<\/li><li>Start service<\/li><li>Verify it is running<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl start openvpnas<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Service working correctly:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">bash-4.2$ systemctl status openvpnas -l\n\u25cf id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp\">Operations Team : GPFS - Collector fills up root partition<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div         <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Storage---GPFS---Archive---ZFS_18223014.html\">Storage - GPFS - Archive - ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"18225088.html\">GPFS \/ DDN<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-2\">\n                            Operations Team : GPFS - Collector fills up root partition\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span> on May 13, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-two-part-solution%3Ach\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Two part solution:<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-change-configuration\">Change Configuration to Use Less Space<\/h3><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@stor-nsd-017 zimon]# pwd\n\/opt\/IBM\/zimon\n\n## Edit ZIMonCollector.cfg\n## As shown below, in 4 places change the file size to 500m and number of files to 1.\n\ndomains = {\n        # this is the raw domain\n        aggregation = 0         # aggregation factor for the raw domain is always 0.\n#       ram = \"500m\"            # amount of RAM to be used\n        duration = \"12h\"        # amount of time that data with the highest precision is kept.\n        filesize = \"500m\"       # maximum file size\n        files = 1               # number of files.\n},\n{\n        # this is the first aggregation domain that aggregates to 30 seconds\n        aggregation = 30\n#       ram = \"800m\"            # amount of RAM to be used\n        duration = \"1w\"         # keep 30 second aggregates for 1 week.\n        filesize = \"500m\"               # maximum file size\n        files = 1               # number of files.\n},\n{\n        # this is the second aggregation domain that aggregates to 30*30 seconds == 15 minutes\n        aggregation = 30\n#       ram = \"800m\"            # amount of RAM to be used\n        duration = \"2m\"         # keep 15 minute averages for 2 months.\n        filesize = \"500m\"               # maximum file size\n        files = 1               # number of files.\n},\n{\n        # this is the third aggregation domain that aggregates to 30*30*24 seconds == 6 hours\n        aggregation = 24\n#       ram = \"800m\"            # amount of RAM to be used\n        duration = \"1y\"         #\n        filesize = \"500m\"               # maximum file size\n        files = 1               # number of files.\n}\n\n## Restart pmsensors and pmcollector\n## Sometimes this release space.  Other times you need to manually delete files in the numbered directories.\n\n systemctl restart pmsensors\n systemctl restart pmcollector\n\n\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-delete-some-space\">Delete Some Space<\/h3><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">## the file in folder \"1\" are usually the problem.\n\n[root@stor-nsd-017 data]# pwd\n\/opt\/IBM\/zimon\/data\n[root@stor-nsd-017 data]# ls -ahls\ntotal 308K\n4.0K drwxr-x---  6 root root 4.0K Apr 11 12:59 .\n4.0K drwxr-xr-x. 7 root root 4.0K Apr 11 14:14 ..\n4.0K drwxr-x---  2 root root 4.0K May 13 18:05 1\n4.0K drwxr-x---  2 root root 4.0K Apr 11 12:59 2\n4.0K drwxr-x---  2 root root 4.0K Apr 11 12:59 3\n4.0K drwxr-x---  2 root root 4.0K Apr 11 12:59 4\n244K -rw-r--r--  1 root root 244K May 13 18:05 keystore.gdbm\n 40K -rw-r--r--  1 root root  40K May 13 18:04 metadatastore.gdbm\n[root@stor-nsd-017 data]# du -hx -d 1 | sort -h\n8.0K    .\/4\n748K    .\/3\n96M     .\/2\n829M    .\/1\n926M    .\n\n## Restart pmsensors and pmcollector.  Space may not be available because the files are in use.  Restart the services to release space.\n systemctl restart pmsensors\n systemctl restart pmcollector<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p><a href=\"https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/en\/STXKQY_4.2.0\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r2.adv.doc\/bl1adv_RestartingThePMT.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/en\/STXKQY_4.2.0\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r2.adv.doc\/bl1adv_RestartingThePMT.htm<\/a><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                        <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-comments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Comments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <table border=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n                                                        <tr>\n                                <td>\n                                    <a name=\"comment-88408263\"><\/a>\n                                    <font class=\"smallfont\"><p>I lowered the size of the data files to 250m because some of the \/ filesystems were getting pretty full.<\/p><\/font>\n                                    <div align=\"left\" class=\"smallfont\" style=\"color: #666666; width: 98%; margin-bottom: 10px;\">\n                                        <img src=\"images\/icons\/contenttypes\/comment_16.png\" height=\"16\" width=\"16\" border=\"0\" align=\"absmiddle\">\n                                        Posted by erh16 at Nov 16, 2020 18:41\n                                    <\/div>\n                                <\/td>\n                            <\/tr>\n                                                    <\/table>\n                    <\/div>\n                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":760,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:50.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:50.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ip-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ip-2\">\n                            Operations Team : IPA\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> JACK STEVEN GUNDRUM<\/span> on Jun 27, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-log-onto-the-ipa-uti\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Log onto the IPA utils node:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">$ ssh ipa-utils01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu <\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Create a Kerberos ticket using 'kinit' and enter your IPA password.<\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Create a group using the ipa group-add command:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">$ ipa group-add name_of_group_to_add<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Add any group members using ipa group-add-member:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">$ ipa group-add-member name_of_group_to_add --users=userid1,userid2<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Sometimes a group requires an HBAC, add that using hbacrule-add-user:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">ipa hbacrule-add-user 'HBAC Name' --groups=name_of_group_to_add<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Creating a new user using ipa user-add, you'll be prompted to set a password:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">$ ipa user-add account_name --first=firstname --last=lastname --password<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":761,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:50.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:50.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

<\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n work were having problems.&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I tried to login to&nbsp;stor-cnfs-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu and wasn't able to get a connection.&nbsp; I couldn't get to cnfs-002 either.&nbsp; I pulled up the idrac for cnfs-001 and cnfs-002 and rebooted cnfs-002.&nbsp; It seemed to come up correctly and&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: getting an IP address.&nbsp; It also had errors in \/var\/log\/messages about not being able to contact some of the ldap servers.&nbsp; We restarted IPA on those servers.<\/p><p>I rebooted cnfs-001 again and it came up fine and showed the proper mmlscluter output.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Myles was looking at cnfs-003 and cnfs-004 There may have been something wrong with those Title contains numbers at the end: Managing RPM Updates 78807160
string(9687) "{"id":2694,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Managing RPM Updates","slug":"managing-rpm-updates-YHU","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ma\">Operations Team : Managing RPM Updates<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ma-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ma-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Managing RPM Updates\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on May 06, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-new-rpms-were-promot\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><p>New RPMs were promoted from QA to production resulting in the nightly yum update pulling down packages for many of the hosts.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Unfortuantely, some hosts didn't get the updates.&nbsp; For some they complained about conflicts with some of the Dell packages already installed.&nbsp; I ended up removing them.<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>yum remove -y yum-dellsysid dell-system-update dell_ft_ie_interface dell_ie_maser dell_ie_tape_quantum dell_ie_rac dell_ie_sas dell_ie_nic_intel dell_ie_ps dell_ie_idrac7 dell_ie_maser_inv_lcl dell_ie_nitrogen firmware-addon-dell dell_ie_tape_ibm dell_ie_bios dell_ie_pcissd dell_ft_install srvadmin-hapi smbios-utils-bin srvadmin-racsvc python-smbios libsmal0<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>This seemed to let some of the nodes update.&nbsp; On others they didn't actually apply packages.<\/p><p>There really isn't any output from the yum script other than an email to root, so I checked that:<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>From root@comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu Tue May 5 04:03:19 2020\nReturn-Path: &lt;root@comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu&gt;\nX-Original-To: root\nDelivered-To: root@comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\nReceived: by comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu (Postfix, from userid 0)\nid C9B6725401A9; Tue, 5 May 2020 04:03:19 -0400 (EDT)\nDate: Tue, 05 May 2020 04:03:19 -0400\nTo: root@comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\nSubject: System update: comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\nUser-Agent: Heirloom mailx 12.4 7\/29\/08\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text\/plain; charset=us-ascii\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit\nMessage-Id: &lt;20200505080319.C9B6725401A9@comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu&gt;\nFrom: root@comp-bc-0007.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu (root)\n\nLoaded plugins: product-id, subscription-manager\nwarning: rpmts_HdrFromFdno: Header V4 RSA\/SHA512 Signature, key ID 34d8786f: NOKEY\nError: The GPG keys listed for the \"dsu_os_dependent_6Server_x86_64\" repository are already installed but they are not correct for this package.\nCheck that the correct key URLs are configured for this repository.\nLoaded plugins: product-id, subscription-manager<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>Looks like the GPG keys for this repo are installed, but aren't correct.&nbsp; I wasn't sure how to clean this out...<\/p><p>Looking in the redhat.repo file I can see an entry for the repository concerned.&nbsp; It listed an sslclientcert in the repo file, so I figured to remove that and allow the system to put it back if needed when the puppet runs and hope that it would put back the proper keys for the repo.<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#!\/bin\/bash\n\ndsu_cert=$(grep dsu_os_dep \/etc\/yum.repos.d\/redhat.repo -B 1 | grep sslclientcert | cut -f 3 -d' ' | cut -f 1 -d.)\n\nif [ -e \"${dsu_cert}-key.pem\" ]\nthen\n    rm -f ${dsu_cert}-key.pem\n    rm -f ${dsu_cert}.pem\nelse\n    echo \"Not here... $dsu_cert\"\nfi\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Running this allowed the yum script to run and install the updates to the node.<\/p><p>Unfortunately, this seemed to be a somewhat short-lived fix.&nbsp; The improper keys that the yum cron complains about, seemed to get put back in place at some point, so I had to run this again on a few nodes.<\/p><p>After a while I was able to make sure all nodes had the proper software.<\/p><p>Example output from before all nodes were updated:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>$ pdsh -g bc,hc,gc,sc,lc,clgc,clhc,clpc \"rpm -qa | grep vim-enhanced- | sort \" | dshbak -c \n.\n.\n.\npdsh@lehi: comp-sc-0510: ssh exited with exit code 255\n----------------\ncomp-bc-[0001-0008,0010-0017,0019-0028,0031-0041,0043-0046,0048-0053,0055-0057,0059-0060,0062,0064,0066-0068,0070-0075,0077,0079-0096,0099-0100,0102-0109,0111-0126,0129-0135,0137-0138,0140-0143,0145,0147-0148,0151-0154,0157-0162,0167-0168,0170-0171,0173-0186,0188-0192,0194-0205,0207-0212,0214,0216-0221,0223-0224,0226,0228-0233,0235-0237,0239-0276,0278-0297,0299-0364,0366-0384],comp-clgc-[0001-0003,0005-0007,0010-0018,0021-0022,0024,0027-0029,0033-0040,0042,0044-0046,0048-0051,0053-0056,0059-0063,0065-0066,0068-0069,0071-0077,0081-0082,0084],comp-clhc-[0001-0002],comp-clpc-[0101,0103-0108,0110,0112],comp-gc-[0001-0012,0016-0027],comp-hc-[0002-0005,0007-0016,0018-0021,0024],comp-lc-[0001-0004,0007-0012,0014,0016-0040,0042-0071,0073-0084,0086-0090,0092-0096],comp-sc-[0001-0023,0025-0206,0208-0244,0246-0247,0249-0253,0255-0266,0268-0270,0272-0279,0281-0284,0287-0299,0301-0306,0308,0310-0317,0319-0322,0324-0327,0329-0332,0334,0336-0337,0339-0346,0348-0354,0356-0357,0359-0362,0364-0365,0367-0371,0373-0377,0379-0380,0383-0388,0390-0398,0401-0403,0405-0413,0415-0429,0431-0442,0444-0449,0452-0461,0463-0469,0471-0472,0474-0475,0477-0509,0511-0528]\n----------------\nvim-enhanced-7.4.629-5.el6_10.2.x86_64\n----------------\ncomp-bc-[0009,0018,0029-0030,0042,0047,0054,0058,0061,0063,0065,0069,0076,0078,0097-0098,0101,0110,0127-0128,0136,0139,0144,0146,0149-0150,0155,0163-0166,0169,0172,0187,0193,0206,0213,0215,0222,0227,0234,0238],comp-clgc-[0004,0008-0009,0019-0020,0023,0025-0026,0030-0032,0041,0043,0047,0052,0057-0058,0064,0067,0070,0083,0085],comp-clpc-[0102,0109],comp-sc-[0245,0248,0254,0267,0271,0280,0285-0286,0300,0309,0318,0328,0333,0335,0338,0355,0363,0366,0372,0378,0381-0382,0399-0400,0404,0414,0430,0443,0450-0451,0462,0470]\n----------------\nvim-enhanced-7.4.629-5.el6_8.1.x86_64\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>After Title is blank after consecutive number removal...Auto-Title applied: Operations Team : AMON HA Instance (Cowen Group)string(16197) "{"id":2700,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Operations Team : AMON HA Instance (Cowen Group)","slug":"operations-team-amon-ha-instance-cowen-group-vTi","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-am\">Operations Team : AMON HA Instance (Cowen Group)<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"ACI-Hosted-Systems-for-faculty_18220277.html\">ACI Hosted Systems for faculty<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-am-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-am-2\">\n                            Operations Team : AMON HA Instance (Cowen Group)\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-adam-bren\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ADAM BRENT FOCHT<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Nov 09, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-overviewproduction-i\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-overview\">Overview<\/h2><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-production-instances\">Production Instances<\/h2><p>There are two physical systems used by the AMON team for production processing.&nbsp; One is located in the Computer Building and one in the Tower Road Datacenter.&nbsp; HA is attained via Corosync, Pacemaker, and DRBD.&nbsp; The HA configuration is a synced block device (mounted at \/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd) housing the MySQL data files, the home directory for the AMON user (which includes the python code used in processing), and configuration files for Apache and RabbitMQ.&nbsp; A virtual IP is also provided for failover.&nbsp; The VIP, MySQL, Apache, and RabbitMQ services are managed via Pacemaker and Corosync (not via init scripts, so chkconfig should always be configured off and the service command should not be used) service-specific ocf providers.&nbsp; Red Hat Software Collections python27 is installed to provide an updated Python environment required by the AMON codebase.&nbsp; Python processes are managed by the ocf::heartbeat::anything provider.&nbsp; Hosts are <a href=\"http:\/\/dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> and <a href=\"http:\/\/dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> internally, and the management interfaces are the standard mgt sub-suite.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-kernel-update-consid\">Kernel Update Considerations<\/h3><p>The production hardware includes Intel 10G cards that are not natively supported by the RHEL 6 kernel.&nbsp; At this time, kernel updates require a build of the Intel ixgbe module, which can only be built against a running kernel - <strong>console access must be ensured prior to kernel update reboots<\/strong>.<\/p><p>Management iDRAC hosts are:&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/dfc13-amon-01a.mgt.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dfc13-amon-01a.mgt.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/dfc13-amon-01b.mgt.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dfc13-amon-01b.mgt.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-development-instance\">Development Instances<\/h2><p>There are four instances to be used by the AMON team for development.&nbsp; Two are HA processing nodes, and two are database servers.&nbsp; All are VMs on the ACI production VMWare cluster.&nbsp; All AMON users have full sudo on these four systems.&nbsp; The HA configuration is the same as the production, however, the roles are split (database and processing).&nbsp; There are no kernel update considerations for the development systems.&nbsp; Hosts are dfc13-amon-devel01.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu and <a href=\"http:\/\/dfc13-amon-devel01.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dfc13-amon-devel02.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> for the processing tools, and \\[...\\] for the database HA servers.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-create-new-ha-resour\">Create New HA Resources<\/h2><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># pcs resource create p_amonrt_client ocf:heartbeat:anything params binfile=\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/twistd-wrapper cmdline_options='-n -l client.log --pidfile client.pid clientpost --hostport http:\/\/localhost:8080 --epath \/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/events\/' workdir=\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/AmonPy\/amonpy\/ops\/network pidfile=\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/AmonPy\/amonpy\/ops\/network\/p_amonrt_client.pid user=amon --group g_amon<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Given the above example, be mindful to:<\/p><ul><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Use a separate pidfile from the underlying process due to how Pacemaker\/Corosync tracks processes and the need to build the python environment via wrapper script.&nbsp; For instance, use the resource primitive name as the filename with the suffix (.pid) determining the file purpose as above.&nbsp; Note the cmdline_options point the underlying process to use client.pid for the pidfile while the Pacemaker configuration points to p_amonrt_client.pid.&nbsp; Note that the wrapper script PID is tracked in p_amonrt_client.pid and the twistd PID is tracked in client.pid.<\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Use a wrapper to ensure the python environment is set up appropriately and to ensure the appropriate system signals are trapped and propagated.&nbsp; The system python does not provide the update level or libraries necessary for the operation of the amon codebase.&nbsp; Use an existing tool wrapper if it is already created (twistd below), or create a new one if needed.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/twistd-wrapper<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#!\/bin\/bash\n\nsource ~\/amonrt-python27-enable\n\nMYPID=$$\n\ntrap 'pkill -9 -u amon -P ${MYPID}' EXIT\n\n\/opt\/rh\/python27\/root\/usr\/bin\/twistd $@<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Add the new resource to the g_amon group.<\/p><\/li><\/ul><p>View the current resources:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># pcs resource show\n Master\/Slave Set: ms_drbd_mysql [p_drbd_mysql]\n     Masters: [ dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n     Slaves: [ dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n Resource Group: g_mysql\n     p_fs_mysql    (ocf::heartbeat:Filesystem) Started\n     p_ip_mysql    (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2) Started\n     p_mysql    (ocf::heartbeat:mysql) Started\n     p_ip_ext_mysql    (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2) Started\n Clone Set: cl_ping [p_ping]\n     Started: [ dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n Resource Group: g_amon\n     p_amonrt_comet    (ocf::heartbeat:anything) Started\n     p_amonrt_celery    (ocf::heartbeat:anything) Started\n     p_amonrt_twistd    (ocf::heartbeat:anything) Started\n Resource Group: g_apache\n     p_apache    (ocf::heartbeat:apache) Started\n Resource Group: g_rabbitmq\n     p_rabbitmq    (ocf::rabbitmq:rabbitmq-server) Started <\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-create-ha-resource-o\">Create HA Resource Ordering Relationships<\/h2><p>If a given resource requires another resource to be running prior to starting, specify the order constraint:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># pcs constraint order start p_amonrt_celery then start p_amonrt_twistd INFINITY id=o_amonrt-celery_before_amonrt-twistd<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">View the current ordering constraints:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># pcs constraint order show --full\nOrdering Constraints:\n  promote ms_drbd_mysql then start g_mysql (score:INFINITY) (id:o_drbd_before_mysql)\n  start g_mysql then start g_amon (kind:Mandatory) (id:o_mysql_before_amon)\n  start p_amonrt_celery then start p_amonrt_twistd (kind:Mandatory) (id:o_amonrt-celery_before_amonrt-twistd)\n  promote ms_drbd_mysql then start g_apache (kind:Mandatory) (id:o_drbd_before_apache)\n  promote ms_drbd_mysql then start g_rabbitmq (kind:Mandatory) (id:o_drbd_before_rabbitmq)<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-review-and-verify-cu\">Review and Verify Current HA Configuration<\/h2><p>To review the current configuration:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># crm configure show\nnode dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\nnode dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\nprimitive p_amonrt_celery ocf:heartbeat:anything \\\n        params binfile=\"\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/celery-wrapper\" cmdline_options=\"worker --pidfile=celery.pid --logfile=celery.log --app=analyser --concurrency=1 -l info\" workdir=\"\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/AmonPy\/amonpy\/ops\" pidfile=\"\/var\/lib\/mysql_drbd\/amon\/AmonPy\/amonpy\/ops\/p_amonrt_celery.pid\" user=\"amon\" \\\n        op start interval=\"0s\" timeout=\"20s\" \\\n        op stop interval=\"0s\" timeout=\"20s\" \\\n       &nbsp;op monitor interval=\"10\" timeout=\"20s\"\nprimitive p_amonrt_comet ocf:heartbeat:anything \\\n[...]<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>To search for configuration issues with the current running configuration (no output means no issues):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># crm_verify -L -V<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-common-debugging\">Common Debugging<\/h2><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">The most common issue with the amon HA pair is stray processes interfering with the monitored ones.&nbsp; In particular, twistd and celery processes tend to linger after any kind of interruption in service.&nbsp; To address this, stop the g_amon resource group, kill stray processes, then restart the resource group, cleaning up the stray errors:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># pcs status\nCluster name: \n============\nLast updated: Tue May 21 10:26:22 2019\nLast change: Tue May 21 10:16:29 2019 via crmd on dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\nStack: openais\nCurrent DC: dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu - partition with quorum\nVersion: 1.1.7-6.el6-148fccfd5985c5590cc601123c6c16e966b85d14\n2 Nodes configured, 2 expected votes\n13 Resources configured.\n============\n\nOnline: [ dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n\nFull list of resources:\n\n Master\/Slave Set: ms_drbd_mysql [p_drbd_mysql]\n     Masters: [ dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n     Slaves: [ dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n Resource Group: g_mysql\n     p_fs_mysql\t(ocf::heartbeat:Filesystem):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n     p_ip_mysql\t(ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n     p_mysql\t(ocf::heartbeat:mysql):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n     p_ip_ext_mysql\t(ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n Clone Set: cl_ping [p_ping]\n     Started: [ dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu dfc13-amon-01b.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu ]\n Resource Group: g_amon\n     p_amonrt_comet\t(ocf::heartbeat:anything):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu FAILED\n     p_amonrt_celery\t(ocf::heartbeat:anything):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n     p_amonrt_twistd\t(ocf::heartbeat:anything):\tStopped\n Resource Group: g_apache\n     p_apache\t(ocf::heartbeat:apache):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n Resource Group: g_rabbitmq\n     p_rabbitmq\t(ocf::rabbitmq:rabbitmq-server):\tStarted dfc13-amon-01a.hs.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\n\n\n#&nbsp;crm resource stop g_amon\n# ps auxww | grep -i comet\namon     122907  0.0  0.0 274300 21964 ?        S    May20   0:00 \/opt\/rh\/python27\/root\/usr\/bin\/python2 \/opt\/rh\/python27\/root\/usr\/bin\/twistd -l twistd.log comet -r -b -v --broadcast-port=5350 --local-ivo ivo:\/\/amon\/amon --save-event\n# kill 122907\n# ps auxww | grep -i twistd\namon     121607  0.0  0.1 732284 164060 ? Title contains numbers at the end: Nagios Configuration Files 91226705
string(10198) "{"id":2701,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Nagios Configuration Files","slug":"nagios-configuration-files-vRn","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-na\">Operations Team : Nagios Configuration Files<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Configuring-Nagios-Monitoring_91226822.html\">Configuring Nagios Monitoring<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-na-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-na-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Nagios Configuration Files\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-robert-sa\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Robert Sand<\/span>, last modified on Jan 29, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-nagios-configura\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The Nagios configuration files for checking status of hosts are located in \/etc\/nagios\/conf.d. These files are broken down into the host<br>groups that each host is assigned to within the Nagios status page. A current list of config files are:<\/p><ul><li><p>amon.cfg - The amon nodes<\/p><\/li><li><p>login.cfg - The login nodes<\/p><\/li><li><p>operations.cfg - other operation servers<\/p><\/li><li><p>switches.cfg - other network switches<\/p><\/li><li><p>brocade.cfg - Brocade network switches<\/p><\/li><li><p>moab.cfg - moab and torque servers<\/p><\/li><li><p>protocol.cfg - SMB protocol servers<\/p><\/li><li><p>user-facing.cfg - User facing (accounts, datacommons, portal)<\/p><\/li><li>dell.cfg - Dell network switches<\/li><li>storage.cfg - Storage devices<\/li><\/ul><p>The configuration files consist of three to four sections, host and host group definition, service and service group definition, command definitions,<br>and service to host definitions. Each of these sections depend upon a template or previously defined and registered definition.&nbsp; By default each <br>definition is registered unless explicitly stated not to register.&nbsp; At this time none of the configuration files use a service group definition.&nbsp; Below are<br>examples of each definition section:<\/p><ul><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Host definitions:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: text; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">define host{\n        use                     linux-server         ;Template to use   \n        host_name               moab01\t\t\t\t ;Host name to use in definitions\n        alias                   moab01 Production    ;Descriptor of the host\n        address                 10.100.1.20\t\t\t ;IP address of the host\n}<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Nagios will not do dns lookups so you can use whatever host name you would like but the address must be reachable from your Nagios<br>server.<\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Host Group definition:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">define hostgroup{\n        hostgroup_name  batch                        ;The name of the hostgroup\n        alias           Batch Servers                ;Long name of the group\n        members         moab01,torque01,torque02     ;previously defined hosts included in this group\n        }<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">The host group is listed on the nagios web page as a way to break down the hosts into the groups for easier monitoring.<\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Service definition (active):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">define service{\n        use                    local-service                   ;Name of service template to use\n        host_name               moab01,torque01,torque02       ;Host or hosts this service will be used on\n        service_description     PING                           ;Descriptive name of service\n   \t    check_command\t\t\tcheck_ping!100.0,20%!500.0,60% ;Command used to check the service\n        }<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">In the host_name field you can use a single host, multiple hosts, and regular expressions like stor-nsd* to shorten up the number of service definitions.<br>The command field can be any of the available plugins.&nbsp; To find the plugins available look in \/usr\/lib64\/nagios\/plugins or you can download any of the<br>plugins available on the nagios web site.<\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Service definition (passive):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">define service{\n        use                             local-service         ;Name of service template to use\n        host_name                       moab01\n        service_description             MoabSum\n\t    active_checks_enabled\t        0                     ;Disable active check\n\t    passive_checks_enabled\t        1                     ;Enable passive check\n\t    flap_detection_enabled\t        0                     ;Disable flap detection\n\t    notifications_enabled\t\t    1                     ;Enable Notifications\n\t    check_period\t\t\t        24x7\n\t    check_freshness\t\t\t        1\n\t    freshness_threshold\t\t        300\n\t    check_command\t\t\t        no_passive\n        }<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">As you can see there are a number of options for each defined type to get a list of the options look on the nagios web site.&nbsp; You can see above a<br>check_command of no_passive.&nbsp; This is a user defined command that you will see in the next definition type.&nbsp; A passive service is performed on the<br>server being checked and the results of the check are sent to the nagios host using the nsca_send command downloaded from nagios and compiled<br>on the server being checked.<\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Command Definition:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">define command{\n\tcommand_name\tno_passive                             ;Command name\n\tcommand_line\t$USER1$\/check_dummy 2 \"No job updates\" ;Command and options\n\t}<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">This command will check to see if there is any passive data sent to the nagios server.&nbsp; If there isn't any data the \"No job updates\" string will be <br>displayed as the status with a '2' = critical level.<\/p><\/li><\/ul><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Be careful of defining the same service more than once unless you use the \"register 0\" definition option in the definition. Once you have a configuration file<br>completed it should be tested before restarting the nagios service.&nbsp; To test all configuration files use the command '\/sbin\/nagios -v \/etc\/nagios\/nagios.cfg'. If<br>there are any warning errors try to fix them because they will become a problem later on.&nbsp; If there are any errors that will stop nagios from running they will<br>show up at the end of the command output.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":771,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:51.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:51.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Auto Deploy - Convert from Stateful to Stateless\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Jul 08, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-auto-deploy-conversi\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-auto-deploy-conversi-1\">Auto Deploy Conversion Checklist<\/h3><ul><li>Host must be assigned a Host Profile that includes Auto Deploy. (Home \/ Policy and Profiles \/ Host Profiles \/ Select a Profile \/ Actions \/ Attach Detach Hosts and Clusters)<\/li><li>Host must be included in an Auto Deploy Rule.&nbsp; (Home \/ Auto Deploy \/ Deploy Rules)<\/li><li>Put host in Maintenance Mode<\/li><li>From VMware PowerCLI run the following.&nbsp; Details below.&nbsp; This will not be part of the normal update process.<ul><li>PS C:\\Users\\mdg104&gt; get-vmhost <a href=\"http:\/\/esxi-0006.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">esxi-0006.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> | Test-DeployRuleSetCompliance | Repair-DeployRuleSetCompliance<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Connect to iDRAC and console.<\/li><li>Use iDRAC Next Boot to boot into Lifecycle Controller.<\/li><li>Reboot host from vCenter.<\/li><li>Verify BIOS Settings<ul><li>Verify host is set for UEFI boot in BIOS. (System Setup \/ Advanced Hardware Configuration \/ System BIOS \/ Boot Settings )<\/li><li>Verify host is set to PXE boot.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Allow host to reboot after BIOS changes.&nbsp; Or reboot from vCenter if not BIOS changes were made.<\/li><li>It should PXE Boot.<ul><li>Compliance check will fail.&nbsp; Then it will check again and pass.&nbsp; (Host \/ Configure \/ Host Profile)<\/li><li>Sometimes it seems like you need to Remediate it.&nbsp; Other times it seems to do it on its own.&nbsp;&nbsp; (Host \/ Configure \/ Host Profile \/ Remediate)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-fix-for-failing-to-p\">Fix for failing to PXE \/ Auto Deploy<\/h3><p>Everything seems to be set for autodeploy, but PXE boot fails and will reboot again in 5 minutes.&nbsp; Error:<\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/78807718\/81854514.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/78807718\/81854514.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854514\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2020-7-3_15-18-36.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"78807718\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"10\"><\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">Details: This host has been added to VC, but no Image Profile\nis associated with it. You can use Apply-ESXImageProfile in the\nPowerCLI to associate an Image Profile with this host.\nAlternatively, you can reevaluate the rules for this host with the\nTest-DeployRuleSetCompliance and Repair-DeployRuleSetCompliance cmdlets.<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><a href=\"https:\/\/docs.vmware.com\/en\/VMware-vSphere\/7.0\/com.vmware.vsphere.vcenterhost.doc\/GUID-54D5B7E5-2C3E-4141-BDB8-75720E7875DB.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/docs.vmware.com\/en\/VMware-vSphere\/7.0\/com.vmware.vsphere.vcenterhost.doc\/GUID-54D5B7E5-2C3E-4141-BDB8-75720E7875DB.html<\/a><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">Windows PowerShell\nCopyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. You may experience problems when using this profile with Auto Deploy.\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h3 id=\"bkmrk-old-process\">Old Process<\/h3><ul><li>Allow host to Reboot into PXE, it will fail.<\/li><li>Then use iDRAC Next Boot to force hard drive boot.<ul><li>Allow vCenter to check compliance of the host.&nbsp; You can watch it.&nbsp; (Host \/ Configure \/ Profile)&nbsp;&nbsp;<ul><li>The compliance check will fail.&nbsp; Once it fails it will show up in the Deployed Host list and you can assign in Image Profile.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Assign an Image Profile. Title is blank after consecutive number removal...Auto-Title applied: Operations Team : rc-xdmod database configuration (mariadb and mongodb)string(4026) "{"id":2703,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Operations Team : rc-xdmod database configuration (mariadb and mongodb)","slug":"operations-team-rc-xdmod-database-configuration-mariadb-and-mongodb-Op4","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-rc\">Operations Team : rc-xdmod database configuration (mariadb and mongodb)<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; The script creates config<\/p><p>information in the etc\/portal_settings.ini file including the servername, database username and<\/p><p>password for each of the database tables for the mariadb database.&nbsp; The mongodb database for<\/p><p>the pcp data is done inside an anaconda environment. There are other commands in the bin<\/p><p>directory that need to be run to setup the processes that collect the data from slurm and process<\/p><p>the ingested data from both slurm and the pcp data processes.&nbsp; All of the information for<\/p><p>setting up the databases is in the installation pages for the given modules.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":773,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:51.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:51.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
