Title contains numbers at the end: KPI   Key Performance Indicators 150340316
string(8019) "{"id":2706,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"KPI   Key Performance Indicators","slug":"kpi-key-performance-indicators-SkK","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-kp\">Operations Team : KPI - Key Performance Indicators<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-kp-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-kp-2\">\n                            Operations Team : KPI - Key Performance Indicators\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> ROBERT GLEN GRONER<\/span> on Jun 15, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-system-availability%3A\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-system-availability%3A-1\">System Availability: 96%<\/h1><p>96% availability is a bit more than 14 days and 14 hours of downtime in a year.&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\">Including 4x36-48 hour maintenance windows?&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-availability-definit\">Availability definition:<\/h2><p>Much of the Availability will need to be calculated manually.&nbsp; Rather than counting the time that the system is available, it's likely much easier to calculate the time that it's down.&nbsp;<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-whole-system-downtim\">Whole system downtime<\/h3><p>If critical services aren't working, the entire system is counted as down.&nbsp; For all of these it will require manual entry into a database for the downtime to be counted.&nbsp; This should be done regularly and communicated to the team so we can agree on the downtime counted.<\/p><ol><li>none of the login nodes are available. (ssh from outside is working)<\/li><li>batch system is down.<ul><li>job submissions are all failing.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>file storage is offline <span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\">(any combination?)<\/span>.<ul><li>group, home, work, scratch, icds software, license servers etc.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>License servers are not functional\/available<\/li><li>Network connection to the outside world is down.<\/li><li>External connection to portal (OoD) works<\/li><li>External connection to globus endpoints (datamgr and archive) works.<\/li><\/ol><p>We need an automated way to collect and store data related to the above metrics.&nbsp; For example:<\/p><ol><li>External (maybe at vmhosting) node should be able to establish connection to ssh services at submit.hpc.psu.edu<\/li><li>Squeue or sinfo query returns standard info<\/li><li>Try creating a file on group\/home\/work\/scratch and removing the file regularly.<\/li><li>Something to check software license availabity:<ol><li>maybe as simple as lmstat<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Check to see that we can get to google\/amazon or similar<\/li><li>External access to HTTPS for portal<\/li><li>Can we script a globus connection regularly?<\/li><\/ol><p>If more than 20% of the compute resources in the cluster are down\/offline, the system is down.&nbsp;<\/p><ul><li>If we have 10000 cores in the system, if 2000 cores are offline, the entire system is down.<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-individual-node-or-r\">Individual node or resource downtime<\/h3><p>We count downtime for individual cores that are unallocated on drained or down nodes.&nbsp; This must be done automatically and regularly.&nbsp; This could probably be scripted with sinfo to output number of cores that are unavailable. Something like the following could be parsed to determine resources that may be unavailable for users.<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>$ sinfo -S N -O StateCompact,Nodes,CPUsState,Gres,GresUsed\nSTATE               NODES               CPUS(A\/I\/O\/T)       GRES                GRES_USED           \nmix                 2                   52\/44\/0\/96          gpu:2               gpu:1               \nidle                33                  0\/1584\/0\/1584       gpu:2               gpu:0               \nmix                 1                   1\/47\/0\/48           gpu:2               gpu:2               \nidle                2                   0\/96\/0\/96           gpu:14              gpu:0               \nmix                 64                  1581\/1479\/0\/3060    (null)              gpu:0               \nidle                260                 0\/12636\/0\/12636     (null)              gpu:0               \nalloc               23                  1104\/0\/0\/1104       (null)              gpu:0               \ndrain*              1                   0\/0\/48\/48           (null)              gpu:0            <\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-job-failure-rate%3A-le\">Job Failure rate: less than 2% of jobs should fail due to system issues.&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/h1><p>This one is likely also to require some manual intervention to identify jobs that failed due to system issues.&nbsp; If we notice that a node fails while a job is on it, we should count that as a failure.&nbsp; Similarly, if users report problems and we find that the problem was our fault (filesystem went offline, node rebooted, network failure).&nbsp; We should add those jobs to the list.<\/p><p>The next question is.....&nbsp; Should jobs carry a different weight based on certain factors.&nbsp; For example is a single-core job that lasts for 5 min counted the same as a single job that spans 100 nodes and runs for a week?<\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\">I believe these jobs should be normalized somehow by core and time allocated.&nbsp; &nbsp;When you mention less than 2% what is the time period?&nbsp; Running 12 month average?&nbsp; Monthly?&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":776,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

command\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div on Sep 28, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-mount-command-wi\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-the-mount-command-wi-1\">The mount command will report gpfs shares differently depending on OS version.<\/h3><p>Appears to be a normal behavior.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">### Old Way  RHEL 6.10\n[mdg104@comp-sc-0195 ~]$ mount |grep gpfs\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,dev=stor-as-100-200.stor-nsd-001:scratch,ldev=scratch)\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,dev=stor-as-100-200.stor-nsd-001:group,ldev=group)\n\n[mdg104@comp-bc-0336 ~]$ mount |grep gpfs\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,dev=stor-as-100-200.stor-nsd-001:scratch,ldev=scratch)\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,dev=stor-as-100-200.stor-nsd-001:group,ldev=group)\n\n[mdg104@aci-lgn-004 ~]$ mount | grep gpfs\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,dev=stor-as-100-200.stor-nsd-001:group,ldev=group)\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,dev=stor-as-100-200.stor-nsd-001:scratch,ldev=scratch)\n\n### New Way RHEL 7.8\n[mdg104@w2w mdg104]$ mount |grep gpfs\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,relatime)\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,relatime)\n\n[root@stor-gpfs-cc-001 ~]# mount |grep gpfs\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,relatime)\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,relatime)\n\n[mdg104@swst-001 mdg104]$ mount |grep gpfs\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,relatime)\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,relatime)\n\n### At this time bc 10 had been updated to 7.8 for testing.\n[mdg104@comp-bc-0010 ~]$ mount |grep gpfs\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,relatime)\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,relatime)\n\n[mdg104@stor-datamgr-003 ~]$ mount |grep gpfs\nscratch on \/gpfs\/scratch type gpfs (rw,relatime)\ngroup on \/gpfs\/group type gpfs (rw,relatime)<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div> "{"id":2708,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Operations Team : (b) Configuration Steps for Open OnDemand (ood)","slug":"operations-team-b-configuration-steps-for-open-ondemand-ood-AuA","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-%28b\">Operations Team : (b) Configuration Steps for Open OnDemand (ood)<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Open-OnDemand-Installation-and-Testing_92799790.html\">Open OnDemand Installation and Testing<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-%28b-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-%28b-2\">\n                            Operations Team : (b) Configuration Steps for Open OnDemand (ood)\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-robert-sa\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Robert Sand<\/span>, last modified on Aug 31, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-configuration-of-the\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><p><span class=\"c1\">Configuration of the cluster tab:<\/span><\/p><ul><li><span class=\"c1\">Create the cluster.d directory 'mkidr \/etc\/ood\/config\/clusters.d'<\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"c1\">Copy the Cluster yaml file 'aci.yml' or create a new yaml file for the cluster needs<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p>Cluster Interactive job configuration (not needed for Roar Collab cluster. Current SLURM conf and binaries were needed):<\/p><ul><li>For \/opt\/mam we need to install perl-XML-LibXML , perl-Log-Log4perl , perl-Config-Tiny , perl-Crypt-CBC , perl-Digest-SHA , perl-JSON<\/li><li>install pbs\/torque (yum install moab-torque-client)<\/li><li>yum install hwloc-libs (if not already installed)<\/li><li>configure torque01 to accept jobs from the server<\/li><li>mkdir \/tmp\/ood_cache;chmod 770 \/tmp\/ood_cache;chgrp aci_users \/tmp\/ood_cache;chmod g+s \/tmp\/ood_cache<\/li><li>create the file \/tmp\/gdesktop-res with this text in it \"ood_gdesktop.3695893\"<\/li><\/ul><p>GPFS for scratch and group:<\/p><ul><li>install the packages for gpfs on the server (gpfs.ext.x86_64, gpfs.docs.noarch, gpfs.gpl.noarch, gpfs.crypto.x86_64, gpfs.msg.en_US, gpfs.base.x86_64, gpfs.gskit.x86_64, kernel-devel, gcc-c++).<\/li><li>build the kernel packages \/usr\/lpp\/mmfs\/bin\/mmbuildgpl<\/li><li>make sure there is a gpfs user\/group\/home and that the sudoers file allows connections from gpfs@stor-gpfs-cc-00(1,2).<\/li><li>add the server into the cluster (sudo mmaddnode N fqdn.servername, sudo mmchlicense client --accept -N fqdn.servername, sudo mmstartup -N fqdn.servername)<\/li><\/ul><p>Branding of Ondemand:<\/p><ul><li>creating the directory \/etc\/ood\/config\/apps\/dashboard<\/li><li>edit the file \/etc\/ood\/config\/apps\/dashboard\/env adding environment variables to change the look of the pages (logos and such)<\/li><li>edit the file \/etc\/ood\/config\/nginx_stage.yml (page colors and others)<\/li><li>edit the locale file to change welcome text at \/var\/www\/ood\/apps\/sys\/dashboard\/config\/locales\/en.yml<\/li><li>the psu-icds logo is located in \/var\/www\/ood\/public\/logo.png<\/li><li>to change the size of the nav-bar edit the application-&lt;long string of characters&gt;.css in \/var\/www\/ood\/apps\/sys\/dashboard\/public\/assets to change the<br>a.navbar-brand.navbar-brand-logo to be 4em instead of 2em.<\/li><\/ul><p>Interactive Apps: To install the interactive apps you can download the files from git or as I did copy the files from the current portal.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In house written apps like accounting and cluster stats needs a bit more done because of the ruby gems needed.<\/p><ul><li>change directories into the application \/var\/www\/ood\/apps\/sys\/&lt;application&gt;<\/li><li>run `scl enable rh-ruby27 bash`<\/li><li>Run `bundle install`<\/li><\/ul><p>Logic changes to the interactive desktop and interactive app forms.<\/p><ul><li>The code to change the node type by the allocation type is a modified java script from the OSC Open Ondemand Project for bc_osc_jupyter server launches.<br>The code uses events to change the node type options when an allocation is selected or changed.<\/li><\/ul><p>User shared and sandbox apps:<\/p><ul><li>A user directory created in \/var\/www\/ood\/apps\/usr will give access to a development area where apps can be shared or tested.<\/li><li>under the directory (ie) \/var\/www\/ood\/apps\/usr I have created a ros5549 dir and changed ownership to ros5549 and perms to 750<\/li><li>A symbolic link must be made to a directory in the users home directory (ie) ln -s \/storage\/home\/ros5549\/ondemand\/share \/var\/www\/ood\/apps\/dev\/ros5549\/gateway. <br>This can allow sharing of applications over users but more needs to be configured to do so and the share directory must exist or be created by the user.<\/li><li>A dev directory in the users ondemand directory under their home directory gives them access to applications for that user only (ie) \/storage\/home\/ros5549\/ondemand\/dev .<\/li><li>Applications can be downloaded via git into the dev directory making that application available to the user.&nbsp; Modifications may be needed to submit the application to the cluster.<\/li><\/ul><p>Reverse Proxy for interactive applications:<\/p><ul><li>The host_regex: 'comp-[ibshgclp]*c-[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]\\..*.production\\.int\\.aci\\.ics\\.psu\\.edu'<\/li><li>The node_uri: '\/node'<\/li><li>The rnode_uri: '\/rnode'<\/li><li>Variables need to be set in order for reverse proxy to the host with the vnc server connection to work. These settings are in the \/etc\/ood\/config\/ood_portal.yml file.<\/li><\/ul><p>Quotas for home\/work and group\/scratch:<\/p><ul><li>I have a script that queries the vast storage system an gets all quota data for home\/work and is in the \/root\/vast_quotas directory.&nbsp; It then converts that data into the same format that the mmrepquota does for group\/scratch.<\/li><li>The script for the group\/scratch quotas is in \/usr\/local\/bin\/check_aci_storage_quota.sh<\/li><li>Both of these are then run once a day at 5am from the root crontab.&nbsp; This could change to more than once when in production.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":778,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                Operations Team : DDN - 7k OpenStack Update Notes\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <ul><li>Shutdown Insight<\/li><li>Shutdown Veeam<\/li><li>Shutdown NFS<\/li><li>sparing policy auto<\/li><li>disk timeout 10<\/li><li>In gridscaler \/ NSD update we unmounted gpfs again&nbsp; GS Update step 2<\/li><li>Current Centos 7.4.17.08, are we updating or not?<ul><li>It is updating the OS using the ISO as a repository. to 7.7<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Move cluster manager before updating<\/li><li>GS update on NSD 23 took about 35 minutes<\/li><li>Grid Scaler update step 11 will say CCR, not Server Based.&nbsp; You can try to enable.&nbsp; It will say already enabled.<\/li><li>GPFS Update Step 3 we ran without --silent&nbsp; it then prompted us to accept the license.<\/li><li>GPFS Update Step 4 we removed crypt and adv RPMs<\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">mmchconfig release=LATEST failed&nbsp;<span style=\"color: rgb(51,51,51);\">Command completed: No changes made<\/span><\/span><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(51,51,51);\">skipped for now<\/span><\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(51,51,51);\">Skipped VNC, not sure why we needed it.&nbsp; Attempted to connect, failed, so we skipped.<\/span><\/span><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(51,51,51);\">GPFS updates do not always have a version update.<\/span><\/span><ul><li><p>mmchconfig release=LATEST failed&nbsp;Command completed: No changes made<\/p><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>During \"Manual upgrade of GPFS on NSD servers\"<ul><li>Some installs had extra packages that stopped the update&nbsp;<\/li><li>yum remove gpfs.crypto<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n string(6889) "{"id":2713,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2018 11 18 Torque problems","slug":"2018-11-18-torque-problems-qcH","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20\">Operations Team : 2018-11-18 Torque problems<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; Adam restarted Torque shortly after 6:30am on Nov 19.<\/p><p>We were still having problems so Gary restarted the torque01 server later that morning.&nbsp; That seemed to clear up some problems, but we had Torque re-using old data.&nbsp; Some of the running jobs were killed, other old jobid's were re-used and other old jobs were charged as if they had just terminated after running for over a month.<\/p><p>Later in the afternoon, the job-id reuse issue was fixed by setting the torque \"next-jobid\" to be higher than the earlier jobs.<\/p><p>We had a number of projects where we needed to \"fix\" charge records to remove bad charges.&nbsp; This took place over a few days.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>We did something like:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">\n[root@moab01 sbin]# mam-list-usagerecords  -s 2018-11-18 -e 2018-11-22  -a mjj13_b_g_sc_default | grep 2018-10\n5184181 Job  7752113  58169980 End   sxd375  sxd375  mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20         2909607 2018-10-15 15:37:01 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n5184188 Job  7751668  58169980 End   hxh5226 hxh5226 mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20 204800  2909607 2018-10-15 14:25:42 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n5184189 Job  7751470  58169980 End   hxh5226 hxh5226 mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20 204800  2909607 2018-10-15 14:15:02 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n5184190 Job  7751374  58169980 End   hxh5226 hxh5226 mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20 204800  2909607 2018-10-15 14:12:06 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n5184191 Job  7751049  58169980 End   hxh5226 hxh5226 mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20 204800  2909607 2018-10-15 14:02:46 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n5184192 Job  7750988  58169980 End   hxh5226 hxh5226 mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20 204800  2909607 2018-10-15 14:01:07 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n5184612 Job  7757854  58169980 End   sxd375  sxd375  mjj13_b_g_sc_default              batch PI               pbs         1         20         2909607 2018-10-15 21:06:02 2018-10-16 16:18:14 2018-11-19 06:48:21\n\n[root@moab01 sbin]# .\/mam-shell 'UsageRecord Modify Account~mjj13_b_g_sc_default StartTime&lt;2018-10-19 EndTime&gt;2018-11-19 Stage==End Account=junk_mistake_charges2'\nSuccessfully modified 7 usage records\n[root@moab01 sbin]# .\/mam-shell 'UsageRecord Modify Account~junk_mistake_charges2 Stage==End Account=junk_mistake_charges'\nSuccessfully modified 7 usage records\n\n\n\n\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>My purpose was to select the records of jobs that started around october 15 and ended in the morning right after Torque was restarted and remove the charges for those jobs.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Since MAM doesn't really \"remove\" charges with the way the double entry accounting works, I needed to move them somewhere else.&nbsp; My initial thought was to move them to the junk_mistake_charges project.&nbsp; However, to be able to back out changes easily, unless my mam-shell logic was bad, I used the temporary junk_mistake_charges2 account and then moved them to the junk_mistake_charges account.&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/p><p>I worked through several accounts for this effort.<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n string(4225) "{"id":2714,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2019 05 09   Torque qstat not responding","slug":"2019-05-09-torque-qstat-not-responding-Ryh","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20\">Operations Team : 2019-05-09 - Torque qstat not responding<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Downtime-Log_18222067.html\">Downtime Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-2\">\n                            Operations Team : 2019-05-09 - Torque qstat not responding\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified on May 09, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-sometime-after-12%3A40\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Sometime after 12:40pm, qstat stopped delivering output...<\/p><p>From a log that does a qstat every minute.&nbsp; At 1:26pm I see:<\/p><pre>Starting showq query... Thu May  9 12:41:52 2019\nShowq took 2 sec\nThu May  9 12:41:54 2019\nStarting showq query... Thu May  9 12:42:39 2019\nqstat: Time out \nqstat: Time out \nShowq took 1821 sec\nThu May  9 13:13:00 2019\nStarting showq query... Thu May  9 13:13:45 2019\n\n<\/pre><p>Even though the text says \"showq\" it's really doing qstat...<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Doing strace on qstat shows it pausing on a network connection.<\/p><p>Running \"netstat -an\" on torque01 shows more than 3000 connections to port 15001<\/p><pre>[root@torque01 log]# netstat -an | grep 15001 | wc\n   3162   18972  252960\n\n<\/pre><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Seeing some RX-DRP on the network.&nbsp; Not sure if that has anything to do with the problems.<\/p><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">I stopped the pbs_server and restarted it on torque01 and things seem to be responding again...<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":784,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

\n","priority":785,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Installing License Managers on LM01 18219357
string(17252) "{"id":2716,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Installing License Managers on LM01","slug":"installing-license-managers-on-lm01-KGB","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-in\">Operations Team : Installing License Managers on LM01<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"License-Managers_18221227.html\">License Managers<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-in-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-in-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Installing License Managers on LM01\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-adam-bren\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ADAM BRENT FOCHT<\/span>, last modified on May 21, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-note%3A-lm01-is-not-cu\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><strong>NOTE<\/strong>: lm01 is not currently able to serve licenses outside of our systems - there is no external network yet.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>In order to affect consistency of support and maintain a simple, clean host system, license manager services will be implemented and deployed with Docker containers rather than via native installations.&nbsp; Native installations can lead to inconsistent system profiles, or more involved installation procedures (see documentation below), therefore the need for containers.<\/p><p>These instructions are not intended to re-create the Docker documentation.&nbsp; If you are unfamiliar with Docker, please see the <a href=\"https:\/\/docs.docker.com\/get-started\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Docker Getting Started Guide<\/a>.<\/p><p>Dockerfiles which are commented and baselined via git can be found in the <a href=\"https:\/\/bitbucket.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/projects\/PLAT\/repos\/docker-lm\/browse\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">docker-lm Bitbucket repository<\/a>.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-building-a-docker-lm\">Building a Docker LM Container<\/h2><ol><li>Starting from a base Dockerfile, create a directory within that repo with the name of the software package, containing the base Dockerfile nearest the known configuration of the package in question.<\/li><li>Create the following directories within the package directory:<ol><li>installer - this will hold the binary installation artifacts that may not be redistributable;<\/li><li>licenses - this will hold the text-based license files we will want to track within git.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/docs.docker.com\/get-started\/part2\/#define-a-container-with-dockerfile\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Update<\/a> the Dockerfile:<ol><li>Create necessary directories (i.e. \/opt\/&lt;packagename&gt;);<\/li><li>Add the binary artifacts to the container;<\/li><li>Run install\/activation commands within the container, including:<ol><li>rpm\/yum installs;<\/li><li>untar and placement of toolset;<\/li><li>license activation;<\/li><li>etc.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Define the exposed ports (generally specified in the license file, and will need to be ensured to not interfere with other license manager ports);<\/li><li>Define the command to be executed when the container is run.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Build the container on lm01, i.e.:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># cd docker\/lm\/&lt;packagename&gt;\n# docker build -t &lt;packagename&gt;-lm .<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">For PZFlex as an example:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># cd docker\/lm\/pzflex\n# docker build -t pzflex-lm .<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Create the log directory on the lm01 host:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># mkdir \/var\/log\/licensing\/&lt;packagename&gt;<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">For PZFlex:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># mkdir \/var\/log\/licensing\/pzflex<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Run the container on lm01, configuring it for auto-start on boot or Docker service restart unless specifically stopped, i.e.:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># docker run -d --restart unless-stopped -v \/var\/log\/licensing\/&lt;packagename&gt;:\/var\/log --net host &lt;packagename&gt;-lm:latest<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">For PZFlex:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># docker run -d --restart unless-stopped -v \/var\/log\/licensing\/pzflex:\/var\/log --net host pzflex-lm:latest<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Verify the container is running and log files are not showing errors; for PZFlex:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@lm01 lm]# docker ps -a\nCONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES\nc3c175979ab5        pzflex-lm:latest    \"\/opt\/pzflex\/lmadmin\u2026\"   About an hour ago   Up About an hour                        distracted_thompson\n[root@lm01 lm]# tail -f \/var\/log\/licensing\/pzflex\/*.log\n==&gt; \/var\/log\/licensing\/pzflex\/lmadmin.log &lt;==\n2018-05-21 16:10:54,303 root Version: 11.15.0.0 build 215497 (2017.10.16-11.49.02)\n2018-05-21 16:10:54,304 root.LicenseEngine started without redundancy.\n2018-05-21 16:10:54,313 root.Vendor (WAIFLEX) started.\n\n==&gt; \/var\/log\/licensing\/pzflex\/WAIFLEX.log &lt;==\n16:10:54 (WAIFLEX) Server started on lm01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu for:    flex        \n16:10:54 (WAIFLEX) review        build        review_xpc    \n16:10:54 (WAIFLEX) flexlab_xpc    \n16:10:54 (WAIFLEX) EXTERNAL FILTERS are OFF\n16:20:54 (WAIFLEX) TCP_NODELAY NOT enabled<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">To stop a running container (and prevent it from auto-starting on boot or Docker daemon restart):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># docker stop distracted_thompson<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">To restart a stopped, but not rebuild container:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># docker start distracted_thompson<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol><h2 id=\"bkmrk-updating-a-license-f\">Updating a License File<\/h2><ol><li>Update the license file in the git repository;<\/li><li>Remove existing container;<\/li><li>Remove existing image;<\/li><li>Follow the build instructions above.<\/li><\/ol><h2 id=\"bkmrk-todos\">TODOs<\/h2><ol><li>Logging<\/li><li>Swarm configuration(?)<\/li><li>Monitoring in SolarWinds<\/li><\/ol><h1 id=\"bkmrk-below-instructions-d\"><span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\">Below Instructions DEPRECATED<\/span><\/h1><p>In order to affect consistency of support, we need to enforce policies on installation of license managers on the lm01 license manager server.<\/p><p>The installation directory for all license managers shall be:<\/p><pre>\/opt\/licensing\/&lt;vendor&gt;\/...<\/pre><p>We also do not want to allow license manager installers to alter the system itself, so we need to avoid running an installer script blindly at all costs.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-installing-lm-rpms\">Installing LM RPMs<\/h2><p>Extract the RPM contents (Intel will be used here as an example):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># rpm2cpio .\/intel-isl-common-2.6.0p-003.noarch.rpm | cpio -idmv\n[...]\n# rpm2cpio .\/intel-isl-2.6.0p-003.x86_64.rpm | cpio -idmv\n[...]<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Verify the RPM scriptlets:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># rpm -qp --scripts .\/intel-isl-common-2.6.0p-003.noarch.rpm\nwarning: .\/intel-isl-common-2.6.0p-003.noarch.rpm: Header V4 RSA\/SHA256 Signature, key ID eac2a93d: NOKEY\npostinstall program: \/bin\/sh\n# rpm -qp --scripts .\/intel-isl-2.6.0p-003.x86_64.rpm\nwarning: .\/intel-isl-2.6.0p-003.x86_64.rpm: Header V4 RSA\/SHA256 Signature, key ID eac2a93d: NOKEY\npostinstall scriptlet (using \/bin\/sh):\n\ntest 0\npreuninstall scriptlet (using \/bin\/sh):\nLANG=C\n\nif [ x\"$RPM_INSTALL_PREFIX\" = x\"\" ]; then\n    # It seems it is broken RPM ignoring --prefix option, so let's use default prefix.\n    export RPM_INSTALL_PREFIX=\"\/opt\/intel\/licenseserver\"\nfi\n\n# stop license server before uninstall\nif [ -f \"${RPM_INSTALL_PREFIX}\/lmutil\" ]; then\n    cd \"${RPM_INSTALL_PREFIX}\" &amp;&amp; .\/lmutil lmdown -q\nfi\n\ntest 0<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-create-the-service-f\">Create the Service File<\/h2><p>Create the flexlm systemd service file (i.e. intellm.service):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[Unit]\nDescription=Intel License Daemon\nAfter=network.target network.service\n\n[Service]\nUser=license\nWorkingDirectory=\/opt\/licensing\/intel\/flexlm\nExecStart=\/opt\/licensing\/intel\/flexlm\/lmgrd -c \/opt\/licensing\/intel\/flexlm\/server.lic -l +\/var\/log\/licensing\/intel.log\nExecStop=\/opt\/licensing\/intel\/flexlm\/lmutil lmdown -c \/opt\/licensing\/intel\/flexlm\/server.lic -q\nRestart=always\nRestartSec=30\nType=forking\n\n[Install]\nWantedBy=multi-user.target<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>Or, the Reprise LM (RLM) systemd service file (i.e. pointwiselm.service):<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[Unit]\nDescription=Pointwise RLM License Daemon\nAfter=network.target network.service\n\n[Service]\nUser=license\nWorkingDirectory=\/opt\/licensing\/pointwise\/RepriseLicenseServer\nExecStart=\/opt\/licensing\/pointwise\/RepriseLicenseServer\/linux_x86_64\/rlm -c \/opt\/licensing\/pointwise\/RepriseLicenseServer\/licenses\/pointwise_license.lic -dlog +\/var\/log\/licensing\/pointwise.log -nows\nExecStop=\/opt\/licensing\/pointwise\/RepriseLicenseServer\/linux_x86_64\/rlmutil rlmdown -q -c \/opt\/licensing\/pointwise\/RepriseLicenseServer\/licenses\/pointwise_license.lic\nRestart=always\nRestartSec=30\nType=simple\n\n[Install]\nWantedBy=multi-user.target<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>Place the resulting service file in:<\/p><pre>\/etc\/systemd\/system<\/pre><p><strong>NOTE<\/strong>: do not create the file in \/etc\/systemd as systemd may detect the new file and attempt to start the license server before other aspects are ready (i.e. prior to placing a correct license file).<\/p><p>Tell systemd about the change and start the service:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># systemctl daemon-reload\n# systemctl start intellm.service<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-enable-log-forwardin\">Enable Log Forwarding<\/h2><p>If the license manager does not use syslog, construct the following file (i.e. \/etc\/rsyslog.d\/intellm.conf) to enable periodic monitoring of an arbitrary file and forwarding through to central logging:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">$InputFileName \/var\/log\/licensing\/intel.log\n$InputFileTag intellm\n$InputFileStateFile intel-file1\n$InputFileSeverity info\n$InputFileFacility local7\n$InputRunFileMonitor\n$InputFilePersistStateInterval 1000<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-enable-lm-process-mo\">Enable LM Process Monitoring in SolarWinds SAM<\/h2><p>In SolarWinds, go to \"MY DASHBOARDS \u2192 APPLICATIONS&nbsp;\u2192 SAM SUMMARY\".&nbsp; Click on \"MANAGE APPLICATIONS\" in the \"All Applications\" panel.&nbsp; On the \"APPLICATION MONITOR TEMPLATES\" tab, select the \"flexlm\" (or \"rlm\") tag to filter by.&nbsp; Select a template and copy to a new template.&nbsp; Rename the template, the components, and adjust the process name and command line filter to match the installed server processes as well as the TCP port monitors.&nbsp; Once the template is saved, assign the template to the lm01 node.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div> Title contains numbers at the end: MGC Feature Requests 94929043
string(8236) "{"id":2717,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"MGC Feature Requests","slug":"mgc-feature-requests-9gi","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-mg\">Operations Team : MGC Feature Requests<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"ACI-Hosted-Systems-for-faculty_18220277.html\">ACI Hosted Systems for faculty<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"92799419.html\">MRI\/NIH Cluster (MGC nodes)<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-mg-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-mg-2\">\n                            Operations Team : MGC Feature Requests\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span> on Mar 29, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-request-for-some-cha\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Request for some changes to the setup per Doug Cowen<br><br><\/p><p>QOS changes are mostly in place from Corey and are reflected in the mgc.new portion of&nbsp; <a href=\"MGC-moab-config_94929029.html\">MGC moab config<\/a><\/p><p>Currently Creating new accounts for each of the sub groups for accounting purposes, will link that process here later.<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>Skouson, Gary\nThu 3\/25\/2021 9:25 AM\n\nCorey and Derick,\n\nDo you have time to look into the request below over the next few days?  It would be great to provide what we can before I leave town.  However, I understand there are other pressing tasks.  Let me know if this is a problem.\n\nThe MRI nodes have been installed and configured and Corey worked with me on the QOS configuration to allow for some basic \"queues\".  Doug would like to change things a bit as detailed below.  The \"queue\" configuration should be fairly simple with the addition of additional QOS options.\n\nFor accounting, I initially disabled it for jobs to the MGC nodes.  He wants to be able to get reports on usage and it'll be easier if we can turn on accounting.\n\nI initially configured multiple accounts under the mgc_mri and mgc_nih groups.  It sounds like he's going to want to require people to choose the account they submit to (rather than just mgc_mri)\n\nTo make this work, we'll need to add MAM accounts and either make them \"credit\" accounts, so they can charge regardless of the funds in the account or dump a bunch of \"time\" into the accounts, so they'll be able to run reports.\n\nDoug would also like to track GPU usage.  I don't think we've done that in MAM for other usage.  If you see an easy way to turn that on for his stuff that would be great, otherwise, we can stick with CPU usage only for now and look into GPU stuff later.\n\nIt makes sense to keep the MRI usage separate from the NIH usage.\n\nLet me know if you have questions.  I'm happy to get together on a zoom call and talk through things if you'd like.\n\n-----\nGary Skouson\n\n-----Original Message-----\nFrom: Doug Cowen &lt;dfc13@psu.edu&gt;\nSent: Wednesday, March 24, 2021 8:10 PM\nTo: NSFMRI-DeepLearning@lists.psu.edu; Leydig, Derek Martin &lt;dml129@psu.edu&gt;; Skouson, Gary &lt;skouson@psu.edu&gt;\nSubject: DL-SAGEMAPP queues and accounting\n\nHi DL-SAGEMAPPers,\n\nIn consultation with Gary Skouson (ICDS HPC Operations Lead), I am proposing the following queue and\naccounting\/monitoring structure for DL-SAGEMAPP.\n\nPlease let me know by this Friday noon if you have any concerns or suggestions.\n\nEverything below can be changed at a future date if warranted by our collective usage patterns.\n\nQueues:\n    - Open queue\n      - No runtime or resource limitations\n      - Usage is not counted against anyone's allocation\n      - Accounting enabled for NSF reporting\n      - Jobs are pre-emptible\n        - Preferred mode: temporarily suspend job if system supports\n        - Next best mode: signal job, allow it 1 hour to stop itself, kill it after 1 hour\n    - Debug queue\n      - Short one-hour runtime limit\n      - Only one job can be running at a time per user\n      - Multiple jobs can be queued per user\n    - Production queue\n      - 48 hour runtime limitation\n      - Multiple jobs per user can run simultaneously\n      - Multiple jobs per user can be queued\n\n    - For all queues, users must specify GPU resource needed:\n      - Number and type of GPUs (Types: V100, V100 w\/NVLink, RTX6)\n\nAccounting (using Moab Accounting Manager--MAM):\n    - Overall goals:\n      - Use data to generate usage reports to NSF\n      - Use data to ensure equitable use of resources\n    - Track CPU and GPU usage by one of 7 groups\n      - Five groups, one per co-PI\n      - One group for Penn State users external to the MRI\n      - One group for educational\/outreach users\n    - Track CPU and GPU usage by userid\n      - Allows fine-grained reporting to NSF: e.g., 4% neural engineering, 7% volcanoes, etc.\n    - Note: To maximize cluster usage, we will start out with no allocation limits.\n      - The plan is to deal with any future resource contentions administratively.\n      - Can implement allocation limits if needed.\n\nVirtual Basic Cores:\n    - We also have 100\/160\/200 ICDS basic CPU cores in years 1\/2\/3\n      - For processing fresh data through trained networks\n    - Allocate equally amongst 5 co-PIs' groups, but plan to allow for \"bursting\"\n\nDisk:\n    - Allocate equally amongst 5 co-PIs' groups, but plan to be flexible with temporary space needs\n\n\nFinally, I will ask the PIs of the \"neighboring\" NIH GPU cluster if we can have access to their cluster's open queue in\nexchange for access to ours.\n\n\nBest,\nDoug\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":787,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:53.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:53.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

group.<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>If the node is also the cluster manager that role should be moved before the reboot.&nbsp; The cluster manager role can only be moved to a quorum string(7608) "{"id":2719,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"IC Node rebuild notes","slug":"ic-node-rebuild-notes-LfF","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ic\">Operations Team : IC Node rebuild notes<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ic-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ic-2\">\n                            Operations Team : IC Node rebuild notes\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/span> on Dec 09, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-dhcp-network-issuest\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-dhcp-network-issues\">DHCP Network issues<\/h1><p>The nodes are configured with a port channel bond, so we need to drop one of the interfaces out of the port channel and make it a single access port before these nodes will boot over DHCP.<\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\"><p>Example of Operational Ready Configuration<\/p><\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Example of DHCP Build Configuration<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">net-ea-001# sh run int te 1\/3\/1<br>interface TenGigabitEthernet 1\/3\/1<br>description comp-ic-001<br>channel-group 301 mode active type standard<br>no fabric isl enable<br>no fabric trunk enable<br>fabric neighbor-discovery disable<br>lacp timeout long<br>sflow enable<br>sflow sample-rate 65536<br>no shutdown<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">net-ea-001# sh run int te 1\/3\/1<br>interface TenGigabitEthernet 1\/3\/1<br>description comp-ic-001<br>switchport<br>switchport mode access<br>switchport access vlan 304<br>spanning-tree shutdown<br>no fabric isl enable<br>no fabric trunk enable<br>fabric neighbor-discovery disable<br>sflow enable<br>sflow sample-rate 65536<br>no shutdown<\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><br><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Code to switch to DHCP Build Configuration<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Code to switch to Operational Ready Configuration<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">conf<br>int te 1\/3\/1<br>no channel-group<br>switchport<br>switchport mode access<br>switchport access vlan 304<br>spanning-tree shutdown<br>no shut<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">conf<br>int te 1\/3\/1<br>no sw<br><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\">channel-group 301 mode active type standard<br><\/span>no shut<br><br><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-avizo-mitigations%3A\">Avizo mitigations:<\/h1><p>Create a file \/opt\/aci\/sw\/avizo\/9.7.0\/bin\/nvidia-settings and make sure it has the following content:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#!\/bin\/bash\n\nDISPLAY=:0\n\/usr\/bin\/nvidia-settings $(echo $@ | sed 's\/\\:[0-9]*\/:0\/g')<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Permissions should be -rwxr-xr-x or 0755<\/p><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-infordb-module-usage\">Infordb module usage tracking:<\/h1><ul><li>Copy SitePackages.lua from \/gpfs\/group\/ops\/default\/ to \/opt\/aci\/modulefiles\/<\/li><li>Make sure permission bits match similar files in the directory, should be -rw-r--r--&nbsp; root root<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-zaci-mt.sh\">zACI-mt.sh<\/h1><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Copy zACI-mt.sh from \/gpfs\/group\/ops\/default\/ to \/etc\/profile.d\/<\/li><li>Make sure permission bits match similar files in the directory, should be -rwxr-xr-x&nbsp; root root<\/li><li>Make sure to put the&nbsp;\/var\/spool\/torque\/mom_priv\/prologue file in place, otherwise users won't be able to access the nvidia device.<ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>There's a copy in \/storage\/work\/gbs35\/prologue<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-note\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-warning confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>The above items will eventually be added into the puppet baseline. but for the time being they're a manual addition.<\/p><\/div><\/div><h1 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-x11-server-gl-config\">X11 Server GL config<\/h1><p>You need to make sure that the virtual GL offload is configured correctly.&nbsp;<\/p><p>run:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">vglserver_config -config +s +f -t<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>This will update some of the config files and update permissions so that multiple people can have access to the hardware acceleration features.<\/p><h1 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-networkmanager\">NetworkManager<\/h1><ul><li>Ensure NetworkManager is disabled by issuing the following command:<ul><li><pre>chkconfig NetworkManager off<\/pre><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div> 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":789,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:53.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:53.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(5776) "{"id":2720,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"VMware   Veeam Backup   Overview","slug":"vmware-veeam-backup-overview-czF","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm\">Operations Team : VMware - Veeam Backup - Overview<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n         <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware_18222976.html\">VMware<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Veeam Backup - Overview\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/span> on Apr 02, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-servers-%28windows-201\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-servers-%28windows-201-1\">Servers (Windows 2019)<\/h3><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Server<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">IP<\/th><th colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTh\">Purpose<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">I6-VEEAM-0003.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">10.112.200.4<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Management Server<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">i6-veeam-prx-01.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">10.112.200.6<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Proxy \/ Data Mover<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">i6-veeam-prx-02.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">10.112.200.7<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Proxy \/ Data Mover<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">i6-veeam-prx-03.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">10.112.200.8<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Proxy \/ Data Mover<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">i6-veeam-prx-04.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">10.112.200.9<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Proxy \/ Data Mover<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">i6-veeam-one.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">10.112.200.10<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">VM Monitoring Tool<\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-data-flow\">Data Flow<\/h3><ul><li>VM Disk to be backed up on stor-zfs-001&nbsp;\u2192 Snapshot taken on source VM \u2192 VM disk mounted on a backup proxy&nbsp;\u2192 Proxy uses VMware change block tracking (CBT) to read appropriate blocks from the disk \u2192&nbsp;Proxy Dedups\/Compresses and writes to backup repository<\/li><li>A Veeam Backup Repository can be a local disk or network storage.&nbsp;&nbsp;<ul><li>Ours is writing to a local disk (E:) on the I6-Veeam-0003 management server.&nbsp; This is a shortcoming of our Veeam design and should be corrected at some point.<\/li><li>The E: on Veeam is a VMware VMDK that lives on stor-as-006.<\/li><li>stor-as-006 is backed up by TSM.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div string(8475) "{"id":2724,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Restarting OpenVPN Remotely","slug":"restarting-openvpn-remotely-9nU","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-re\">Operations Team : Restarting OpenVPN Remotely<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta       <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"18220711.html\">Setting up VPN connection to access.ics.psu.edu with NetworkManager (Linux)<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-re-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-re-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Restarting OpenVPN Remotely\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-adam-bren\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ADAM BRENT FOCHT<\/span>, last modified on Aug 27, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-for-when-you-are-una\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>For when you are unable to connect to OpenVPN remotely and need to restart the VPN service.&nbsp; Unfortunately this is a catch-22 as to access the VPN server, you need access to the internal network, which can only be accessed via the VPN.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-step-by-step-guide\">Step-by-step guide<\/h2><p>Gain access to the VPN server and restart the OpenVPN service<\/p><ol><li>Make sure you have certificate auth set up from your remote system as root to your PSU id on aci-b login nodes.&nbsp; You will need to forward the privileged port 443 from localhost to the vcenter host.<\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Update your local hosts file to mitigate the FQDN url from vcenter.&nbsp; Add the line:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>127.0.0.1 vcenter-0001 vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Connect via ssh, forwarding the SSL port<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre># ssh -L 443:10.112.10.1:443 aci-b.aci.ics.psu.edu -l abf123<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li>Visit <a href=\"https:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/<\/a> and accept any cert warnings.<\/li><li>Find access.admin.int.aci.ics.psu.edu in the vm list and restart the openvpnas service.<br><p><br><\/p><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-related-articles\">Related articles<\/h2><p><\/p><p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<\/p><ul class=\"content-by-label\">\n        <li>\n Title contains numbers at the end: VMware   Decommissioning Procedure 116588780
string(7643) "{"id":2727,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"VMware   Decommissioning Procedure","slug":"vmware-decommissioning-procedure-3aT","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm\">Operations Team : VMware - Decommissioning Procedure<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware_18222976.html\">VMware<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Decommissioning Procedure\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-kevin-tat\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Kevin Tate<\/span>, last modified on Sep 08, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-verify-with-vm-owner\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <ol><li>Verify with VM owner(s) that the VM should be removed.<\/li><li>Power off the VM(s) and leave it sit for a 2-4 weeks to ensure it won't be missed.<\/li><li>Remove Satellite entry.<ol><li>Login to Satellite:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/users\/login\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/<\/a><ol><li>Select \"Hosts\" \u2192 \"All Hosts\"&nbsp;on the left hand menu.<\/li><li>Click the checkbox next to the host(s) that you would like to remove.<\/li><li>Click the \"Select Action\" button and then select \"Delete Hosts\".<\/li><li>Confirm the selected host(s) are correct and then click the \"Submit\" button.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Delete the VM(s) from vCenter.<ol><li>Login to vCenter (<a href=\"http:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"external-link\">vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>)<\/li><li>Search for the VM to be decommissioned and select it.<\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Select the \"Actions\" dropdown next to the name and select \"Delete from Disk\".<\/span><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">A prompt will appear asking you to confirm that you would like to delete the VM disk. Once absolutely certain that the desired VM is selected, click \"YES\" to delete.<\/span><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Remove the VM(s) from VEEAM.<ol><li>Login to the i6-veeam-0003.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu VM.<ol><li>Option 1: RDP to the host with the local administrator profile.<\/li><li>Option 2: Login to vCenter (<a class=\"external-link\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" href=\"http:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/\" rel=\"nofollow\">vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>) and access it through the web console.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Launch the \"Veeam Backup &amp; Replication Console\" application either through the start menu or from the desktop.<\/li><li>Select \"Yes\" to allow the application to make changes when prompted.<\/li><li>Veeam Login Window<ol><li>Server: localhost<\/li><li>Port: 9392<\/li><li>Username: Autofilled<\/li><li>Password: Autofilled<\/li><li>Use Windows session authentication: Checked<\/li><li>Click \"Connect\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Select \"Home\" from the menu on the bottom left and then select \"Jobs\" on the left hand side.<\/li><li>Right click on the job that contains the VM(s) that is being decommissioned and select \"Edit...\".<\/li><li>Select \"Virtual Machines\" from the left hand menu.<\/li><li>Select the VM(s) to be removed in the list of virtual machines and click \"Remove\".<\/li><li>Click \"Finish\".<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Remove IP assignment(s) and DNS entries.&nbsp;[NOTE: This may have been completed automatically with the removal of the entry in Satellite.]<ol><li>Login to IPA:<span>&nbsp;<\/span><a class=\"external-link\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" href=\"https:\/\/ipa01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/ipa\/ui\/\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/ipa01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/ipa\/ui\/<\/a><ol><li>Select \"Network Services\" from the menu bar<\/li><li>Select the \"DNS\" dropdown and then select \"DNS Zones\"<\/li><li>Select the forward DNS zone that the host is part of (e.g. mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu.).<\/li><li>Click the checkbox next to the record(s) you'd like to delete and click the \"Delete\" button.<\/li><li>Once you've confirmed that the selected record(s) are correct, click \"Delete\" to confirm.<\/li><li>Go back to the full list of \"DNS Zones\" and then select the reverse DNS zone that the host was part of (e.g. <span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\">102.10.in-addr.arpa.<\/span>).<\/li><li>Click the checkbox next to the record(s) you'd like to delete and click the \"Delete\" button.<\/li><li>Once you've confirmed that the selected record(s) are correct, click \"Delete\" to confirm.<\/li><li>Verify the forward and reverse entries were deleted with nslookup (e.g. {nslookup <a href=\"http:\/\/i6-ead-mgt.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">$<\/a>hostname} and {nslookup $ip_address}) (NOTE: You may need to flush your DNS cache to confirm.)<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Remove AD objects.<\/li><\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n
