    <\/td>\n                            <\/tr>\n                                                        <tr>\n                                <td style=\"border-top: 1px dashed #666666\">\n                                    <a name=\"comment-75727820\"><\/a>\n                                    <font class=\"smallfont\"><p>I've found that there's a tendency for the job to get skipped after the LC initializes if the job was scheduled while the node was on.<\/p><p>I've had the best luck with:<\/p><ul><li>ensure server is powered off<\/li><li>set embedded video to enabled\/disabled depending on your needs<\/li><li>schedule the job<\/li><li>send the \"serveraction powercycle\" command<\/li><\/ul><p>This seems to have the best chance of the LC seeing the job and processing it, at least that's been my experience with these R720s.<\/p><\/font>\n                                    <div align=\"left\" class=\"smallfont\" style=\"color: #666666; width: 98%; margin-bottom: 10px;\">\n                                        <img src=\"images\/icons\/contenttypes\/comment_16.png\" height=\"16\" width=\"16\" border=\"0\" align=\"absmiddle\">\n                                        Posted by mrg225 at Apr 24, 2020 12:31\n                                    <\/div>\n                                <\/td>\n                            <\/tr>\n                                                        <tr>\n                                <td style=\"border-top: 1px dashed #666666\">\n                                    <a name=\"comment-88408642\"><\/a>\n                                    <font class=\"smallfont\"><p>Is there a reason we want the console output to go to the GPU rather than the normal output?&nbsp; The GPU is available to users either way.&nbsp; Any reason we'd need to switch video back to the GPU card?<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/font>\n                                    <div align=\"left\" class=\"smallfont\" style=\"color: #666666; width: 98%; margin-bottom: 10px;\">\n                                        <img src=\"images\/icons\/contenttypes\/comment_16.png\" height=\"16\" width=\"16\" border=\"0\" align=\"absmiddle\">\n                                        Posted by gbs35 at Dec 09, 2020 15:31\n                                    <\/div>\n                                <\/td>\n                            <\/tr>\n                                                        <tr>\n                                <td style=\"border-top: 1px dashed #666666\">\n                                    <a name=\"comment-88408649\"><\/a>\n                                    <font class=\"smallfont\"><p>The gpu needs to be available for the primary Xorg instance.&nbsp; That serves as a rendering screen.&nbsp; If the embedded video is enabled, X will not start on the Nvidia card.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I hope this helps!<\/p><\/font>\n                                    <div align=\"left\" class=\"smallfont\" style=\"color: #666666; width: 98%; margin-bottom: Title contains numbers at the end: Managing Avizo LM in Temporary Singularity Container on lm 18221052
string(12100) "{"id":2762,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Managing Avizo LM in Temporary Singularity Container on lm","slug":"managing-avizo-lm-in-temporary-singularity-container-on-lm-VxE","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ma\">Operations Team : Managing Avizo LM in Temporary Singularity Container on lm<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"License-Managers_18221227.html\">License Managers<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ma-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ma-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Managing Avizo LM in Temporary Singularity Container on lm\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-adam-bren\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ADAM BRENT FOCHT<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> JACK STEVEN GUNDRUM<\/span> on Apr 29, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-backgroundlm.aset.ps\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-background\">Background<\/h2><p>lm.aset.psu.edu is currently running RHEL5.&nbsp; Avizo has introduced new features that cannot be served without a newer version of the Avizo LM service.&nbsp; The new Avizo LM service requires RHEL6 or newer.&nbsp; In order to buy time to notify and coordinate with all external Avizo users to update their license file and to avoid a hasty deployment of external connectivity on lm01, we use a singularity container to provide a RHEL6 environment for the Avizo LM service on lm.aset.psu.edu.&nbsp; This details common maintenance actions.<\/p><p><strong>Note<\/strong>: The log for the Avizo license manager is located at \/var\/log\/licenses\/Avizo-9-4.log and can be accessed without entering the container.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-starting-avizo-lm\">Starting Avizo LM<\/h2><ol><li>Log in to lm as root<\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Enter a screen session:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@lm ~]# screen -t avizolm\n-or reattach -\n[root@lm ~]# screen -r avizolm<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Start the shell in the singularity container:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@lm ~]# export PATH=\/opt\/singularity-2.1.2\/bin:$PATH\n[root@lm ~]# \/opt\/singularity-2.1.2\/bin\/singularity shell -s \/bin\/bash --writable \/opt\/Avizo\/sl6-avizo.img\nSingularity.sl6-avizo.img&gt;<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Start the flexlm service in the container:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">Singularity.sl6-avizo.img&gt; export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=\/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager:\/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/FlexNetLicenseServerTools\nSingularity.sl6-avizo.img&gt; \/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/FlexNetLicenseServerTools\/lmgrd -l +\/var\/log\/licenses\/Avizo-9-4.log -c \/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/licenses\/license.dat<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li>&nbsp; I found you need to reread the license file (see below)&nbsp; to start the LM correctly.<\/li><li>&nbsp; Detach from the screen session, leaving the Singularity container running in place (via Ctrl-A D)<\/li><\/ol><h2 id=\"bkmrk-reread-the-license-f\">Reread the License File on Update<\/h2><p>In the singularity environment, the error when FlexLM cannot open a port does not appear as if it were running natively.&nbsp; It generally looks like this:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@lm ~]# tail -f \/var\/log\/licenses\/Avizo-9-4.log\n[...]\n12:56:11 (mcslmd) SLOG: Summary LOG statistics is enabled.\n12:56:11 (mcslmd) SLOG: FNPLS-INTERNAL-CKPT1\n12:56:11 (mcslmd) SLOG: VM Status: 1\n12:56:11 (mcslmd) SLOG: FNPLS-INTERNAL-CKPT2\n12:56:11 (lmgrd) mcslmd exited with status 0 signal = 17\n12:56:11 (lmgrd) Please correct problem and restart daemons\n12:56:38 (lmgrd) lmgrd will now shut down all the vendor daemons<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Therefore, it's better to make updates to the license file then issue the lmreread command: <a href=\"http:\/\/fei-software-center.com\/support\/flexnet-server-doc\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Procedure to update license is at http:\/\/fei-software-center.com\/support\/flexnet-server-doc<\/a><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@lm ~]# screen -r avizolm\nSingularity.sl6-avizo.img&gt; \/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/FlexNetLicenseServerTools\/lmutil lmreread -c \/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/licenses\/license.dat -vendor mcslmd<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Then detach from the screen session via Ctrl-A D<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-stopping-avizo-lm\">Stopping Avizo LM<\/h2><ol><li>Log in to lm as root<\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Find the lmgrd process sourced from '\/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/FlexNetLicenseServerTools' and kill the pid:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@lm ~]# ps auxww | grep -i fnp\nroot     25073  0.0  0.0  17060  2124 pts\/6    S    12:58   0:00 \/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/FlexNetLicenseServerTools\/lmgrd -l +\/var\/log\/licenses\/Avizo-9-4.log -c \/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/licenses\/license.dat\nroot     25074  0.0  0.2 197396 10856 ?        Ssl  12:58   0:00 mcslmd -T lm.rcc.psu.edu 11.14 3 -c :\/opt\/FNPLicenseServerManager\/licenses\/license.dat: -srv yrg72R1V07iQMWgXYXzsBBcN3bqp4bLejNymT37yqTFG5fK8qUO20vLrdZlToHF -daemon_port 908e --lmgrd_start 5a871bc4 -vdrestart 0\nroot     25479  0.0  0.0  61212   820 pts\/4    S+   14:04   0:00 grep -i fnp\n[root@lm ~]# kill 25073<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                        <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-comments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Comments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <table Title contains numbers at the end: Downtime Log 18222067
string(9927) "{"id":2763,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Downtime Log","slug":"downtime-log-eTD","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-do\">Operations Team : Downtime Log<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-do-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-do-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Downtime Log\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified on Jul 22, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-here%27s-a-list-of-the\" Title contains numbers at the end: Node Expansion Procedure 18224080
string(12738) "{"id":2764,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Node Expansion Procedure","slug":"node-expansion-procedure-KVy","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-no\">Operations Team : Node Expansion Procedure<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-no-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-no-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Node Expansion Procedure\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> MYLES R GOODWIN<\/span> on Apr 04, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-procedure-assum\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-error confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>This procedure assumes that the new chassis are in the rack and cabled. If IB cables aren't connected yet do so with the blades powered off. Blade IPs should be set up through the CMC.<\/p><\/div><\/div><p>(I'll put more details into this)<\/p><ol><li>Set up Idracs for each node<ol><li>Make sure the node hostnames have dns resource records in IPA, use <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Adding+DNS+Resource+Records+to+a+DNS+Zone\">Adding DNS Resource Records to a DNS Zone<\/a> if they're missing.<\/li><li>Log into Titan, go to the ground control repo, and use the setupACIiDRAC.sh script: reference <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Dell+iDRAC+Profiles\">Dell iDRAC Profiles<\/a> for how to upload Dell Server Profiles<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Ingest Each Node into Satellite<ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">In the Titan ground control repo, use the reinstall.sh script to ingest nodes into satellite and begin the build process: reference <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Satellite+Bulk+Upload\">Satellite Bulk Upload<\/a> to get a better idea regarding what the reinstall script does under the hood.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>Satellite Ingestion<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">ssh titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edusudo -icd \/opt\/aci\/satellite_tools\/master\/groundcontrol\/\n\nset +o history\nDRACPASS=&lt;iDRAC password&gt;\n\n#Use a for loop that iterate the reinstall script though each hostname. Make sure to account for the leading zeroes, since {x..y} doesn't include them\n\nfor IP in {488..500}; do .\/reinstall.sh -h comp-sc-0$IP -p $DRACPASS --setIDRAC; done\n\n\n\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Configure GPFS on nodes<ol><li>&nbsp;Once all the nodes are built and up, add them to the GPFS Client Cluster: reference <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Add+Node+to+GPFS+Client+Cluster\">Add Node to GPFS Client Cluster<\/a><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Verify all nodes have consistent configurations<ol><li>Check installed rpms. There are a few ways to go about this, take your pick as long as you compare the rpms on each node:<ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Using cssh, pipe the outputs of 'rpm -qa' to a central location. Something like 'rpm -qa | \/storage\/home\/dth5124\/sc_rpms\/$HOSTNAME'&nbsp; then diff all of the files using&nbsp; 'for i in $(ls); do for j in $(ls); do diff $i $j; done; done'<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># In cssh\nrpm -qa &gt;&gt; \/storage\/home\/dth5124\/sc_rpms\/$HOSTNAME\n\n#in a singular terminal\nfor i in $(ls); do for j in $(ls); do diff $i $j; done; done<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Check the Bios versions<ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">again may just want to use cssh or something similar to grab the outputs and diff them.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># In cssh\ndmidecode -t BIOS | grep Version: &gt;&gt; \/storage\/home\/dth5124\/sc_bios\/$HOSTNAME\n\n#in a singular terminal\nfor i in $(ls); do for j in $(ls); do diff $i $j; done; done<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>&nbsp;If there are IB cards check Firmware versions<ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">I'll use pdsh and dshbak this time:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">pdsh -g sc -f 48 \"sudo \/usr\/bin\/mstflint -d 03:00.0 q | grep 'FW Version'\" | dshbak -c \n\n----------------\ncomp-sc-[0001-0106,0108-0182,0184-0206,0208-0481,0483-0485,0487,0491,0496-0497,0502,0506,0509,0512,0514-0520,0523-0525,0527-0528]\n----------------\nFW Version:          2.40.5048\n----------------\ncomp-sc-[0107,0207]\n----------------\nFW Version:          2.32.5100\n----------------\ncomp-sc-[0482,0489-0490,0492,0494-0495,0498,0500,0507-0508,0511,0521-0522]\n----------------\nFW Version:          2.11.0550\n----------------\ncomp-sc-[0493,0499,0501,0503-0505,0510,0513,0526]\n----------------\nFW Version:          2.36.5000<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li>&nbsp;The new nodes should be in line with the majority of nodes, if not you'll need to update the firmware:<ol><li><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http:\/\/www.mellanox.com\/pdf\/prod_adapter_cards\/ConnectX-3_Dual_Port_40_Gbs_and_56_Gbs_IO_card_for_Dell_User_Manual.pdf\" class=\"external-link\">http:\/\/www.mellanox.com\/pdf\/prod_adapter_cards\/ConnectX-3_Dual_Port_40_Gbs_and_56_Gbs_IO_card_for_Dell_User_Manual.pdf<\/a> Has installation process for firmware, page&nbsp; 30.<ol><li>The bin file for version 2.40.5048 of the sc IB cards is currently in \/gpfs\/group\/ops\/default\/firmware\/mellanox\/comp-sc, may need to copy it locally to \/tmp<\/li><li>Drivers can be found on <a href=\"http:\/\/www.mellanox.com\/page\/firmware_table_dell?mtag=oem_firmware_download\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.mellanox.com\/page\/firmware_table_dell?mtag=oem_firmware_download<\/a><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Add to torque and place a moab reservation on new nodes<br><ol><li>&nbsp;Verify all nodes pass nhc when run<\/li><li>Add nodes to torque<ol><li>Log into <a href=\"http:\/\/torque01.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">torque01.util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> and add node entries to torque in \/var\/spool\/torque\/server_priv\/nodes and the mom_hierarchy file in the same directory<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Pause moab<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@moab01 ~]# mschedctl -p\nscheduling will be disabled, cluster information will continue to be updated<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Restart torque<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@torque01 ~]# systemctl status pbs_server\n[root@torque01 ~]# systemctl restart pbs_server\n[root@torque01 ~]# systemctl status pbs_server<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Create the reservation, add whoever needs access for testing.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@moab01 ~]# mrsvctl -c -h 'r:comp-sc-[0481-0528]' -F ignstate -n SCCapExpand\nNOTE:     reservation SCCapExpand.3220174 created\n\n[root@moab01 ~]# mrsvctl -m -a USER+=dth5124 SCCapExpand.3220174\nsuccessfully changed ACL for rsv SCCapExpand.3220174<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Resume moab<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@moab01 ~]# mschedctl -r\n\nscheduling will resume immediately\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Try submitting a job with qsub to verify jobs are getting scheduled to the allocation.<\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Test nodes<ol><li>Last time this was mainly done by Diego or someone in ATS. They mainly just ran HPL across the new node range. You can reference <a href=\"HPL-Benchmark-Testing---Results-Matrix_4883144.html\">HPL Benchmark Testing - Results Matrix<\/a> and<span class=\"aui-message aui-message-warning jim-error-message jim-error-message-single\">\n        <span class=\"icon-in-pdf\"><\/span>\n     <a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/browse\/GROW-9?src=confmacro\">GROW-9<\/a> - Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.\n    <\/span>\n<ol><li>GPU nodes will probably require some kind of cuda or GPU-focused test<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><p>Remove reservation to release to users.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: true; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@moab01 ~]# mrsvctl -r SCCapExpand.3220174\nreservation SCCapExpand.3220174 successfully released<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><br><\/p><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":834,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:58.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:58.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                  <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-li-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-li-2\">\n                            Operations Team : LIGO Transition to operations\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Oct 21, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-requirements-for-ope\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-requirements-for-ope-1\"><strong>Requirements for Operations<\/strong><\/h3><ul><li>For all new production systems\/processes, it is expected that all changes can be versioned.&nbsp;<ul><li>If code is managed in git, coordination is required to ensure common understanding for branches and merging changes.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>A documented process for making changes is required.&nbsp; Operations staff should have access to make needed changes.&nbsp;<ul><li>At least two people need to have a good understanding of the process for making changes<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>All changes are expected to be coordinated with the operations team.&nbsp;<ul><li>Ideally, all changes should be pushed to production by operations staff following documented processes.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Changes made directly on a production server are discouraged.<ul><li>If such changes are required, notification of these changes is required.<\/li><li>Ideally, any unauthorized local changes would be reverted to the \"approved\" configuration automatically. (puppet, cron, etc. overwriting manual changes)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Build instructions for installing\/rebuilding any virtual or physical server to the production state is required.&nbsp;<ul><li>Ideally, builds could be scripted, or could be automated through kickstart, puppet or other common practice.<\/li><li>The fact that a system can be rebuilt does not remove the need for documentation, even if it's only a pointer to the standard ICS-ACI way of installing an operating system.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-hardware-hardware\">Hardware Hardware<\/h3><ul><li>What hardware is included with LIGO:<ul><li>Compute nodes comp-ex-[0001-0128]<\/li><li>Head nodes ???<\/li><li>Storage ???<\/li><li>DB server ????<\/li><li>Networks\/Switches etc.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How do you access it?<ul><li>Usual IP addresses, BMC (iDRAC\/IPMI\/??)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Is there a plan for how we make sure if the BIOS\/firmware on the physical systems is correct?<ul><li>Is there a plan for how we update the BIOS\/firmware<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Remote power control commands (especially if it used the normal dsh shorthand notation for node ranges host-a-[01-08,12-30],host-b[4-16])<ul><li>remote-power box[1-4,6,10,14-17] status|on|off|boot<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Network access (bmc and normal IP traffic)<ul><li>LIGO VPN and other LIGO passwords&nbsp;<\/li><li>What's the network topology\/routing\/vlan configuration?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What is the hardware configuration and how is it configured?<ul><li>Which rack locations, how many network connections, any physical concerns?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>If we replace one of the boxes involved, what are the steps to rebuild\/reinstall it?<br><ul><li>I'd love a command to do whatever installation configuration needed to be done:<ul><li>reinstall-node box[1,5-8]<\/li><li>This would power off the system, configure whatever, provisioning stuff needed to be configured and then boot the specified nodes (physical or virtual would be nice)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What passwords are used?<ul><li>What's the plan to update\/change passwords?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How to report hardware problems and get&nbsp; things fixed?<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-services%C2%A0\">Services&nbsp;<\/h3><ul><li>What services should be running (either on the host boxes or on the VMs, but also what server processes should be running and where are they running)?<ul><li>Steps to verify that services are running and functioning as expected.<\/li><li>If things aren't working as expected, how do you restart them?<\/li><li>Is there a specific order for any of the services?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What's the expected startup\/shutdown process<ul><li>Any dependencies with other systems that should be up first or turned off first?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Where are things backed up, in case one of the physical systems is broken either naturally or through sys-admin error?<ul><li>What's the restore process.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Are there log files we should know about to debug or monitor things?<\/li><li>What passwords are used?<ul><li>What is the plan for changing\/updating those passwords?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-maintenance%C2%A0\">Maintenance&nbsp;<\/h3><ul><li>How are configuration changes managed?<ul><li>git\/puppet, etc.&nbsp; If we need to make a change how do we do it and track those changes?<\/li><li>Are there things outside of git\/puppet we may need to change?&nbsp; How is that managed?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What routine maintenance is expected?<ul><li>clean-up of VM's that don't get cleaned by the expected processes<\/li><li>How do you tell if there are orphans out there?<\/li><li>Is there a command I can use to see which VMs are up and which are allocated?<\/li><li>What are the commands to destroy a VM and clean up torque\/moab etc. when something goes wrong?<\/li><li>What command to use to see which jobs\/VMs are allocated to a particular physical system?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What is the expected performance?<ul><li>This isn't necessarily benchmark stuff.&nbsp; I'm thinking more about how quickly should a job submit, launch, etc.&nbsp; How long would we expect virtual systems to need to boot and start a job; how long to clean up after a job exits, etc.<\/li><li>There may be benchmarks for system performance.<ul><li>If it's a filesystem, what's the read\/write performance so we can verify functionality after maintenance or upgrades.<\/li><li>If it's a compute system, do we have a baseline to compare against after updates\/maintenance?<\/li><li>For networks, what's the expected bandwidth or other measure of functionality?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What is the expected workflow? (Maybe workflow isn't the proper term. I'm interested in how it would be used and what gets handed off where and how things flow through the process)<ul><li>Where do the jobs go when they're submitted?<\/li><li>How do the \"triggers\" or processes work to spin up a VM, get the proper job to the proper VM, bring down the VM, clean up any moab\/torque details for this job?<\/li><li>What if Moab restarts during some of these processes?&nbsp; How are things \"fixed\" or checked for triggers that may not complete successfully?&nbsp; What about \"triggers\" that may fail part way through the run?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Are there any passwords that someone may need?<\/li><li>Any other systems we may need access to to run this stuff?<\/li><li>What security is in place?&nbsp;&nbsp;<ul><li>How is this protected?&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/li><li>What should we avoid doing that would violate the planned protections?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Where does the design documentation live?<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-monitoring\">Monitoring<\/h3><ul><li>How do I know if the system is operational?<\/li><li>How do we know if nodes are up\/down?<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":838,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:58.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:58.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

<\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ts-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ts-2\">\n                            Operations Team : TSM\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Oct 30, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-what-is-the-purpose-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-what-is-the-purpose--1\">What is the purpose of the system?<\/h3><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li>TSM (aka IBM Spectrum Protect) is a file versioning backup system.&nbsp; TSM allows ICS to provide case by case restores to end users as well as DR for the entire file system.<ul><li>Backup Clients<br><ul><li>GPFS&nbsp;<ul><li>\/home<\/li><li>\/work<\/li><li>\/group (\/group is 97% of the daily backup)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Physical servers<ul><li><a href=\"TSM---Occupancy-Table_18224196.html\">here is a list<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/TSM+Backup+Flow\">TSM Diagram<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-who-is-responsible-f\">Who is responsible for this system?&nbsp;<\/h3><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li>Eric Huyett<\/li><li>Mike Gallo<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-how-is-it-configured\">How is it configured?<\/h3><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ol><li>Are there files in puppet, git, configurations on the systems?&nbsp; How are these managed?<\/li><li>How do we manage changes?<\/li><li>If there's high availability configured, how is that expected to work?<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-how-do-we-know-if-it\">How do we know if it's broken?<\/h3><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ol><li>Location of important log files<\/li><li>Services that should be running?<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-what-are-the-common-\">What are the common fixes for things that have gone wrong in the past?<\/h3><h3 id=\"bkmrk-what-are-the-standar\">What are the standard maintenance tasks?<\/h3><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ol><li>Security fixes, software updates, backups, password changes, etc.<\/li><li>How often do we do this?<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-shutdown-and-startup\">Shutdown and Startup process<\/h3><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ol><li>Is there an order to how this goes down or comes online.<\/li><li>Are there specific things to check to see that it's happy?<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-what%27s-the-recovery-\">What's the recovery plan if the system gets fried?<\/h3><p><br><\/p><p>Feel free to add additional info to the documentation if needed.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div> <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware---Updates_78807262.html\">VMware - Updates<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Host Updates\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Jul 18, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ipsaci-prod-mgmt%2Fvmo\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-ips\">IPs<\/h3><ul><li>ACI Prod MGMT\/VMotion 10.112.100.1-32 \/ Storage VMK1 10.110.75.1-32<\/li><li>HPRC MGMT\/VMotion 10.112.101.1-19 \/ Storage VMK1 10.110.76.1-19<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Transition Admin hosts to UEFI to match HPRC hosts.&nbsp; Because there is only one VMware configuration file on the TFTP server.<\/li><li>iDRAC profile lives on Titan, managed in Bit Bucket.<ul><li>Modified to use UEFI instead of BIOS.<\/li><li>All hosts will boot using UEFI.&nbsp; Both Admin and HPRC.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-idrac-update-from-ti\">iDRAC Update from Titan<\/h3><ol><li>XML file Titan managed by BitBucket<\/li><li>Pull down with git<\/li><li>file is generic only needs to be edit to make change to iDRAC config<ol><li>if you pull a fresh copy of the iDRAC config you need to remove the service tag from the config<\/li><li>more info on Confluence page<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>.\/setupACIiDRAC.sh -t DellMD630-ESXI-Config.xml -u root -p 'PW in single quotes' -e 10.192.0.<a href=\"http:\/\/30\/opt\/aci\/satellite_tools\/master\/groundcontrol\/idrac-profile\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">30:\/opt\/aci\/satellite_tools\/master\/groundcontrol\/idrac-profile<\/a> -h <a href=\"http:\/\/esxi-0028.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">esxi-0028.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><ol><li>fill in the mgmt password<\/li><li>change the host name should be ...mgt.vm...<\/li><li>use the correct profile<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-transition-admin-clu\">Transition Admin Cluster from Local install to Stateful Auto Deploy<\/h3><ol><li>Put host in maintenance mode<\/li><li>Verify host is part of a Deploy Rule and has correct Image Profile<ol><li>vCenter \/ Home \/ Auto Deploy \/ Deploy Rules<ol><li>Verify the host is part of one of the IP ranges<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>vCenter \/ Home \/ Auto Deploy \/ Deployed Hosts<ol><li>Verify the host has the correct Image Profile associated with it<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Host profiles are sometimes specific to a version of ESXi.&nbsp; Sometimes in the process a host seems to drop its Auto Deploy from 6.7 to 6.5.&nbsp; When that happens Host Profile 4.0 is not available to select. This can be rectified by going to vCenter \/ Home \/ Auto Deploy \/ Deployed Hosts \/ Select the Host \/ Edit Image Profile \/ Browse \/ Select the desired profile<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Note - Deleting the old partition prior to applying the updated iDRAC profile seemed to confuse the Lifecycle manager.&nbsp; This particular change to the iDRAC profile seems to require two reboots.&nbsp; Which did not happen when I deleted the disk partition first.<\/li><li>Shut down<\/li><li>Remove from inventory (<u>not necessary<\/u>)<ol><li>But if you get in a weird spot and you think removing it from inventory is the answer...&nbsp; This may reset the Image Profile to something you are not expecting.&nbsp; So you will need to do step 2. Verify host is part...<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Apply the iDRAC profile&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Dell+iDRAC+Profiles\">Details here<\/a>&nbsp;<ol><li>This will bounce the host, no matter the power state, no warnings.&nbsp; Make sure you don't bounce the wrong host!&nbsp;<\/li><li>set history +o<\/li><li>[root@titan groundcontrol]# .\/setupACIiDRAC.sh -t DellMD630-ESXI-Config.xml -u root -p 'iDRAC PW in single quotes' -e 10.192.0.<a href=\"http:\/\/30\/opt\/aci\/satellite_tools\/master\/groundcontrol\/idrac-profile\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">30:\/opt\/aci\/satellite_tools\/master\/groundcontrol\/idrac-profile<\/a> -h <a href=\"http:\/\/esxi-0028.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">esxi-0028.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><ol><li>Script will say \"ERROR: Login failed - invalid username or password\", but it will run just fine.<\/li><li>Fill in the mgmt password<\/li><li>Change the host name should be ...mgt.vm...<\/li><li>Use the correct profile<\/li><li>Host will reboot a couple times to apply settings then one final time back into existing ESXi install<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>set history -o<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Host will boot off local disk.<ol><li>Seeing it's new Profile it will be non-compliant<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Maintenance mode \/ Shut down host<\/li><li>Delete old partition (cannot be done from BIOS.&nbsp; But I think you can force the PERC card to come up.&nbsp; Might be easier to just do this in Lifecycle.)<ol><li>Boot into Lifecycle controller<\/li><li>Configure RAID \/&nbsp;RAID 1 \/ select both disks \/ name esxi-30 \/ Finish<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Verify boot order is Disk then PXE<\/li><li>Allow boot to happen<ol><li>Should fail on local boot and move on to PXE boot (long paths while ESXi is loading)<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>After PXE booting, it is trying to become compliant with the Profile which is set for Stateful Installation.&nbsp;<ol><li>In vCenter tasks, you will see the host Disconnect and Reconnect as soon as the ESXi boot finishes.&nbsp; I think this Immediate action is part of the Profile setup.&nbsp;<\/li><li>Typically if you reboot a host it takes a minute or so for vCenter to find it again.&nbsp;<\/li><li>The Profile cannot be satisfied until ESXi is installed on disk.&nbsp; It seems to go into a PXE boot loop at this point.&nbsp; Which is good and bad.&nbsp; Good this is a sign that it is working.&nbsp; Bad, why the boot loop.<\/li><li>Be patient waiting for Remediation to finish.&nbsp; It will often come back non-compliant.&nbsp; But then kicks off another compliance check and it is now Compliant.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Not sure what is happening but somehow the boot order is getting changed<\/li><li>If you got into the Boot Loop&nbsp;<ol><li>You see ESXi shutting down<\/li><li>POST \/ BIOS starts<\/li><li>Set Next Boot to BIOS (or Lifecycle controller, but BIOS is faster)<\/li><li>Do a warm boot ASAP as soon as ESXi finishes shutting down<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Change boot order local disk then BIOS \/ UEFI (These are Lifecycle direction.&nbsp; BIOS is almost identical.)<\/li><ol><li>System Setup \/ Advanced Hardware Configuration \/ System BIOS \/ Boot Settings<\/li><li>Boot UEFI \/ Back \/ Save Setting \/ Set next boot to Lifecycle Controller \/ Allow to reboot<\/li><li>Go back to Boot Settings.&nbsp; UEFI Boot Setting should now be available.<\/li><\/ol><li>Often the host will come back non-compliant, but then another compliance check kicks off auto-magically.&nbsp; And it should come back compliant.<\/li><li>You should be done. Verify ESXi version and any other profile changes.<ol><li>You can reboot again and watch ESXi load.&nbsp; Should be a short path, which means it is booting from disk.<\/li><li>Verify ESXi version and Profile Compliance<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>That was easy!<\/li><li>Once the host is compliant with the profile if you force a PXE boot it will not be compliant.&nbsp; Then if you let it reboot again, it will boot from disk, assuming boot order is correct.&nbsp; It will then check compliance and remediate and finally be compliant.<\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><ol><li>Remediate if needed - Host \/ Configure \/ Host Profiles<ol><li>Edit \/ Validate Host Customizations (MAC addresses will fill in automatically)<\/li><li>Check Compliance<\/li><li>Remediate<\/li><li><s>Allow to PXE boot again<\/s><\/li><li>Verify next boot is from disk<\/li><li>Verify Profile applied<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p>.\/setupACIiDRAC.sh --help<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-aci-prod-boot-proces\">ACI Prod Boot Process<\/h3><ol><li>PXE Boot<ol><li>Host request IP<\/li><li>Request forwarded to Titan<\/li><li>Titan responds assigns IP and provides IP of the TFTP server and name of TFTP file to boot from<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>TFTP boot<ol><li>Load IPXE boot loader<\/li><li>Tells it where to boot from, vCenter AutoDeploy<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>AutoDeploy<ol><li>Pushes ESXi image<\/li><li>Applies host profile<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><h3 id=\"bkmrk-appliance-management\">Appliance Management<\/h3><p><a href=\"https:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:5480\/login\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:5480\/login<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                  <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-2\">\n                            Operations Team : 2020-04-20 Group became unusable during a cluster failover during a planned maintenance.\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-eric-rich\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/span> on Apr 20, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-michael-david-gallo-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p style=\"text-align: left;\"><a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"mdg104\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~mdg104\" data-linked-resource-id=\"18219322\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/a> &nbsp;and <a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"erh16\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~erh16\" data-linked-resource-id=\"557290\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/a> started doing rolling reboots of the nsd servers&nbsp;at 14:00<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">After we got 3-16 rebooted, we pushed the manager of scratch from nsd2 to nsd4. &nbsp;And rebooted nsd2.<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">After nsd came back, we pushed the manager of group from nsd1 to nsd5 and cluster manager from nsd1 to nsd5.<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">We rebooted nsd1, but it had a little trouble mounting the filesystem.<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">Around 16:00, we noticed that nsd5 was having some trouble. &nbsp;We did some troubleshooting and finally ejected nsd5, which failed manager back to nsd1.<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">We rebooted nsd5 and we had to remount \/group on all the clients.<\/p><ul><li style=\"text-align: left;\">On the server cluster (as root): &nbsp;mmmount all -N all<\/li><li style=\"text-align: left;\">On the client cluster (as gpfs): sudo mmmount all -N all<\/li><\/ul><p style=\"text-align: left;\">Around 16:45, we believe the clients were all usable again.<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">Around 16:50, we found that the protocol nodes needed \/group mounted as well. &nbsp;This is due to the fact that root ssh is not working on these nodes.<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><br><\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\">Total downtime approximately 45-50 minutes.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n Title contains numbers at the end: VMware   Auto Deploy   Merge ESXi Images 81854787
string(12422) "{"id":2773,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"VMware   Auto Deploy   Merge ESXi Images","slug":"vmware-auto-deploy-merge-esxi-images-r0N","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm\">Operations Team : VMware - Auto Deploy - Merge ESXi Images<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware_18222976.html\">VMware<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware---Updates_78807262.html\">VMware - Updates<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware---Auto-Deploy_78807246.html\">VMware - Auto Deploy<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Auto Deploy - Merge ESXi Images\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Nov 05, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-problemthe-dellemc-e\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-problem\">Problem<\/h3><p>The DellEMC ESXi image is only updated a couple times per year.&nbsp; We need to patch ESXi hosts at least once per quarter.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-solution\">Solution<\/h3><ul><li>Use VMware PowerCLI which is a series of modules for Windows Power Shell.<\/li><li>There is a way to do this through the Web GUI.&nbsp; But it is very difficult.<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/blogs.vmware.com\/vsphere\/2017\/05\/apply-latest-vmware-esxi-security-patches-oem-custom-images-visualize-differences.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/blogs.vmware.com\/vsphere\/2017\/05\/apply-latest-vmware-esxi-security-patches-oem-custom-images-visualize-differences.html<\/a><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-steps\">Steps<\/h3><ol><li>Download the most recent versions of ESXi from DellEMC and VMware.&nbsp; Both are on the VMware site.<ol><li>For ease of use put them in the same folder locally on the machine with VMware PowerCLI.&nbsp; Most likely this is your laptop.&nbsp; Or perhaps we will configure a windows utility server for this purpose.<\/li><li>You will also need a copy of the two scripts mentioned in the article above.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Use PowerCLI to merge the files.&nbsp;<ol><li>By default the script excludes tools-light aka VMware Tools.&nbsp;&nbsp;(esxi-image-creator.ps1)<\/li><li>Update script to allow tools-light be included in the ESXi image.&nbsp;<ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Remove tools-light from the list of one.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#### Specify optional image fine-tuning here ####\n# comma-separated list (array) of VIBs to exclude\n### simply commenting out the line does not install VMware tools.\n# $removeVibs = @(\"tools-light\")\n### you need to remove tools-light from the double quotes.  Now it will add the tools-light VIB to the ESXi image.\n$removeVibs = @(\"\")<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li>There is a workaround to put VMware tools in a shared folder.&nbsp; We may investigate that later.&nbsp; Having VMware tools in the ESXi image significantly slow the boot process.<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/docs.vmware.com\/en\/VMware-vSphere\/6.7\/com.vmware.esxi.install.doc\/GUID-FAB12BE2-B098-4A01-A3BD-6F232FE37FA1.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/docs.vmware.com\/en\/VMware-vSphere\/6.7\/com.vmware.esxi.install.doc\/GUID-FAB12BE2-B098-4A01-A3BD-6F232FE37FA1.html<\/a><\/li><li><p class=\"shortdesc\" style=\"text-align: left;\">When you provision hosts with vSphere Auto Deploy, you can select to provision the hosts with an image profile that does not contain VMware Tools binaries. This image profile is smaller, has a lower memory overhead, and boots faster in a PXE-boot environment.<\/p><p class=\"p\">If the network boot time is too slow when using the standard image, or if you want to save space on the hosts, you can use an image profile that does not include VMware Tools and place the VMware Tools binaries on a shared storage.<\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">\n### move to the directory with the copies of ESXi you are going to merge.\nPS C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware&gt; cd .\\ESXi-Downloads\\\n\n### use PowerCLI command to add the two (or more) files to the Depot\nPS C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads&gt; Add-EsxSoftwareDepot .\\VMware-VMvisor-Installer-6.7.0.update03-16075168.x86_64-DellEMC_Customized-A05.zip\nDepot Url\n---------\nzip:C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads\\VMware-VMvisor-Installer-6.7.0.update03-16075168.x86_64-DellEMC_Customized-A05.zi...\n\nPS C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads&gt; Add-EsxSoftwareDepot .\\ESXi670-202006001.zip\nDepot Url\n---------\nzip:C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads\\ESXi670-202006001.zip?index.xml\n\n### List the versions in the depot.  Note that the latest copy of 6.7 actually had two version of ESXi.  One with and another without VMware tools.\n### Also note that the version number of the individual copies of ESXi does not match the version of the original zip file.  202006001 vs. 20200604001  \nPS C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads&gt; Get-EsxImageProfile\n\nName                           Vendor          Last Modified   Acceptance Level\n----                           ------          -------------   ----------------\nDellEMC-ESXi-6.7U3-16075168... Dell            5\/12\/2020 7:... PartnerSupported\nESXi-6.7.0-20200604001-stan... VMware, Inc.    6\/4\/2020 2:2... PartnerSupported\nESXi-6.7.0-20200604001-no-t... VMware, Inc.    6\/4\/2020 2:2... PartnerSupported\n\n\n### Use the script to merge the files.  The files are just a comma separated list.  Each file might be a complete copy of ESXi or it could be just a single driver.\nPS C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads&gt; .\\esxi-image-creator.ps1 -NewProfileName DellEMC_16075168-A05+VMW-670EP15-16316930 -WriteZip -Files VMware-VMvisor-Installer-6.7.0.update03-16075168.x86_64-DellEMC_Customized-A05.zip,ESXi670-202006001.zip -Acceptance PartnerSupported\n\nDepot Url\n---------\nzip:C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads\\VMware-VMvisor-Installer-6.7.0.update03-16075168.x86_64-DellEMC_Customized-A05...\nzip:C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads\\ESXi670-202006001.zip?index.xml\n\nFinished creating DellEMC_16075168-A05+VMW-670EP15-16316930\nCreating zip bundle...\n\n\n### Use the other script to compare Profiles currently in the depot.\n### -Interactive cause the script to prompt you for which files you want to compare.\n### -Grid cause the output to go to a popup window instead of the terminal.  See the picture below.\nPS C:\\Users\\mdg104\\Documents\\VMware\\ESXi-Downloads&gt; .\/esxi-image-comparator.ps1 -interactive -Grid\nFound the following profiles:\nDellEMC_16075168-A05+2020060001\nDellEMC-ESXi-6.7U3-16075168-A05\nESXi-6.7.0-20200604001-no-tools\nESXi-6.7.0-20200604001-standard\n\nType 'y' next to each profile to compare...\nDellEMC_16075168-A05+2020060001: y\nDellEMC-ESXi-6.7U3-16075168-A05: y\nESXi-6.7.0-20200604001-no-tools: n\nESXi-6.7.0-20200604001-standard: y\n\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-popup-window-compari\">Popup window comparing versions of ESXi<\/h3><p>It seems to have mostly kept the DellEMC versions of the VIBs.&nbsp; But if you look closely it choose the VMware version of esx-base and esx-update.&nbsp; It also choose the VMware versions of VSAN.<\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" src=\"attachments\/81854787\/81854819.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/81854787\/81854819.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854819\" id=\"bkmrk-i-noticed-that-we-we\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>I noticed that we were getting a failed cron job from moab01.&nbsp; It was having problems getting to the ipa server it was looking for.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I ran:<\/p><p>$ pdsh -w ipa[01-04] -f 12 -R exec ldapsearch -h %<a href=\"http:\/\/h.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">h.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> -b 'dc=int,dc=aci,dc=ics,dc=psu,dc=edu' -x '(&amp;(objectClass=*)(uid=gbs35))' | sort | dshbak -c <br>ipa04: ldap_sasl_bind(SIMPLE): Can't contact LDAP server (-1)<br>ipa02: ldap_sasl_bind(SIMPLE): Can't contact LDAP server (-1)<br>pdsh@gbs35-grafana: ipa04: ldapsearch exited with exit code 255<br>pdsh@gbs35-grafana: ipa02: ldapsearch exited with exit code 255<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>This should work for all 4 ldap servers...<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>[root@ipa04 ~]# systemctl status ipa.service<br>\u25cf ipa.service - Identity, Policy, Audit<br>Loaded: Looking online, I could see that the way to restore things was supposed to be to copy over the dse.ldif.startOK file to dse.ldif:<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: bash; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@ipa02 ~]# cd \/etc\/dirsrv\/slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU\n[root@ipa02 slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU]# cp -p dse.ldif.startOK dse.ldif\n[root@ipa02 slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU]# systemctl start dirsrv@INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU.service\n[root@ipa02 slapd-INT-ACI-ICS-PSU-EDU]# systemctl start ipa<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Things seemed to be OK, but ipa03 still wasn't responding to query requests. I ended up rebooting ipa03 and it seems to now be working.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":844,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:59.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:59.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-da-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Daily Tasks\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-nicole-an\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> NICOLE ANNA CHIPEGO<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span> on Jun 15, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-expectati\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-operations-expectati-1\">Operations expectations while on duty in iASK:<\/h3><ul><li>Be available to answer tickets and work with the others in iASK<\/li><li>Check the state of nodes that aren't up:<\/li><\/ul><blockquote><pre>$ pbsnodes -ln | cut -b 1-130 <br>comp-bc-0232 down ERROR: nhc: Health check failed: check_ps_loadavg: 1-minute load average too h<br>comp-gc-0014 down,offline Initial load<br>comp-lc-0095 down,offline IB Problems - ERROR: nhc: Health check failed: check_fs_mount: \/gpfs\/scratch n<\/pre><\/blockquote><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><ul><li>If you don't understand why a node is down, investigate and find out.&nbsp;<ul><li>Check the SEL etc.&nbsp; If there's a hardware problem, make sure it gets tracked.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Check your email and respond to things you can.<\/li><li>Review&nbsp;JIRA tasks assigned to you, or that you've opened for someone else and see what needs to be done on those<\/li><li>Plan stuff to work on during your non-iASK time.<\/li><li>For any stuff you need to hand-off to someone else, make sure to communicate what you're handing off and that there's an email or&nbsp;JIRA task to track the hand-off.<\/li><li>Check vendor support tickets you may have opened and follow up on them<\/li><li>Check any old iASK tickets you have that haven't been closed.<ul><li>Follow-up with any that haven't had a response in more than a week.<\/li><li>If there's something you're waiting for follow-up with whoever it is you're waiting on.<ul><li>If they don't respond to a JIRA task, or email, try to contact them in another way (phone, text, stop by their office etc.)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-daily-tasks-that-are\">Daily tasks that are expected:<\/h3><p><br><\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"18221260\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"21\"><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/OPS\/Tower+Road+Walk+Through\" rel=\"nofollow\">Data center walk-through<\/a>&nbsp;- This is done by Michael Paley&nbsp;<br><br><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"22\">&nbsp;Check down nodes and open service tickets with vendor as needed.<\/li><\/ul><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; How do you open service tickets with different vendors?<\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"18221260\"><li style=\"background-image: none;\"><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"18221260\"><li style=\"background-image: none;\"><ul><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Vendor+Support+Information\" rel=\"nofollow\">Vendor Support Information<\/a>&nbsp;- Need info Dell, Nexenta, and Oracle<\/li><li>Email&nbsp;<\/li><li>Phone number<\/li><li>Contacts?<\/li><\/ul><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/HowTo+create+an+SR+for+Dell\" rel=\"nofollow\">HowTo create an SR for Dell<\/a><br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"23\">&nbsp;Check-up on any service tickets that need followup<br><br><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"24\">&nbsp; Answer iASK tickets - There is a scattering of confluence pages for common i-ask questions spread in various subpages. Many are in the&nbsp;<a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/collector\/pages.action?key=TST\">Technical Solutions Team<\/a>&nbsp;page. There is also an&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/collector\/pages.action?key=TST\" rel=\"nofollow\">iask<\/a>,&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/SUPPORT\/Support\" rel=\"nofollow\">Support<\/a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/UGUIDE\/i-Ask+Users+Guide\">i-Ask User Guide<\/a>&nbsp;page. Seems like elements these pages could be rolled into the TST page into a single helpdesk source. On that note a lot of these should be looked over to see what is still applicable since the decommission of the legacy system.<\/li><\/ul><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><br><\/p><h3 style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\" id=\"bkmrk-other-routine-tasks%3A\">Other routine tasks:<\/h3><p><br><\/p><ul><li style=\"list-style-type: none;background-image: none;\"><br><ul><li>Someone deleted everything in their home directory again?&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=18220001\" rel=\"nofollow\">Restore Procedure (ACI Systems)<\/a><ul><li>Until group gets a full backup home and work aren't necessarily run at a regular interval so the data won't be there if it was made and lost after the last backup (Snapshots are being made for the time being, check in \/group\/.snapshots\/backup*).<br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>System Monitoring:<ul><li>Solarwinds Orion<ul><li><a href=\"https:\/\/solarwinds01.win.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/Orion\/Login.aspx?ReturnUrl=%2fOrion%2fView.aspx\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/solarwinds01.win.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/Orion\/Login.aspx?ReturnUrl=%2fOrion%2fView.aspx<\/a>&nbsp;- log in using &lt;psuid&gt;@<a href=\"http:\/\/dce.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu<\/a> and your penn state access account password<\/li><li>Adding a node for monitoring in Solarwinds:<ul><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Enable+SNMPv3+for+SolarWinds\" rel=\"nofollow\">Enable SNMPv3 for SolarWinds<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Adding custom script templates to Solarwinds -&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/www.solarwinds.com\/documentation\/en\/flarehelp\/sam\/content\/sam-linux-unix-script-monitor-sw3260.htm\" rel=\"nofollow\" class=\"external-link\">http:\/\/www.solarwinds.com\/documentation\/en\/flarehelp\/sam\/content\/sam-linux-unix-script-monitor-sw3260.htm<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>DirectMon<br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How to create users?<ul><li>Users submit a request at&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/accounts.aci.ics.psu.edu\/users\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/accounts.aci.ics.psu.edu\/users\/<\/a>, once their sponsor approves or two days pass the request is approved at&nbsp;<a class=\"external-link\" href=\"https:\/\/accounts.aci.ics.psu.edu\/admin\/requests.php\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/accounts.aci.ics.psu.edu\/admin\/requests.php,<\/a>&nbsp;the account is then generated via a script that runs within 24 hours.<br><ul><li>In the event that the request seems to only be filled up to the sponsorID field create a ticket specifying the requestee's userID and assign to Derick to resolve. This is a known issue where one of the requestee's sponsors is no longer is in Penn State's LDAP system.<br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How to create and enable access to groups?<ul><li>Create group on <a href=\"http:\/\/ipa-utils01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ipa-utils01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> using the group add command <span class=\"confluence-link\">(eg. ipa group-add mlr36-daymont_collab<\/span>)<\/li><li>Adding members to groups with group add member command (eg. ipa group-add-member mlr36-daymont_collab --users=jpp226)<\/li><li>Showing details of a group with group show command (eg. ipa group-show mlr36-insight_collab)<\/li><li>Modify a group with group modify command (eg. ipa group-mod mlr36-insight_collab --rename=mlr36-ADAPT_collab)<br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How to enable access to allocations?<ul><li>Adding users to an allocation with the command similar to adding to a group (eg.&nbsp; ipa group-add-member evf11_a_g_sc_default&nbsp; --users=did5166)<\/li><li><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Enabling+Access+to+CyberLamp\">Enabling Access to CyberLamp<\/a>&nbsp;\/&nbsp;<a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/SUPPORT\/CyberLAMP+PIs\">PIs who can grant access to CyberLamp<\/a><\/li><li><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Adding+an+ACI+2.0+Compute+Allocation\">Creating Compute Allocation<\/a><\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Adding+an+ACI+2.0+Archive+Storage+Allocation\" rel=\"nofollow\">Creating Archive Storage Allocation<\/a><\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/OPS\/Adding+an+ACI+2.0+Restricted+Active+Storage+Allocation\" rel=\"nofollow\">Creating Restricted Active Storage Allocation<\/a>&nbsp;- For PI's with data security requirements such as dbgap, nist, export controlled, etc.<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/SUPPORT\/Allocation+Funds+Formula+and+Adding+Credit+to+Allocation\" rel=\"nofollow\">Crediting Core Hours to a Compute Allocation<\/a><\/li><li><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Adding+an+ACI+2.0+Active+Storage+Allocation\">Creating Active Storage Allocation<\/a><\/li><li>&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/OPS\/Dual+Mount+Storage+Creation\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dual Mount Storage Request Process<\/a>&nbsp;<ul><li><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=12025992\">Setting up Samba Dual Mount for Active Storage<\/a><\/li><\/ul><br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><ul><li>What directories do users usually have access to?&nbsp; &nbsp;How to create those (permissions etc.)<br><ul><li>When a user's account is created a script runs to create and configure the three default directories.<\/li><li>The directories a user has access to by default are:<ul><li>home - \/storage\/home\/abc1234 - 10GB Quota.<ul><li>&nbsp;This directory is on available to the user.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>work - \/storage\/work\/abc1234 - 100GB Quota.&nbsp;<br><ul><li>Access can be shared to another user through membership in the abc1234_collab group<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>scratch - \/gpfs\/scratch\/abc1234 - No Space quota but limited to 1 million Inodes and any files not accessed for 30 days are deleted.&nbsp;<br><ul><li>Access can be shared to another user through membership in the abc1234_collab group<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Users can also gain access to a PI's group storage located at:<ul><li>&nbsp;group - \/gpfs\/group\/&lt;PI_ID&gt;\/ - Size depends on the PI 's SLA but it will be in increments of 5TB<br><ul><li>Access to a PI's group storage requires membership in the &lt;PI_ID&gt;_collab group. Users wishing to have access to a PI's group space must secure permission from the PI, typically in the form of a ticket submitted from the PI themselves requesting the addition.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>There are some exceptions to the standard PI group storage layouts, these should probably be tracked in another page and linked here&lt;&gt;<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>All directory permissions requiring changes must be done by root on the appropriate nsd:<ul><li><strong>As a warning<\/strong>, changing permissions will require a new backup of any changed files even if they are changed to the same state. This adds more stress to TSM, so when changes are required it is best to narrow down changes to the problem files instead of doing a complete rewrite of the file structure.<\/li><li>Group\/Scratch - stor-nsd-[001-016].<a href=\"http:\/\/stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>Work - stor-nsd-[017-018].<a href=\"http:\/\/stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>Home - stor-nsd-[021-022].<a href=\"http:\/\/stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Checking for jobs before servicing a compute node<ul><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=1638959\" rel=\"nofollow\">Offlining a node<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>When it is OK to reboot the systems running Moab or torque, etc.<\/li><li>How often are services restarted (moab, torque, license servers, RedHat Satellite server etc.)<br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":850,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:59.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:20:59.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
