Title contains numbers at the end: Roadmap 7372942
string(6660) "{"id":2782,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Roadmap","slug":"roadmap-6rf","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ro\">Operations Team : Roadmap<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Legacy-hosted-solutions_7372857.html\">Legacy hosted solutions<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ro-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ro-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Roadmap\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-jack-stev\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> JACK STEVEN GUNDRUM<\/span>, last modified on Feb 03, 2017\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-1%29-initial-email-pro\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>1) initial email proposed to Julian:<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Subj: Decommissioning ICS Legacy Hosted Solutions<\/p><p>Greet User first,<\/p><p>As you know, the Institute for CyberScience (ICS) will be decommissioning our Legacy systems during Spring semester 2017. As part of the decommission of the legacy systems we will be decommissioning the legacy hosted solutions also, which includes your server\/system.<\/p><p>We will provide you help to transition to a different solution for your server\/system if you are still in need of the service it provides? If you think that you no longer need the service please let us know. If you still need the service several options are available which we can discuss, (for example VM hosting will migrate you to their service for free, but with a monthly service fee). Please let us know how how you would like to move forward and if you have questions or concerns, please contact us, thanks Jack.<\/p><p>Note: Working with Julian to determine the best approach for the series of emails to the PI.<\/p><p>1a) Julian's changes below<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Hi &lt;name&gt;,<\/p><p>As you know, the Institute for CyberScience (ICS) will be decommissioning our \u201clegacy systems\u201d (Lion-XF, Lion-XG, Lion-XV, CyberSTAR, and BioSTAR) during Spring semester 2017. As part of this process, we will also be decommissioning our legacy hosted solutions, which includes your server and system.<\/p><p><strong>IF YOU STILL NEED THE SERVICE YOUR LEGACY HOSTED SOLUTION PROVIDES:<\/strong> Please let me know, and I will work with you to transition you to a different solution that will meet your research needs; we can discuss multiple options.<\/p><p><strong>IF YOU NO LONGER NEED YOUR LEGACY HOSTED SOLUTION:<\/strong> Let me know and we will proceed with decommissioning your system.<\/p><p>Whatever the case, we will not decommission your systems until you have a working solution in a reasonable timeframe.<\/p><p>Please inform me of how you would like to move forward by (DATE). If you have questions or concerns, feel free to contact me.<\/p><p>Thanks,<\/p><p>Jack<\/p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/p><p>2) Based on the response from the initial email I would hope that around half the PI's&nbsp;don't need anything migrated to a new solution. But based on the response&nbsp;we will need to propose a&nbsp;new solution for some people I am sure.<\/p><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                        <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-comments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Comments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <table border=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n                                                        <tr>\n                                <td>\n                                    <a name=\"comment-7372944\"><\/a>\n                                    <font class=\"smallfont\"><p>Love it<\/p><\/font>\n                                    <div align=\"left\" class=\"smallfont\" style=\"color: #666666; id=\"bkmrk-some-of-the-gotchas-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-some-of-the-gotchas--1\">Some of the gotchas and fixes we found as part of the conversion process<\/h3><ul><li>Unprovision the host from IPA when you start the rebuild.&nbsp; It will not be recognized by IPA even though it has the same name.<br><ul><li>Hosts-&gt;&lt;Hostname&gt;-&gt;Actions-&gt;Unprovision<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Install the GPFS Encryption RPMs<\/li><li>Update the GPFS Encryption config files<\/li><li>Copy Keys???<\/li><li>Update the CES group???<\/li><li>Copy krb5.keytab from existing node<ul><li>klist -ek \/etc\/krb5<\/li><li>Restart sssd<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Kinit<\/li><li>Verify pam config matches existing nodes<ul><li>\/etc\/pam.d\/password...<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n Title contains numbers at the end: SMB Protocol Nodes 18223465
string(14409) "{"id":2784,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"SMB Protocol Nodes","slug":"smb-protocol-nodes-fOm","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-sm\">Operations Team : SMB Protocol Nodes<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-sm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-sm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : SMB Protocol Nodes\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Sep 15, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-parties-responsible-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><strong>Parties responsible for this system:<\/strong><\/p><ul><li>Derick Haigh - dth5124<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Purpose of this system:<\/strong><\/p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This system is a CES cluster for supporting SMB traffic for several user groups. It is not directly accessible by the users via ssh, but users can mount an exported share via smb using the gateway '<a href=\"http:\/\/fsgateway.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">fsgateway.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>'<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>System Configuration Information<\/strong><\/p><p><strong><br><\/strong><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"relative-table wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><col><col><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Hostname<\/th><th colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTh\">Hardware<\/th><th colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTh\">Cores<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Memory<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Network<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Interconnect<\/th><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><a href=\"http:\/\/stor-protocol-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor-protocol-001.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Dell R630<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">2 Socket Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU 2680v3<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">256GB<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Bonded 40G ConnectX3<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">N\/A<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><a href=\"http:\/\/stor-protocol-002.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor-protocol-002.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Dell R630<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span>2 Socket Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU 2680v3<\/span><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">256GB<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Bonded 40G ConnectX3<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">N\/A<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><a href=\"http:\/\/stor-protocol-003.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor-protocol-003.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Dell R630<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span>2 Socket Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU 2680v3<\/span><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">256GB<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Bonded 40G ConnectX3<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">N\/A<\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><strong><br><\/strong><\/p><p>Protocol Nodes Essentially have three major parts to them:<\/p><ol><li>CES - Cluster Export Services - Pretty much what it says on the tin, provides services for exporting a gpfs cluster using various protocols including SMB<\/li><li>SMB - Server Message Block - The protocol we use for the exporting of GPFS file shares to users.<\/li><li>GPFS - General Parallel File System - The File system we use for Group and Scratch storage. Technically users can access their scratch through the smb export, but in practice they're limited to their group storage.<br><br><\/li><\/ol><p>Configuration Files:<\/p><ol><li><strong>&nbsp;<\/strong>smb.conf - <a href=\"https:\/\/bitbucket.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/projects\/INFRA\/repos\/aci\/browse\/files\/samba\/gpfs-samba.conf\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/bitbucket.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/projects\/INFRA\/repos\/aci\/browse\/files\/samba\/gpfs-samba.conf<\/a><ol><li>Not managed in puppet but the configuration is periodically backed up manually to bitbucket. Changes are made on one of the protocol nodes and is automatically propagated to the others.<ol><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/OPS\/smb.conf+Global+Settings\" rel=\"nofollow\">smb.conf Global Settings<\/a> - A list of current global settings and what they do<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=12025992\" rel=\"nofollow\">Export Active Storage CIFS\/Samba Share<\/a> - Explains how to create export a share via smb, but also list commands for changing\/removing settings from smb.conf<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>GPFS configurations -<ol><li><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># Run from server cluster\n# https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/community\/wikis\/home?lang=en#!\/wiki\/General%20Parallel%20File%20System%20(GPFS)\/page\/Protocol%20Node%20-%20Tuning%20and%20Analysis\nmmchconfig maxFilesToCache=4000000 -N stor-protocol-001,stor-protocol-002,stor-protocol-003\nmmchconfig maxAllocRegionsPerNode=DEFAULT,logWrapThreads=DEFAULT,maxBackgroundDeletionThreads=DEFAULT,maxFileCleaners=DEFAULT,maxInodeDeallocPrefetch=DEFAULT,maxReceiverThreads=DEFAULT,nfsPrefetchStrategy=DEFAULT,nsdInlineWriteMax=DEFAULT,nsdMaxWorkerThreads=DEFAULT,nsdMinWorkerThreads=DEFAULT,prefetchPct=DEFAULT,seqDiscardThreshhold=DEFAULT,statCacheDirPct=DEFAULT,syncIntervalStrict=DEFAULT,syncWorkerThreads=DEFAULT,worker1Threads=DEFAULT,enforceFilesetQuotaOnRoot=DEFAULT,numaMemoryInterleave=DEFAULT\n -N stor-protocol-001,stor-protocol-002,stor-protocol-003\nmmchconfig maxMBpS=20000,pagepool=128G,numaMemoryInterleave=yes -N stor-protocol-001,stor-protocol-002,stor-protocol-003<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><ul><li>How is it configured?<ol><li>Are there files in puppet, git, configurations on the systems?&nbsp; How are these managed?<\/li><li>How do we manage changes?<\/li><li>If there's high availability configured, how is that expected to work?<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Shutdown Procedure - <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=18223590\" rel=\"nofollow\">Shutting Down\/Starting Up A Protocol Node<\/a><\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Status Information:<\/strong><\/p><ol><li>Important log files - there are separate logs for each node<br><ol><li>\/var\/adm\/ras\/log.smbd - smb daemon log<\/li><li>\/var\/adm\/ras\/mmfs.log.latest<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Commands for diagnostics<ol><li>smbstatus - Displays the current status of smb and any active connections.<\/li><li>mmlscluster --ces - Displays some cluster information, including what IPs are associated with which node<\/li><li>mmces state show - SHow the state of the node in the CES cluster, -a to display all nodes in the CES cluster<\/li><li>mmces service list - list enabled services (should be NFS and SMB) and if they're running<\/li><li>mmces node list - lists nodes in CES cluster<\/li><li><p>ctdb dbstatistics locking.tdb | grep Key: | awk -F'[:]' '{print $3}' | while read line; do net tdb locking $line; done - This will list any hot keys (files that have a lot of share modes\/locks)<\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Thing to look out for<ol><li>Disabled Services - Make sure NFS and SMB are running<ol><li>If they're not running the services can be<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Node isn't running in the CES cluster - If a node is suspended (and it has no known issues) resume it using 'mmces node resume'<\/li><li>Various states are degraded - Use 'mmces state show' to see if any aspects are down or degraded<ol><li>Solutions really depend on what is degraded, it's suggested to use the commands for diagnostics to try to narrow down the issue<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Split Brain Cluster - If nodes are refusing to come up, reach quorum, or assign IPs there may be a split brain<ol><li>There may be a better way but bringing down all nodes and restarting them starting with 001 has resolved this issue<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>System Monitoring - There are a few scripts running to push data to grafana:<br><ol><li>parser_smbstatus.py - Runs of stor-protocol-001, pushes data from smbstatus<\/li><li>parser_ctdb.py - Runs on all three nodes (Has a variable set for each node valued 0-2), pusheds data regarding lock files\/operations<\/li><li>Both scripts can be found in Bitbucket: <a href=\"https:\/\/bitbucket.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/projects\/OP_MON\/repos\/samba_monitoring\/browse\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/bitbucket.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/projects\/OP_MON\/repos\/samba_monitoring\/browse<\/a><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Standard Maintenance:<\/strong><\/p><ul><li>&nbsp;Apply any Security Fixes, updates, required<ul><li>Done during a standard maintenance window<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Change root\/system passwords<ul><li>Done after someone with root access leaves or as determined by security team<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Check various statuses of the nodes, make sure connections are being maintained, nodes are up, etc.<ul><li>At least Once or Twice a week.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><strong>Recovery Plan:<\/strong><\/p><ol><ol><li>There is some puppet stuff for protocol nodes, and there is a protocolnode host group for titan, so that should handle most of the intial building and provisioning.<\/li><li>CES may have been manually set up, the documentation I found for that is on IBM's site <a href=\"https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/en\/STXKQY_4.2.3\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r23.doc\/bl1adm_cesproconfig.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/en\/STXKQY_4.2.3\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r23.doc\/bl1adm_cesproconfig.htm<\/a><\/li><li>The node will have to be registered to the gpfs cluster<\/li><li>If a singular node went down the smb.conf should be copied over from the survivors, if they're all gone use the back up in Bitbucket<\/li><li>GPFS configurations may have to be redone using mmchconfig<\/li><\/ol><\/ol><h3 id=\"bkmrk-static-network-route\">Static Network Routes<\/h3><p>By default the protocol nodes sit on two networks, the internal 10.0.0.0 network with the ACI stuff and the research network.&nbsp; The default route goes out to the research network, with the 10.0.0.0\/8 network passing to the internal ACI network.<\/p><p>The university has also used 10.0.0.0 addresses for it's purposes, one of these is the VPN.&nbsp; In order to not have problems with things on these networks, we need to add static routes to our network to deal with these addresses.<\/p><p>I added static routes:<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>ip route add 10.142.128.0\/17 via 192.5.158.1 dev bond01.3000\nip route add 10.40.0.0\/16 via 192.5.158.1 dev bond01.3000<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>I also added&nbsp;\/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts\/route-bond01.3000 with:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>10.142.128.0\/17 via 192.5.158.1 dev bond01.3000\n10.40.0.0\/16 via 192.5.158.1 dev bond01.3000<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>to make sure these routes are there when the system comes back up.<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":854,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Roar Collab xdmod configuration 131368704
string(4070) "{"id":2785,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Roar Collab xdmod configuration","slug":"roar-collab-xdmod-configuration-NT2","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ro\">Operations Team : Roar Collab xdmod configuration<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ro-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ro-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Roar Collab xdmod configuration\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-robert-sa\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Robert Sand<\/span>, last modified on Jan 02, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-collection-will\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>This collection will explain how the xdmod server was installed and configured including<\/p><p>database setup, authentication, and pcp data collection.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>The Roar Collab xdmod server is installed as a stateless system.&nbsp; The main directory with the configuration files '\/opt\/xdmod' is stored in the<br>shared storage area '\/storage\/sys\/xdmod\/xdmod'.&nbsp; When the server starts up it installs the rpms located in the '\/storage\/sys\/xdmod' directory<br>and then replaces two directories in '\/etc\/xdmod and \/etc\/supremm' to point to the '\/storage\/sys\/xdmod\/xdmod\/etc' directory and then replaces<br>the '\/opt\/xdmod' directory with a symlink to the '\/storage\/sys\/xdmod\/xdmod' directory.&nbsp; This was done because all of the configuration files<br>created in the setup of xdmod and the supremm module store the configs into the '\/opt\/xdmod' directory.&nbsp; This installation will help when or<br>if the application is put into a container.&nbsp; All scripts run&nbsp; by the server to update the Mariadb and Mongodb databases are done as the xdmod user.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":855,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: Running MPI tests outside of a job 83591571
string(5246) "{"id":2787,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Running MPI tests outside of a job","slug":"running-mpi-tests-outside-of-a-job-3fM","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ru\">Operations Team : Running MPI tests outside of a job<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ru-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ru-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Running MPI tests outside of a job\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified on Aug 27, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-normally-we-run-mpi-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Normally we run MPI jobs from within a job.&nbsp; However, there may be times when we have nodes drained or otherwise unavailable through the batch system that we may still need to run tests.&nbsp; This can be done with the following steps:<\/p><p>Load the intel compiler and intel MPI modules.&nbsp; The modules we use are configured to push the job launch through PBS\/Torque, so we need to unset the I_MPI_HYDRA_BOOTSTRAP setting, so it'll default to ssh.<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[gbs35@comp-lc-0001 alltest]$ module add intel\n[gbs35@comp-lc-0001 alltest]$ module add impi\n[gbs35@comp-lc-0001 alltest]$ unset I_MPI_HYDRA_BOOTSTRAP<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>Create a file with a list of hosts where your tasks will run.&nbsp; A simple list can be used like something with a filename of \"myhosts\" with the following contents:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>comp-lc-0001\ncomp-lc-0002\ncomp-lc-0003<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>more info on the contents of this file can be found at:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/software.intel.com\/content\/www\/us\/en\/develop\/articles\/controlling-process-placement-with-the-intel-mpi-library.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/software.intel.com\/content\/www\/us\/en\/develop\/articles\/controlling-process-placement-with-the-intel-mpi-library.html<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Now you're ready to run your MPI job:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[gbs35@comp-lc-0001 alltest]$ mpirun -np 3 -ppn 1 -machinefile myhosts .\/alltest -sb -fn out.out<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>The -np, -ppn and -machinefile parameters should be explained in the Intel documentation, basically, -np gives the total number of processes to run, -ppn says how many processes to run on each node (host)<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":857,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Appliance Configuration<\/strong><\/h2><p>====================<\/p><p>vCloud Usage Meter Documentation: <a href=\"https:\/\/docs.vmware.com\/en\/vCloud-Usage-Meter\/index.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/docs.vmware.com\/en\/vCloud-Usage-Meter\/index.html<\/a><\/p><ol><li>Open a web browser and navigate to <a href=\"https:\/\/10.192.0.102\" fields default<\/p><\/li><li><p>Select \"Add\"<\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small \n","priority":859,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2019 08 16 Group storage IBM Key server cert expiration 43188299
string(8339) "{"id":2790,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2019 08 16 Group storage IBM Key server cert expiration","slug":"2019-08-16-group-storage-ibm-key-server-cert-expiration-x6W","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20\">Operations Team : 2019-08-16 Group storage IBM Key server cert expiration<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Downtime-Log_18222067.html\">Downtime Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-20-2\">\n                            Operations Team : 2019-08-16 Group storage IBM Key server cert expiration\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Aug 19, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-between-9%3A00am-and-1\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Between 9:00am and 10:00am, on Aug 16, the certificate used for encrypting GPFS storage expired.&nbsp; As far as I know, there was no plan to deal with this expiration.<\/p><p>We were able to understand the problem by 11:00am and knew that we needed to do something.&nbsp; We poked around a bit on the ISKLM servers and looked at options.<\/p><p>Mike Gallo opened a ticket with DDN to understand their process for getting a new key.<\/p><p>The DDN response was:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">You will need to generate new certificates and move them to the NSD nodes: <br><br>High level steps: <br>-create new server side key good to 2028, exported and moved to NSDs. <br>-create new GPFS keystore and cert importing the new server-side cert using mmauth. Pushed to all gpfs nodes. <br>-modifie gpfs RKM.conf and pushed to all nodes. <br>-run '\/usr\/lpp\/mmfs\/bin\/tsloadikm run' on all affected nodes and re-mounted where needed to restore data access <\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><br><\/p><p>A web page at:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/en\/STXKQY_4.2.0\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r2.adv.doc\/bl1adv_encryptionusecases.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/en\/STXKQY_4.2.0\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r2.adv.doc\/bl1adv_encryptionusecases.htm<\/a>&nbsp;provided the basics for how to do this:<\/p><p>on ISKLM-2, I did:<\/p><p><br><\/p><pre># .\/wsadmin.sh -username SKLMAdmin -password &lt;SEE Lastpass&gt; -lang jython\n\nWASX7209I: Connected to process \"server1\" on node SKLMNode using SOAP connector; The type of process is: UnManagedProcess\nWASX7031I: For help, enter: \"print Help.help()\"\nwsadmin&gt;print AdminTask.tklmCertList('[-alias gs-cert-1]')\nCTGKM0001I Command succeeded.\n\nuuid = CERTIFICATE-225f3b27-343d-4832-b5bb-c546ddf1fb20\nalias = gs-cert-1 \nkey store name = defaultKeyStore \nkey state = ACTIVE\nissuer name = CN=GRIDScaler Cert1\nsubject name = CN=GRIDScaler Cert1\ncreation date = 8\/16\/16, 1:16:55 PM GMT\nexpiration date = 8\/16\/19, 1:16:55 PM GMT\nserial number = 11805617968920\n\nwsadmin&gt;print AdminTask.tklmCertList('[-alias gs-cert-2]')\nCTGKM0001I Command succeeded.\n\nuuid = CERTIFICATE-731dec2-8ab3743b-cec2-4aba-a9e6-e598e0758737\nalias = gs-cert-2 \nkey store name = defaultKeyStore \nkey state = PRE_ACTIVE\nissuer name = CN=GridScaler Cert2\nsubject name = CN=GridScaler Cert2\ncreation date = 8\/16\/19, 2:21:38 PM GMT\nexpiration date = 8\/15\/22, 2:21:38 PM GMT\nserial number = 17274637822526193\n\nwsadmin&gt;print AdminTask.tklmCertExport('[-uuid CERTIFICATE-731dec2-8ab3743b-cec2-4aba-a9e6-e598e0758737 -format base64 -fileName \/root\/gbscert]')\nCTGKM0002E Command failed: CTGKM2927E Invalid file extension. Valid extensions are .cer or .der for baser64 and DER formats respectively. \nwsadmin&gt;print AdminTask.tklmCertExport('[-uuid CERTIFICATE-731dec2-8ab3743b-cec2-4aba-a9e6-e598e0758737 -format base64 -fileName \/root\/gbscert.cer]')\nCTGKM0001I Command succeeded.\n\/root\/gbscert.cer\n\n<\/pre><p><br><\/p><p>This provided a cert I could copy to stor-nsd-001.&nbsp; I created a password in \/root\/psdfile using the password in the \/var\/mmfs\/etc\/RKM.conf file using the passphrase given there:<\/p><p>I used mmauth to create a key store and then created a certificate from the new key store:<\/p><p><br><\/p><pre>mmauth gencert --cname stor-nsd --label icsgpfs --cert \/root\/gbscert2.cer --out \/var\/mmfs\/etc\/RKMcerts\/icsgpfs.p12 --pwd-file \/root\/psdfile\n\nopenssl pkcs12 -in RKMcerts\/icsgpfs.p12 -nokeys -out \/root\/icsgpfs.crt<\/pre><p><br><\/p><p>I edited the file to remove the \"server\" block of info and copied this new cert to the isklm.&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>On ISKLM-2 we edited the GPFS device group and added some keys.&nbsp; We also made sure to enable the \"hold new certificate requests\" button as instructed in the above web page.<\/p><p>In the ISKLM, from the Welcome tab, I added the certificate client certificate.<\/p><p>I edited the RKM.conf to point to the new keystore and the new clientCertLabel.&nbsp; I also pushed isklm2 to be the primary key server and made isklm1 the secondary.<\/p><p>Once we had the cert and the RKM.conf in the proper location we just needed to run \"\/usr\/lpp\/mmfs\/bin\/tsloadikm run\".<\/p><p>I still got permission denied on files in group, but on the ISKLM server I was able to select the \"Pending client device communication certificates\" and see the one I had created.&nbsp; I accepted the key and then things worked again on group for nsd-001.<\/p><p>I needed to copy \/var\/mmfs\/etc\/RKM.conf and \/var\/mmfs\/etc\/RKMcerts\/icsgpfs.p12 to the rest of the GPFS nodes and run the \"tsloadikm run\" command on the rest of the nodes.&nbsp;<\/p><p>That seemed to work for us and things are working again.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>This does not \"fix\" the other ISKLM to get the proper certificates on it, nor set things so it could use this second server if the first one failed.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":860,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:00.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>The low number for reads using large files probably represent the true read speed of the underlying storage.<\/p><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-notes\">Notes<\/h3><ol><li class=\"auto-cursor-target\">The top three MB\/s were averaged regardless of data set size.&nbsp; These numbers are probably accurate for bursty workloads.<\/li><li class=\"auto-cursor-target\">The MB\/s from the largest data set sizes were averaged.&nbsp; These are probably more accurate for sustained workloads.<\/li><\/ol><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-file-size-difference\">File Size Differences<\/h3><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">When changing parameters and results start to tail off we stop increasing the data set size.&nbsp; This is why some test show significantly larger data sets.&nbsp; Test using larger data sets is an indication of positive results and the systems ability to handle a mixed workload.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n Title contains numbers at the end: VAST   Replace Fan 150340781
string(14350) "{"id":2792,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"VAST   Replace Fan","slug":"vast-replace-fan-JYa","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-va\">Operations Team : VAST - Replace Fan<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VAST_125699272.html\">VAST<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-va-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-va-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VAST - Replace Fan\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on May 20, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-fan-reported-failed-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Fan reported failed on dbox-USE2600028UPF10D &amp; sys_fan6.( 2 FAN's in that <a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.vastdata.com%2Fhc%2Frequests%2F3&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=yNHBb1SrgDgjiPMO9RaQudazLwdFQ1DMt7GMXeIU8J8%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">#3<\/a> socket &nbsp;- image given below)<br>This Dbox contain Dnode - 112 &amp; 113.&nbsp;<br><br><br>Below are the Dnode FAN replacement procedure. Its a bit lengthy procedure.<br>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<\/p><ul><li><strong>Be mindful of the cabling slack. If there is not enough slack, the cables can be knocked loose and cause the dbox to go offline<\/strong><\/li><li><strong>When doing the fan swaps, at least 3 fans must be operational at all times. Less than 75% air flow can cause overheating over time, and less than 50% airflow will greatly decrease the time it takes to overheat.<\/strong><\/li><li><strong>Do not open multiple fan covers.<\/strong><\/li><li><strong>Replace (front) fans <\/strong><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F1&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=S48MwVTHmalNcqboGQB4BpdmpdL696uZ5QM8mqkk0Q0%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"><strong>#1<\/strong><\/a><strong> and <\/strong><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F3&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=jUwtvkwJ9q0LwN4%2F7XXpqgDR7FYQKXjQrvtQxIPXL3Q%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"><strong>#3<\/strong><\/a><strong> Since airflow is from front to rear of the chassis, if you were to swap the (rear) fans <\/strong><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F2&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=CFyST%2FGrU2y7oOZG8aYnSqSRPzejI0K6WbZga5xwxCI%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"><strong>#2<\/strong><\/a><strong> and <\/strong><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F4&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=x0HG0BSXMtRZ9JkAufq8W51GJh9A5KpVcu3v7JN9frU%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"><strong>#4<\/strong><\/a><strong> first, <em>while unlikely,<\/em> then the front fan(s) were to shred before you could swap them, it would send shrapnel to the fans you just replaced and would require replacing them again.<\/strong><\/li><\/ul><p>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<br>Identify the chassis S\/N via impi fru<br>&nbsp;<\/p><ol><li>sudo ipmitool fru list | grep \"Chassis Serial :\"<\/li><\/ol><ul><li>The colon is no longer present.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Turn on chassis LED of desired chassis<\/li><\/ul><ol><li>sudo ipmitool chassis identify 180<br>This will turn the identification led for 3 minutes<\/li><\/ol><p>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<\/p><ul><li>Refer to the system fan LEDs to identify the system fan module to be removed.<\/li><li>Extend the enclosure from the rack into the serviceable position.&nbsp;<br>Ensure there is enough cable slack, cabling is not restricted and the DBOX can be pulled out to the maximum.<\/li><li>Pull up on the system fan module cover located on top of the enclosure for the fan module requiring replacement (see Figure 1 on page 2).<ol><li>Each fan module has two sys_fans as seen in the output ipmitool sensor list<ol><li><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F1&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=S48MwVTHmalNcqboGQB4BpdmpdL696uZ5QM8mqkk0Q0%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">#1<\/a> - sys_fan_1, 2<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F2&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=CFyST%2FGrU2y7oOZG8aYnSqSRPzejI0K6WbZga5xwxCI%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">#2<\/a> - sys_fan_3,4<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F3&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=jUwtvkwJ9q0LwN4%2F7XXpqgDR7FYQKXjQrvtQxIPXL3Q%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">#3<\/a> - sys_fan_5,6<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fvastdata.zendesk.com%2Fagent%2Ftickets%2F4&amp;data=05%7C01%7Cmdg104%40psu.edu%7C40c9fb273bbe4642d8a108db587f4769%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C638201075913909739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=x0HG0BSXMtRZ9JkAufq8W51GJh9A5KpVcu3v7JN9frU%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">#4<\/a> - sys_fan_7,8<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><p>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/150340781\/150340782.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/150340781\/150340782.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"150340782\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2023-5-20_10-40-54.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"150340781\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"2\"><\/span><br><br>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<br>Lift up on the fan module and disconnect the fan cable from the fan module connector (see Figure 2).<\/p><ol><li>Note: Since the connector is black and it can be dark, it is recommended to have a small <strong><u>flashlight<\/u><\/strong> to ensure there is sufficient light when changing the connector.<\/li><\/ol><p>&nbsp;<br><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/150340781\/150340783.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/150340781\/150340783.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"150340783\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2023-5-20_10-41-18.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"150340781\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"2\"><\/span>&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;<\/p><ul><li>Make note of the fan module\u2019s orientation and lift the fan module out of the enclosure.<\/li><li>Be careful on this step when disconnecting the fan module connector<ol><li>The connector can be very tight. It\u2019s not easy to disconnect.<\/li><li>It is recommended to bring a plier, and use it to hold on to the plastic to disconnect the connector.<ol><li><strong>Caution<\/strong>: Don\u2019t press too hard else you\u2019ll break the plastic.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ul><p>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<\/p><ul><li>Insert the new fan module in the same orientation as the removed fan module and connect the fan cable to the fan module connector (see Figure 2).<\/li><\/ul><ol><li>Press down on the fan module to secure it in place.<\/li><li>Close the fan module cover.<\/li><li>Return the enclosure to its operational position within the rack.<\/li><li>Verify that the corresponding fan module LED displays normal status<\/li><\/ol><p>Validation:<\/p><ol><li>Identify the SMBus master dnode by running on both dnodes&nbsp;<\/li><\/ol><p>clush -g dnodes 'sudo ipmitool raw 0x3c 0x33 0'<\/p><p>### Not sure what the output of this command is telling us.<\/p><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Validate all Fans are present:&nbsp;<br>From the master dnode run&nbsp;<\/li><\/ul><p>sudo ipmitool sensor | grep Fan | egrep \"Prsnt|_Tach|_Status\" | grep -v SVR<\/p><p>### Fan 6 only has one line in the output.&nbsp; I thought maybe it is an indication of it being broken.&nbsp; But I checked another DNode and it was the same.&nbsp; Only one line for fans 5,6,7,8.<\/p><p><br><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n well?<\/li><li>What didn\u2019t go well?<\/li><li>Things we should have done?<\/li><li>Anything else we should consider?<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-notes\">Notes<\/h2><p>From&nbsp;<a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"jmp579\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~jmp579\" data-linked-resource-id=\"13107625\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">JUSTIN M PETUCCI<\/a>:<\/p><ul><li>Gateway<\/li><li>OOD<\/li><li>Accounts<\/li><li>Licenses<\/li><\/ul><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"relative-table confluenceTable\" style=\"width: 100.0%;\"><colgroup><col style=\"width: 49.4707%;\"><col style=\"width: 22.0029%;\"><col style=\"width: 12.7611%;\"><col style=\"width: 15.7082%;\"><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Do in the future<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Did well<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Did not do well<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Do not do in future<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Outage template (Review lessons learned from previous outages to develop)<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Sized well<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Vendor Coordination<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Do not plan stuff at outage end<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Vendor template with explicit actions that they need to perform<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">List of tasks at Draft Timeline:&nbsp;<a href=\"Planned-Downtime---2019-05-17_18225611.html\">Planned Downtime - 2019-05-17<\/a><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Communication on Monday AM<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">ICS staff member should be with a vendor while on-premises. If possible, ICS staff should be performing all typing.<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Starting the VM storage migration early<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Helpdesk: Unable to reach out to community in timely manner<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Have a Recovery Plan<\/p><p>Should include:<\/p><ul><li>Communication backup if listserv goes down<\/li><\/ul><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Power testing was planned well, ran smoothly<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Helpdesk: Communication of license usage. Users were reporting to i-ASK that licenses were unavailable.<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Return to production checklist (to accommodate list of items provided by Justin)<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Brocade was able to get into the facility ok. Facility access was planned well.<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Automated user list export (to Box or something else)<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Planning meetings<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Action plan (i-ASK and Communications) for how to post an outage notification<\/p><ul><li>\"ICS Status\" account<\/li><\/ul><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-questions\">Questions<\/h2><p>How are PI's and their labs preparing for the outage? Are they scheduling this on their calendar?<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-action-items\">Action items<\/h2>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":864,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:01.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:01.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 42401846
Title is blank after consecutive number removal...Auto-Title applied: Operations Team : GPFS / Lenovo Mini Summitstring(9927) "{"id":2795,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Operations Team : GPFS \/ Lenovo Mini Summit","slug":"operations-team-gpfs-lenovo-mini-summit-13j","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp\">Operations Team : GPFS \/ Lenovo Mini Summit<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Storage---GPFS---Archive---ZFS_18223014.html\">Storage - GPFS - Archive - ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-2\">\n                            Operations Team : GPFS \/ Lenovo Mini Summit\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Feb 04, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-stewartstewart-was-s\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-stewart\">Stewart<\/h3><p>Stewart was set up to host KVM, which hosts XCAT.&nbsp; XCAT was used to provision the DSS servers.&nbsp; Stewart is a GPFS client and acts as a quorum node.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-xcat%2Fconfluent\">xcat\/confluent<\/h3><p>They live on a VM on stewart.&nbsp; Both services are currently stopped.&nbsp; They are repeatedly connecting to the XCC locking the account because confluent is not configured with the correct password.&nbsp; Confluent is currently set to not start on boot. (systemctl disable confluent.service )<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-gpfs\">GPFS<\/h3><p>The Lenovo storage hosts a GPFS file system used by the IBM Mini Summit.&nbsp; There is a RAID card in each server, but the disks are presented to the OS as JBOD.&nbsp;&nbsp;The file system uses IBM GPFS mirroring between stor-dss-001 &amp; 2 to provide protection against media failure.&nbsp; Each server contains NVMe and SSDs that are presented to GPFS.&nbsp; A GPFS policy designates the NVMe as the initial landing place for data.&nbsp; A second policy will demote data from NVMe to SSD using IBMs \"Heat\" metric.&nbsp; When the NVMe reach 80% full the policy will move data until the NVMe are 70% full.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-disks\">Disks<\/h3><p>Each of the two dss servers has 8x 5.8TB NVMe and 6x 7TB SSDs.&nbsp; These are all presented to GPFS.<\/p><p>If you run mmlsnsd, you will see 177TB usable.&nbsp; But because the data is mirrored between the two system the space will be consumed 2x faster than you might think.&nbsp; So we really have 88.5 TB usable.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"400\" src=\"attachments\/42401846\/42401862.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/42401846\/42401862.png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"42401846\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"17\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped                      <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-2\">\n                            Operations Team : GPFS - Restripe LUNs\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Aug 11, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-do-you-need-to-restr\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-do-you-need-to-restr-1\">Do you need to restripe?<\/h3><p>After adding new disks.&nbsp; Yes<\/p><p>After deleting a huge amount of data.&nbsp; Maybe.&nbsp; But probably not.<\/p><p>Take a look at percentages on mmdf.&nbsp; If there is great variance between them, then maybe a restripe will help.<\/p><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-monitor-waiters\">Monitor Waiters<\/h3><p>Establish a baseline before you kick off the restripe.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@stor-nsd-001 ~]# watch -n 2 'clush -g nsd \"mmdiag --waiters | head -3 | tail -1\"'\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/83591296\/83591299.png\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"83591296\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"2\"><\/span><\/p><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-monitor-free-blocks\">Monitor Free Blocks<\/h3><p>Establish a baseline before you kick off restripe.<\/p><p>This will change very slowly.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" MB\/s.&nbsp; (150,000-200,000 on this chart.)<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" 7k Full Stack Update\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Jun 03, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23%23\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>########################################################################<br>h3.&nbsp;### Upgrade Type and Personnel Involved ################################<br>########################################################################<br>Upgrade Type: SFA GS7K Embedded<br>Plan template: GridScaler 4.x to 4.x GS7K Embedded upgrade template version 2 <br>Case: 141161<br>Customer: Pennsylvania State University<br>Location: <br>Customer contact: Penn State Team<br><a href=\"mailto:aci-systems-team@ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">aci-systems-team@ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>(814) 867-5390<br>Upgrade planner: Amir J<br>Upgrade team involved: <br>Date For Upgrade: <br>Upgrade time required: 12.5<br>Support Required: No<\/p><p><br>########################################################################<br>### Assumptions ########################################################<br>########################################################################<br>1. This upgrade plan requires an outage<br>2. System must be completely healthy before upgrade<br>3. During upgrades there is a chance of a drive failure or drives will go missing for a period of time requiring pool rebuilds. <br>4. Pool rebuilds can take up to 24 hours per drive being rebuilt<br>5. It is preferred to rebuild pools in a no redundant state before preceeding with upgrade. <br><span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\"><strong>6. The ICL has been upgraded.<\/strong><\/span><br>7. If changing from connected to datagram mode you can NOT do a rolling upgrade of GridScaler.<br><span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\"><strong>8. SFA public SSH keys will be changed during\/after the upgrade. Please ensure the existing password is known.<\/strong><\/span><br>9. Onsite Personnel will be needed for physically power cycling the systems (controllers, disk enclosures)<\/p><p><br>########################################################################<br>### Open Item\/Action ###################################################<br>########################################################################<\/p><p><strong><span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\">***Check and Verify that the FW\/SW links below are correct and match up with the \"go-to\" versions before using.<\/span><\/strong><\/p><p><strong><span style=\"color: rgb(255,0,0);\">***If upgrading SFA OS from versions lower then 11.5.1 or 3.1.5.0, AND, DDN Insight version less than DDNi 2.1, then please make sure to disable monitoring of SFA\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s within Insight before any upgrades to SFA OS are started.<\/span><\/strong><\/p><p><br>########################################################################<br>### System Details
