---------------------------------------<br>Mellanox NSD Server<br>Driver facing SFA:<br>--------------------- -------------------- ----------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------------------------<br>Mellanox NSD Server<br>Driver facing Client: <br>--------------------- -------------------- ----------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------------------------<br>Fabric Switch Firmware:<br>--------------------- -------------------- ----------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------------------------<\/p><p>Tools for upgrade:<\/p><p>gpfs_repo_builder.sh <a href=\"https:\/\/datadirectnetworks.sharepoint.com\/:u:\/t\/tm-support-all\/ERagUxlPUCJPuHiH1YMzWwMBGHIV8VRXyQBknCRh3U0eTw?e=hFjQkL\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/datadirectnetworks.sharepoint.com\/:u:\/t\/tm-support-all\/ERagUxlPUCJPuHiH1YMzWwMBGHIV8VRXyQBknCRh3U0eTw?e=hFjQkL<\/a><\/p><p>--------------------- -------------------- ----------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------------------------<\/p><p><br>########################################################################<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%23%23%23-summary-of-work-\">### Summary of work \/ Order \/ Timing ###################################<\/h3><p>########################################################################<br>01. [0.5 hour] Prep work (disabled cache, disable bg verify, set sparing to manual, health checks)<br>02. [0.5 hour] GPFS health checks<br>03. [4.0 hour] Upgrade GridScaler<br>04. [1.0 hour] Manual upgrade of GPFS on NSD servers as needed<br>05. [??? hour] Manual upgrade of GPFS on Native Clients as needed<br>06. [0.5 hour] Completing the migration to a new level of GPFS <br>07. [0.5 hour] Datagram check and fix as needed<br>08. [0.5 hour] Embedded Prep Work for SFA upgrades<br>09. [0.5 hour] Perform clean controller\/enclosure power cycle, then health check<br>10. [1.0 hour] Upgrade FPGA\/BMC, health checks<br>11. [1.0 hour] Upgrade controller firmware (one controller at a time), health checks<br>12. [1.5 hour] Upgrade drive firmware ONLINE, health checks<br>13. [0.5 hour] Post work (enable cache, enable bg verify, set sparing back to original setting, health checks).<br>14. [0.5 hour] Embedded Post Work<\/p><p>Total upgrade time 12.5 hours<\/p><p><br>########################################################################<br>### Detailed Process ###################################################<br>########################################################################<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-prep-work-%2B%2B%2B\">+++ Prep Work +++<\/h3><p>1. Halt all host IO \/ un-mount file system(s) [refer to file system user guide(s) as needed]<\/p><p>2. Disable verifies <br>$ set subsystem verify_policy false<\/p><p>3. Disable caching<br>$ set pool * write_back_caching false<\/p><p>4. View existing jobs<br>$ show job (view existing jobs)<br>*** Wait for all remaining jobs to complete before continuing ***<\/p><p>5. Document current \"sparing policy\" and \"disk time-out\" value<br>$ show pool *<\/p><p>6. Set sparing policy to manual for all pools <br>$ set pool * sparing MANUAL<\/p><p>7. Set drive time out to 4 hour<br>$ set pool * disk_timeout 240<\/p><p>8. Capture diags from each controller<br># ssh diag@IP_ADDRESS_OF_CONTROLLER_0 tgz &gt; SR[#####]_[customer-name]_C0_Diag.tgz Password=user<br># ssh diag@IP_ADDRESS_OF_CONTROLLER_1 tgz &gt; SR[#####]_[customer-name]_C1_Diag.tgz Password=user<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2A%2A%2Aensure-sfa-is-100\"><br>***Ensure SFA is 100% Healthy before proceeding<\/h3><p>- check that all Physical Disks are reporting GOOD \/ NORM <br>$ show pd<\/p><p>- check that all Pools are NORMAL \/ OPTIMAL <br>$ show pool<\/p><p>- check that all Virtual Disks are READY<br>$ show vd<\/p><p>- check to ensure there are no Drive Rebuild Jobs in process<br>$ show job<\/p><p>- check to ensure there are no critical faults in Disk Channels<br>$ show channel<\/p><p>- check to ensure all enclosures are reporting their FW version and are Responsive<br>$ show enclosure<\/p><p>- check to ensure all disk slots are Present<br>$ show slot<\/p><p>- check all fans and power supplies for health state<br>$ show fan<br>$ show power_supply<\/p><p>- check all temperature\/voltage sensors to ensure they are present and status is OK<br>$ show temperature<br>$ show voltage<\/p><p>- check to ensure all expanders, UPS(s), and SEP(s) are present and status is OK<br>$ show expander<br>$ show ups<br>$ show sep<\/p><p>- check to ensure all ICL channels are UP (if applicable, some may be down if no external ICL cable)<br>$ show icl_channel<\/p><p>- check for SCSI errors by reviewing Event Log <br>(eg. LOG_AMPD_MPI_SCSI_SENSE_DATA_EXT_EVT)<br>$ show subsystem summary<\/p><p>- check to ensure that none of the enclosures are showing sensor monitoring errors in the event log:<br>LOG_ES_VOLTAGE_SENSOR_ERROR<br>LOG_ES_EXPANDER_ELEMENT_ERROR<br>LOG_ES_TEMPERATURE_SENSOR_ERROR<\/p><p>$ show subsystem summary<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%C2%A0%2B%2B%2B-gpfs-health-che\">&nbsp;+++ GPFS health checks +++<\/h3><p>1. Health checks from NSD server. <br>Log into NSD server being upgraded<br># mmgetstate -N nsdnodes -L &lt;-- all NSD nodes are active<br># mmlsdisk &lt;device&gt; &lt;-- NSDs are up<\/p><p>2. Health checks from the SFA controller<br>Log into SFA controller<br>$ show controller (verify both controllers are displayed and there is no MIR state)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives) <br>$ app show presentation (verify presentations are available)<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-gridscaler-upgra\"><br>+++ GridScaler Upgrade +++<\/h3><p>Note: Perform the upgrade steps 1 to 10 for each NSD server.<br>Note: You can do all NSD servers in parallel IF IO IS STOPPED since this will shutdown GPFS<br>Note: You can do multiple NSD servers in parallel IF YOU MAINTAIN GPFS quorum. <br>Note: Please do the cluster manager NSD server and primary NSD server last <br>1. Copy the installation ISOs and any associated RPMs to all the NSD nodes in your GRIDScaler cluster that will be upgraded (typically to \/tmp\/ on each node).<\/p><p>2. Reboot the NSD servers 1 at a time before mounting the the iso on the NSD nodes<br># reboot<\/p><p>3. Mount the ISOs on each node with option 'loop'. <br>Log into NSD server being upgraded<br># mkdir -p \/mnt\/iso<br># mount -o loop \/tmp\/path-to-iso.iso \/mnt\/iso<\/p><p>4. Start GridScaler upgrade script.<br>Note: If the script fails please contact support<br>Log into NSD server being upgraded<br># \/mnt\/iso\/scripts\/gsinstaller upgrade<\/p><p>NOTE: If GPFS has been updated at any point outside of a Gridscaler Update, --skip-rpms-check will be needed at the end<\/p><p># \/mnt\/iso\/scripts\/gsinstaller upgrade --skip-rpms-check<\/p><p>5. Reboot system<br>Log into NSD server being upgraded <br># reboot<\/p><p>6. Restart GridScaler upgrade script.<br>Note: If the script fails please contact support<br>Log into NSD server being upgraded<br># mount -o loop \/tmp\/path-to-iso.iso \/mnt\/iso<br># \/mnt\/iso\/scripts\/gsinstaller upgrade <br>Upgrade script should complete with \"System upgrade has been completed. Reboot to finish upgrade.\"<\/p><p>7. Reboot system<br>Log into NSD server being upgraded <br># reboot<\/p><p>8. Verify upgrade completed <br># rpm -qa <br># cat \/etc\/GRIDScaler-release <br># cat \/etc\/GRIDScaler-edition<\/p><p>9. Health checks from NSD server. <br># mmgetstate <br># mmlsdisk &lt;device&gt;<\/p><p>10. Repeat for all NSD servers<\/p><p>11. Enable CCR if necessary<br>Note: It is strongly recommended to enable CCR (cluster configuration repository)<br>Log into any NSD server<br>To verify is CCR is enabled<br># mmlscluster | grep \"Repository type\" &lt;-- should say server-based<br>To enable CCR<br>mmchcluster --ccr-enable<br>To verify is CCR is enabled<br># mmlscluster | grep \"Repository type\" &lt;-- should say server-based<\/p><p>12. Health checks from the SFA controller<br>Log into SFA controller<br>$ show controller (verify both controllers are displayed and there is no MIR state)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives) <br>$ app show presentation (verify presentations are available)<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-gpfs%2Fsfa-health-\"><br>+++ GPFS\/SFA health checks +++<\/h3><p>1. Verify SFA is healthy for upgrade from one controller\/CLUI<br>$ show controller (verify dual controller &amp; determine which controller is primary)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives)<\/p><p>2. GPFS cluster health check<br>Log into any NSD server node<br># mmgetstate -N nsdnodes -L &lt;-- all NSD nodes are active<br># mmdf &lt;file system&gt; &lt;-- can see all file systems<br># mmlsdisk &lt;file system&gt; &lt;-- Disks show availability as \u00e2\u20ac\u0153up\u00e2\u20ac\u009d<\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-manual-upgrade-o\">+++ Manual upgrade of GPFS on NSD servers, protocol nodes, and clients as needed +++<\/h3><p>1. Determine the order to upgrade the NSD servers or clients<br>Use the following commands and notes to build a list of NSD servers, protocol nodes, and clients.<br>Note: We want to make sure we maintain quorum<br>Note: upgrade all non-quorum nodes first<br>Note: upgrade current manager nodes last<br>To list all NSD servers and the quorum nodes<br>Log into any NSD Server<br># mmgetstate -N quorumNodes -L<br>To list the filesystem manager nodes<br>Log into any NSD Server<br>Get a list of the file systems<br># mmlsfs all<br># mmlsmgr &lt;file system name&gt;<br>To list the cluster manager node<br>Log into any NSD Server<br># mmlsmgr -c<\/p><p>2. Log into node being upgraded<br>Shutdown GPFS<br># mmshutdown<br>Verify GPFS is unmounted and down<br># mmlsmount &lt;file system&gt; -L<br># mmgetstate<\/p><p>3. Copy GPFS code to NSD server; Self extract files to \/usr\/lpp\/mmfs\/x.x.x-x<br>scp or copy GPFS code to NSD server<br><br># ls -l <br>You should see something similar with permissions like: <br>-rwxr--r-- l root root 110885866 Apr 27 15:52 \/download_dir\/package_name. <br>If it's not executable, you can always make the package executable using the following command: <br># chmod +x \/download_dir\/package_name<br>Execute self-extracting archive file<br># .\/Spectrum_Scale_Standard-x.x.x-x-x86_64-Linux-install --silent<\/p><p>4. Run \"gpfs_repo_builder.sh\" script to create the yum repositories for GPFS. Answer 'y' or 'yes' to run update.<br>NOTE: obtain this script from support. You can execute it from any directory such as \/tmp.<br># .\/gpfs_repo_builder.sh<\/p><p>5. Build Portablity Layer<br>Log into NSD server being upgraded<br>For CentOS, issue this command<br># export LINUX_DISTRIBUTION=REDHAT_AS_LINUX <br>Then<br># \/usr\/lpp\/mmfs\/bin\/mmbuildgpl<\/p><p>6. Reboot NSD server<br>Log into NSD server being upgraded<br># reboot<\/p><p>7. GPFS NSD health check<br># mmgetstate <br># mmlsmount all<\/p><p>8. Repeat steps 2-7 until all nodes are upgraded<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-completing-the-m\">+++ Completing the migration to a new level of GPFS +++<\/h3><p>NOTE: Once you are comfortable with the new level of GPFS, all servers and clients are running this new level, and all servers and clients have up to date licenses,<br>you may take adavantage of new cluster-wide functions by setting the miminmum release level. Once this is done you CANNOT revert back to a previous level. Also,<br>any servers or clients not at this minimum level will no longer join the cluster. <br>NOTE: It is assumed that an appropriate GPFS license has been applied to each node.<br><a href=\"http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/STXKQY_4.2.1\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r21.doc\/bl1ins_mignew.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/STXKQY_4.2.1\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v4r21.doc\/bl1ins_mignew.htm<\/a><br>1. Set Minimum Release Level<br>Log into any NSD server<br># mmchconfig release=LATEST<\/p><p>2. Migrate to latest metadata format<br>NOTE: Nodes in remote clusters that run an older GPFS version will no longer be able to mount the file system.<br>NOTE: The first mount of a file system after you run mmchfs -V might fail with a no-disk-space error. This situation might occur if the file system <br>is relatively low on metadata disk space (10% or less free). If so, enter the command again. Typically the file system is mounted without a problem <br>after the initial failed mount. <br>Log into any NSD server<br># mmchfs &lt;file system&gt; -V full<\/p><p>3. Enable fast extended attributes<br>Log into any NSD server<br># mmmigratefs FileSystem --fastea<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-datagram-check-a\">+++ Datagram check and fix +++<\/h3><p>NOTE: IBM and DDN best practices call for GridScaler 3.x and above be run in \"datagram\" mode<br>NOTE: Perform this section on every NSD server<br>1. Check to see if you are in \"Datagram\" mode. Both these should be the same.<br>log into NSD server<br># mmdsh cat \/sys\/class\/net\/ib1\/mode if it says datagram we are in datagram mode<br>and<br># mmdiag --config |grep verbsRdmaCm if disable then datagram; if enable then connected mode<\/p><p>2. If the above check does not show \"datagram\" do the following steps<br>Modify the file \/etc\/infiniband\/openib.conf and set the configuration parameter SET_IPOIB_CM=no<br>Modify the applicable ifcfg -ib&lt;X&gt; files in \/etc\/sysconfig\/network -scripts, commenting out the line \u00e2\u20ac\u02dcCONNECTED_MODE=\"yes\"\u00e2\u20ac\u2122<br># ifdown ib1 ; echo datagram &gt; \/sys\/class\/net\/ib1\/mode ; ifup ib1<\/p><p>3. Continue to next NSD server<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%C2%A0%2B%2B%2B-embedded-prep-w\"><br>&nbsp;+++ Embedded Prep Work for SFA upgrades +++<\/h3><p>NOTE: Depending on your network set up you may be able to use ssh. If ssh is not availble you must use vnc.<br><br>For ssh access<br>To log into VMs using ssh connect through the following ports<br># ssh -p 5555 &lt;C0_IP&gt; (C0-VM-0) <br># ssh -p 5556 &lt;C0_IP&gt; (C0-VM-1) <br># ssh -p 5557 &lt;C0_IP&gt; (C0-VM-2) <br># ssh -p 5558 &lt;C0_IP&gt; (C0-VM-3) <br># ssh -p 5555 &lt;C1_IP&gt; (C1-VM-32768) <br># ssh -p 5556 &lt;C1_IP&gt; (C1-VM-32769) <br># ssh -p 5557 &lt;C1_IP&gt; (C1-VM-32770) <br># ssh -p 5558 &lt;C1_IP&gt; (C1-VM-32771)<\/p><p>For VNC access <br>Note: You will have to have a vncview installed on your workstation. For example on windows <a href=\"http:\/\/www.tightvnc.com\/download.php\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.tightvnc.com\/download.php<\/a> <br>Note: When using vnc access you will be prompted for a login.<br>NOTE: Prior to exiting the vnc session, you MUST log out.<br>1. Log into SFA<br>2. For each stack enable vnc<br>$ app set stack &lt;stack number&gt; vnc true Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>3. Launch the vncviewer with the following<br>Note: Use the following cross reference to get the correct stack index<br>Controller 0 stack index 0 = global index 0<br>Controller 0 stack index 1 = global index 1<br>Controller 0 stack index 2 = global index 2<br>Controller 0 stack index 3 = global index 3<br>Controller 1 stack index 0 = global index 32768<br>Controller 1 stack index 1 = global index 32769<br>Controller 1 stack index 2 = global index 32770<br>Controller 1 stack index 3 = global index 32771<br>4. vnc into each VM<br># vncviewer &lt;controller IP&gt;:&lt;stack index&gt; <br><br>1. Gracefully bring down the filesystem managed by the stacks (VMs) <br>Log into one of the VMs<br>Shutdown GPFS on all VMs<br># mmshutdown -N nsdnodes <br>Verify GPFS is down on all NSD nodes<br># mmgetstate -L -N nsdnodes<\/p><p>2. Gracefully shutdown all the VMs\/OSes. <br>ssh or vnc to each of the VMs <br># shutdown -h now<\/p><p>3. Shut down the stacks from the controller (to be sure they are really shutdown): <br>Log in to any controller<br>View existing stacks<br>$ app show stack<br>Shut down all stacks<br>$ app shutdown stack &lt;stack number&gt; Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>Verify stack is shutdown<br>$ app show stack &lt;stack number&gt; Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>Repeat for all stacks<\/p><p>4. Disable auto start for the VMs (application stacks) <br>Log in to any controller<br>View existing stacks <br>$ app show stack <br>Disable auto start<br>$ app set stack &lt;stack number&gt; auto_start false Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>Verify it is set to NOT auto start <br>$ app show stack &lt;stack number&gt; all Most likely tack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-power-cycle-cont\">+++ Power cycle controllers and enclosures +++<\/h3><p>1. Shut down the subsystem<br>$ shutdown subsystem<\/p><p>*** Wait for the LEDs and the fan on the back of the controllers to go off ***<br><br>2. Power cycle routine for the enclosures (the controller should be OFF for the entire process)<br>NOTE: Depending on the enclosure type this may vary slightly (LEDs many not exist or be different).<br>a. Shut off all of the disk enclosures using the two power switches on the power supplies<br>*** wait 3 minute after the last enclosure was turned off ***<\/p><p>b. Turn on all of the disk enclosures EXCEPT the base enclosure using the two toggle power switches on the enclosure power supplies with the following caveats.<\/p><p>Note: DO NOT interupt power. Interupting power could result in extended down time! <br>*** Wait 5 minutes after the last enclosure was turned on ***<br>*** Wait for all of the drive LEDs to go solid on *** <br>*** Verify the OK indicator located on the IOMs are \"on\" for all of the enclosures (seen on the back of the enclosure) ***<br>*** For the 14K base enclosure, DO NOT power on the base enclosure with controllers until told to do so.<br>*** If using 8462 enclosures ***<br>*** You should expect to see the fault LED \"on\", this is because the controller are currently down - this is expected ***<br>*** Check that the display is functioning properly on the front of the enclosures (you should see the fw version, wwn, index, etc), if not re-power cycle the enclosure ***<\/p><p>c. Power on the 14k base enclosure to bring up the controllers.<br>*** Wait for controllers to boot plus an additional 3 minutes ***<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-upgrade-sfaos-bm\"><br>+++ Upgrade SFAOS BMC \/ FPGA firmware +++<\/h3><p>NOTE: Update the secondary controller first. Doing this requires primary ownership to toggle once instead of twice, this also minimizes the fail-over time during the upgrade, you go through mastership negotiation process only once instead of twice.<br>1. Download the BMC \/ FPGA Firmware File to a local system then to a controller<br>Download the BMC \/ FPGA firmware to a local system using the link provided<br>SCP the firmware file to one of the controllers<br># scp &lt;BMC-FPGA FILE&gt;.tgz firmware@&lt;CONTROLLER_IP&gt;: (password: Firmware; note you need the \":\" at the end)<\/p><p>2. Verify multipath on hosts connected to the storage (multipath -ll) (if applicable)<br>- All devices should be fully redundant at this point (at least 2 paths per device)<\/p><p>3. Verify SFA is healthy for upgrade from one controller\/CLUI<br>$ show controller (verify dual controller &amp; determine which controller is primary)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives)controller local restart\" to resolve this issue before doing the upgrade)<\/p><p>4. Initiate the upgrade (NOTE: THIS PROCESS WILL TAKE UP TO 30 MINUTES)<br>$ update controller local file=&lt;BMC-FPGA FILE&gt;.tgz<br>Wait for \"The system is going down for system halt NOW!\"<\/p><p>5. Wait for 20-30 minutes for the update to complete and the controller to reboot itself, at this point you should be able to log back into the controller.<\/p><p>6. Log into the controller and verify the firmware has been updated to the new levels.<br>show enclosure * all<\/p><p>7. Verify the SFA is healthy for upgrading the second controller<br>$ show controller (verify both controllers are up and are in a normal state)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership - this make take a few minutes)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives)<br>$ show ups all (check to see that Interface Failed = FALSE)<\/p><p>8. Verify multipath on hosts connected to the storage (multipath -ll) <br>- All devices should be fully redundant at this point (at least 2 paths per device)<\/p><p>*** Repeat steps for other controller ***<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-upgrade-sfaos-co\">+++ Upgrade SFAOS controller firmware +++<\/h3><p>1. SCP the firmware file to each controller<br># scp &lt;FIRMWARE FILE&gt; firmware@&lt;ctrl-0_IP&gt;: (password=Firmware; note you need the \":\" at the end)<br># scp &lt;FIRMWARE FILE&gt; firmware@&lt;ctrl-1_IP&gt;: (password=Firmware; note you need the \":\" at the end)<\/p><p>2. Verify multipath on hosts connected to the storage (multipath -ll)<br>- All devices should be fully redundant at this point (at least 2 paths per device)<\/p><p>3. Verify SFA is healthy for upgrade from one controller\/CLUI<br>$ show controller (verify dual controller &amp; determine which controller is primary)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives)<\/p><p>4. Log into the secondary controller and upgrade it<br>$ update controller local file=&lt;FIRMWARE FILE&gt;<br>NOTE: There may be multiple reboots<br>*** Wait for controller to reboot + a few minutes ***<\/p><p>5. Verify multipath on hosts connected to the storage (multipath -ll)<br>- Half of the paths should be failed at this point.<\/p><p>6. From the non-upgraded controller verify the SFA is healthy for upgrading the second controller<br>$ show controller (Verify other controller is in MIR FIRMWARE MISMATCH STATE)<br>$ show pool (verify pools are in a fault state)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are in write-thru and that this controller owns all of the pools\/VDs)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives)<\/p><p>7. Update the second controller's firmware<br>$ update controller local file=&lt;FIRMWARE FILE&gt;<br>*** Wait for controller to reboot + a few minutes *** <br><br>8. Verify SFA is healthy post upgrade<br>$ show controller (verify dual controller &amp; determine which controller is primary)<br>$ show enclosure all (Check the BMC, BIOS, &amp; New Controller FW are updated) <br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership - this make take a few minutes)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives)<\/p><p>9. Verify multipath on hosts connected to the storage (multipath -ll)<br>- All devices should be fully redundant at this point (at least 2 paths per device)<\/p><p><br>**Additional Power cycle of both controllers may be needed in order for SFAOS \/ Gridscaler to load the new SFA Block Drivers.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-upgrade-online-d\">+++ Upgrade ONLINE Drive Firmware +++<\/h3><p>NOTE: Steps 1 to 7 in this section need to be completed for each drive type being upgraded. <br>1. Identify the primary controller<br># ssh user@&lt;CONTROLLER&gt;<br>RAID-C0$ show controller *<br>OID: 0x38000000 Index: 0000 Name: A LOCAL PRIMARY &lt;&lt;&lt; PRIMARY CONTROLLER &gt;&gt;&gt;<br>OID: 0x38000001 Index: 0001 Name: B REMOTE SECONDARY<\/p><p>3. Copy firmware file to both controllers +++<br># scp &lt;DRIVE FIRMWARE FILE&gt;.DDN firmware@&lt;ip address of primary controller&gt;: (password=Firmware; note you need the \":\" after the ip address)<br># scp &lt;DRIVE FIRMWARE FILE&gt;.DDN firmware@&lt;ip address of secondary controller&gt;: (password=Firmware; note you need the \":\" after the ip address)<\/p><p>4. Log into the Primary controller if it has not already been done.<\/p><p>The procedure to use to this point depends on the RAID level of the pool.<\/p><p>For RAID 6 pools, the drives can be upgraded on-line in one batch.<br>For RAID 1 and RAID 5 pools, each drive must be updated one at a time, and the pool must be back to NORMAL before proceeding to to the next drive.<br>&lt;Fill out one step 5 below, as appropriate to the customer. Delete the unused section&gt;<\/p><p>+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%3Cuse-this-step-for-t\">&lt;use this step for the upgrade of drives in RAID 6 pools&gt;<\/h3><p>5. Update the Drive firmware<br>$ update pd * file=&lt;DRIVE FW FILE&gt; online - (start drive firmware update)<\/p><p>At this point there will be messages similar to this, as each drive is upgraded<br>LOG_ST_POOL_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx CHANGED STATE:DGRADED<br>LOG_ST_MEMBER_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx MEMBER CHANGE ID:0xnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn PHYSICAL DISK PD:0nnnn MEMBER_INDEX:00000 STATE:MISSING<br>LOG_ST_MEMBER_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx MEMBER CHANGE ID:0xnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn PHYSICAL DISK PD:0nnnn MEMBER_INDEX:00000 STATE:REBUILD<br>LOG_ST_MEMBER_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx MEMBER CHANGE ID:0xnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn PHYSICAL DISK PD:0nnnn MEMBER_INDEX:00000 STATE:NORMAL<\/p><p>$ show pd * update_firmware_progress (view update process)<\/p><p>EXAMPLE OF \"Process Completed\"<br>$ \"show pd * update_firmware_progress\"<br>Encl|Slot| Vendor| Product ID |Type|Revision| Serial Number|Pool| Idx| WWN |% Complete| Status |<br>-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br>1 5 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 JFVWMZNC5301 UNAS 271 50014ee2032d2555 Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<br>1 6 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 J4V1YYAA5301 UNAS 272 50014ee2032d196c Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<br>1 17 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 JFVWL5YC5301 UNAS 274 50014ee2032ca9a9 Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<br>1 18 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 JFVSU5PC5301 UNAS 269 50014ee25882b499 Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<\/p><p>Note, there may be other messages resulting from this command which would be expected results:<br>2 2 16 Hitachi HUA721050KLA330 SATA GK6OAB0A GTF402P6GA2BNF 7 127 5000cca214c494a1 Done JS_STATE_PD_DWNL_FAIL_PROD_MISMATCH (Online download not permitted due to vendor\/product mismatch.)<br>If the drive firmware does not match the drive model, it will be rejected<br>2 2 17 HITACHI HUS156060VLS600 SAS A820 J9YWDKHJ 12 1224 5000cca01fdaeec8 Done JS_STATE_PD_DWNL_FAIL_RAID_LEVEL (Online download not permitted on pool type.)<br>If the drive is in a RAID 1 or RAID 5 pool, it will be rejected<\/p><p>+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%3Cuse-this-step-for-t-1\">&lt;use this step for the upgrade of drives in RAID 1 or RAID 5 pools&gt;<\/h3><p>5. Update the Drive firmware<br>&lt;provide a table of the individual drives to be upgraded, spares pool first&gt;<br>&lt;it is recommended to upgrade any spare pool drives first, then one drive of each pool before upgrading the second drive in each pool&gt;<br>$ show vd count rate +2 (let the command run for 10 seconds to confirm that the vd with the drive to be upgraded is running I\/O)<\/p><p>Using the table above, upgrade the firmware for a single drive <br>$ update pd n file=&lt;DRIVE FW FILE&gt; online bypass=POOL - (start drive firmware update - Note, the keyword POOL must be all-caps)<br>Note the resulting console messages during the drive upgrade process:<\/p><p>Allowing pd upgrades on all pool types<br>PHYSICAL DISK n OID=0xnnnnnnnn firmware update started STATUS='An asynchronous command has been started' (0x3000068)<\/p><p>The controller has initiated the download operation which may take up to several minutes. Check the progress and status of the download operation with SHOW PD n UPDATE_FIRMWARE_PROGRESS. Additional information may be found in the event log.<br>&lt;system TOD&gt;<br>RAID[0]$ <br>LOG_ST_POOL_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx CHANGED STATE:NOREDUN<br>LOG_ST_MEMBER_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx MEMBER CHANGE ID:0xnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn PHYSICAL DISK PD:0nnnn MEMBER_INDEX:00000 STATE:MISSING<br>LOG_ST_MEMBER_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx MEMBER CHANGE ID:0xnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn PHYSICAL DISK PD:0nnnn MEMBER_INDEX:00000 STATE:REBUILD<br>LOG_ST_POOL_CHANGE STATE POOL:000xx CHANGED STATE:NORMAL<\/p><p>$ show pd n update_firmware_progress (view update process)<br>Encl|Slot| Vendor| Product ID |Type|Revision| Serial Number|Pool| Idx| WWN |% Complete| Status |<br>-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br>1 5 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 JFVWMZNC5301 UNAS 271 50014ee2032d2555 Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<br>1 6 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 J4V1YYAA5301 UNAS 272 50014ee2032d196c Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<br>1 17 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 JFVWL5YC5301 UNAS 274 50014ee2032ca9a9 Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<br>1 18 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS A410 JFVSU5PC5301 UNAS 269 50014ee25882b499 Done JS_GBL_SUCCESS (Success)<\/p><p>$ show vd count rate +2 (let the command run for 10 seconds to confirm that the vd with the upgraded drive is still running I\/O)<br>+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++<\/p><p><br>6. Verify the health of the system<br>$ show pool (verify pools are healthy)<br>$ show vd (verify virtual disks are healthy and that current ownership matches preferred ownership)<br>$ show pd (verify there are no partial ready drives) <br>$ app show presentation (verify presentations are available)<br>$ show faults (verify there are no other faults)<\/p><p>7. Verify the drive firmware was updated on all disk drives<br>$ show pd * (Verify Revision is at the new \/ correct drive firmware level)<br>Encl|Slot| Vendor | Product ID |Type|Cap GB | RPM|Revision| Serial Number |Pool|State|<br>-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br>1 5 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS 1863 5.4K A420 JFVWMZNC5301 UNAS GOOD<br>1 6 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS 1863 5.4K A420 J4V1YYAA5301 UNAS GOOD<br>1 17 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS 1863 5.4K A420 JFVWL5YC5301 UNAS GOOD<br>1 18 HITACHI HUS153014VLS300 SAS 1863 5.4K A420 JFVSU5PC5301 UNAS GOOD<br>Note: If all drives have not updated, please retry the drive upgrade section again from the Primary controller.<br>If the upgrade still fails, retry the upgrade from the opposite controller.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-post-work%2B%2B%2B\">+++ Post Work+++<\/h3><p>1. Enable caching<br>$ set pool * write_back_caching true<\/p><p>2. Resume any jobs that may have been previously paused<br>$ show job (view existing jobs)<br>$ resume job X (where X is the job id)<\/p><p>3. Enable background verify<br>$ set subsystem verify_policy true<\/p><p>4. For each spare pool, set sparing policy to what it was before the upgrade for all pools<br>$ set pool * sparing &lt;AUTO\/SWAP\/ETC&gt;<\/p><p>5. For each spare pool, set drive time-out to what it was before the upgrade for all pools<br>$ set pool * disk_timeout &lt;PREVIOUS VALUE&gt;<\/p><p>6. Capture diags from each controller<br># ssh diag@IP_ADDRESS_OF_CONTROLLER_0 tgz &gt; SR[#####]_[customer-name]_C0_Diag.tgz Password=user<br># ssh diag@IP_ADDRESS_OF_CONTROLLER_1 tgz &gt; SR[#####]_[customer-name]_C1_Diag.tgz Password=user<\/p><p>7. If required initialize Battery Life Remaining Feature<br>a. Log in to the controller.<br>b. Issue the command: \"show ups * all\"<br>c. If a battery manufacturing date is displayed, do nothing more. However, if the battery manufacturing date and life remaining are not available as shown below, proceed to Step 4. <br>Battery Mfg. Date: NOT AVAILABLE <br>Battery Life Remaining: NOT AVAILABLE<br>d. Issue the command \"SET UPS &lt;encl-idx&gt; &lt;UPS-idx&gt; BATTERY_MANUFACTURE_DATE=&lt;yyyy&gt;:&lt;mm&gt;:&lt;dd&gt;\". <br>- Use a data close to when the system was installed. <br>e. Verify it was set - issue the command \"show ups * all\" and you should see output similar to the following: <br>Battery Mfg. Date: Thu Sep 8 4:10:30 2012 <br>Battery Life Remaining: 730 days<\/p><p>8. If required set Internal Disk Mirror if A or B Drives are NOT MIR State. <br>$ show internal_disk (check MIRROR state for A &amp; B Disks) <br>$ assign INTERNAL_DISK &lt;enclosure-id&gt; &lt;object-id&gt; to_system_disk<\/p><p>9. Please update the case or email the case owner with the answers to the following questions.<br>a. How long did the upgrade take?<br>b. Were there any issues during the upgrade?<br>c. Are there any open action items?<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%2B%2B%2B-embedded-post-wo\">+++ Embedded Post Work +++<\/h3><p>1. Start the stacks from the controller: <br>Log in to any controller <br>View existing stacks <br>$ app show stack<br>Start all stacks <br>$ app start stack X\" &lt;stack number&gt; Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>Verify stack is running <br>$ app show stack &lt;stack number&gt; all Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>Repeat for all stacks<\/p><p>2. Enable auto start for the VMs (application stacks) <br>Log in to any controller<br>View existing stacks <br>$ app show stack<br>Enable auto start on all stacks<br>$ app set stack &lt;stack number&gt; auto_start true Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<br>Verify it is set to auto start <br>$ app show stack &lt;stack number&gt; all Most likely stack numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 32768, 32769, 32770, 32771<\/p><p>3. Verify GPFS health <br>Log into any VM<br># mmgetstate -a<br># mmlsdisk &lt;device&gt; <br>Verify GPFS is running on all NSD serversz (VMs), if not run # mmstartup -N nsdnodes<br># mmgetstate -L -N nsdnodes (verify all are running, if not run \u00e2\u20ac\u0153mmstartup -N nsdnodes\u00e2\u20ac\u009d) <br># mmlsmount all -L -N nsdnodes<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":867,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:01.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:01.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

SFA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*<\/p><p>******************************<\/p><p>For the show sub sum from BOTH controllers...<\/p><p>$ echo 'show subsystem summary' | ssh -T user@(controller 0 IP) &gt; (case #)_(customer name)_C0_sss.log<\/p><p>$ echo 'show subsystem summary' | ssh -T user@(controller 1 IP) &gt; (case #)_(customer name)_C1_sss.log<\/p><p>Attach result to this email and reply.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-ftp-directions\">FTP Directions<\/h3><p>Either upload logs to the ftp server or attach to the case.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To upload all files collected to ftp server:<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; $ ftp&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/ddntsr.com\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ddntsr.com<\/a><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; login: anonymous<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; password: your email address<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; $ cd upload<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; $ bin<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; $ put (case #)_(customer name)_(file from above)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; $ put (case #)_(customer name)_(file from above)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;repeat until all requested files are uploaded<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; $ quit<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-log-output-location\">Log Output Location<\/h3><ul><li>I have been putting the output of the gsctl commands below in \/crash\/tmp or \/tmp.&nbsp; Often \/tmp does not have much space so I use \/crash and mkdir tmp.<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-cnfs\">CNFS<\/h3><p>gsctl showall -s 118104 -N cnfsNodes<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-gridscalar-%28nsds%29\">GridScalar (NSDs)<\/h3><ul><li>This appears to be the current log collector.<\/li><\/ul><p><span>gsctl showall -s 118104 -N nsdnodes&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><ul><li>This appears to be the deprecated log collector.<\/li><\/ul><p>For Title contains numbers at the end: Outage Shutdown Procedure 124518718
string(4727) "{"id":2802,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Outage Shutdown Procedure","slug":"outage-shutdown-procedure-HpV","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ou\">Operations Team : Outage Shutdown Procedure<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ou-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ou-2\">\n                            Operations Team : Outage Shutdown Procedure\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-derick-t-\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span>, last modified on Aug 12, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-list-of-things-i-do-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h5 id=\"bkmrk-list-of-things-i-do--1\"><br>List of things I do at the start of an outage to make sure no users are on\/jobs are running\/ etc.<br><br>Disable HBAC for general user access:<\/h5><ol><li>Disable HBAC for general user access:<ol><li>In IPA, Policy-&gt;Host-Based Access Control\u2192ICS ACI General Compute-&gt;Actions\u2192Disable<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Turn off Nagios (on gbs35-nagios 'sudo systemctl stop nagios')<\/li><li>Start kicking users off public facing systems, generally through reboots while giving users a wall warning<ol><li>Submit nodes -With some kind of cluster tool like pdsh or cssh, run the following as root:<ol><li>&nbsp;wall Attention Roar Users, A scheduled outage is about to begin, please finish up any current work as these nodes will be powering off at 5:15. Any scheduled jobs in queue will begin after the outage.<\/li><li>shutdown -r 17:15 &amp;<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Datamgr Nodes - Same as submit nodes<\/li><li>Protocol Nodes<ol><li><a href=\"18223590.html\">Shutting Down\/Starting Up a Protocol Node<\/a><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>As root on moab01.<a href=\"http:\/\/util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">util.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a> Pause the scheduler, suspend any jobs still running.<ol><li>schedctl -p<\/li><li>&nbsp;Suspend running jobs.<ol><li>showq -r | grep R | awk '{print $1}'&nbsp; - Gets a list of jobs<\/li><li>vim jobs_to_suspend_03042022 - Copy jobs into a file, can probably skip this step I just like to have the job ids for later.<\/li><li>while read i; do mjobctl -s ${i}; done &lt; job_to_suspend_03042022<ol><li>After the outage to resume: while read i; do mjobctl -r ${i}; done &lt; job_to_suspend_03042022<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":872,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:01.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:01.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

             <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ADAM BRENT FOCHT<\/span> on Nov 21, 2016\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-communications-t\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The communications team would like to have access to a set of mailing lists for marketing and announcement emails. &nbsp;The current lists in Sympa are primarily targeted for system outage and service interruption emails and thus have unsubscribe disabled. &nbsp;They would&nbsp;prefer to use MailChimp for more appealing campaigns, but IPA LDAP is on the private network, so automated sync is likely not an option. &nbsp;We will likely want to add a user to a list or list of lists upon account creation and allow the user to maintain their subscriptions from that point. &nbsp;To that end, here are salient links:<\/p><p>API          <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Storage---GPFS---Archive---ZFS_18223014.html\">Storage - GPFS - Archive - ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"ZFS_83591201.html\">ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-zf-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-zf-2\">\n                            Operations Team : ZFS - Update Procedure\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-eric-rich\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/span>, last modified on Jul 27, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-log-on-to-the-zfs-ap\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <ul><li>Log on to the ZFS Appliance using the credentials provided in LastPass<\/li><li>Click Maintenance &gt; System<\/li><li>Click the link \"Check for updates on My Oracle Support\"<\/li><li>If a new version is available, it should be listed at the top of the list<\/li><li>Click it and follow the link to download the latest version (My Oracle Support Login may be required)<\/li><li>Once downloaded extract the .pkg file from the .zip file<\/li><li>Click the '+' next to 'Software Updates'<\/li><li>Click 'Browse' and select the .pkg file and click 'Upload'<\/li><li>Upon successful upload, the new version should show up on the list<\/li><li>Repeat for the other node<\/li><li>Starting with the secondary<\/li><li>When ready to perform the update, click the '\u2192' next to the new firmware<\/li><li>It is recommended that you 'check' the update before applying<\/li><li>Once ready, click 'apply'<\/li><li>The node will process the update and then reboot<\/li><li>Once rebooted and rejoined the cluster, repeat on the primary<\/li><li>After the second node reboots, any drive tray and drive updates will occur<\/li><li>They can be monitored on the 'Maintenance &gt; System' tab (bottom left of screen)<\/li><li>Once they are completed, if there are any deferred updates, apply them now on each node<\/li><li>Once they complete, any SP and Hardware updates might need to happen<\/li><li>Start by rebooting the secondary node by clicking the power button below the 'SUN\/ORACLE' symbol<\/li><li>If there are updates, it should show up as one of the reboot options<\/li><li>This process could take 45-60 minutes, so be patient<\/li><li>Once the node has completed the cycle, proceed to the primary<\/li><li>Again 45-60 minutes<\/li><li>Once completed, the upgrade should be complete<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section Title contains numbers at the end: SSSD performance tuning 18225222
string(5048) "{"id":2807,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"SSSD performance tuning","slug":"sssd-performance-tuning-gbH","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ss\">Operations Team : SSSD performance tuning<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"How-to-articles_2589258.html\">How-to articles<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ss-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ss-2\">\n                            Operations Team : SSSD performance tuning\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-ryan-robb\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> RYAN ROBB<\/span> on Feb 01, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-sssd-performance-tun\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>SSSD performance tuning is required in certain instances where SSSD is looking in large groups (ie, aci_users) and\/or handling lots of login requests. We recently added this tweak to OpenVPN to fix SEGV with sssd\/duo\/ipam.<\/p><p>&nbsp;<\/p><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>Server options<\/p><p>The following options should be added to the \/etc\/sssd\/sssd.conf file on the IdM masters.<\/p><p><strong>ignore_group_members<\/strong><br>Normally the most data-intensive operation is downloading the groups including their members. Usually, we are interested in what groups a user is a member of (id aduser@ad_domain) as the initial step rather than what members do specific groups include (getent group adgroup@ad_domain). Setting the ignore_group_members option to True makes all groups appear as empty, thus downloading only information about the group objects themselves and not their members, providing a significant performance boost. Please note that id aduser@ad_domain would still return all the correct groups!<\/p><p>Minimal version: For users from IdM domain, this option was introduced in sssd-1.10. However, it\u2019s only possible to use it for trusted domain users via the subdomain_inherit option (see below).<br>Recommended value: ignore_group_members=True unless your environment requires the output of getent group to also contain members<br>Pros: getgrnam\/getgrgid calls are significantly faster<br>Cons: getgrnam\/getgrgid calls only return the group information, not the members<\/p><\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-https%3A%2F%2Faccess.redha\"><a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/articles\/2133801\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/articles\/2133801<\/a><\/h2>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":877,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:02.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:02.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

               <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-so-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-so-2\">\n                            Operations Team : SolarWinds - Reports Partially Working\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Oct 25, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-situationafter-a-sig\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-situation\">Situation<\/h3><ul><li>After a significant interruption to service \/ DB access SolarWinds was finally up an running again.&nbsp; This was recovering from the situation described at:&nbsp;<a href=\"SolarWinds---Collector-Service-will-not-start_18224138.html\">SolarWinds - Collector Service will not start<\/a>.<\/li><li>SolarWinds appeared to be collecting all data.&nbsp; Graphs for CPU and memory were working.&nbsp; But, graphs for volumes and interfaces were not.<\/li><li>Graphs for volumes and interfaces magically started working at 2:30 AM.&nbsp; The SolarWinds database maintenance (application level maintenance, not an MS SQL server scheduled job) runs at 2:15 am.&nbsp; Coincidental???, probably not.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-resolution\">Resolution<\/h3><ul><li>Perhaps running database maintenance manually could have fixed this.&nbsp; Here are a couple links discussing running it manually.<ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(68,68,68);\">From the SolarWinds server: Click Start &gt; All Programs &gt; SolarWinds Orion &gt; Advanced Features &gt; Database Maintenance<\/span><\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/support.solarwinds.com\/Success_Center\/Network_Performance_Monitor_(NPM)\/Knowledgebase_Articles\/Run_the_database_maintenance_manually\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.solarwinds.com\/Success_Center\/Network_Performance_Monitor_(NPM)\/Knowledgebase_Articles\/Run_the_database_maintenance_manually<\/a><\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/support.solarwinds.com\/Success_Center\/Network_Performance_Monitor_(NPM)\/Knowledgebase_Articles\/Database_Maintenance_does_not_start_automatically\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.solarwinds.com\/Success_Center\/Network_Performance_Monitor_(NPM)\/Knowledgebase_Articles\/Database_Maintenance_does_not_start_automatically<\/a><br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n Title contains numbers at the end: GPFS   DDN Jeno Visit 29 May 2019 34963575
string(9652) "{"id":2811,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"GPFS   DDN Jeno Visit 29 May 2019","slug":"gpfs-ddn-jeno-visit-29-may-2019-C86","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp\">Operations Team : GPFS - DDN Jeno Visit 29 May 2019<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Storage---GPFS---Archive---ZFS_18223014.html\">Storage - GPFS - Archive - ZFS<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"18225088.html\">GPFS \/ DDN<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-gp-2\">\n                            Operations Team : GPFS - DDN Jeno Visit 29 May 2019\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified on Jul 01, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-confirmed-that-the-7\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><ul><li>Confirmed that the 7K is not busy.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p>Encryption minimum 20% performance degradation<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Chunk size (Volume?) TSM 100 GB???<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-history-from-trouble\">History from Troubleshooting Sessions<\/h3><h1 id=\"bkmrk-tsm\"><u>TSM<\/u><\/h1><p><u>These settings are specific to a single client large sequential workload.&nbsp;<\/u> May or may not help our mixed workload DDN hardware.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-gpfs-tuning\">GPFS Tuning<\/h3><ul><li>Much bigger block size might help&nbsp; From 1 MB to 4 MB<ul><li>requires rebuild of filesystem<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>SFA pool chunk size would need to change 128 KB to 256 KB<\/li><li>GPFS page pool 4 GB to 16 GB<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-nsd-tuning\">NSD Tuning<\/h3><ul><li>NSD threads per disk from default 3 to16<\/li><li>NSD thread per queue 3 to 16<\/li><li>NSD small thread ratio to 1<\/li><li>NSDMin\/Max worker thread from 16\/512 to 1024<\/li><li>NSD Buff Space to 70%, how much GPFS page pool space can it use for<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-client-tuning\">Client Tuning<\/h3><ul><li>Client (TSM) worker thread 48 1MB threads&nbsp; bump to 1024 (only one client to worry about)<\/li><li>Scatter buffer size from 32 to 256k - chunks of page pool and how the are divided in memory<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-network-tuning\">Network Tuning<\/h3><ul><li>TCP Rmem and Wmem to higher values that match 40 Gb networking.&nbsp; Currently set for 10 Mb<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-nsds-and-client\"><u>NSDs and Client<\/u><\/h1><h3 id=\"bkmrk-fix-network-first%3A\">Fix network first:<\/h3><ul><li>stor-gpfs-cc-002 has correct settings<\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(36,39,41);\">net.core.somaxconn<\/span>&nbsp;should be 4096 not 128<ul><li>[mdg104@stor-gpfs-cc-002 ~]$ sysctl -a | grep -i somax<br>net.core.somaxconn = 4096<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>[mdg104@stor-gpfs-cc-002 ~]$ sysctl -a | grep -i thresh<ul><li>Correct Settings&nbsp;<\/li><li>net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh1 = 2048<br>net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh2 = 8192<br>net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh3 = 163840<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>recommended gc_stale_time set from 60 to 3600<ul><li>there is a default and one for each interface<\/li><li>use caution on protocol \/ ces \/ cnfs nodes which have random clients<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-ib-stabilization\">IB Stabilization<\/h3><ul><li>Throttle RDMA threads<ul><li>verbsRdbmasperconnection set to 48<\/li><li>verbsRdmaPerNode set to 192<\/li><li>verbsRdmasPerNodeOpimize = no<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-then-open-nsds\">Then open NSDs<\/h3><ul><li>Highest priority NSD buff space from 30 to 70%<\/li><li>GPFS page pool changed from 8 to 16 GB<\/li><li>NSD match worker settings (similar to TSM)<\/li><\/ul><pre><br><\/pre>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                                            <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-attachments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Attachments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <div class=\"greybox\" align=\"left\">\n (text\/plain)\n                                <br>\n                                                            <img src=\"images\/icons\/bullet_blue.gif\" height=\"8\" width=\"8\" alt=\"\">\n gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># openssl genrsa -out `hostname`.`date +\"%Y%m%d\"`.key 2048\n# openssl req  -out $(hostname).$(date +\"%Y%m%d\").csr -new -key \/etc\/pki\/\/tls\/private\/iask_aci_ics_psu_edu.key -config \/etc\/pki\/tls\/openssl.cnf<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-installation\">Installation<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-software-collections\">Software Collections Apache 24 (httpd24)<\/h3><p>Update ssl config in \/opt\/rh\/httpd24\/root\/etc\/httpd\/conf.d\/ssl.conf to reflect the new\/updated key and certificate files.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-standard-system-apac\">Standard System Apache<\/h3><p>Update ssl config in \/etc\/httpd\/conf.d\/ssl.conf to reflect the new\/updated key and certificate files.&nbsp; Make sure to edit the SSLCertificate info and also the CosignCrypto info if that's in the ssl.conf file.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-sources\">Sources<\/h2><p>Comodo documentation: <a href=\"https:\/\/support.comodo.com\/index.php?\/Knowledgebase\/Article\/View\/1\/0\/csr-generation-using-openssl-apache-wmod_ssl-nginx-os-x\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.comodo.com\/index.php?\/Knowledgebase\/Article\/View\/1\/0\/csr-generation-using-openssl-apache-wmod_ssl-nginx-os-x<\/a><\/p><p>ICS documentation: <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/SEC\/Certificates\">Certificates<\/a><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":883,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:03.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:03.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                           <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"IPA_18221119.html\">IPA<\/a><\/span>\n                               <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ip-2\">\n                            Operations Team : IPA Automount Change to NFS V3\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Jan 27, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-as-of-jan-27%2C-2021-t\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>As of Jan 27, 2021 the automount settings for the default automount in IPA look like:<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>\/acisysutils -soft,intr,noatime,rsize=32768,wsize=32768,tcp,nosuid fs01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:\/aciteam\/acisysutils<br>\/storage\/home -hard,intr,noatime,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,tcp,nosuid stor-cnfs-home.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:\/home<br>\/storage\/work -hard,intr,noatime,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,tcp,nosuid stor-cnfs-work.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:\/work<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>We want to change them to force the mount to NFS version 3 to see if that'll clear up some of the issues we've been seeing on the home and work fileservers.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>\/acisysutils -soft,intr,noatime,rsize=32768,wsize=32768,tcp,nosuid fs01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:\/aciteam\/acisysutils<br>\/storage\/home -hard,intr,noatime,vers=3,local_lock=all,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,tcp,nosuid stor-cnfs-home.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:\/home<br>\/storage\/work -hard,intr,noatime,vers=3,local_lock=all,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,tcp,nosuid stor-cnfs-work.stor.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu:\/work<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n Title is blank after consecutive number removal...Auto-Title applied: Operations Team : [DRAFT] Thoughts about using EIT OC to help with off hours monitoringstring(8090) "{"id":2815,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Operations Team : [DRAFT] Thoughts about using EIT OC to help with off hours monitoring","slug":"operations-team-draft-thoughts-about-using-eit-oc-to-help-with-off-hours-monitoring-anz","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-%5Bd\">Operations Team : [DRAFT] Thoughts about using EIT OC to help with off hours monitoring<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-%5Bd-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-%5Bd-2\">\n                            Operations Team : [DRAFT] Thoughts about using EIT OC to help with off hours monitoring\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> DERICK T HAIGH<\/span> on Jul 26, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-wayne-asked-that-i-t\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Wayne asked that I talk to the operations center about options for having them help with after-hours monitoring.&nbsp; I sat down with Pablo Garaitonandia and went through a \"checklist\" to evaluate how that might work.<\/p><p>After speaking with Pablo, a few things have come to mind.<\/p><ul><li>The EOC isn't used to \"monitoring\" HPC services<ul><li>They need specific instructions if they're going to watch anything.<\/li><li>Load average, memory use, CPU load, and network bandwidth aren't all that useful in determining brokenness\"<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>We can't have EOC look at something we aren't already watching.<ul><li>Initially, I\u2019d start small with very high level things to have someone look at. Maybe the following:<ul><li>Does ssh respond on login\/interactive nodes?<\/li><li>Can you list jobs in the queue, including HPRC? (showq\/qstat)<\/li><li>Are too many compute nodes down\/offline? (what\u2019s a good measure for a threshold?)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Once we have to respond to something, we'll start to identify underlying issues that we may want to watch too.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>We need well defined actions to take when one of the events happen<\/li><ul><li>EOC staff can\u2019t login to our systems. I\u2019m not sure I\u2019d trust them to \u201cfix\u201d things if they could.<\/li><li>About the only thing they can do is to call someone.<\/li><li><strong>If they\u2019re just going to notify us, why wouldn\u2019t we just program the notification and not have them in the middle?<\/strong><\/li><\/ul><li>How should \u201con-call\u201d work?<ul><li>It won\u2019t make much sense to watch something 24x7 unless there\u2019s someone available to be \u201con-call\u201d when there\u2019s a problem.<\/li><li>Who should participate in an \"on-call\" rotation?<\/li><li>How often to change who is \u201con-call\u201d? (Daily, weekly, monthly)<ul><li>Daily seems like too many chances to forget it's your day and maybe be under-prepared, monthly seems unlikely you won't be out at least one day. I think weekly would work best.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Are there compensations that could be offered for the additional inconvenience of on-call duties?<ul><li>Comp time for \u201con-call\u201d<\/li><li>Comp time for time spent responding to something?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What are the expectations for someone \u201con-call\u201d?<ul><li>How long do they have to respond to an alert?<ul><li>Do we expect them to pull over and respond immediately if they\u2019re driving?<\/li><li>Do they need to keep a laptop with them at all times?<\/li><li>Can they turn off their phone to go to a movie in the evening?<\/li><li>Does ICS provide a phone\/laptop for \"on-call\"?&nbsp; &nbsp; Do people need to have something that works for them?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How do we maintain lists of who knows how to fix different things?<ul><li>How much time do we expect the \u201con-call\u201d person to dig before calling someone else?<\/li><li>Frequently, the \u201con-call\u201d person isn\u2019t going to be able to fix what\u2019s wrong, who do they call?<ul><li>How do we maintain a list of who\u2019s here that knows how to fix what\u2019s broken?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Do we deny people vacation requests based on coverage for ability to resolve possible problems?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Dependencies:<ul><li>How do we handle outages of things we don't control?<ul><li>Power<\/li><li>Cooling<\/li><li>Networks<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>How do we coordinate with others that depend on us and people that we depend on so we get alerted of issues that may impact our ability to deliver on our SLAs?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Responding to \u201calerts\u201d<ul><li>Requires good documentation and training\/mentoring.<\/li><ul><li>If we don\u2019t have good documentation, the \u201con-call\u201d person is just going to call whoever knows more.<\/li><li>After waking up at 2am documentation needs to be fairly specific or we may cause more problems.<\/li><\/ul><li>How to maintain a concise list of things to try for the possible alerts that may come.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>What's the proper checklist for an item we want to watch 24x7?<ul><li>Is it important enough to wake someone up?<\/li><li>Is there another level of something we should monitor that would let us know before things are broken?<\/li><li>How do we decide when something has reached the stage where we want to wake someone up to respond to it?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Are there other things we should watch that we may only want to respond to during business hours?<\/li><li>How do we contact people?<ul><li>Email isn\u2019t going to wake us up, but could prompt the EOC staff to wake up the on-call person.<\/li><li>What about text messages?<\/li><li>Slack?<\/li><li>Can we automate a phone call?<\/li><li>Other options for alerting someone at night?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":885,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:03.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:03.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(5222) "{"id":2816,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"ACI compute node rebuild","slug":"aci-compute-node-rebuild-Tpq","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ac\">Operations Team : ACI compute node rebuild<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ac-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-ac-2\">\n                            Operations Team : ACI compute node rebuild\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> JACK STEVEN GUNDRUM<\/span> on Aug 16, 2018\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-first-log-into-the-r\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>First log into the RedHat Satelite server:<a href=\"https:\/\/titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/hosts\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"> https:\/\/titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/hosts\/<\/a><\/p><p>You can log into the page for the specific system you're trying to rebuild like:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/hosts\/comp-bc-0001.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/titan.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/hosts\/comp-bc-0001.acib.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/p><p>Once there, you can click the \"build\" button to configure the system to rebuild when it next boots either from the reboot command or a power cycle.<\/p><p>To boot the node, you can use ipmi or the iDRAC to reboot or reboot from node as root.&nbsp; From somewhere with access to the ipmi network you can run:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">ipmitool -I lanplus -E -H comp-bc-0001.mgt.acib.production.ics.psu.edu -U root power boot<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>It'll prompt you for the iDRAC password (management password).<\/p><p>Or you can use a web browser to browse to the management port (type something like: comp-bc-0001.mgt.acib.production.ics.psu.edu in your browser) and the iDRAC will let you login and you can power the system from there.<\/p><p>The node will do a PXE boot and will kickstart and reboot.&nbsp; Once the node reboots, it'll start puppet, which will install bunches of other RPMs.&nbsp; It seems to take about 4 hours to complete the install.<\/p><p>Once all the packages have been installed, you'll still need to manually configure GPFS on the node.&nbsp; See:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Add+Node+to+GPFS+Client+Cluster\">Add Node to GPFS Client Cluster<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:00<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n
