Title contains numbers at the end: VMware   Template   Windows   Clone 75727272
string(17369) "{"id":2818,"book_id":107,"chapter_id":0,"name":"VMware   Template   Windows   Clone","slug":"vmware-template-windows-clone-VmI","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm\">Operations Team : VMware - Template - Windows - Clone<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-oper-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Team_1638637.html\">Operations Team<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operations-Manual_18221242.html\">Operations Manual<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"VMware_18222976.html\">VMware<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-operations-team-%3A-vm-2\">\n                            Operations Team : VMware - Template - Windows - Clone\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-michael-d\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> Kevin Tate<\/span> on Aug 19, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-network-prep---reser\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-network-prep---reser-1\">Network Prep - Reserving IP Address<\/h3><ol><li>Determine the desired VLAN (VLAN list available here: <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=1638410\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=1638410<\/a>)<\/li><li>Login to IPA: <a href=\"https:\/\/ipa01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/ipa\/ui\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/ipa01.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/ipa\/ui\/<\/a><ol><li>Select \"Network Services\" from the menu bar<\/li><li>Select the \"DNS\" dropdown and then select \"DNS Zones\"<\/li><li>Select the forward DNS zone that the host will be part of (e.g. mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu.)<\/li><li>Determine the unassigned IP address you want to use (verify it's unused with nslookup\/ping)<\/li><li>Click \"+ Add\"<ol><li>Record name: All lowercase name of the host (e.g. i6-ead-mgt)<\/li><li>Record Type: A<\/li><li>IP Address: Unassigned IP address selected in the previous step<\/li><li>Create reverse: Checked<\/li><li>Click \"Add\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Verify forward and reverse entries were created correctly with nslookup (e.g. {nslookup i6-ead-mgt.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu} and {nslookup 10.113.102.1})<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><h3 id=\"bkmrk-ead-domain-prep---cr\">EAD Domain Prep - Creating EAD Computer Object<\/h3><ol><li>Follow this section only if the machine is going to be joined to the EAD domain.<\/li><li>Login to EAD management host with sadmin credentials: i6-ead-mgt.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/li><li>In Server Manager, select \"Tools\" -&gt; \"Active Directory Users and Computers\"<\/li><li>Navigate to the OU where the computer object will be located: AD.PSU.EDU\\PSU-IT-Units\\Institute-for-Cyberscience\\Servers\\Test-Servers<\/li><li>Right click and select \"New\" -&gt; \"Computer\"<ol><li>Computer Name: All uppercase name of the host (e.g. I6-EAD-MGT)<\/li><li>User or group: Select \"Change...\", type \"I6-Server-Admins\" in the \"Enter the object name...\" field and select \"Check Names\".<\/li><li>Click \"OK\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Click \"OK\"<\/li><li>Double click on the newly created computer object and enter a description (e.g. \"EAD Management\/Jump Server\")<\/li><li>Click \"OK\"<\/li><li>Sign out<\/li><\/ol><h3 id=\"bkmrk-vmware-template-prep\">VMware Template Prep - Updating the Template VM<\/h3><ol><li>Login to the win-2019-dc-template.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu VM with the credentials from the \"Win-2012R2-Data Win-2019-DC-Template\" LastPass entry.<ol><li>Option 1: RDP to the host with the local administrator profile.<\/li><li>Option 2: Login to vCenter (<a href=\"http:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>) and access it through the web console.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Open the start menu, search for \"Updates\", and select the \"Check for updates\" System Settings option.<\/li><li>If needed, select the \"Check for updates\" button to begin checking Microsoft for updates.<\/li><li>Once the machine is up to date, open the start menu, select the power symbol, and select \"Shut down\". When prompted to select a reason, leave the default \"Other (Unplanned)\" and select \"Continue\".<\/li><li>The template VM is now ready for cloning.<\/li><\/ol><h3 id=\"bkmrk-windows-vm---cloning\">Windows VM - Cloning Template<\/h3><ol><li>Login to vCenter (<a href=\"http:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>)<\/li><li>Search for the \"Win-2019-DC-Template\" VM and select it.<\/li><li>Select the \"Actions\" dropdown next to the name and select \"Clone\" -&gt; \"Clone to virtual machine...\"<ol><li>Select a name and folder<ol><li>Virtual machine name: Enter the FQDN of the host in all (e.g. i6-ead-mgt.mgt.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu)<\/li><li>Select a location for the virtual machine: Select the location most appropriate for the VM you are creating.<\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Select a compute resource<ol><li>Select \"ICS-ACI\" -&gt; \"ACI-PROD\"<\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Select storage<ol><li>Select \"stor-zfs-001\"<\/li><li>Ensure \"Select virtual disk format\" is set to \"Thin Provision\"<\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Select clone options<ol><li>Customize the operating system: Checked<\/li><li>Customize this virtual machine's hardware: Checked<\/li><li>Power on virtual machine after creation: Checked<\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Customize guest OS<ol><li>Select \"Win 2019 non-domain\"<\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>User Settings<ol><li>Network Adapter Settings<ol><li>IPv4 address: IP address that was assigned in the \"Network Prep - Reserving IP Address\" section above.<\/li><li>IPv4 subnet mask: Subnet mask for the VLAN the IP address belongs to (Most likely 255.255.0.0).<\/li><li>IPv4 default gateway: Default gateway for the VLAN the IP address belongs to.<\/li><li>IPv4 alternate gateway: Alternate gateway for the VLAN the IP address belongs to (Most likely left blank).<\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Customize hardware<ol><li>Leave default selections for CPU\/Memory\/Hard Disk unless modifications are needed.<\/li><li>Network adapter 1<ol><li>Select the drop down next to \"Network adapter 1\" that reads \"VLAN312-ACI-Production-VM\" and click \"Browse...\".<\/li><li>Search for the VLAN this VM is going to be part of, select it, and click \"OK\".<\/li><li>Click \"OK\"<\/li><li>Select the checkbox next to \"Connect At Power On\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Click \"NEXT\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Ready to complete<ol><li>Review the options that are configured to ensure they are correct.<\/li><li>Click \"Finish\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p>The new VM should now be up and running.<\/p><p><em><strong>*NOTE*<\/strong><\/em> The VM will reboot automatically a few times after it has finished cloning while it goes through the configuration process. Give the VM ~5-10 minutes before attempting to login.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-windows-vm---joining\">Windows VM - Joining Domain<\/h3><p>Follow this section only if the machine is going to be joined to the EAD domain.<\/p><ol><li>Login to the newly created VM with the credentials from the \"Win-2012R2-Data Win-2019-DC-Template\" LastPass entry.<ol><li>Option 1: RDP to the host with the local administrator profile.<\/li><li>Option 2: Login to vCenter (<a href=\"http:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>) and access it through the web console.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>In Server Manager, select \"Local Server\" on the left hand side and then select \"WORKGROUP\" underneath of the \"Computer name\"<\/li><li>In the window that appears, select the \"Change...\" button.<\/li><li>\"Computer Name\/Domain Changes\" window<ol><li>Ensure the \"Computer name\" is set to the hostname of the machine, written in uppercase (e.g. I<span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">6-EAD-MGT<\/span>).<\/li><li>Member of: Select the Domain\" radio button and then enter \"ad.psu.edu\" in the domain field.<\/li><li>Click \"OK\"<\/li><li>Enter sadmin credentials when prompted.<\/li><li>Click \"OK\" in the domain welcome window.<\/li><li>Click \"OK\" in the restart prompt window.<\/li><li>Click \"Close\" in the System Properties window.<\/li><li>Click \"Restart Now\" when prompted.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Once the machine restarts, login with sadmin credentials to verify it joined the domain properly.<\/li><\/ol><h3 id=\"bkmrk-windows-vm---configu\">Windows VM - Configuring Backup<\/h3><ol><li>Login to the i6-veeam-0003.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu VM.<ol><li>Option 1: RDP to the host with the local administrator profile.<\/li><li>Option 2: Login to vCenter (<a href=\"http:\/\/vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">vcenter-0001.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>) and access it through the web console.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Launch the \"Veeam Backup &amp; Replication Console\" application either through the start menu or from the desktop.<\/li><li>Select \"Yes\" to allow the application to make changes when prompted.<\/li><li>Veeam Login Window<ol><li>Server: localhost<\/li><li>Port: 9392<\/li><li>Username: Autofilled<\/li><li>Password: Autofilled<\/li><li>Use Windows session authentication: Checked<\/li><li>Click \"Connect\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Select \"Home\" from the menu on the bottom left and then select \"Jobs\" on the left hand side.<\/li><li>Right click on \"1j - WIN administrative\" and select \"Edit...\"<\/li><li>Select \"Virtual Machines\" from the left hand menu and then click \"Add...\"<\/li><li>Select the VM you'd like to be added to the backup and then click \"Add\"<\/li><li>Click \"Finish\"<\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D\">==============<\/h3><h3 id=\"bkmrk-old-instructions\">Old Instructions<\/h3><h3 id=\"bkmrk-%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D%3D-1\">==============<\/h3><h3 id=\"bkmrk-vlan%2C-ip%2C-name%2C-dns\">VLAN, IP, Name, DNS<\/h3><ul><li>VLAN<ul><li>Select appropriate <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=1638410\">VLAN<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>IP<ul><li>Select appropriate IP from IPA<ul><li>Network Services \/ DNS \/ DNS Zones \/ Search for chosen <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=1638410\" rel=\"nofollow\">VLAN<\/a> by name (vm.prod, qa, etc.)<\/li><li>Identify an unused IP,<ul><li>If you know you want to be in the 200. range, search for 200. and check what numbers are available.&nbsp;<\/li><li>As an example in this case 10.112.200.3<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Name \/ DNS<ul><li>Create Host in IPA<ul><li>Windows hosts joining EAD names must begin with I6- (eye six dash). ALL CAPS is preferred,&nbsp;and be 15 character or less.<\/li><li>Creating the host should also create a forward and reverse DNS records.&nbsp;&nbsp;<ul><li>You can verify as follows<ul><li>Network Services \/ DNS \/ DNS Zones \/ Search for reverse of first two octets.&nbsp; Following the example above 112.10<\/li><li>Click the zone<\/li><li>Search for the reverse of the last two octets 3.200 in this example.<\/li><li>Or it may be easier to search for the name of the server.<\/li><li>Ping the hostname<\/li><li>nslookup on the IP address<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-create-computer-obje\">Create Computer Object in EAD<\/h3><ul><li>Connect to EAD<ul><li>Open RemoteApp (need to be on PSU network to do this.&nbsp; While WFH have been using <a href=\"http:\/\/i6-veeam-one.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">i6-veeam-one.vm.production.int.aci.ics.psu.edu<\/a>&nbsp;as a jump server.)<\/li><li>Login with WebAccess Account<\/li><li>Click OK to get Duo Prompt<\/li><li>Login with psu\\mdg104_sadmin<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Create New Computer Object<ul><li>Tools \/ Active Directory Users and Computers<\/li><li>AD.PSU.EDU \/ PSU IT Units \/ Institute-for-CyberScience \/ Servers<\/li><li>In the appropriate OU, Right Click and create new computer.&nbsp;<ul><li>NAME ALL CAPITALS. I6-SERVER-NAME<\/li><li>Change Default User\/Group to I6-Server-Admins<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Modify AD Groups<ul><li>For test servers Add Group I6-TestWinServer<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Add a description on Properties \/ General<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-clone-template\"><span>Clone Template<\/span><\/h3><ul><li>Login to Template (Win-2019-DC-Template) and check\/run MS Updates<\/li><li>Update VMware tools - Actions \/ Guest OS \/ Upgrade VMware Tools<\/li><li>Power off Template VM<\/li><li>Actions \/ Clone<\/li><li>Use same name as hostname in IPA&nbsp;<\/li><li>Select a folder<\/li><li>Select a Cluster, usually ACI-Prod<\/li><li>Select storage, usually stor-zfs-001<\/li><li>Select all 3 customization options<\/li><li>Select a Customization, usually Join EAD<\/li><li>Enter IP info from IPA<\/li><li>Power on VM<\/li><li>Watch wait patiently<\/li><li>Let it reboot a couple times.<\/li><li>If joining EAD, verify it joined<\/li><li>Power on template.&nbsp; (So it gets updates.)<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-verify-adding-to-ead\">Verify Adding to EAD Worked<\/h3><ul><li>Connect to EAD ADUC \/ Navigate to the Computer<\/li><li>Right click \/ properties \/ Attribute Editor \/ Find \"lastLogon TimeStamp\" (click L)<\/li><li>Verify timestamp<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-verify-sid-%28need-to-\">Verify SID (need to validate this is the correct identifier)<\/h3><blockquote><p>&nbsp;Get-WmiObject -class SoftwareLicensingService | Select-object ClientMachineID<\/p><\/blockquote><h3 id=\"bkmrk-connect-to-ead-off-c\">Connect to EAD Off Campus<\/h3><ul><li>First install the EAD RADC<ul><li><a href=\"https:\/\/pennstate.service-now.com\/sp?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0011829&amp;sys_kb_id=3577fdd01b51b3c840a242a2cd4bcb74#PC\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/pennstate.service-now.com\/sp?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0011829&amp;sys_kb_id=3577fdd01b51b3c840a242a2cd4bcb74#PC<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Two options for connecting to EAD<ul><li>From&nbsp;OneForestAdmin01 on ACI VMware \/&nbsp;<span style=\"color: rgb(86,86,86);\">10.197.10.4<\/span><\/li><li>PSU VPN on Cisco AnyConnect at&nbsp;<span style=\"color: rgb(46,46,46);letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><a href=\"http:\/\/vpn.ais.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">vpn.ais.psu.edu<\/a><\/span><ul><li>But I have not figured out how to be on ACI and AIS VPNs yet.&nbsp; Bouncing back and forth sucks.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 14:01<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":888,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:03.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:21:03.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 06 29 Tower Road power supply event 115507420
string(22356) "{"id":2819,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 06 29 Tower Road power supply event","slug":"2021-06-29-tower-road-power-supply-event","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-29-to\">Ligo : 2021-06-29 Tower Road power supply event<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-29-to-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-29-to-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-06-29 Tower Road power supply event\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Aug 17, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-there-was-an-unknown\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>There was an unknown power supply issue at the data center affecting LIGO servers in racks AW30-AW33 on June 29, 2021. This caused 35 servers to power off until rebooted in-person on July 1; one of these servers failed to power on and had to have the motherboard replaced later (see <span class=\"aui-message aui-message-warning jim-error-message jim-error-message-single\">\n        <span class=\"icon-in-pdf\"><\/span>\n     <a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/browse\/SUPPORT-2406?src=confmacro\">SUPPORT-2406<\/a> - Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.\n    <\/span>\n). The server and blade enclosure logging had limited information, and the data center staff couldn't determine the root cause of the failure with their power supply logs.<\/p><p>Details:<\/p><p><br><\/p><ul><li><span>AW30: five of six failed (#1-5); no servers powered off but some dropped pings<br><\/span><\/li><li><span>AW31<\/span>: five of six failed <span>(#1-5)<\/span>; all 16 servers powered off<\/li><li><span>AW32:<\/span> five of six failed <span>(#1-5)<\/span>; all 16 servers powered off. One server failed to power on afterwards.<\/li><li><span>AW33: four of six failed (#1,4,5,6); three servers powered off<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p>Note that the PSU issues for these enclosures began at ~21:40 on Tuesday, but the internal time for the enclosures are off by either 3 hours or 27 hours (verified when I checked the date\/time settings for the chassis), so the log timestamps aren't true:<\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">AW30<\/th><th removed.<\/p><p># reseating servers<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:32 The power supplies are not redundant.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:32 The input power for power supply 5 has been restored.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:31 Power supply 5 is operating normally.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:27 The input power for power supply 6 has been restored.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:27 Power supply 6 is operating normally.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:23 The input power for power supply 1 has been restored.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:22 Power supply 1 is operating normally.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:18 The input power for power supply 4 has been restored.<\/p><p>OK Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:17 Power supply 4 is operating normally.<\/p><p>Critical Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:11 The power input for power supply 1 is lost.<\/p><p>Critical Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:10 The power input for power supply 4 is lost.<\/p><p>Critical Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:09 The power input for power supply 5 is lost.<\/p><p>Critical Wed Jun 30 2021 00:48:08 The power input for power supply 6 is lost.<\/p><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p>The PSU issues seem to have affected only the bottom enclosures, though some of the upper enclosures had a network link interruption at&nbsp;~10:40 Wednesday morning.<\/p><p>We also noticed that half of the row (AW30-36) had thermal warnings for the right-side PDU only in each rack (on the right side when looking from the back); none of the other racks in the row had that problem, and none of the left-side PDUs had a warning.<\/p><p>Other concurrent events:<\/p><ul><li>data center staff noted a small power surge on Tuesday evening (June 29)<\/li><li>data center staff were doing a short maintenance on unrelated hardware that evening<\/li><li>there were severe thunderstorms in the evening<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n \n","priority":2,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 06 Resolving Foreman DHCP issues 100532322
string(21274) "{"id":2820,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 06 Resolving Foreman DHCP issues","slug":"2021-06-resolving-foreman-dhcp-issues","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-resol\">Ligo : 2021-06 Resolving Foreman DHCP issues<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-resol-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-resol-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-06 Resolving Foreman DHCP issues\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jun 22, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-backgroundupon-re-su\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-background\">Background<\/h2><p>Upon re-subscribing a server with a Foreman activation key (to, e.g., change that server's lifecycle environments), the previous Host for that server would disappear from the Foreman GUI but be visible via Foreman hammer-cli. The server's Content Host would be unaffected, but it would point to the deleted and now non-existent Host, not the one visible with hammer-cli.<\/p><p>Normally this would be resolved by creating a new Host in Foreman for that server (using the same hostname, network interfaces, mac address, OS, etc.). But, when attempting to submit the Host, Foreman says that the MAC address \/ DHCP entry already exists and asks if you want to overwrite it. Upon submitting the request to \"Overwrite\", this gives an error:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><br><strong>Unable to save <\/strong>DHCP conflicts removal for <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a> task failed with the following error: ERF12-0635 [ProxyAPI::ProxyException]: Unable to delete DHCP entry for a8:99:69:8c:be:81 ([RestClient::BadRequest]: 400 Bad Request) for proxy <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:9090\/dhcp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:9090\/dhcp<\/a><\/p><p>This is apparently a known (and later patched) bug in Foreman v1.15 and v1.16: <a href=\"https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19634\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19634<\/a>.<\/p><p>This bug occurred for both comp-ex-0186 (See <a href=\"2021-06-Adding-comp-ex-0186-back-to-Foreman_99385729.html\">2021-06 Adding comp-ex-0186 back to Foreman)<\/a> and then comp-ex-0049 below. The RTDB server is in a similar situation: it needs to have its Foreman Host recreated since it was re-subscribed to a Foreman AK, but this will result in the same bug that is afflicting 0186 and 0049.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>comp-ex-0049 interfaces:<\/p><p>[root@comp-ex-0049 bfc5288]# ip addr show<\/p><p>1: lo: &lt;LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP&gt; mtu 65536 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN group default qlen 1000<\/p><p>link\/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00<\/p><p>inet 127.0.0.1\/8 scope host lo<\/p><p>valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever<\/p><p>inet6 ::1\/128 scope host<\/p><p>valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever<\/p><p>2: em1: &lt;BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP&gt; mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP group default qlen 1000<\/p><p>link\/ether a8:99:69:8c:be:81 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff<\/p><p>inet 10.136.28.6\/23 brd 10.136.29.255 scope global noprefixroute dynamic em1<\/p><p>valid_lft 629892sec preferred_lft 629892sec<\/p><p>inet6 fe80::aa99:69ff:fe8c:be81\/64 scope link noprefixroute<\/p><p>valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever<\/p><p>3: em2: &lt;NO-CARRIER,BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP&gt; mtu 1500 qdisc mq state DOWN group default qlen 1000<\/p><p>link\/ether a8:99:69:8c:be:83 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-reproducing-the-bug\">Reproducing the bug<\/h2><p>The same error occurred after I re-registered comp-ex-0049 (note that its Content Host IP later became 10.136.28.6 somehow), removed the empty Host via Foreman hammer-cli, and attempted to create a new comp-ex-0049 Host in Foreman GUI:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">$ tail -f \/var\/log\/foreman-proxy\/proxy.log&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # then, submit the \"Overwrite\" request in the Foreman GUI<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">I, [2021-06-11T18:09:36.745980 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [11\/Jun\/2021:18:09:36 -0400] \"GET \/tftp\/serverName HTTP\/1.1\" 200 17 0.0004<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">I, [2021-06-11T18:09:36.803934 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [11\/Jun\/2021:18:09:36 -0400] \"GET \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/mac\/a8:99:69:8c:be:81 HTTP\/1.1\" 200 231 0.0005<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">E, [2021-06-11T18:09:36.848324 ] ERROR -- : No DHCP records for IP 10.136.28.0\/10.136.29.49 found<br>I, [2021-06-11T18:09:36.848508 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [11\/Jun\/2021:18:09:36 -0400] \"GET \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/ip\/10.136.29.49 HTTP\/1.1\" 404 53 0.0005<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">I, [2021-06-11T18:09:36.965720 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [11\/Jun\/2021:18:09:36 -0400] \"GET \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/mac\/a8:99:69:8c:be:81 HTTP\/1.1\" 200 231 0.0005<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">E, [2021-06-11T18:09:37.010321 ] ERROR -- : No DHCP records for IP 10.136.28.0\/10.136.29.49 found<br>I, [2021-06-11T18:09:37.010496 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [11\/Jun\/2021:18:09:37 -0400] \"GET \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/ip\/10.136.29.49 HTTP\/1.1\" 404 53 0.0004<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">W, [2021-06-11T18:09:37.055162 ] WARN -- : DELETE dhcp\/:network\/:record endpoint has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Please use DELETE dhcp\/:network\/mac\/:mac_address or DELETE dhcp\/:network\/ip\/:ip_address instead.<br>E, [2021-06-11T18:09:37.055331 ] ERROR -- : 10.136.28.6 \/ a8:99:69:8c:be:81 is static - unable to delete<br>I, [2021-06-11T18:09:37.055534 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [11\/Jun\/2021:18:09:37 -0400] \"DELETE \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/a8:99:69:8c:be:81 HTTP\/1.1\" 400 60 0.0005<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>This reproduces <a href=\"https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19634#note-26\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">this user's error<\/a> in this <a href=\"https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19634\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Foreman issue<\/a>. Note that this still created a host entry visible via hammer-cli (`hammer host info --name <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>`), so this needed to be removed prior to resubmiting the \"Overwrite\" request (`hammer host delete --name <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>`).<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-debugging\">Debugging<\/h2><p>I downloaded the <a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/theforeman\/foreman\/pull\/4555\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">pull request referenced in the Foreman issue<\/a> as a patch and applied it:<\/p><p>[root@foreman01 foreman]# cd \/usr\/share\/foreman<br>[root@foreman01 foreman]# wget <a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/theforeman\/foreman\/pull\/4555.patch\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/github.com\/theforeman\/foreman\/pull\/4555.patch<\/a><br>[root@foreman01 foreman]# patch -p1 4555.patch<\/p><p>This didn't apply the patch, since the PR included changes to unit test files (which are only in the Github repo, not in the Foreman install so the patch couldn't find those files locally):<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">[root@foreman01 foreman]# patch -p1 &lt; 4555.patch<br>can't find file to patch at input line 15<br>Perhaps you used the wrong -p or --strip option?<br>The text leading up to this was:<br>--------------------------<br>|From 8ca5d8ac52b72b6142ea08b5bf5ad24f626f9686 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001<br>|From: Lukas Zapletal &lt;lzap+git@<a href=\"http:\/\/redhat.com\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">redhat.com<\/a>&gt;<br>|Date: Thu, 25 May 2017 13:38:23 +0200<br>|Subject: [PATCH] Fixes #19706 - don't treat DHCP leases as conflicts<br>|<br>|---<br>| lib\/net\/dhcp\/record.rb | 36 ++++++++++++---<br>| test\/unit\/net\/dhcp_test.rb | 94 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++------------<br>| 2 files changed, 94 insertions(+), 36 deletions(-)<br>|<br>|diff --git a\/lib\/net\/dhcp\/record.rb b\/lib\/net\/dhcp\/record.rb<br>|index 42652573d35..dd5d54b80a0 100644<br>|--- a\/lib\/net\/dhcp\/record.rb<br>|+++ b\/lib\/net\/dhcp\/record.rb<br>--------------------------<br>File to patch: ^C<\/p><p>So, I trimmed out the bottom part of the file that modified the Github tests and applied the patch:<\/p><p>[root@foreman01 foreman]# head -n 84 4555.patch &gt; 4555-trim.patch<br>[root@foreman01 foreman]# patch -p1 &lt; 4555-trim.patch<br>patching file lib\/net\/dhcp\/record.rb<\/p><p>The error still occurred, so I figured I needed to restart a service. I disabled the \"<span>Delete Host upon unregister<\/span>\" option. But, after waiting, adding the Hosts worked (see below).<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-comp-ex-0049\">comp-ex-0049<\/h3><p>After the weekend, adding the 0049 Host worked:<\/p><p>bfc5288@alcor:~$ ssh 10.136.28.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # note the different IP, found from Foreman Content Hosts<\/p><p>[root@foreman01 bfc5288]# hammer host delete --name <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>Host deleted<br>[root@foreman01 bfc5288]# hammer host info --name <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>Error: host not found<br>[root@foreman01 bfc5288]# tail -f \/var\/log\/foreman-proxy\/proxy.logI, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.405675 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"GET \/tftp\/serverName HTTP\/1.1\" 200 17 0.0004<\/p><p>I, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.465357 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"GET \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/mac\/a8:99:69:8c:be:81 HTTP\/1.1\" 200 231 0.0004<\/p><p>E, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.511189 ] ERROR -- : No DHCP records for IP 10.136.28.0\/10.136.29.49 found<br>I, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.511363 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"GET \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0\/ip\/10.136.29.49 HTTP\/1.1\" 404 53 0.0004<\/p><p>I, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.711406 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"POST \/dhcp\/10.136.28.0 HTTP\/1.1\" 200 - 0.0594<\/p><p>I, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.794046 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"POST \/tftp\/PXELinux\/a8:99:69:8c:be:81 HTTP\/1.1\" 200 - 0.0012<\/p><p>I, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.821773 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"POST \/tftp\/fetch_boot_file HTTP\/1.1\" 200 - 0.0094<\/p><p>I, [2021-06-14T09:40:02.847863 ] INFO -- : 10.136.28.207 - - [14\/Jun\/2021:09:40:02 -0400] \"POST \/tftp\/fetch_boot_file HTTP\/1.1\" 200 - 0.0009<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Next steps:<\/p><ul><li>Host created successfully (see tail logs above)<\/li><li>Condor drain and soft reset<\/li><li>Puppet run succeeded<\/li><li>Content Host didn't exist and the server was not subscribed to Foreman, so I re-subscribed it:<\/li><\/ul><p>[root@comp-ex-0049 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\"<br>This system is already registered. Use --force to override<br>[root@comp-ex-0049 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\" --force<br>Unregistering from: <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>:443\/rhsm<br>The system with UUID 0d069d97-e0a3-41d4-aa16-3e9ad797131b has been unregistered<br>All local data removed<br>HTTP error (422 - Unknown): Validation failed: Medium SL7.6 does not belong to Scientific 7.9 operating system<\/p><p># I changed the Host's OS to 7.8 as per <a href=\"Provisioning-LIGO-servers_63111169.html\">Provisioning LIGO servers<\/a>, then:<\/p><p>[root@comp-ex-0049 bfc5288]# subscription-manager identity<br>This system is not yet registered. Try 'subscription-manager register --help' for more information.<br>[root@comp-ex-0049 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\" <br>The system has been registered with ID: 294c6a01-5382-4061-bde9-27d840d35888<br>The registered system name is: <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0049.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>No products installed.<\/p><p>This resulted in the Content Host associated with the newly-created Host.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-comp-ex-0186\">comp-ex-0186<\/h3><p>Like 0049, this server had a different IP and did not have an entry in Foreman Content Hosts, so I had to find the IP from an iDRAC console:<\/p><p>[root@comp-ex-0186 bfc5288]# hostname -i&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # gives the incorrect IP:<\/p><p>10.136.29.186<\/p><p>[root@comp-ex-0186 bfc5288]# ip addr show | grep 10.136.<\/p><p>inet 10.136.28.5\/23 brd 10.136.29.255 scope global noprefixroute dynamic em1<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Steps<\/p><ul><li>soft reset<\/li><li>IP address became 10.136.29.195 (incorrect)<ul><li>I changed this in the Host to 10.136.29.186, which gave the same DHCP entry overwrite option as before<\/li><li>I deleted the host and recreated it. Subscribing failed due to `HTTP error (400 - Bad Request): Organization LIGO does not exist.`<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>soft reset<\/li><li>IP became 10.136.31.186 (correct)<\/li><li>subscribing still failed due to `HTTP error (400 - Bad Request): Organization LIGO does not exist.`<\/li><li>I realized the server didn't have the Foreman katello rpm installed, so I installed it, changed the OS as per <a href=\"Provisioning-LIGO-servers_63111169.html\">Provisioning LIGO servers<\/a>, and then could successfully subscribe the server:<br>[root@comp-ex-0186 bfc5288]# rpm -Uvh <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm<\/a><br>Retrieving <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm<\/a><br>Preparing... ################################# [100%]<br>Updating \/ installing...<br>1:katello-ca-consumer-foreman01.gwa################################# [100%]<br>[root@comp-ex-0186 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_qa_all\" --force<br>HTTP error (422 - Unknown): Validation failed: Medium SL7.6 does not belong to Scientific 7.9 operating system<br>[root@comp-ex-0186 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_qa_all\" <br>The system has been registered with ID: 6ffdba1d-169e-48d4-811b-a1eaa4b17321<br>The registered system name is: <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>No products installed.<\/li><li>soft reset<\/li><li>successful puppet run<\/li><\/ul><p>This resulted in the Content Host associated with the newly-created Host.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-rtdb\">RTDB<\/h3><p>Interfaces<\/p><ul><li>MAC address e4:43:4b:52:b1:50<\/li><li>identifier bond0<\/li><li>DNS name rtdb-01<\/li><li>IPv4 address 10.136.28.240<\/li><li>IPv6 address fe80::e643:4bff:fe52:b150<\/li><li>Mode 802.3ad<\/li><li>Attached devices em1,em2<\/li><li>Bond options: miimon=100 mode=4<\/li><\/ul><p>Steps<\/p><ul><li>Re-created Host in Foreman<ul><li>I needed to specify a root password (I think I did not make a default root pw for the Database Host Group)<\/li><li>This submitted successfully, without the DHCP, other 400 errors, or the need to Overwrite<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Deleted the host via Foreman hammer-cli<\/li><\/ul><p>[root@foreman01 bfc5288]# hammer host delete --name <a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>Host deleted<br>[root@foreman01 bfc5288]# hammer host info --name <a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>Error: host not found<\/p><ul><li>Unsubscribed and re-subscribed the server:<\/li><\/ul><p>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# subscription-manager identity<br>Unit 91fbd957-5e03-48d0-bcde-7a0a5a937a53 has been deleted<br>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\" <br>This system is already registered. Use --force to override<br>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\" --force<br>Unregistering from: <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>:443\/rhsm<br>The system with UUID 91fbd957-5e03-48d0-bcde-7a0a5a937a53 has been unregistered<br>All local data removed<br>The system has been registered with ID: eaafb2db-082f-484a-84c6-6eb97223d1f1<br>The registered system name is: <a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>No products installed.<\/p><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Successful puppet run<\/li><li>But, server could not be rebuilt from Foreman due to unrelated PXE boot problems. See <a href=\"102826012.html\">RTDB build\/boot debugging<\/a><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-other-resources\">Other resources<\/h3><ul><li>similar but different issue (causing DHCP error 409) <a href=\"https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/21120\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/21120<\/a><ul><li>also <a href=\"https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19649\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19649<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>other users with same problem on mailing list <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman-users.narkive.com\/blmJR79j\/foreman-1-15-isc-dhcp-issues-duplicate-addresses-and-overwrites\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman-users.narkive.com\/blmJR79j\/foreman-1-15-isc-dhcp-issues-duplicate-addresses-and-overwrites<\/a><\/li><li>The original bug may not have happened when re-subscribing nodes in the past, since I hadn't enabled `Delete Host upon unregister` in Foreman GUI - Administer - Settings - Content. Enabling this (as I had during system maintenance) would cause the server's Host to be deleted from Foreman GUI when the server is re-subscribed, which&nbsp;<em>might<\/em> be contributing to the issue and discrepancy of Host between Foreman GUI and Foreman hammer-cli.<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":3,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(9962) "{"id":2821,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"OSG Stashcache","slug":"osg-stashcache","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-osg-stashcach\">Ligo : OSG Stashcache<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"106627090.html\">LIGO R&amp;D Projects<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Open-Science-Grid_125699037.html\">Open Science Grid<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-osg-stashcach-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-osg-stashcach-2\">\n                            Ligo : OSG Stashcache\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jun 02, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-backgroundintended-p\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-background\">Background<\/h2><p>Intended purpose: intermediate cache for LIGO data storage. Data is write once read many; the only writes are from OSG services, not users, that fetch LIGO analysis job data from source servers. Thus, the data non-critical and can be re-cached by the OSG services.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-hardware-and-install\">Hardware and Installation<\/h2><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><a class=\"confluence-embedded-file\" href=\"\/download\/attachments\/125699041\/US_QUOTE_3000093731041.2_stashcache-final.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1651073053021&amp;api=v2\" data-nice-type=\"PDF Document\" data-file-src=\"\/download\/attachments\/125699041\/US_QUOTE_3000093731041.2_stashcache-final.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1651073053021&amp;api=v2\" data-linked-resource-id=\"125699042\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"125699041\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"US_QUOTE_3000093731041.2_stashcache-final.pdf\" data-mime-type=\"application\/pdf\" data-has-thumbnail=\"true\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-can-edit=\"true\" aria-label=\"US_QUOTE_3000093731041.2_stashcache-final.pdf\" draggable=\"false\"><img src=\"rest\/documentConversion\/latest\/conversion\/thumbnail\/125699042\/1\" height=\"250\" alt=\"\" draggable=\"false\"><\/a><span class=\"companion-edit-button-placeholder edit-button-overlay\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"125699041\" data-linked-resource-id=\"125699042\" data-template-name=\"companionEditIcon\" data-source-location=\"embedded-attachment\"><\/span><\/span><\/p><ul><li>R640 and MD1400 drive enclosure<\/li><li>&nbsp;Specs<ul><li>1 TB RAM<\/li><li>30TB NVMe<\/li><li>216TB HDD<\/li><li>Two 40G ports<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Installation details<ul><li>AW35, racked as of 2022-02-04<\/li><li>One port cabled internally, one port cabled externally. Complete as of 2022-02-21<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Management<ul><li>iDRAC: 10.136.30.245<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Bootable MAC address is b8:ce:f6:fa:32:8a<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-configuration-planni\">Configuration Planning<\/h2><ul><li>Foreman provisioning: <a href=\"Provisioning-LIGO-servers_63111169.html\">Provisioning LIGO servers<\/a><\/li><li>OSG Stashcache (Open Science Data Federation) overview <a href=\"https:\/\/opensciencegrid.org\/docs\/data\/stashcache\/overview\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/opensciencegrid.org\/docs\/data\/stashcache\/overview\/<\/a><\/li><li>OSG-hosted stashcache as part of the Nautilus supercluster<ul><li>would allow for centralized management, monitoring, and reduced ICDS effort, but would require an MoU with OSG admins in order for them to administer the server while adhering to PSU\/ICDS policy. An MoU was explored but was not completed<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Containerized stashcache:<ul><li>would require the server to already be provisioned and have docker installed<\/li><li>multiple host partitions mounted to the container <a href=\"https:\/\/opensciencegrid.org\/docs\/data\/stashcache\/run-stashcache-container\/#multiple-host-partitions-recommended\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/opensciencegrid.org\/docs\/data\/stashcache\/run-stashcache-container\/#multiple-host-partitions-recommended<\/a><\/li><li>will need to ensure the container has access to most of the system memory<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>required repositories:<ul><li>OSG<\/li><li>openZFS<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>profiles<ul><li>OSG<\/li><li>fail2ban?<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>storage: ZFS<ul><li>NVMe: L2arc<\/li><li>HDD: colder storage. Will be two raidz pools each with a hot spare, so 8 of the 12 disks will be used for storage (~128 TB)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-provisioning-and-con\">Provisioning and Configuration<\/h2><ul><li>firmware<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125699041\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"11\">BIOS<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"12\">iDRAC<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"13\">raid card H330<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"14\">raid card H840<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"15\">NVMe drives<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"16\">SSDs<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>SSD RAID for OS<br><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125699041\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"17\">iDRAC gui \u2192 Storage \u2192 Controllers \u2192 PERC H330 Mini (Embedded) \u2192 Actions \u2192 Create Virtual Disk \u2192 (select the two SSDs)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>HDD RAID 0 to prepare for ZFS<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125699041\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"22\">DRAC gui \u2192 Storage \u2192 Controllers \u2192 PERC H330 Mini (Embedded) \u2192 Actions \u2192 Create Virtual Disk \u2192 (name the vdev stashrust0X for the Xth HDD). Repeat x12<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>foreman config<br><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125699041\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"18\">new host group<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"19\">partition table math:<br><ul><li>total space is 446.63 GB<\/li><li>allocate slightly less than the total space since that's what's worked for provsioning other servers (RTDB): 440.320GB<\/li><li>swap should be 16GB; Var 32GB; boot 2GB; root should be the rest (391.168 GB)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"20\">host networking<br><ul><li>interfaces:<ul><li>em1: b8:ce:f6:fa:32:8a<\/li><li>em2: b8:ce:f6:fa:32:8b<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>need to have private\/public VLANs, like with login nodes<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-post-configuration\">Post-Configuration<\/h2><ul><li>need to specify the new IP in the squid proxy on docker host<\/li><li>check the CVMFS config to disable aliencache<\/li><li>disable services in puppet&nbsp;that are unneeded by stashcache (e.g. autofs, creation of \/ligo)<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n Title contains numbers at the end: Accounting and Access 15271687
string(9381) "{"id":2822,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Accounting and Access","slug":"accounting-and-access","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-accounting-an\">Ligo : Accounting and Access<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Administrative-Information_15271685.html\">Administrative Information<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-accounting-an-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-accounting-an-2\">\n                            Ligo : Accounting and Access\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-jason-a-s\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> JASON A STAPH<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Oct 05, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-user-accessible-serv\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-user-accessible-serv-1\">User-Accessible Servers<\/h1><p>Login nodes: <code>ligo0{1,2}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/code><\/p><p>Compute nodes: <code>comp-ex-0{001-184}.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/code><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-accessing-ligo-from-\">Accessing LIGO from PSU<\/h1><p>The LIGO cluster's login nodes are available through the round-robin DNS entry&nbsp;<span><span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\"><a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" rel=\"nofollow\" class=\"external-link\">ligo.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>. After your account is set up, you can SSH to the login nodes via<br><\/span><\/span><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p><code class=\"java plain\">ssh &lt;<a href=\"http:\/\/user.name\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">user.name<\/a>&gt;<\/code><code class=\"java color1\">@ligo<\/code><code class=\"java plain\">.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/code><\/p><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><span><span class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\">Note that you will need to either be on the internal LIGO VPN (using PSU credentials) or have a LIGO account. The VPN grants access to all servers for administration; LIGO access is restricted to public SSH to the login nodes, from which the compute nodes can be accessed via SSH<\/span><\/span><span><span class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\">.<\/span><\/span><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-user-managed-groups\">User Managed Groups<\/h3><p>The LIGO cluster uses user managed groups (or UMGs) to control access and administration of the cluster and the LIGO VPN. Note that these groups do not apply to LIGO-authenticated access, which is managed through LIGO's LDAP\/shibboleth system.<\/p><ol><li>umg\/up.ics.ligoroot -&nbsp;this group is the ICS management group, and contains users with unrestricted admin<\/li><li>umg\/up.ics.ligoadmin - this group is for users with limited sudo capabilities related to workflows on the ligo system (altering permissions for groups, perhaps service management).<\/li><li>umg\/up.ics.ligo - this group contains normal PSU-LIGO users.<\/li><\/ol><p>To learn more about UMGs, please see&nbsp;<a href=\"http:\/\/kb.its.psu.edu\/article\/1010\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">PSU's Knowledge Base Article<\/a>, or to manage UMGs you have access to, use <a href=\"https:\/\/accounts.psu.edu\/manage\/umg\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/accounts.psu.edu\/manage\/umg<\/a><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-vpn\">VPN<\/h3><p>The LIGO VPN grants access to all nodes (login, execute, administration, storage) on the LIGO cluster, through SSH or iDRAC. This is available only to users in the Root or Admin <a href=\"https:\/\/accounts.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">user groups<\/a>.<\/p><p><strong>Setup<\/strong><\/p><p>To set up the VPN profile, log in to LastPass and go to the LIGO VPN config file entry in Shared-LIGO. Copy and paste the text in the config text a new .ovpn file, and launch the VPN (for first-time VPN setup, you may want to use e.g. <a href=\"https:\/\/openvpn.net\/download-open-vpn\/\" rel=\"nofollow\" class=\"external-link\">OpenVPN<\/a>). Log in with your PSU credentials (you do not need to use 2FA).<\/p><ul><li>example command for OpenVPN CLI:<br>sudo openvpn --script-security 2 --config ~\/<a class=\"external-link\" href=\"http:\/\/ligo.ics.psu.edu\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.ics.psu.edu<\/a>.ovpn --auth-user-pass \/opt\/.vpn_user<\/li><\/ul><p><strong>Troubleshooting<\/strong><\/p><p>If you get this error:<\/p><p><code>Options error: In LIGO-VPN.ovpn:8: Maximum option line length (256) exceeded, line starts with resolv-retry infinite <\/code><br><code>Use --help for more information.<\/code><\/p><p>...make sure that the .ovpn does not have any trailing spaces from the copy\/paste from LastPass<\/p><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-accessing-as-a-ligo-\">Accessing as a LIGO User<\/h1><p>Non-PSU LIGO-authenticated users can be granted access to the cluster by adding them to the LDAP filter on the login and execute nodes. See a <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/commit\/21097741c715614b9bb49389c5c3c6e016fc7993\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">sample commit<\/a> for an example. An addition must then be deployed to the cluster using the deploy-production playbook.<\/p><p>The user's home directory is created dynamically via oddjobd-mkhomedir. The user's software directory must be created manually (see <a href=\"LIGO-Storage_69795842.html\">LIGO Storage<\/a>).<\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-shared-accounts\">Shared Accounts<\/h1><p>Users typically run production workflows from the shared account `gstlalcbc`, which mirrors the job submission standards for other LIGO clusters.<\/p><p>To add a user to the PSU gstlalcbc group, run the appropriate <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/add_user_shared.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">LIGO Ansible playbook<\/a>.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-adding-other-user-ac\">Adding other user accounts<\/h1><p>To add user accounts, a Puppet profile must be created. This profile must then be declared in the Puppet roles of the servers that will have the account.<\/p><p>An example is given for the osg07 user, which required a custom home directory and SSH key:<\/p><ul><li>Puppet profile <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/profile\/osg_users.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/profile\/osg_users.pp<\/a><\/li><li>Declared in the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/role\/login.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">login<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/role\/execute.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">execute<\/a> Puppet roles<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":5,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 01 17 NFS Failure 71729203

The system was pingable.<\/p><p><strong>Cause<\/strong><\/p><p>The group reported that a DAG job may have requested more memory than reasonable. Averaged memory usage was ~160GB, with ~6GB free.<\/p><p><strong>Resolution<\/strong><\/p><p>I connected to the active NAS server (10.136.28.101) and restarted the system, which resolved the problem. However, failover from stor-nas-001a over to stor-nas001b did <strong>not<\/strong> occur, so there was an file system outage for 15-20 minutes.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Related: <a href=\"2019-11-05-NFS-failure_66977826.html\">2019-11-05 NFS failure<\/a><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":6,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                                            <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-certificates--2\">\n                            Ligo : Certificates for ligo-rt VMs\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jul 16, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-derek-morr-notified-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Derek Morr notified me that the certificates for the LIGO low-latency (real-time) VMs were expiring (for the ligo-rt-kafka{1-4}.vmhost.psu.edu VMs). I looked into it but could not find the previous certificates. Derek then said that the certs may have never been used and so they could be skipped.<\/p><p>But, the mirrormaker servers had expired certificates that Patrick Brockill (LIGO) had renewed and sent. So, I attempted to install these.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-mirrormaker1%3A\">Mirrormaker1:<\/h4><p>The server was unresponsive to SSH. The VMhosting console showed \"failed at step exec spawning mirrormaker.service: input\/output error\". I restarted the VM, and it came up properly. But, mirrormaker.service and network.service were marked as failed.<\/p><p>I installed the certs:<\/p><ul><li>SCP to the box (scp from the box didn't work):<br>scp -r -P 1855 \/ligo\/home\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/certs\/ligo-rt-mirrormaker\/psu-until-dec2021\/ bfc5288@ligo-rt-mirrormaker1.vmhost.psu.edu:\/home\/bfc5288<\/li><li>Move old certs:<br>mv \/opt\/kafka\/config\/psu.keystore.jks{,.old}<br>mv \/opt\/kafka\/config\/psu.truststore.jks{,.old}<\/li><li>Copy new certs:<br>cp -t \/opt\/kafka\/config\/ \/home\/bfc5288\/psu-until-dec2021\/*<\/li><li>Restart mirrormaker.service:<br>systemctl status mirrormaker<\/li><\/ul><p>The service was still marked as failed, due to: <br>Jun 24 17:06:47 ligo-rt-mirrormaker2 mirrormaker-java.sh: [2021-06-24 17:06:47,949] ERROR [Consumer clientId=uwm-to-psu-mirrormaker1-1, groupId=uwm-to-psu-mirrormaker1] Connection to node -2 (<a href=\"http:\/\/lowlatency1.cgca.uwm.edu\/129.89.61.83:9093\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">lowlatency1.cgca.uwm.edu\/129.89.61.83:9093<\/a>) failed authentication due to: SSL handshake failed (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient)<br><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-mirrormaker2%3A\">Mirrormaker2:<\/h4><p>The kafka service had failed, and would restart into an error, e.g.:<br>Jun 24 13:45:13 ligo-rt-mirrormaker2 kafka-server-start.sh: [2021-06-24 13:45:13,563] INFO Opening socket connection to server ligo-rt-zk3.vmhost.psu.edu\/172.28.246.94:2181. Will not attempt to authenticate using SASL (unknown error) (org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn)<\/p><p><br><\/p><ul><li>Copy the certs:<br>scp -P 1855 \/ligo\/home\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/certs\/ligo-rt-mirrormaker\/psu-until-dec2021\/psu2.truststore.jks bfc5288@ligo-rt-mirrormaker2.vmhost.psu.edu:\/home\/bfc5288<\/li><li>Installed the certs as with mirrormaker1, and received the same error when restarting mirrormaker.service<\/li><\/ul><h4 id=\"bkmrk-zookeepers\">Zookeepers<\/h4><p>Zookeeper3 was inaccessible entirely. VMhosting console showed:<\/p><p>systemd[]: Failed at step EXEC spawning \/usr\/sbin\/nslcd: Input\/output error (similar to the error on mirrormaker1)<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>The zookeeper1 and 2 servers had failed network.service:<\/p><p>[root@ligo-rt-zk1 bfc5288]# systemctl restart network -l <br>Job for network.service failed because the control process exited with error code. See \"systemctl status network.service\" and \"journalctl -xe\" for details.<\/p><p>In \/var\/log\/messages:<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: Bringing up loopback interface: &nbsp;[ &nbsp;OK &nbsp;]<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: Bringing up interface eno16780032: &nbsp;ERROR &nbsp; &nbsp; : [\/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts\/ifup-eth] Device eno16780032 does not seem to be present, delaying initialization.<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 \/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts\/ifup-eth: Device eno16780032 does not seem to be present, delaying initialization.<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: [FAILED]<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: Bringing up interface ens192: &nbsp;RTNETLINK answers: File exists<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: [ &nbsp;OK &nbsp;]<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: RTNETLINK answers: File exists<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: RTNETLINK answers: File exists<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: RTNETLINK answers: File exists<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: RTNETLINK answers: File exists<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1 network: RTNETLINK answers: File exists<br>Jun 24 16:45:17 ligo-rt-zk1
