string(7098) "{"id":2826,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"System Updates","slug":"system-updates","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-system-update\">Ligo : System Updates<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operational-Guides_15271632.html\">Operational Guides<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-system-update-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-system-update-2\">\n                            Ligo : System Updates\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified by <span class=\"editor\"> MYLES R GOODWIN<\/span> on Mar 10, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-software-updatescrea\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h3 id=\"bkmrk-software-updates\">Software updates<\/h3><p>Create a new page via the <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/templates2\/viewpagetemplate.action?entityId=116883457&amp;key=LIGO\" rel=\"nofollow\"> LIGO Update Template <\/a><strong>(go to the <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/LIGO\/Event+Log\" rel=\"nofollow\"> Event Log<\/a>, create a new page from the template via 'Create ...' \u2192 select 'LIGO cluster update template')<\/strong>. It is recommended that you start this process days\/weeks before the update to allow adequate testing on a QA node, depending on the complexity of the update.<\/p><p>The template is an instruction checklist for update staging, deployment, and system testing. Follow the checklist for the maintenance window. Deploy updates with the cluster management tool of your choice, though there are many <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/tree\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Ansible playbooks<\/a> that may be helpful for update provisioning.<\/p><p>Maintenance windows for non-PSU LIGO clusters occur on Tuesday during business hours; it is recommended that updates for the PSU cluster follow this time window as users generally expect clusters to be down.<\/p><p>Rough guideline for downtime:<\/p><ul><li>simple yum-updates that do not require reboots can be done live and can be done in 1-3 hours<\/li><li>minor version updates to HTCondor, as well as kernel updates and other reboot-required updates, may require 3-6 hours<ul><li>minor HTCondor updates can be done without reboots, but cannot be done live due to jobs needing to be held and a condor_reconfig command to soft-reset the condor processes<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Major version changes to HTCondor may require 6+ hours and additional planning\/testing (see <a href=\"102825993.html\">2021-06-29 System maintenance: HTCondor Update 8.8 -&gt; 9.0<\/a>)<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-firmware-updates\">Firmware updates<\/h3><ul><li>Single-server updates:<ul><li>Download the firmware (from, e.g. <a href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/product-support\/servicetag\/0-RXV4VzRMamhSeGRZZ0RHZVptMnV4UT090\/drivers\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/product-support\/servicetag\/0-RXV4VzRMamhSeGRZZ0RHZVptMnV4UT090\/drivers<\/a>)<\/li><li>use iDRAC for the node and upload the firmware .exe (iDRAC \u2192 Maintenance \u2192 System Update \u2192 (upload the firmware .exe). Note that even though the servers are running Linux, the firmware must be a .exe for iDRAC to run the update<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Multiple servers:<ul><li>use the blade enclosure CMC interface: Server Overview \u2192 Update \u2192 Firmware Update \u2192 (select the component and all servers)<\/li><li>Note that while multiple servers can be updated at once, updating multiple components&nbsp;(e.g., BIOS, iDRAC) across multiple servers at once is not reliable. So, it is recommended to attempt updating only one component at a time<\/li><li>Note that this may take multiple attempts (see <a href=\"2021-02-PowerEdge-firmware-updates_92799132.html\">2021-02 PowerEdge firmware updates<\/a>)<\/li><li>Repeat for all CMCs<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>CMC firmware<ul><li>Download the CMC firmware (from, e.g., <a href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/product-support\/servicetag\/0-Mzk2di9GYVkvQm5Md2hsaVo5dFpqZz090\/drivers\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/product-support\/servicetag\/0-Mzk2di9GYVkvQm5Md2hsaVo5dFpqZz090\/drivers<\/a>)<\/li><li>Update the passive component in Chassis Overview \u2192 Update \u2192 Firmware Update \u2192 (select only cmc-standby) \u2192 Apply CMC Update<\/li><li>Failover the component: Chassis Overview \u2192 Troubleshooting&nbsp;\u2192 Reset\/Failover CMC<\/li><li>Update the newly-passive component (as above)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":9,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Using HTCondor 67731459
string(6212) "{"id":2827,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Using HTCondor","slug":"using-htcondor","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-using-htcondo\">Ligo : Using HTCondor<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operational-Guides_15271632.html\">Operational Guides<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-using-htcondo-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-using-htcondo-2\">\n                            Ligo : Using HTCondor\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jan 03, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-is-a-descriptio\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>This is a description of general HTCondor commands that are useful for interacting with the LIGO cluster.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>HTCondor is the batch system used by most of the LIGO compute resources across the LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA collaboration. Likewise, the Penn State LIGO cluster uses HTCondor. A detailed description of HTCondor can be found <a href=\"https:\/\/research.cs.wisc.edu\/htcondor\/description.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">here<\/a>.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Managing Nodes<\/strong><\/p><ul><li>Drain a node to checkpoint its&nbsp; jobs and prevent it from starting new jobs. Note that these commands must be run from the admin node comp-ad-001.gwave.ics.psu.edu:<br><ul><li>$ condor_drain -graceful &lt;HOSTNAME&gt;<\/li><li>This marks the node as drained, where it cannot receive any more jobs until a cancel command is sent:<br>$ condor_drain -cancel &lt;HOSTNAME&gt;<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Restart Condor on a node, which is useful if a node's instance of Condor isn't functional, or for forcing a Condor to stop if draining is unsuccessful:<br><ul><li>$ condor_off -peaceful &lt;HOSTNAME&gt;<\/li><li>$ condor_on &lt;HOSTNAME&gt;<\/li><li>Or: $ condor_restart -name &lt;HOSTNAME&gt;<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><strong>Managing Jobs<\/strong><\/p><p>The following commands are useful for submitting, monitoring, and managing jobs:<\/p><ul><li>List all current jobs across the cluster, sorted by node:<br><ul><li>$ condor_status<\/li><li>Can be used to find jobs running on specific nodes:<br>$ condor_status | head -n 2 &amp;&amp; condor_status | grep -- -&lt;NODE_NUMBER&gt; | cat -n<br>where NODE_NUMBER is the four-digit number for a node (e.g., 0001, 0184)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>List all current jobs, sorted by the Owner (submitter):<ul><li>$ condor_q -all<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Submit a job to the queue:<ul><li>$ condor_submit \/path\/to\/submit\/file.sub<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Remove a job from the queue:<ul><li>$ condor_rm &lt;JOB_ID&gt;<\/li><li>Note that you can find the JOB_ID using $ condor_q<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><strong>Changing Configuration<\/strong><\/p><p>The Condor configuration for a node can be managed by either terminal or config file. The terminal allows for parameter modifications; the file allows for customizing many parameters simultaneously and permanently.<\/p><ul><li>Edit a config parameter via terminal:<ul><li>$ condor_config_val -name &lt;HOSTNAME&gt; -&lt;PARAM_NAME&gt; -&lt;ACTION&gt; &lt;'PARAM = EXPRESSION&gt;<\/li><li>For example, to set the startd parameter to false for node 0184 (to stop it from starting new jobs):<br>$ condor_config_val -name comp-ex-0184.gwave.ics.PSU.EDU -startd -set \"StartJobs = False\"<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Edit a config file:<ul><li>The config file must be created on the node that you wish to configure, in \/etc\/condor\/config.d\/<\/li><li>Name the file according to the node's number, e.g. 0184_test_config.config<\/li><li>See <a href=\"https:\/\/research.cs.wisc.edu\/htcondor\/manual\/v7.7\/3_3Configuration.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">here<\/a> for more detail about specific configuring<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":10,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:48.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 78807637
Title is blank after consecutive number removal...Auto-Title applied: Ligo : 2020-06-05/8 login02 disk fullstring(9491) "{"id":2828,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Ligo : 2020-06-05\/8 login02 disk full","slug":"ligo-2020-06-058-login02-disk-full","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-05%2F8-\">Ligo : 2020-06-05\/8 login02 disk full<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-05%2F8--1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-05%2F8--2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-06-05\/8 login02 disk full\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jun 08, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-issue-2020-06-05two-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-issue-2020-06-05\">Issue 2020-06-05<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><p>Two graduate students reported that HTCondor was not running on login02 as of 6\/4 22:30, while they were trying to run a very large (&gt;100000 job) DAG. The condor Master logs showed that the SCHEDD processes were continuously being killed and restarted.<\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<\/h1><p>The Master logs showed only the process being killed repeatedly. No condor processes were running on the node (normally, we'd expect ~100s). The SchedLog showed a few \"out of storage\" warnings. I checked the disk space with `df -h \/` which showed that its local disk space was full (200 GB). No new files could be written. I identified that there were 150 GB in \/tmp, most of it being written recently by a new graduate student.<\/p><p>I checked that the files in \/tmp could be removed, and removed them. This allowed the Condor Master to start its processes again, and the original DAG started running again without rebooting the node. But, I held the DAG until I affirmed that the issue was with disk space and not Condor. After confirming, I released the job which ran without issues.<\/p><p>I checked later and found that \/tmp was filling up again, with similar files from the same student (~27 GB in a few hours). I monitored the disk space to confirm, and then contacted the student. They were launching several DAGs to test workflows before submitting them to the cluster. These workflows normally write the temporary files from CVMFS as a caching mechanism, but when running on the execute nodes the files are directed to _CONDOR_SCRATCH_DIR which is cleared after the job completes. This directory doesn't exist on login nodes, so they were building up in \/tmp.<\/p><ul><li>There were still several workflow processes running when I contacted them, and \/tmp had grown to 31 GB, though they claimed that no more processes were running.<\/li><li>Checking their history, I found that they had launched many DAGs (lalapps_inspr) but hadn't properly killed them. I believe that this, perhaps along with other DAGs (gstlal) that were killed but may have spawned child DAGs, were continuing to generate the files in the background.<\/li><li>They apparently stopped the jobs soon after I contacted them, which removed the processes and halted \/tmp at 31 GB.<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-resolution\">Resolution<\/h1><p>I removed the temporary files a second time. I instructed the graduate student to not run long workflows on the login nodes and to ensure that the processes are stopped. I will later add a routine to clear \/tmp after a number of days.<\/p><p><br><\/p><hr><h1 id=\"bkmrk-issue-2020-06-08\">Issue 2020-06-08<\/h1><p>The node was still having issues with Condor after the resolution above. A user's jobs were running on the node as if it were an execute node, and all CPUs were maxed out. Thinking that the user was running test lots of test jobs instead of submitting, I had them kill their processes on the node. But right after, another user's jobs appeared on the node, maxing the CPU again.<\/p><p>After confirming that a reboot would be reasonable with ICDS and the LIGO group, I had all users move their jobs to be running from login01. I then rebooted the node. It came up after ~3 minutes, and Condor started again. But it quickly maxed out CPU again because of new processes.<\/p><p>I drained the head node from comp-ad-001 to stop new jobs from running while I did troubleshooting:<\/p><p>&gt; condor_drain -quick <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-hd-002.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-hd-002.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-cause-1\">Cause<\/h1><p>This behavior suggested that the node was still being treated as an execute node by HTCondor. I found that the default configuration in \/etc\/condor\/condor_config has the following daemon list:<\/p><p>DAEMON_LIST = COLLECTOR, MASTER, NEGOTIATOR, SCHEDD, STARTD<\/p><p>The STARTD daemon marks the host node as able to run jobs. Both login nodes have this configuration enabled, but login01 was not running the STARTD daemon:<\/p><ul><li>$ login01# ps aux | grep condor_ | grep -v condor_shadow | grep -v cluster | grep -v dag<p><strong>condor 15455 4.7 0.0 117860 14452 ? Ss 15:00 3:58 condor_startd -f<\/strong><br>condor 27159 0.0 0.0 135180 2748 ? Ss 2019 11:59 \/usr\/sbin\/condor_master -f<br>condor 957177 1.3 0.5 1297172 1140672 ? Ss Jan17 2744:51 condor_schedd -f<br>condor 1509022 0.0 0.0 127148 3696 ? Ss 2019 111:08 condor_shared_port -f<br>root 1509021 0.4 0.0 62544 38660 ? S 2019 2144:19 condor_procd -A \/var\/run\/condor\/procd_pipe -L \/var\/log\/condor\/ProcLog -R 1000000 -S 60 -C 994<br>root 1056503 0.0 0.0 112712 980 pts\/20 S+ 16:24 0:00 grep --color=auto condor_<\/p><\/li><li>$ login02# ps aux | grep condor_ | grep -v condor_shadow | grep -v cluster | grep -v dag<p>condor 13474 0.0 0.0 133064 7900 ? Ss 15:00 0:00 \/usr\/sbin\/condor_master -f<br>condor 15462 0.0 0.0 114800 8352 ? Ss 15:00 0:00 condor_schedd -f<br>condor 14804 0.1 0.0 110744 6916 ? Ss 15:00 0:08 condor_shared_port -f<br>root 14794 7.2 0.0 31988 10708 ? S 15:00 6:41 condor_procd -A \/var\/run\/condor\/procd_pipe -L \/var\/log\/condor\/ProcLog -R 1000000 -S 60 -C 994<br>root 43025 0.0 0.0 112712 984 pts\/0 S+ 16:32 0:00 grep --color=auto condor_<\/p><\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-resolution-1\">Resolution<\/h1><p>After confirming that login nodes should not have the startd daemon running (<a href=\"https:\/\/htcondor.readthedocs.io\/en\/latest\/apis\/python-bindings\/advanced\/Interacting-With-Daemons.html?highlight=daemons\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">HTCondor daemons<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/forge.puppet.com\/HEPPuppet\/htcondor\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">HTCondor Puppet<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/role\/login.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">PSU_LIGO Puppet<\/a>, etc.), I turned off the startd daemon from comp-ad-001:<\/p><p>&gt; condor_off -daemon startd -graceful <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-hd-002.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-hd-002.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/p><p>I did not have to cancel the condor_drain (disabling startd makes condor_drain fail, since the node can't accept jobs). This appears to have resolved the issue.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":11,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Hardware Maintenance Log 69795860
string(58324) "{"id":2829,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Hardware Maintenance Log","slug":"hardware-maintenance-log","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-hardware-main\">Ligo : : Hardware Maintenance Log\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last string(8887) "{"id":2830,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Puppet and Foreman Setup","slug":"puppet-and-foreman-setup","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-puppet-and-fo\">Ligo : Puppet and Foreman Setup<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Administrative-Information_15271685.html\">Administrative Information<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-puppet-and-fo-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-puppet-and-fo-2\">\n                            Ligo : Puppet and Foreman Setup\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jun 28, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-puppetcommon-puppet-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-puppet\">Puppet<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-common-puppet-change\">Common Puppet changes<\/h3><ul><li>Adding packages to a node role:<ul><li>Edit the Puppet profile role; declare the profile in the Puppet role<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Updating firewall ports:<ul><li>Declare the service in ligo_puppet_control_repo\/hiera\/common.yaml<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-deploying-updates-af\">Deploying updates after changing puppet modules<\/h3><ul><li>Push changes to the `psu_ligo` puppet module repo<\/li><li>rebuild the puppet modules in `ligo_puppet_control_repo`:<br>bundle exec r10k puppetfile install<\/li><li>run the `deployproduction` playbook from `ligo_puppet_control_repo\/ansible\/playbooks`<\/li><li><p>subsequent puppet runs will reflect the updates, which can be viewed via:<br>puppet agent -tvo --noop<\/p><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-foreman\">Foreman<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-terminology\">Terminology<\/h3><ul><li>Activation Keys (AK)<ul><li>Created by assigning to a Lifecycle Env and a Content View or CCV<\/li><li>Can subscribe to products provided by the CV\/CCV it is associated with<\/li><li>Servers can be registered with an activation key via, e.g.:<br>subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_activationkey_name\"<ul><li>Note: this must be done <strong>after<\/strong> the AK subscribes to products, otherwise the products won't be available to the server (even if the AK later subscribes to them)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-design\">Design<\/h3><ul><li>Partition Tables<ul><li>kickstart-LIGO: template for standard LIGO servers (compute, head, webserver\/docker nodes). Creates localscratch partition.<\/li><li>kickstart-default: template for administrative LIGO servers (HTCondor Manager node). Doesn't create localscratch.<\/li><li>kickstart-LIGO-NFS:<\/li><li>kickstart-LIGO-RTDB:<\/li><li>Notes<ul><li>to add a new kickstart, go to Hosts - Partition tables and create\/clone a new table. For this table to be available for use in a Host (or Host Group), it must first be added to the corresponding OS via Hosts - Operating systems - &lt;select the OS&gt; - Partition table<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Host Groups<ul><li>LIGO-Admin: the HTCondor Manager server<ul><li>Kickstart is kickstart-default, not kickstart-LIGO<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>LIGO-Compute: defunct group, unused<\/li><li>LIGO-Compute-2.0: parent group for all lifecycle stages for compute nodes<ul><li>development: compute nodes testing newest Content View version<ul><li>lifecycle environment: development<\/li><li>AK: CCV-LIGO_development_all<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>qa: compute nodes testing second newest Content View version<ul><li>lifecycle environment: qa<\/li><li>AK: CCV-LIGO_qa_all<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>production: compute nodes currently operating in production<ul><li>lifecycle environment: production<\/li><li>AK: CCV-LIGO_production_all<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>LIGO-Database: the Real Time DataBase (RTDB) Poweredge R840 server<\/li><li>LIGO-Docker: Docker host docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/li><li>LIGO-Headnodes: two login nodes ligo02.gwave.ics.psu.edu and ligo01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<br><ul><li>lifecycle environment: production<\/li><li>AK: CCV-LIGO_production_all<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>LIGO-Software-Mount: host of the \/ligo\/software partition in <a href=\"LIGO-Storage_69795842.html\">LIGO Storage<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Lifecycle Environments<ul><li>Library: default for new content view versions<ul><li>The cluster was initially set up with all nodes in Library, which offered no control over package versions when creating new content views. This was superseded by the following development \u2192 qa \u2192 production cycle, initiated during <a href=\"2020-09-22-System-Update_85328047.html\">2020-09-22 System Update<\/a>.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>development: newest content views<\/li><li>qa: second newest content views<\/li><li>production: stable content views, for servers operating in production<\/li><li>postprod: environment to hold content views previously in `production`, in case a rollback is needed after an update<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-provisioning\">Provisioning<\/h3><ul><li>An entirely new server (e.g., requiring a new Host Group)<ul><li>See <a href=\"Provisioning-LIGO-servers_63111169.html\">Provisioning LIGO servers<\/a> for specific steps using Foreman<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-update-deployment\">Update Deployment<\/h3><ul><li>update<\/li><li>rollback using `postprod`<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-ansible\">Ansible<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-ssh\">SSH<\/h3><p>Ansible Vaults are used to store secrets, such as SSH keys. These secrets are stored per server role (e.g., compute, login, admin; these roles are similar to but not the same as Foreman's Host Groups for LIGO). This allows an ansible playbook to SSH as root to the servers (to, e.g., run yum-update or reboot).<\/p><p>The format for an ssh key secret stored in ansible\/group_vars\/&lt;server&gt;\/vault:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">---<br>ansible_ssh_pass: &lt;password&gt;<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><br><\/p><p>To view\/edit\/create new vaults, the Ansible vault password is required (in LastPass `LIGO management\/network` in the Shared-LIGO folder).<\/p><ul><li>viewing\/editing a vault: <br>ansible-vault edit group_vars\/&lt;server&gt;\/vault<\/li><li>creating a vault:<br>ansible-vault create group_vars\/&lt;server&gt;\/vault<\/li><\/ul><p>Note:<\/p><ul><li>the two login nodes have `PermitRootLogin no` for security in \/etc\/gsissh\/sshd_config (since they are public-facing boxes), so Ansible playbooks cannot SSH to them as root<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":13,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 10 26 ligo02 condor issues 117670846
string(4794) "{"id":2832,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 10 26 ligo02 condor issues","slug":"2021-10-26-ligo02-condor-issues","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-10-26-li\">Ligo : 2021-10-26 ligo02 condor issues<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-10-26-li-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-10-26-li-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-10-26 ligo02 condor issues\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Nov 18, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-starting-oct.-18%2C-th\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Starting Oct. 18, the ligo02 submit node stopped running condor. This was unusual as the problem persisted after a reboot. The condor master was repeatedly getting killed and restarted, such that the submit process Schedd was not working (and condor couldn't be soft-reset via condor_reconfig). So no user could manage existing jobs from the node, submit new jobs, or remove existing jobs.<\/p><p>This coincided with OSG jobs failing to run, since the OSG compute entrypoint SSHs to ligo02 to submit jobs.<\/p><p>On Oct. 26, I killed and restarted the condor processes manually (`pkill condor` and `kill -9 &lt;specific process&gt;`), which restored condor so users could submit again. But, OSG jobs still haven't resumed since then (as of Nov. 11).<\/p><p>I submitted an OSG ticket: <a href=\"https:\/\/support.opensciencegrid.org\/support\/tickets\/68290\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.opensciencegrid.org\/support\/tickets\/68290<\/a><\/p><p>Many other LIGO OSG sites also had problems with running OSG jobs (not necessarily due to condor issues) which was compiled as a \"list of doom\" on IGWN <a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/lscsoft\/osg-igwn\/issues\/288\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/github.com\/lscsoft\/osg-igwn\/issues\/288<\/a>, HTCondor Jira <a href=\"https:\/\/opensciencegrid.atlassian.net\/browse\/OPS-227\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/opensciencegrid.atlassian.net\/browse\/OPS-227<\/a>, and a combined OSG ticket <a href=\"https:\/\/support.opensciencegrid.org\/support\/tickets\/68134\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.opensciencegrid.org\/support\/tickets\/68134<\/a>.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":15,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:49.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

This caused 4000+ job failures overnight due to framecpp and frame I\/O errors.<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Upstream debugging: Edgar Fajardo \u2192 Dave Dykstra \u2192 Derek Weitzel. See <a href=\"https:\/\/app.slack.com\/client\/T03MU5LDV\/G01B8DNDKJR\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">OSG Slack<\/a>.<\/p><p>General understanding is:<\/p><ul><li>OSG rolled out some update on their machines that publish the CVMFS repos<\/li><li>the gwosc repo occasionally has issues during these updates<\/li><li>Derek Weitzel said that their repo origin can drop its NFS mount so its repo directory appears empty<ul><li>their cvmfs_sync command then syncs to the origin repo and clears the cvmfs repo directory<\/li><li>then, sites that sync to this upstream will correctly read an empty <code class=\"c-mrkdwn__code\">\/gwosc<\/code> directory but without any cvmfs errors (since <code class=\"c-mrkdwn__code\">gwosc<\/code> was \"supposed\" to be empty)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>They resolve this by reverting to a previous working version, and are \"working on a permanent fix.\"<\/li><\/ul><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Y<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><span class=\"c-link\">Contact Derek Weitzel directly: <\/span><a class=\"external-link\" href=\"mailto:dweitzel@unl.edu\" rel=\"nofollow\">dweitzel@unl.edu<\/a> and cc <a class=\"external-link\" href=\"mailto:help@opensciencegrid.org\" rel=\"nofollow\">help@opensciencegrid.org<\/a>.<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">20200917<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">ex-0068<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">unresponsive to ssh;                   <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce <p><br><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Date<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Description<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Commands<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Files<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-09 21:29:15<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Disk failure on Nexenta server; resilvering begins<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-12\/13\/14<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Users reported hanging interactive sessions, slow software compiling, and low job throughput.<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-14<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">I met with graduate students to determine a plan for running analyses during the rebuild (Chad was unavailable). We decided to have users limit their maximum job counts to reduce the strain on NFS.<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-20<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Chad and I determined that we should put user jobs on hold for several days to see if it helps the rebuild rates; users agreed.<\/p><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>I started monitoring the rebuild rates with a cronjob executing:<br>zpool status work | grep 'scanned out' | awk '{print d, $1, $7}' \"d=$(date +%Y%m%d-%T)\" &gt;&gt; 20201009_pool_scan.txt<br>zpool status work | grep 'done' | awk '{print d, $1, $3}' \"d=$(date +%Y%m%d-%T)\" &gt;&gt; 20201009_disk_rebuild.txt<\/p><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-25 17:xx:xx<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">User jobs released; CPUs limited to 25% to reduce NFS strain from user jobs (instead of asking users to limit their jobs again, since that would not guarantee or enforce a limit on NFS usage)<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">for i in $(seq -f \"%04g\" 1 137); do condor_off -startd comp-ex-${i}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>; done<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-26<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">LIGO group meeting; decided to prioritize pipeline analysis (chunk #22) over all other jobs. CPUs limited to 50%.<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">for i in $(seq -f \"%04g\" 46 92); do condor_on -startd comp-ex-${i}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>; done<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>2020-10-26<\/p><p>14:05:xx<\/p><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">CPUs limited to 75%<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-10-28<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><a href=\"2020-10-28-Archiving-to-Caltech_87326924.html\">2020-10-28 Archiving to Caltech<\/a> begins<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">2020-11-01 22:55:xx<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">NFS storage peaked at 94% due to 12 TB written by analyses over the weekend; timestamped copies of logs (generally)<br>cp \/var\/log\/condor\/SchedLog{,.\"$(date +%Y-%m-%d)\"}<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-influx-%28via-docker01\">Influx (via docker01 influxdb_grafana 30s<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-other\">Other<\/h2><ul><li>Lookup a user in LIGO LDAP:<br>UNAME=bryce.cousins; ldapsearch -Z -x -h <a href=\"http:\/\/ldap.ligo.org\" class=\"external-link\" Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 04 23 Replacing four NAS HDDs 75727822
string(5741) "{"id":2841,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 04 23 Replacing four NAS HDDs","slug":"2020-04-23-replacing-four-nas-hdds","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-04-23-re\">Ligo : 2020-04-23 Replacing four NAS HDDs<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-04-23-re-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-04-23-re-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-04-23 Replacing four NAS HDDs\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on May 19, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-on-4%2F19%2F2020%2C-a-four\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><p>On 4\/19\/2020, a fourth HDD failed in LIGO NAS, and a total of six drives had reported slow IO. I created a work order with Dell for four drives. I proceeded with installing these drives as follows:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>I followed the <a href=\"Nexenta-Drive-Replacement_75727823.html\">Nexenta Drive Replacement<\/a> procedure for each drive. <br><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Note: one spare had already been fully resilvered and had replaced the failed drive, so it was not software-replaced in NMS.<\/li><li>Note: following standard ICDS procedure from Eric Huyett, I did software-replace for the other three drives. Nexenta Support later pointed out that this was unnecessary since two spares were partially resilvered. See below.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>The system did not experience any downtime and the resilvering process began.<\/li><li>Checksum errors were occurring during the resilvering, so I created a support ticket with Nexenta.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><hr><p>5\/8\/2020<\/p><p>Nexenta Support recommended that I have the hot spares fully replace the failed drives and add the new drives as new hot spares (instead of replacements for the failed drives):<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Detach the failed drive with $ <span>zpool detach work 12397210730818410326 &amp; <\/span><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Wait for this to finish (~30 seconds) and check the pool to confirm the change: $ zpool status<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Detach the newly-added replacement drive with $ <span>zpool detach work c0t50000399E80853F5d0 &amp;<\/span><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li><span>Wait for this to finish and check the pool to confirm the change: $ zpool status<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>Repeat for each pair of failed + replacement drives.<\/span><\/li><li><span>Add the replacement drives as new hot spares in NMV \/data\/datasets\/volumes\/work\/.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><span>This removed the checksum errors and did not interrupt the resilvering.<br><\/span><\/p><hr><p><span>5\/17\/2020<\/span><\/p><p>The resilvering completed for 5.33TB from 4\/23 to 5\/17.&nbsp;The resilver was very slow to begin with (~60\/189 TB scanned in the first three weeks), but picked up rapidly at the end (remaining TB scanned in the last three days). During this time there was reduced performance:<\/p><ul><li>IO errors were occurred during this time due to intensive workflows (but see <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/LIGO\/2020-05-12+NFS+Hard+Mount+test\" rel=\"nofollow\">2020-05-12 NFS Hard Mount test<\/a>).<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":24,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(6754) "{"id":2842,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 09 30 NFS CPU overload","slug":"2020-09-30-nfs-cpu-overload","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-30-nf\">Ligo : 2020-09-30 NFS CPU overload<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-30-nf-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-30-nf-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-09-30 NFS CPU overload\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Sep 30, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-problemuser-reported\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-problem\">Problem<\/h2><p>User reported that login nodes were down at 17:11.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<\/h2><p>Login nodes were both online, but my open sessions were very sluggish or unresponsive, and new ssh requests hung. I checked NFS on grafana, and the CPU was at &gt;99% starting at 17:10.<\/p><p>I drained 75% of the execute nodes to reduce the NFS load from running jobs, so that I could ssh to the NFS box. NFS logs showed typical CPU overload symptoms (e.g., could not communicate with the other Nexenta server).<\/p><p>`condor_status` showed that hd-002 had 48 slots running jobs, since its startd must have activated again somehow. I was unable to drain this with `condor_drain` -quick.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-solution\">Solution<\/h2><p>I drained hd-002 with `condor_drain -fast`, which preempted its jobs. I turned off its startd again. The NFS load went down to ~10%. Login nodes and new ssh sessions became responsive again.<\/p><ul><li>hd-002 logs:<\/li><\/ul><p><a href=\"attachments\/85328227\/85328230\" data-linked-resource-id=\"85328230\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"SchedLog.2020-09-30\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"application\/octet-stream\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"85328227\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"1\">SchedLog.2020-09-30<\/a><\/p><p><a href=\"attachments\/85328227\/85328229\" data-linked-resource-id=\"85328229\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"ProcLog.2020-09-30\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"application\/octet-stream\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"85328227\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"1\">ProcLog.2020-09-30<\/a><\/p><p><a href=\"attachments\/85328227\/85328231\" data-linked-resource-id=\"85328231\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"ShadowLog.2020-09-30\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"application\/octet-stream\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"85328227\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"1\">ShadowLog.2020-09-30<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Downtime: 23 minutes (17:11-17:34)<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-related-articles\">Related articles<\/h2><p><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                                            <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Feb 19, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div
