class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.nexenta.com\/CasesSummary<\/a><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-update-procedure\">Update procedure<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"92799161\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"7\">Update the passive server in the HA cluster (currently, nas-02b) and reboot it<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"8\">Login to the passive server and make the new OS the default OS<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"9\">Check the status of the passive server<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"10\">Fail over the active server to the newly-updated passive server<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"11\">Check status on the now-active server<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"12\">Update the newly-passive server and reboot<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"14\">Check the status on the newly-passive server<\/li><\/ul><h4 id=\"bkmrk-first-%28passive%29-ha-s\">First (passive) HA server<\/h4><ul><li>I attempted a firmware update from the NMC without clearing upgrade caches, which failed:<br>admin@stor-nas02b:~# nmc<br><p>nmc@stor-nas02b:\/$ setup appliance upgrade -s<\/p><p>Cleanup upgrade caches (note: cleanup is generally not required and can be skipped in most cases; if you say Yes, prepare to wait for software upgrade to complete a bit longer) ? No<\/p><p>...<\/p><p>Fetched 276 MB in 5min 12s (883 kB\/s)<br>Download complete and in download only mode<br>Upgrade is in progress. Please DO NOT interrupt...<br>Creating Upgrade Checkpoint...<br>Feb 15 16:18:50 EXCEPTION: SystemCallError: cannot unmount '\/syspool\/rootfs-nmu-008': Device busy<br>Uncaught exception from user code:<br>com.nexenta.nmu.SystemCallError: cannot unmount '\/syspool\/rootfs-nmu-008': Device busy<br>at \/usr\/perl5\/5.12\/lib\/NZA\/<a href=\"http:\/\/NMUUtil.pm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">NMUUtil.pm<\/a> line 470<br>NZA::NMUUtil::_set_legacy('syspool\/rootfs-nmu-008') called at \/usr\/perl5\/5.12\/lib\/NZA\/<a href=\"http:\/\/NMUUtil.pm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">NMUUtil.pm<\/a> line 713<br>NZA::NMUUtil::_mark_rootfs('syspool\/rootfs-nmu-008', 0, '') called at \/usr\/perl5\/5.12\/lib\/NZA\/<a href=\"http:\/\/NMUUtil.pm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">NMUUtil.pm<\/a> line 817<br>NZA::NMUUtil::clone_rootfs() called at \/usr\/bin\/nmu line 576<\/p><\/li><li>I attempted as firmware update from NMC after clearing upgrade caches, which succeeded: <br><p>nmc@stor-nas02b:\/$ setup appliance upgrade -s<\/p><p>Cleanup upgrade caches (note: cleanup is generally not required and can be skipped in most cases; if you say Yes, prepare to wait for software upgrade to complete a bit longer) ? Yes<\/p><\/li><li>NMC created a new system checkpoint with the 4.0.5 firmware. I activated this checkpoint, then rebooted:<br><p>nmc@stor-nas02b:\/$ setup appliance checkpoint &nbsp;&nbsp; # selected 'rootfs-nmu-009'<\/p><p>nmc@stor-nas02b:\/$ setup appliance reboot<\/p><\/li><li>server lost heartbeats due to the reboot, then came back online. Server reflected the new update:<br><p>nmc@stor-nas02b:\/$ show appliance upgrade<\/p><p>RELEASE STABILITY DESCRIPTION<\/p><p>4.0* stable Open Storage Appliance v4.0.5-FP4<\/p><\/li><li>I re-enabled automatic failover for the server: Settings \u2192 HA Cluster \u2192 right-click `Manual` failover and change to `Automatic`<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-failover\">Failover<\/h4><ul><li>I failed over the export from 02a to 02b: Settings \u2192 HA Cluster \u2192 right-click Failover to stor-nas-02b<\/li><li>I re-enabled automatic failover for the now-passive server: Settings \u2192 HA Cluster \u2192 right-click `Manual` failover and change to `Automatic`<\/li><li>The previously-unrecognized drive now appeared in the pool: Data Management \u2192 Datasets \u2192 Volume (work). I added the disk as a spare.<\/li><\/ul><h4 id=\"bkmrk-second-%28newly-passiv\">Second (newly-passive) server<\/h4><ul><li>I followed the same steps as with the first server. I selected \"Cleanup upgrade cache\" the first time, but this still caused the same error as above; the second attempt worked.<\/li><li>I selected the reboot option after the update which appeared as though it would activate the new firmware. After coming online, it still suggested that I activate the firmware by selecting the new checkpoint.<ul><li>I selected the new checkpoint and rebooted (as with the first server).<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>The server reflected the firmware update:<br><p>nmc@stor-nas02a:\/$ show appliance upgrade<\/p><p>RELEASE STABILITY DESCRIPTION<\/p><p>4.0* stable Open Storage Appliance v4.0.5-FP4<\/p><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":26,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 06 05 stor nas02a reboot 78807602
string(5074) "{"id":2844,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 06 05 stor nas02a reboot","slug":"2020-06-05-stor-nas02a-reboot","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-05-st\">Ligo : 2020-06-05 stor-nas02a reboot<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-05-st-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-05-st-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-06-05 stor-nas02a reboot\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jun 08, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-issueseveral-graduat\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-issue\">Issue<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><p>Several graduate students and postdocs in the LIGO group reported IO errors and&nbsp;Python ImportErrors when running DAGs on the cluster (including the core gstlal analysis workflow) from ~5\/30 - 6\/3. The corrupted files caused IO errors lingering after this period, through 6\/4, for the core workflow.<\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><p>The exact cause is uncertain, though the issues coincided with a certain routine (bayestar) being run in large amounts during this time. According to the postdoc using the program, bayestar has caused issues for the cluster in the past. It's normally run one DAG at a time a few times a month, but from ~5\/29 - 6\/3 it was run 30+ times with many concurrent DAGs.<\/p><p>I noticed that after a bayestar DAG was submitted and running, the NAS server maxed out its CPU (around 6\/3 14:00-15:00 UTC on <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.29.192:3000\/d\/a3-HVnyZz\/ligo-nas?orgId=1&amp;from=1591200714436&amp;to=1591203035430\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Grafana<\/a>). The jobs finished on 6\/3; the CPU maxed out again as they were finishing (19:05-19:10 UTC on <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.29.192:3000\/d\/a3-HVnyZz\/ligo-nas?orgId=1&amp;from=1591209998412&amp;to=1591212319406\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Grafana<\/a>). There were no indicators in NAS logs of an issue (and NFS logs are not kept on Solaris 11 for NFSv4). IO errors were occurring during this time.<\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-resolution\">Resolution<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><p>I had thought about rebooting NFS, but I wanted to run tests of the bayestar DAG before rebooting to investigate if it was the cause without changing the NFS setup. Chad recommended rebooting on 6\/4, so I rebooted stor-nas02a at 6\/4 12:14pm, which failed over properly to stor-nas02b by 12:16. After, 02a was online by 12:22. Logs indicate no further issues, and no IO\/ImportErrors were reported.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":27,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Provisioning LIGO servers 63111169
string(18565) "{"id":2845,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Provisioning LIGO servers","slug":"provisioning-ligo-servers","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-provisioning-\">Ligo : Provisioning LIGO servers<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Administrative-Information_15271685.html\">Administrative Information<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-provisioning--1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-provisioning--2\">\n                            Ligo : Provisioning LIGO servers\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on May 11, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-general-instructions\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>General instructions for commissioning new servers and re-provisioning existing servers in the LIGO cluster.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-commissioning-new-se\">Commissioning New Servers<\/h2><p>This process requires root access to: the new server, the Foreman manager GUI <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a> (and optionally the terminal at IP 10.136.28.207), and the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/tree\/development\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">psu_ligo repository<\/a>.<\/p><p>Refer to the <a href=\"Puppet-and-Foreman-Setup_85328050.html\">Puppet and Foreman Setup<\/a> for background on the LIGO Foreman setup.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-if-desired%2C-prepare-\">If desired, prepare a new Puppet Role<\/h3><p>If the new server is going to have a distinct purpose in the cluster (e.g., it's not just another compute or login node), then a new Puppet Role ( and a new Host Group corresponding to that Role) must be created.<\/p><ul><li>Create a new Puppet Role (in the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/tree\/development\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">psu_ligo repository<\/a>):<ul><li>Minimally, a new Puppet Role must be created (see, e.g. the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/role\/nfs_sw_mount.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">NFS Software Mount role<\/a>), but Puppet profiles can also be created and associated with the new Role (see, e.g. the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/profile\/nfs_sw_mount.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">NFS Software Mount profile<\/a>).<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Create a new Host Group (in the Foreman GUI):<ul><li>Configure \u2192 Host Groups \u2192 Create Host Group<\/li><li>Enter in the fields as desired. You may need to create a new partition table (see below for <strong>Set up hardware provisioning<\/strong>)<\/li><li>Note: the \"Parameters\" category is essential to connect the new server to Puppet and Foreman. Add the following \"Global Parameters\":<br>role = &lt;the Puppet role you created for this server in the psu_ligo repository, e.g. <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/hostgroups\/14-LIGO-Software-Mount\/edit\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">nfs_sw_mount<\/a>&gt;<br>enable-puppet4 = true<br>puppet_enabled = true<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-create-a-new-foreman\">Create a new Foreman Host and register it with Katello<\/h3><p>If a new Puppet Role has been created for server (or it will be assigned an existing Role), then the next step is to create a new Foreman Host and associate that Host with a Katello Content Host. This will provide server with access to package repositories via an activation key (AK).<\/p><ul><li>Create a new Foreman Host (in the Foreman GUI):<ul><li>Hosts \u2192 All Hosts \u2192 Create Host<\/li><li>Select the corresponding Host Group (either the newly-created or an existing Host Group), which will auto-populate many of the fields, including the Parameters you entered in the Host Group<\/li><li>Complete the sections for \"Interfaces\" and \"OS\"<ul><li>Use `ip addr show` to get Mac address and IPv6 info as needed, for each interface. For compute nodes, the primary interface is em1, and the secondary (non-provisioned) interface is em2.<\/li><li>As of May 2021, the OS setup is convoluted: the servers typically run SL7.8 or 7.9, but Foreman requires a specific OS specification in order to provision the OS. What currently works is:<br>&lt;Go to Operating System tab&gt;:<br>&lt;Operating System&gt;&nbsp;\u2192 select \"Scientific Linux 7.8\"<br>&lt;Media Selection&gt;&nbsp;\u2192 select \"All Media\"<br>&lt;Media&gt; \u2192 select \"SL7.6\"<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><p>Register the server with the desired activation key (AK), such as \"CCV-LIGO_production_all\" (terminal on the server):<br>$ rpm -Uvh <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm<\/a><\/p>$ subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"&lt;activation-key-name&gt;\"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # add in the AK name, including the quotes<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-set-up-hardware-prov\">Set up hardware provisioning<\/h3><p>If the server will be in a new Role, it may require a separate partition table or provisioning template.<\/p><ul><li>Create a new partition table: Hosts - Partition tables - &lt;create or clone&gt;<ul><li>This partition table must then be added to an OS in Foreman for it to be able to be selected in a Host's config: Hosts - Operating systems - &lt;select the OS&gt; - Partition table<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Create a new provisioning template:<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-connecting-the-serve\">Connecting the server to Puppet and Foreman<\/h3><p>The server is now ready to be provisioned and configured via Puppet. A <a href=\"https:\/\/web.archive.org\/web\/20201025050146\/https:\/\/www.itzgeek.com\/how-tos\/linux\/ubuntu-how-tos\/how-to-add-puppet-nodes-to-foreman-centos-7-ubuntu-14-04.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">similar-but-not-exact example<\/a>.<\/p><ul><li>Install and configure Puppet:<br>$ yum install puppet-agent<\/li><li>Edit puppet.conf to point the Puppet Agent to the Foreman server. Note that one field must be changed: &lt;CERTIFICATE NAME&gt;. This will be the name of the Puppet certificate requested from Foreman; convention is that this is the new server's hostname.<br>#\/etc\/puppetlabs\/puppet\/puppet.conf<br>[main]<br>vardir = \/var\/lib\/puppet<br>logdir = \/var\/log\/puppet<br>rundir = \/var\/run\/puppet<br>ssldir = $vardir\/ssl<br>[agent]<br>pluginsync = true<br>report = true<br>ignoreschedules = true<br>ca_server = <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>certname = &lt;CERTIFICATE NAME&gt;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # fill in the server's hostname<br>environment = production<br>server = <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>Request a Puppet certificate for the server by running a puppet-agent command, e.g.:<br>$ puppet agent --test --debug --verbose&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # this will request the certificate and then fail since the certificate is unsigned<br><br>...Exiting; no certificate found and waitforcert is disabled<\/li><li>Sign the Puppet certificate request (via GUI or terminal):<ul><li>GUI:<ul><li>Infrastructure \u2192 Smart proxies \u2192 Puppet CA \u2192 Filter by \"pending\" \u2192 Select &lt;CERTIFICATE NAME&gt;<\/li><li>select Action \u2192 Sign<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Terminal<br><ul><li>Confirm that the certificate request name has been requested:<br>$ puppet cert list<\/li><li>Sign the request:<br>$ puppet cert sign &lt;CERTIFICATE NAME&gt;<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Trigger a puppet run on the server<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-re-provisioning-serv\">Re-provisioning Servers<\/h2><p>This process requires root access to LIGO CMC 10.136.30.1{11:22} and iDRAC 10.136.31.X.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-compute-node-with-ne\">Compute node with new motherboard<\/h3><p>A compute node with a newly-installed motherboard must be reconfigured with an assigned IP, a reset Service Tag, and initialized Network Settings. You may also need to change the boot settings and\/or the Server Configuration Profile.<\/p><p>Note that all of these steps can be skipped if the server iDRAC is assigned in-person at the CMC.<\/p><ol><li>Update the server IP from Dell Chassis Management Controller (CMC). This process allows the server to be accessed via iDRAC.<br><ol><li>Identify the CMC containing the current server (note that each CMC holds 16 servers), and log in.<\/li><li>Go to Server Overview - Setup. You can select \"Auto-populate using QuickDeploy Settings\" or do the steps below:<br><ol><li>Find the server slot for the current node. Enable LAN and enable IPv4.<\/li><li>Enter the IP (10.136.31.X), subnet mask (255.255.254.0), and gateway (10.136.31.254).<\/li><li>Select \"Apply iDRAC Network Settings.\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Go to the individual Server Slot to configure booting.<ol><li>Select Setup - First Boot Device - PXE (boot once).<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Update the Service Tag. Note that this can be skipped if the ST was updated from the blade enclosure during the MB replacement.<br><ol><li>Log in to iDRAC and start a remote console to boot up the node. Note that the login information will have been reset to default with a new motherboard, so reenter the root password from LastPass.<\/li><li>Enter System Setup (F2) during boot.<\/li><li>Select Service Tag from the menu, and enter in&nbsp; the service tag from the previous motherboard.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Initialize Network Settings for the NIC.<ol><li>Enter Lifecycle Controller (F10) during boot.<\/li><li>Select Settings - Network Settings.<\/li><li>Keep the defaults (DHCP) and press Next. This allows the Foreman to assign the IPv4 Settings during the next boot.<ol><li>Note that the IPv6 configuration may fail since the server is not configured for IPv6.<\/li><li>Select OK - Finish, and reboot when prompted.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><h4 id=\"bkmrk-troubleshooting\">Troubleshooting<\/h4><ul><li>On boot, the server may download the NBP file from Foreman, but it may fail to boot:<br>NBP file downloaded successfully.<br>Boot failed: pxe device 1 integrated nic 1 port 1 partition 1<ul><li>In this case, change the boot settings in BIOS or via iDRAC:<br><ul><li>BIOS Settings \u2192 Boot Mode \u2192 select \"BIOS\" (not UEFI)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>If the server cannot update its network\/boot settings or service tag, you could try changing the Server Configuration Profile:<ul><li>Export a stable Server Configuration Profile from a stable node.<br><ul><li>Log in to iDRAC - Configuration - Server Configuration Profile - Export.<\/li><li>Select Local, enter a file name, choose \"All components\", \"Basic\" type, and XML format.<\/li><li>See <a href=\"attachments\/63111169\/83591372.xml\" data-linked-resource-id=\"83591372\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"idracProfile_31_50_BasicReplace.xml\" data-nice-type=\"XML File\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"text\/xml\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"63111169\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"19\">comp-ex-0050 Basic Replacement profile<\/a> as an example file for re-provisioning comp-ex-0050 (ST 2YT71Q2, IP 10.136.31.50)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Update the Server Configuration Profile:<ul><li>The service tag (line 1) and the IP (line ~372) must be updated.<\/li><li>Other options don't need to be updated for a compute node, though more general information on this process is at <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/IT\/Dell+iDRAC+Profiles\">Dell iDRAC Profiles<\/a>.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Import the Server Configuration Profile onto the current node.<ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">Log in to iDRAC - Configuration - Server Configuration Profile - Import.<\/span><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">Select Local, select file path, choose \"All components\", \"Basic\" type, and defaults for other options.<\/span><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">Select import, and wait for the job to finish.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">Let the server reboot. It should go through PXE boot using the newly-configured network settings, download the NBP file from Foreman, and boot into Scientific Linux 7.x.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-re-registering-nodes\">Re-registering nodes with Foreman<\/h3><p>Sometimes, a node may need to be re-registered with Foreman due to issues with the subscription manager, if the node has been offline for an extended period, or if the node is failing to rebuild normally.<\/p><ul><li>Nominally, this would involve only a single step to re-register the server with the activation key, e.g.:<br>subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\" --force<\/li><li>However, this may not resolve issues with the subscription manager, the node's Host entry in Foreman, or the node's Katello Content Host. Instead, this may require re-creating the node in Foreman as both a Host and Content Host:<ul><li><p>Sometimes, the host may not show up in Foreman GUI, but is still present from the CLI: $ hammer host info --name &lt;node's hostname&gt;. In this case, a new Host cannot be created from the GUI since the Host's name will already exist. So, the Host and Content Host should be deleted and then re-registered.<\/p><\/li><li><p>Un-register the server:<br>[root@comp-ex-####]# subscription-manager clean; yum remove <a href=\"http:\/\/katello-ca-consumer-foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">katello-ca-consumer-foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/p><\/li><li><p>Remove the server from Foreman:<br>[root@foreman01]# hammer host delete --name &lt;node's hostname&gt;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # on the foreman server<\/p><ul><li>This will delete both the Host and Content Host from Foreman.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Manually create a Host in the Foreman GUI (see above section on \"Create a new Foreman Host and register it with Katello\").<ul><li>This will create a new Host for the server.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><p>Re-register the server (substituting the appropriate activationkey):<br>rpm -Uvh <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm<\/a><br>subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\"<\/p><ul><li>This will create a new Katello Content Host and associate it with the newly-created Foreman Host.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>If you wish to rebuild the server, select \"Build\" on the Host's entry in Foreman. Then enable PXE boot via iDRAC or during system setup so that the node boots and builds from Foreman PXE.<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-provisioning-for-oth\">Provisioning for other servers<\/h2><p><a href=\"Dell-PowerEdge-R840-Database_62586902.html\">Dell PowerEdge R840 Database<\/a><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                                            <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-attachments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Attachments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <div class=\"greybox\" align=\"left\">\n                                                            <img src=\"images\/icons\/bullet_blue.gif\" height=\"8\" width=\"8\" alt=\"\">\n                                <a href=\"attachments\/63111169\/83591372.xml\">idracProfile_31_50_BasicReplace.xml<\/a> (text\/xml)\n                                <br>\n                                                    <\/div>\n                    <\/div>\n                    \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":28,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:50.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(4483) "{"id":2847,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Using Foreman","slug":"using-foreman","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-using-foreman\">Ligo : Using Foreman<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operational-Guides_15271632.html\">Operational Guides<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-using-foreman-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-using-foreman-2\">\n                            Ligo : Using Foreman\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Mar 10, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-content-viewsforeman\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-content-views\">Content Views<\/h2><p>Foreman content views (CVs) are groups of yum repositories that can be managed via lifecycle environments and subscription keys so that servers can access version-controlled yum packages.<\/p><p>There are three content views for the LIGO Foreman instance:<\/p><ul><li>CCV-LIGO: this is a Composite CV, containing only the LSC-Stack and OS-Base component CVs<\/li><li>LSC-Stack: this contains<\/li><li>OS-Base:<\/li><\/ul><p>To view the upstream yum repositories, go to the CV \u2192 Yum Content dropdown \u2192 Repositories.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>To manage CVs for system updates, the component CVs must have a new version published, and then the CCV must have a new version published:<\/p><ul><li>Go to the CV: Content \u2192 Content Views \u2192 (choose from LSC-Stack, OS-Base, or CCV-LIGO)<\/li><li>Publish a new version: select Publish New Version (upper right) \u2192 enter description (\"new version in preparation for system update planned for YYYY-MM-DD\") \u2192 select `Force Yum Metadata Regeneration` \u2192 Save<\/li><li>The CV version will take 5-15 minutes to publish<\/li><\/ul><p>Once both new LSC-Stack and OS-Base versions have finished publishing, do the same process for CCV-LIGO.<\/p><p>Promote CCV-LIGO to the desired environment (e.g., Development or QA to stage a system update, Production for a system update).<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":30,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:51.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:51.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Grafana GPFS bridge information 88408871
string(8310) "{"id":2848,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Grafana GPFS bridge information","slug":"grafana-gpfs-bridge-information","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-grafana-gpfs-\">Ligo : Grafana GPFS bridge information<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta                                       <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-grafana-gpfs--1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-grafana-gpfs--2\">\n                            Ligo : Grafana GPFS bridge information\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-norman-pa\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Norman Patten<\/span>, last modified on Jan 06, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-grafana-gpfs-bri\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-the-grafana-gpfs-bri-1\"><strong>The Grafana-GPFS bridge is an open-source software project that connects GPFS monitoring (pmsensors) to Grafana&nbsp;<\/strong><\/h2><p><br><\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image confluence-external-resource\" draggable=\"false\" alt=\"bridge_overview.PNG\" src=\"https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana\/blob\/master\/docs\/bridge_overview.PNG?raw=true\" data-image-src=\"https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana\/blob\/master\/docs\/bridge_overview.PNG?raw=true\"><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Project source&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Instructions:<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>download the zip package and unpack it :<\/p><pre><span class=\"pl-c\"># git clone https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana.git<\/span><\/pre><p>Start the bridge application by issuing:<\/p><pre><span class=\"pl-c\"># cd source\/<\/span>\n\n<span class=\"pl-c\"># python3 zimonGrafanaIntf.py <\/span><\/pre><p>If the bridge did establish the connection to the specified pmcollector and the initialization of the metadata was performed successfully, you should get the message \"server started\" at the end of line. Otherwise check the zserver.log stored in the zimonGrafanaIntf directory. Additionally, check the pmcollector service running properly by issuing:<\/p><pre><span class=\"pl-c\"># systemctl status pmcollector<\/span><\/pre><h4 id=\"bkmrk-step-4.-install-graf\">Step 4. Install Grafana<\/h4><p>Download and install<span>&nbsp;<\/span><a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https:\/\/grafana.com\/get\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"external-link\">Grafana<\/a><span>&nbsp;<\/span>according to the given instructions. Before you start Grafana for the first time, check<span>&nbsp;<\/span><a href=\"http:\/\/docs.grafana.org\/installation\/configuration\/\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"external-link\">the configuration options<\/a><span>&nbsp;<\/span>for port settings. Start the Grafana server as it described on the Grafana configuration pages.<\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-step-5.-establish-co\">Step 5. Establish connection to the running bridge in Grafana<\/h4><p>Define a new data source (Data Sources -&gt; Add New)<\/p><p><a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana\/blob\/master\/docs\/Example_Add_DataSource.png\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image confluence-external-resource\" draggable=\"false\" src=\"https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana\/raw\/master\/docs\/Example_Add_DataSource.png\" data-image-src=\"https:\/\/github.com\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana\/raw\/master\/docs\/Example_Add_DataSource.png\"><\/span><\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Since the DSS cluster in Ligo is 4.2.3 V4 of the bridge was used. Python libraries package dependancies were manually installed since the cluster does not have internet access.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p class=\"p1\"><strong><span class=\"s1\">Python library list for grafana bridge Ligo<\/span><\/strong><\/p><p class=\"p2\"><br><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana-4.0<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">cheroot-5.11.0<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">portend-2.2<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">Six<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">more-itertools-4.1.0<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">tempora-1.11<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">zc.lockfile-1.4<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">cherrypy-17.3.0<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">query-0.1.3<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><br><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><br><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">Pmsensors setup is a requirement, documentation can be found at IBM:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/STXKQY_5.0.5\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v5r05.doc\/bl1adv_guienableperfmon.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.ibm.com\/support\/knowledgecenter\/STXKQY_5.0.5\/com.ibm.spectrum.scale.v5r05.doc\/bl1adv_guienableperfmon.htm<\/a><\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><br><\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">Bridge software is located in Stewart in&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">\/opt\/IBM\/ibm-spectrum-scale-bridge-for-grafana-4.0<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Port is&nbsp;<\/span><span class=\"s1\">4242 on all interfaces<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p1\"><br><\/p><p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Startup script is&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">\/etc\/systemd\/system\/gpfs-bridge.service<\/span><\/p><p class=\"p3\">ie. \"service gps-bridge start|stop|status\"<\/p><p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\">&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n           <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-31-sy-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-31-sy-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-08-31 system update\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Nov 22, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-main-goals-for-t\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The main goals for this maintenance are to 1) upgrade to HTCondor 9.0.4 as a security patch, 2) upgrade <a href=\"https:\/\/scientificlinux.org\/category\/sl-errata\/slsa-20212725-1\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">kernel <\/a>and <a href=\"https:\/\/scientificlinux.org\/category\/sl-errata\/slsa-20213028-1\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">microcode_ctl<\/a> as security patches, and 3) have all nodes reboot to address any OOM issues lingering from the first occurrence around ~August 16 (see <a href=\"Cluster-Operations-Maintenance-Log_78807468.html\">Cluster Operations Maintenance Log<\/a>).<\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-update-staging\">Update Staging<\/h1><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"116588628\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"1\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Promote desired Foreman CCV to the QA lifecycle environment<br><\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"2\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Email ldg-announce@ligo.org list and ICDS. Template:<br>Hello,<br><\/span><\/span><\/span><p>The Penn State GWave computing cluster is scheduled for upgrade maintenance tomorrow, August 31th. &lt;This will include kernel updates and HTCondor 9.0.1 upgraded to 9.0.4.&gt;<\/p><p>The maintenance will begin at 9:00 EDT and is expected to conclude by 13:00 EDT. The following services will be unavailable during this window:<\/p><ul><li>HTCondor (jobs will be temporarily held immediately before the maintenance window)<\/li><li>SSH access to <a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><\/ul><p>I will send a reminder immediately before the maintenance window and again after the maintenance is complete.<\/p><p>Please contact me if you have any questions.<\/p><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br><\/span><\/span><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-qa-node\">QA node<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"116588628\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"3\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Update a QA node<br><\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"116588628\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"552\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">This required updating condor and related packages (*condor* and blahp) separately due to the GPG check issue (as first noted in <a href=\"102825993.html\">2021-06-29 System maintenance: HTCondor Update 8.8 -&gt; 9.0<\/a>):<br>yum update --downloadonly<\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br>yum update -y --exclude=*condor*,blahp<\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br>yum update *condor* blahp --nogpgcheck<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"553\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Reboot<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"4\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Debug<\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br><\/span><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-download-on-producti\">Download on production nodes<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"116588628\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"5\">Promote desired Foreman CCV from QA to Production lifecycle environment<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"6\">Download the packages on all nodes (<a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/update-download.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">update-download<\/a> playbook)<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-update\">Update<\/h1><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"116588628\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"574\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Send reminder email. Grafana<\/a> to confirm failover<\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br><\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"647\"><span unofficial downtime -- HTCondor was disabled for several days to reduce load on NFS while the Nexenta server rebuilt (see <a href=\"85328489.html\">2020-10-09 NFS Disk Failure\/Rebuild<\/a>), and so no compute nodes were being used. <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2019-12-20-na-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2019-12-20 nas02a NMS failure\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Dec 20, 2019\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-aci-received-an-emai\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>ACI received an email alert from <span class=\"ITWTqi_23IoOPmK3O6ErT\">[NMWatchdog Report] host stor-nas02a<\/span>, reporting that the NMS couldn't be reached:<\/p><p><code>Description: Failed to execute DBus call on NMS: the server does not respond for '60' seconds<\/code><\/p><p>But, the file server itself had no visible issues, and was supporting file access as expected. <a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"mdg104\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~mdg104\" data-linked-resource-id=\"18219322\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">MICHAEL DAVID GALLO<\/a> and I verified that the issue was indeed from stor-nas02a by viewing the nfsd process with <span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\"><code>$ top<\/code><\/span> on both nas02a (nfsd present) and nas02b (nfsd absent), and also with <code>$ iostat<\/code>.<\/p><p>This error had happened before (in August 2019), which was resolved by <a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"erh16\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~erh16\" data-linked-resource-id=\"557290\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">ERIC RICHARD HUYETT<\/a> restarting the physical server.<\/p><p>To avoid downtime, I looked into alternatives (since there is no failover between nas02a and b). I found that NMS was \"<a href=\"https:\/\/web.archive.org\/web\/20191220181757\/https:\/\/docs.nexenta.com\/NexentaRH\/NexentaRH\/server\/NXS_v40_en\/projects\/NXS_Merged_UG_IG\/MERGEDPROJECTS\/NexentaStorUserGuide\/NexentaStorUserGuide\/nxs_usr_nms\/nxs_usr_nms.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Nexenta Management Server<\/a>\" which manages user operations within Nexenta. The log showed:<\/p><blockquote><p>\/var\/log\/nms.log<\/p><p>...<\/p><p>Dec 20 01:17:27 stor-nas02a nms[27598]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] (:1.18) FMA EVENT: ======= START =======<br><strong>Dec 20 01:17:27 stor-nas02a nms[27598]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] (:1.18) FMA EVENT: SOURCE: <a href=\"http:\/\/ereport.io\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ereport.io<\/a>.scsi.disk.predictive-failure<\/strong><br>Dec 20 01:17:27 stor-nas02a nms[27598]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] (:1.18) FMA EVENT: ======== END ========<br><em>Dec 20 01:22:33 stor-nas02a hosts-check[18875]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.<\/em><br><em>Dec 20 01:22:45 stor-nas02a volume-check[19087]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.<\/em><br><em>Dec 20 01:23:05 stor-nas02a ses-check[19000]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.<\/em><br><em>Dec 20 01:23:08 stor-nas02a nfs-collector[18683]: [ID 702911 <a href=\"http:\/\/local0.info\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">local0.info<\/a>] Did not receive a reply. The italics show the failure of NMS to respond to the event. The second bold shows the email alert about the NMS failure.<\/p><p>Since this showed that NMS was not a critical process, and that the core issue was not with the NAS system, I decided to reboot the NMS processes (nms, nmv, nmcd) instead of the whole system. The processes are:<\/p><blockquote><p><code>online Dec_19 <a href=\"http:\/\/svc\/application\/nms:default\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">svc:\/application\/nms:default<\/a><\/code><br><code>online Dec_19 <a href=\"http:\/\/svc\/application\/nmv:default\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">svc:\/application\/nmv:default<\/a><\/code><br><code>online Dec_19 <a href=\"http:\/\/svc\/application\/nmcd:default\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">svc:\/application\/nmcd:default<\/a><\/code><\/p><\/blockquote><p>Rebooting the processes (following the steps <a href=\"https:\/\/web.archive.org\/web\/20170713122339\/http:\/\/www-enstore.fnal.gov\/nexenta.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">here<\/a>):<\/p><blockquote><p><code><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">$ svcs nm{s,v,cd} &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; #check status<\/span><\/code><\/p><p><code><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">$ sudo svcadm -v disable nm{s,v,cd}&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #disable the services<\/span><\/code><\/p><p><code><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">$ svcs nm{s,v,cd}&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #ensure they're disabled<\/span><\/code><\/p><p><code><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">$ sudo svcadm -v enable nm{s,v,cd}&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #re-enable<\/span><\/code><\/p><p><code><span style=\"color: rgb(0,51,102);\">$ svcs nm{s,v,cd}&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #ensure they're re-enabled (may take several minutes)<\/span><\/code><\/p><\/blockquote><p>After this, there was no apparent issue with NAS. An alert came in soon after about the NFS status (reiterating the degraded state of NAS since two spares are currently in use). I believe that this confirmed that NMS was working again; I verified in \/var\/log\/nms.log which showed that there was no failure of NMS to respond to the event.<\/p><p>Notes for future troubleshooting:<\/p><ul><li><code>$ svcs -a<\/code> shows all running solaris processes, which can be managed individually using <code>$ svcadm enable\/disable <\/code><code>[service name]<\/code><\/li><li>If restarting the physical server, make note of the running processes so that individual processes can be enabled after the reboot if they fail to start automatically<\/li><li>Other resources: <a href=\"https:\/\/docs.nexenta.com\/NexentaRH\/NexentaRH\/server\/NXS_v40_en\/projects\/NXS_Merged_UG_IG\/MERGEDPROJECTS\/NexentaStorUserGuide\/NexentaStorUserGuide\/nxs_usr_fault_id\/Hosts_Check.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Nexenta Server<\/a>, <a href=\"http:\/\/docs.nexenta.com\/NexentaRH\/NexentaRH\/server\/NXS_v40_en\/projects\/NXS_Merged_UG_IG\/MERGEDPROJECTS\/NexentaStorUserGuide\/NexentaStorUserGuide\/nxs_usr_runners_triggers\/About_NM_Watchdog.htm\" Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 03 16 Moving HTCondor localscratch 92799678
string(7295) "{"id":2853,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 03 16 Moving HTCondor localscratch","slug":"2021-03-16-moving-htcondor-localscratch","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-16-mo\">Ligo : 2021-03-16 Moving HTCondor localscratch<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-16-mo-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-16-mo-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-03-16 Moving HTCondor localscratch\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Mar 16, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-backgroundthe-comput\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h4 id=\"bkmrk-background\">Background<\/h4><p>The compute nodes were previously using a folder on the root partition (\/home\/condor\/) to store intermediate data for HTCondor jobs. This has not yet caused issues, but could cause problems if HTCondor jobs errantly write large amounts of data. The compute nodes each have \/localscratch\/ on a dedicated non-OS partition, which could be used instead. Moreover, future OSG jobs require scratch space, which should be separated from the root partition as well.<\/p><p>To resolve these two issues, the HTCondor scratch space should be transitioned from \/home\/condor\/ to \/localscratch. This would require a restart of condor (either via systemctl, or a soft reload via condor_reconfig) and would impact running jobs since the jobs' data directories would become empty. So, the servers should be drained and then reconfigured to avoid job interruptions.<\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-procedure\">Procedure<\/h4><ul><li>stop Puppet temporarily<\/li><li>deploy changes from <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/htcondor\/-\/tree\/development\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/htcondor\/-\/tree\/development<\/a><\/li><li>drain a set of nodes:<br>START=1; STOP=46; for i in $(seq -f \"%04g\" $START $STOP); do condor_drain -quick comp-ex-${i}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>; condor_drain -cancel comp-ex-${i}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>; condor_drain -quick comp-ex-${i}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>; done<\/li><li>enable Puppet and trigger runs on those nodes only:<br>ansible-ligo -l 'execute-thirdQ:!execute-down' playbooks\/run_cmd.yml -e \"{'cmd': 'systemctl start puppet &amp;&amp; puppet agent -tvo'}\"<\/li><li>cancel the drain on those nodes:<br>for i in $(seq -f \"%04g\" $START $STOP); do condor_drain -cancel comp-ex-${i}.<a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>; done<\/li><li>repeat for all nodes<\/li><\/ul><h4 id=\"bkmrk-execution\">Execution<\/h4><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"92799678\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"12\">Verify procedure on single compute node (ex-0184) by manually changing \/etc\/condor\/ config instead of via a Puppet run<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"5\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">deploy changes on first quarter of node <\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"6\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">second quarter<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"7\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">third quarter<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"8\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">fourth quarter<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"13\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">verify usage of the new directory within the last hour:<br>ansible-playbook --ask-vault-pass -f 128 -l 'execute:!execute-down' playbooks\/run_cmd.yml -e '{\"cmd\": \" DIFF=$(echo \\\"$(date +%s) - $(stat --format %Z \/localscratch\/condor\/execute\/)\\\" | bc); echo \\\"$DIFF &lt; 3600\\\" | bc | grep 0 \"}'&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # should return all errors since the servers have modified the directory within the last hour<br><\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"16\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">verify non-usage of old directory within the last hour:<br>ansible-playbook --ask-vault-pass -f 128 -l 'execute:!execute-down' playbooks\/run_cmd.yml -e '{\"cmd\": \" DIFF=$(echo \\\"$(date +%s) - $(stat --format %Z \/home\/condor\/execute\/)\\\" | bc); echo \\\"$DIFF &lt; 3600\\\" | bc | grep 0 \"}'&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # should return all success with 0s since the servers haven't modified the old directory within the last hour<\/span><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"14\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">cleanup the old partition space<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":36,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:51.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:51.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 02 TRDC overheating recovery 92799316
string(9573) "{"id":2854,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 02 TRDC overheating recovery","slug":"2021-02-trdc-overheating-recovery","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-02-trdc-\">Ligo : 2021-02 TRDC overheating recovery<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-02-trdc--1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-02-trdc--2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-02 TRDC overheating recovery\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Mar 16, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-trdc-had-heating-iss\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>TRDC had heating issues on Feb. 22 around 3am. This impacted ICDS hardware, including LIGO servers. Puppet runs halted between 2-3am. Blade enclosure 0011 (be-80 in the rack) had temperature warnings for several hours. be-80 is at the top of the rack, and contains compute nodes 177-186 and adminstrative nodes.<\/p><ul><li>the Foreman server showed no temperature issues, but the overheating may have impacted it somehow as the Puppet runs halted<\/li><li>ex-177 and 186 are down entirely, no ping iDRAC<\/li><li>ex-186 was hosting the \/ligo\/software-2\/ partition (see <a href=\"LIGO-Storage_69795842.html\">LIGO Storage<\/a>), which became unavailable<\/li><\/ul><p>Recovery:<\/p><ul><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">debug 0177 and 0186: <\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">inaccessible via iDRAC, ssh, or CMC; <\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">unaffected by CMC failover and physical reseating<\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">create second software partition to replace ex-0186<br><\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"92799316\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"152\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">unmount failed software partition<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"153\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">mount new partition and check for all login\/execute nodes<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"201\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">deployed new software partition \/ligo\/software\/ from ex-0185 at Feb. 22 18:38<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">fix puppet runs: this was due to runs hanging when trying to mount \/ligo\/software-2\/ from ex-0186, so the puppet runs would never finish<\/span><ul><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">note that the Condor manager did not have this problem since it doesn't mount software-2<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"92799316\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"159\">create hardware tickets:<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-02-power-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-02 PowerEdge firmware updates\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n id=\"bkmrk-testing-updates-on-e\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-testing-updates-on-e-1\">Testing updates on ex-0001-0016:<\/h2><ul><li>Successfully updated the CMC firmware on each of the units in the redundancy pair (10.136.30.111)<\/li><li>Attempted iDRAC firmware update from the CMC, but this failed on each of the servers:<ul><li><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">A network connection is successfully started to the remote host, but the file, CMC_LC_iDRAC-with-Lifecycle-Controller_Firmware_62GW1_WN64_4.40.00.00_A00.EXE, is unable to be transferred.<\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">Unable to transfer a file, CMC_LC_iDRAC-with-Lifecycle-Controller_Firmware_62GW1_WN64_4.40.00.00_A00.EXE, because the file is not available at the remote host location.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">Successfully updated the BIOS from the CMC for each server<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p>I retried the iDRAC update, after clearing the failed Lifecycle Log jobs via Server Overview \u2192 Troubleshooting \u2192 Lifecycle Log<\/p><ul><li>As an alternative, I downloaded the iDRAC file only (which has failed when doing individual server updates via iDRAC) from <a href=\"https:\/\/dl.dell.com\/FOLDER06840975M\/1\/iDRAC_4.40.00.00_A00.exe\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/dl.dell.com\/FOLDER06840975M\/1\/iDRAC_4.40.00.00_A00.exe<\/a><br><ul><li>This failed due to \"Unable to verify Update Package signature\", which I was expecting due to issues with this file in the past.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>I cleared the failed jobs and redownloaded the iDRAC firmware w\/LC used on Feb. 12 above.<ul><li>I followed the same steps, but this time the update downloaded\/transferred successfully.<\/li><li>But the update later failed due to \"<span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">Unable to extract payloads from Update Package.<\/span>\"<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>I cleared the failed jobs and redownload and reinitialized the installation. This failed due to:<br><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">The maximum iDRAC storage space allocated for storing firmware image files is reached. The firmware image of the earlier version that was stored for a rollback operation is now deleted.<\/span><\/li><li>I tried an older 3.36.x version rather than 4.40.x <a href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/drivers\/driversdetails?driverid=hfmcv&amp;oscode=wst14&amp;productcode=poweredge-m640\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/drivers\/driversdetails?driverid=hfmcv&amp;oscode=wst14&amp;productcode=poweredge-m640.<\/a> This updated succeed on all servers.<\/li><li>I then installed the most recent 4.40.x (the same download as above). This time, the updates all succeeded.<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-deploying-idrac-firm\">Deploying iDRAC firmware updates<\/h2><ul><li>I updated all firmware for the CMCs, as above.<\/li><li>I attempted updating iDRAC to 3.36.x as above, but these requests frequently timed out on the CMC GUI.<ul><li>After 1-2 reattempts, the update began.<\/li><li>In total, only four servers failed to update after several tries, but after several more retries they updated.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>I attempted updating from 3.36.x to 4.40.x as above.<ul><li>Again, this took some retries due to timeouts.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>2021-02-26: all iDRACs updated<\/li><li>2021-02-26: all BIOS updated, except for admin nodes (ex-185,189,foreman01,191,192) and login&nbsp;node #1 (ex-189)<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":40,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(4264) "{"id":2858,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2022 05 23 kickstart install issues with stashcache","slug":"2022-05-23-kickstart-install-issues-with-stashcache","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2022-05-23-ki\">Ligo : 2022-05-23 kickstart install issues with stashcache<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2022-05-23-ki-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2022-05-23-ki-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2022-05-23 kickstart install issues with stashcache\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-myles-r-g\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> MYLES R GOODWIN<\/span> on May 23, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-problemstashcache-se\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-problem\">Problem<\/h2><p>stashcache server successfully PXE boots but fails on stage2 install because it could not fetch it and the rest of the installation packages from nat01.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<\/h2><p>httpd on nat01 was not starting following the power outage on 2022-05-12 and 2022-05-13.&nbsp; The reason for httpd failing to start was due to stale entries in \/etc\/resolv.conf which no longer worked, namely:<\/p><pre>nameserver 128.118.25.6<br>nameserver 128.118.70.6<br>search <a href=\"http:\/\/ern.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ern.ics.psu.edu<\/a> <\/pre><h2 id=\"bkmrk-solution\">Solution<\/h2><p>Modified \/etc\/resolv.conf on nat01 to reflect DNS configuration on foreman01:<\/p><pre>nameserver 128.118.25.3<br>search <a href=\"http:\/\/gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/pre><p>Once this change was made, httpd on nat01 successfully starts and the kickstart install of stashcache was able to continue<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-related-articles\">Related articles<\/h2><p><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/incidents-online\/en-us\/srdetails\/Q05valJwbnA2S3lkSG1VRHJEaEhRakFwQW8rR3VRYkZtb1lDY3ZrZUpoaHVGc3AzcjZVaExOdWRZeVBWZjRWTw2\" class=\"external-link\" HDDs are marked as failing by ZFS due to too many disk errors, causing two hot spares to activate.
