Title contains numbers at the end: LIGO Storage 69795842
string(16446) "{"id":2860,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"LIGO Storage","slug":"ligo-storage","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-storage\">Ligo : LIGO Storage<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Cluster-Design_15271629.html\">Cluster Design<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-storage-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-storage-2\">\n                            Ligo : LIGO Storage\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Feb 20, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-cern-virtual-machine\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><strong><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><a class=\"confluence-embedded-file\" href=\"\/download\/attachments\/69795842\/psu_ligo_caching.pdf?version=2&amp;modificationDate=1594318444419&amp;api=v2\" data-nice-type=\"PDF Document\" data-file-src=\"\/download\/attachments\/69795842\/psu_ligo_caching.pdf?version=2&amp;modificationDate=1594318444419&amp;api=v2\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854591\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"69795842\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"psu_ligo_caching.pdf\" data-mime-type=\"application\/pdf\" data-has-thumbnail=\"true\" data-linked-resource-version=\"2\" data-can-edit=\"true\" aria-label=\"psu_ligo_caching.pdf\" draggable=\"false\"><img src=\"rest\/documentConversion\/latest\/conversion\/thumbnail\/81854591\/2\" height=\"250\" alt=\"\" draggable=\"false\"><\/a><span class=\"companion-edit-button-placeholder edit-button-overlay\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"69795842\" data-linked-resource-id=\"81854591\" data-template-name=\"companionEditIcon\" data-source-location=\"embedded-attachment\"><\/span><\/span><br><\/strong><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cern-virtual-machine-1\">CERN Virtual Machine File System CVMFS (LIGO data): \/cvmfs\/ and \/ligo\/apps\/<\/h2><p>The cluster uses the <a href=\"https:\/\/cvmfs.readthedocs.io\/en\/stable\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">CERN Virtual Machine File System<\/a> to serve archived data from LIGO detectors. CVMFS is used across the LIGO-Virgo-KAGRA collaboration to access this data and distributed software. The data is served by the <a href=\"https:\/\/cvmfs.readthedocs.io\/en\/stable\/cpt-configure.html#cache-settings\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Alien cache<\/a> on the Nexenta stor-nas02a\/b system.<\/p><p>CVMFS is automounted to \/cvmfs\/ and \/ligo\/apps\/, and provides compilers at \/ligo\/apps\/intel\/.<\/p><p>Steps for monitoring CVMFS are shown in <a href=\"LIGO-System-Monitoring_87326993.html\">System Monitoring<\/a>.<\/p><p>CVMFS involves multiple layers of caching, as shown in the diagram. Follow the hyperlinks in the diagram for more info (or reference the <a href=\"https:\/\/cvmfs.readthedocs.io\/en\/stable\/cpt-squid.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">HTTP cache<\/a> or <a href=\"https:\/\/cvmfs.readthedocs.io\/en\/stable\/cpt-configure.html#cache-settings\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Alien cache<\/a>).<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-primary-nfs-home-dir\">Primary NFS home directory: \/ligo\/home\/<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-description\">Description<\/h3><p>The user home directories are served by a high-availability Nexenta system stor-nas02a\/b mounted via NFS.<\/p><p>The Nexenta server consists of two Dell R720 systems (stor-nas-001a and stor-nas-001b) in an active\/passive failover pair.&nbsp; The servers were retired from ACI (around 2015-2016) and repurposed for the LIGO group.<\/p><ul><li>Service Tags (warranty extended until Nov. 2022): GD75P22 and GD64P22.<\/li><\/ul><p>Data for the home directories (LIGO auth: \/ligo\/home\/<a rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/&lt;ligo<\/a> username&gt; or PSU auth: \/ligo\/home\/<a rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/&lt;PSU<\/a> username&gt;) and for the Alien Cache are served via NFS from a ZFS pool consisting of ~60 drives.<\/p><ul><li>Service Tags (warranty extended until Nov. 2022):&nbsp;GDH5P22 and GDG6P22<\/li><\/ul><p>The Nexenta servers have DNS entries as stor-nas-<strong>001<\/strong>a\/b. However, in Nexenta the servers are stor-nas-<strong>002<\/strong>a\/b (corresponding to their names when they were in use by ACI).<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-management\">Management<\/h3><p>The Nexenta system is not provisioned, maintained, or monitored using Puppet\/Foreman, so operational requirements are different from those of the rest of the cluster:<\/p><ul><li>Alerts<ul><li>hardware alerts and NFS status are sent to <a href=\"mailto:aci-team-alerts@ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">aci-team-alerts@ics.psu.edu<\/a> from either stor-nas02a or <a href=\"mailto:stor-nas02b@ics.psu.edu.\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stor-nas02b@ics.psu.edu.<\/a> The subject contains \"<span class=\"_15gqBTUta5ZVWkGNTkvx90\">[ICS ACI Infrastructure Alerts] [NMS Report]<\/span>\".<\/li><li>The emails of most interest are NOTICE (indicates general pool health) or CRITICAL ALARM (indicates an issue, such as drive faults, NMS problems, CPU hanging).<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Maintenance<ul><li>The servers may need to failover on occasion, either automatically due to system problems, or manually (e.g., to recognize a newly-installed disk, or for general maintenance). The high-availability configuration is here: <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\/settings\/rsfcluster\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\/settings\/rsfcluster\/<\/a>.<\/li><li>To shutdown\/reboot the active appliance, select the desired operation under `Maintenance` on the left-hand-side of <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\/settings\/appliance\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\/settings\/appliance\/<\/a>.<\/li><li>Automatic failover will occur without intervention if the active appliance shuts down as long as the `Failover mode` is set to automatic.<\/li><li>Manual failover can be done by right-clicking the appliance whose `Volume state` is `Available`, then selecting `Failover work keeping automatic mode to stor-nas02[a,b]`.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Monitoring<ul><li>Like the rest of the cluster, a <a href=\"https:\/\/10.136.29.192:3000\/grafana\/d\/a3-HVnyZz\/ligo-nas?orgId=1&amp;refresh=5m&amp;var-NAS_HOST=All\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Grafana dashboard<\/a> is used to display metrics, but collectd was installed manually to collect the metrics since it could not be deployed via Puppet\/Foreman<ul><li>Note: collectd may fail to start after a failover, in which case the service can be started with the correct configuration on CLI via<br>admin@stor-nas02b:~# $(which collectd) -C \/etc\/opt\/csw\/collectd.conf<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Logs are on the system:<ul><li>\/var\/log\/nms*: logs for the Nexenta Management Server (the firmware itself)<\/li><li>\/var\/log\/nmv*: logs for the Nexenta Management Viewer (the online GUI)<\/li><li>\/var\/log\/nmcd.log: logs for the Nexenta Management Console Daemon<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-system%2Fhardware%3A\">System\/Hardware:<\/h3><ul><li>File system: NFS version 4<\/li><li>OS: Nexenta (Open Solaris) Open Storage Appliance 4.0.4-FP4<\/li><li>SunOS stor-nas02a 5.11 NexentaOS_4:55745843a2<ul><li>Note: SunOS 5.11 is analogous to <a href=\"https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Solaris_(operating_system)\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"> Solaris 11<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>ZFS configuration:<ul><li>7x raidz2 arrays: each 10x 4TB HDDs<\/li><li>2x ZIL mirrors: each 2x 400GB SSDs<\/li><li>L2ARC cache:<ul><li>3x 900GB SSDs<\/li><li>3x 750GB SSDs<\/li><li>total ~5TB cache<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>6x HDD hot spares<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p>Checking ZFS status:<\/p><ul><li>$ zpool status<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-secondary-nfs-partit\">Secondary NFS partition: \/ligo\/software\/<strong><br><\/strong><\/h2><p>To reduce the load on the Nexenta server due to software sourcing\/importing (especially Python imports, which are <a href=\"https:\/\/portal.tacc.utexas.edu\/tutorials\/managingio\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">known to cause file server strain<\/a> and have caused numerous file corruption issues on the cluster), a second NFS mount point `\/ligo\/software\/` was prototyped, hosted on the <a href=\"Dell-PowerEdge-R840-Database_62586902.html\">Dell PowerEdge R840 Database<\/a> using the attached manual configuration steps <a href=\"attachments\/69795842\/91226642.txt\" data-linked-resource-id=\"91226642\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"rtdb-sw-partition.txt\" data-nice-type=\"Text File\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"text\/plain\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"69795842\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"27\">rtdb-sw-partition.txt<\/a> (not in Puppet). The provisioning is in Puppet (see <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/hiera\/role\/nfs_sw_mount.yaml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Hiera<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/role\/nfs_sw_mount.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Puppet role\/profile<\/a>).<\/p><p>Timeline<\/p><ul><li>The prototype was retired in Nov. 2020 from production due to server maintenance (<a href=\"2020-11-24-RTDB-maintenance_88408407.html\">2020-11-24 RTDB maintenance<\/a>)<\/li><li>Jan. 2021: the software mount was redeloyed on a spare compute node <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0185.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>, as `\/ligo\/software-2\/`.<\/li><li>March 2021: the software mount host had a hardware problem, so the mount was redeployed on <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0185.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0185.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><\/ul><p>This command was used to generate the initial user directories and permissions:<\/p><ul><li>NFS_SW_SERVER_DIR=\/localscratch\/nfs\/ligo\/software\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org<\/a>; mkdir -p $NFS_SW_SERVER_DIR; for USER_UID in $(ls -l \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a> | awk '{print $3}'); do USER=$(ls -l \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a> | grep $USER_UID | awk '{print $9}'); mkdir ${NFS_SW_SERVER_DIR}\/${USER} &amp;&amp; chown -R $USER_UID:$USER_UID ${NFS_SW_SERVER_DIR}\/${USER} &amp;&amp; chmod 0711 ${NFS_SW_SERVER_DIR}\/${USER}; done<\/li><\/ul><p>If a new LIGO user is added to the cluster, the following can be used to make their software directory:<\/p><ul><li>Create the directory for each new user but don't change folders for old users:<br>NFS2_DIR=\/localscratch\/nfs\/ligo\/software\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org<\/a>; for USER_UID in $(ls -l \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a> | awk '{print $3}'); do USER=$(ls -l \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a> | grep $USER_UID | awk '{print $9}'); mkdir ${NFS2_DIR}\/${USER} &amp;&amp; chown -R $USER_UID:$USER_UID ${NFS2_DIR}\/${USER} &amp;&amp; chmod 0711 ${NFS2_DIR}\/${USER} &amp;&amp; echo $USER; done<\/li><\/ul><p>Troubleshooting:<\/p><ul><li>The usernames do not exist on the software mount host, so if the folders are not set up properly they could be owned by root. To fix this, run:<br>NFS2_DIR=\/localscratch\/nfs\/ligo\/software\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org<\/a>; for USER_UID in $(ls -l \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a> | awk '{print $3}'); do USER=$(ls -l \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a> | grep $USER_UID | awk '{print $9}'); OWNER=$(stat -c %U ${NFS2_DIR}\/${USER}); if [ $OWNER == root ]; then chown -R $USER_UID:$USER_UID ${NFS2_DIR}\/${USER}; echo $USER; fi; don<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-secondary-nfs-partit-1\">Secondary NFS partition: \/ligo\/analysis-1\/<\/h2><p>To further reduce the load on the Nexenta server during time-sensitive and intensive analyses, another NFS mount point `\/ligo\/analysis-1\/` was created. As of Jan. 2021, this is provided by the <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=42401846\">Lenovo GPFS mini-summit server<\/a>.<\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                                            <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n src=\"images\/icons\/bullet_blue.gif\" height=\"8\" width=\"8\" alt=\"\">\n                                <a href=\"attachments\/69795842\/81854591.pdf\">psu_ligo_caching.pdf<\/a> (application\/pdf)\n                                <br>\n                                                            <img src=\"images\/icons\/bullet_blue.gif\" height=\"8\" width=\"8\" alt=\"\">\n                                <a href=\"attachments\/69795842\/91226642.txt\">rtdb-sw-partition.txt<\/a> (text\/plain)\n                                <br>\n id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-nexen-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-nexen-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-03 Nexenta ZeusRAM replacement\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Mar 18, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-following-the-genera\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Following the general steps from <a href=\"Nexenta-Drive-Replacement_75727823.html\">Nexenta Drive Replacement<\/a> and <a href=\"2020-06-10-Replacing-ZeusRAM-drives-on-NAS_78807658.html\">2020-06-10 Replacing ZeusRAM drives on NAS<\/a>.<\/p><h4 id=\"bkmrk-preparation\">Preparation<\/h4><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"92799776\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"55\">flash the ZeusRAM drives in NMV \u2192 Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 JBODs \u2192 (select jbod:1. Tray 1, slots 2 and 11)<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"56\">disable log syncing for the pool:<br>zfs set sync=disabled work\/nfs\/ligo<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"57\">check that the IO to the drives is zero:<br>zpool iostat | head -n 3 &amp;&amp; zpool iostat -v work 5 | egrep 'mirror'<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"58\">remove the faulted ZeusRAM from the pool:<br>zpool detach work 5919118443711914966<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"59\">remove the remaining ZeusRAM from the pool:<br>zpool remove work c0t5000A720300B74DEd0<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"60\">verify the drives are removed:<br>zpool status work<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"61\">renable log syncing for the remaining ZILs:<br>zfs set sync=standard work\/nfs\/ligo<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"62\">check IO to the ZILs<br>zpool iostat | head -n 3 &amp;&amp; zpool iostat -v work 5 | egrep 'mirror'<\/li><\/ul><h4 id=\"bkmrk-replacement\">Replacement<\/h4><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"92799776\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"67\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">First ZeusRAM replaced (Slot 2 in JBOD 1 Tray 2)<br><\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"68\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Second ZeusRAM replaced (Slot 11 in JBOD 1 Tray 11<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"69\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">New ZIL mirror created and activated:<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zpool add work log mirror c4t58CE38EE20EDF12Fd0 c4t58CE38EE20F2668Bd0<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zfs get -r sync work<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zfs set sync=standard work\/nfs\/ligo<br><\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"70\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">verify new mirror is in use:<br>zpool iostat | head -n 3 &amp;&amp; zpool iostat -v work 5 | egrep 'mirror'<\/span><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":45,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 09 29 nodes missing update and subscription manager 85328214
string(7444) "{"id":2864,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 09 29 nodes missing update and subscription manager","slug":"2020-09-29-nodes-missing-update-and-subscription-manager","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-29-no\">Ligo : 2020-09-29 nodes missing update and subscription-manager<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-29-no-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-29-no-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-09-29 nodes missing update and subscription-manager\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Sep 29, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-problemusers-reporte\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-problem\">Problem<\/h2><p>Users reported job errors involved DBUS and\/or Avahi, e.g.:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><span class=\"codespan__pre-wrap\"><code>Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"\/ligo\/software\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/final\/builds\/gstlal+lalsuite-082620\/opt\/bin\/gstlal_inspiral\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/final\/builds\/gstlal+lalsuite-082620\/opt\/bin\/gstlal_inspiral<\/a>\", line 683, in &lt;module&gt;\n    verbose = options.verbose\n  File \"\/ligo\/software\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/final\/builds\/gstlal+lalsuite-082620\/opt\/lib64\/python2.7\/site-packages\/gstlal\/httpinterface.py\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/final\/builds\/gstlal+lalsuite-082620\/opt\/lib64\/python2.7\/site-packages\/gstlal\/httpinterface.py<\/a>\", line 121, in __init__\n    self.service_publisher = servicediscovery.Publisher().__enter__()\n  File \"\/ligo\/software\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/final\/builds\/gstlal+lalsuite-082620\/opt\/lib64\/python2.7\/site-packages\/gstlal\/servicediscovery.py\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/final\/builds\/gstlal+lalsuite-082620\/opt\/lib64\/python2.7\/site-packages\/gstlal\/servicediscovery.py<\/a>\", line 149, in __enter__\n    bus = Gio.bus_get_sync(Gio.BusType.SYSTEM, None)\nGLib.Error: g-io-error-quark: Exhausted all available authentication mechanisms (tried: EXTERNAL, DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1, ANONYMOUS) (available: EXTERNAL, DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1, ANONYMOUS) (0)<\/code><\/span><\/p><p>But, the avahi-daemon was running on all execute nodes. Another user pointed out that some nodes had a different avahi version, i.e. 0.6.3 vs 0.7 (installed during the <a href=\"2020-09-22-System-Update_85328047.html\">2020-09-22 System Update<\/a>). Checking the versions across the cluster,&nbsp; ~66 nodes were on the old avahi version.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<\/h2><p>A subset of the old-avahi nodes were also lacking a subscription-manager identity, which would have caused them to miss some of the recent update, e.g.:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"># yum update avahi<br>Loaded plugins: product-id, search-disabled-repos, subscription-manager<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">This system is not registered with an entitlement server. You can use subscription-manager to register.<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">No packages marked for update<\/p><p>Note that these nodes were also missing updates for &gt;100 packages, presumably again due to the missing identity.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-solution\">Solution<\/h2><p>I ran the re-subscribe command across the cluster (note that it would fail, as desired, for nodes that were already subscribed):<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">ansible-ligo -l execute playbooks\/run_cmd.yml -e '{\"cmd\":\"subscription-manager register --force --org=\\\"LIGO\\\" --activationkey=\\\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\\\" \"}'<\/p><p>I ran yum-update on two nodes and checked to see if they needed a reboot:<\/p><ul><li>ex-0183:<br># needs-restarting -r<br>No core libraries or services have been updated.<br>Reboot is probably not necessary.<\/li><li>ex-0184:<br># needs-restarting -r<br>Core libraries or services have been updated:<br><p>dbus -&gt; 1:1.10.24-14.el7_8<br>glibc -&gt; 2.17-307.el7.1<br>systemd -&gt; 219-73.el7_8.9<br>openssl-libs -&gt; 1:1.0.2k-19.el7<\/p><p>Reboot is required to ensure that your system benefits from these updates.<\/p><\/li><\/ul><p>I created and ran a playbook to update \u2192 check if reboot is needed \u2192 drain and reboot if needed. I ran the playbook on a quarter of the nodes at a time, waiting for one quarter to finish before going on to the next. ~66 nodes updated, and several nodes required a reboot:<\/p><ul><li>ex-0002<\/li><li>ex-0005<\/li><li>ex-0184<\/li><\/ul><p>Two nodes still were not subscribed to the environment, so I re-subbed them and ran the update playbook on them, but they did not require a reboot:<\/p><ul><li>ex-0163<\/li><li>ex-0176<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-related-articles\">Related articles<\/h2><p><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":47,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:52.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:52.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 08 05 Lenovo GPFS storage issues 113704961
string(9985) "{"id":2866,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 08 05 Lenovo GPFS storage issues","slug":"2021-08-05-lenovo-gpfs-storage-issues","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-05-le\">Ligo : 2021-08-05 Lenovo GPFS storage issues<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-05-le-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-05-le-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-08-05 Lenovo GPFS storage issues\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Aug 09, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-between-the-week-of-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Between the week of July 26 and Aug. 2, the Lenovo GPFS server (hosting `\/ligo\/analysis-1` for the LIGO group) began having problems. Users reported issues when using the `\/ligo\/analysis-1` partition, although there was enough space (~50%) and inodes (&gt;50%).<\/p><p>Eric identified that the SSD storage was completely empty, but the NVMe storage was full. There was a GPFS policy to regularly migrate data from NVMe to SSD, but this was never enabled.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>However, the policy could not be run due to the space. Removing ~3GB of data was not enough, and the space kept filling after removing files. After checking with the LIGO group, I transferred a ~500GB directory from `\/ligo\/analysis-1` to `\/ligo\/home` (hosted by the Nexenta). This allowed the policy to be run.<\/p><p>The transfer process:<\/p><ul><li>We removed two folders:<br>[gstlalcbc@comp-hd-001 bfc5288]$ rm -r \/ligo\/analysis-1\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/b\/chunk27_1259423400_1260081799\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/b\/chunk27_1259423400_1260081799<\/a><br>[gstlalcbc@comp-hd-001 bfc5288]$ rm -r \/ligo\/analysis-1\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/b\/chunk32_1262946475_1263751886\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/b\/chunk32_1262946475_1263751886<\/a><\/li><li>We transferred one folder:<br>[gstlalcbc@comp-hd-001 bfc5288]$ mv \/ligo\/analysis-1\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/rnp_injections\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/rnp_injections<\/a> \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/rnp_injections\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/rnp_injections<\/a><\/li><li>This wasn't enough, so we transferred another folder:<br>mv \/ligo\/analysis-1\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test<\/a> \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test<\/a><\/li><\/ul><p>Restoring the folders:<\/p><ul><li>mv \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\/uniform_mass_model\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\/<\/a> &amp;<br>1003 mv \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\/bank_opt_chi_3\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\/bank_opt_chi_3\/<\/a> \/ligo\/analysis-1\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/observing\/3\/sub-solar-mass\/test\/\"           <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-22-sy-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-09-22-sy-2\">\n                            Ligo         <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Nov 03, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-update-intends-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>This update intends to bring all compute and login nodes up-to-date with the newly-configured Production environment in Foreman, so that any future node rebuilds, rollbacks, and environment management are much simpler (since before, all nodes were in Library and there were no lifecycle environments).<\/p><p>The condormanager and docker servers were brought up-to-date during the <a href=\"2020-09-08-System-Update_83591766.html\">2020-09-08 System Update<\/a>, so this update will cover the remaining servers (compute, login, RTDB).<\/p><h2 <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-05-14-ne-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-05-14 Nexenta disk replacements\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jun 02, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-summarizes-the-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>This summarizes the physical replacement of two disks (one storage HDD, one L2ARC SSD cache) on 2021-05-14 and the following Nexenta\/ZFS configuring afterwards.<\/p><ul><li>L2ARC SSD cache:<br><ul><li>failed: c3t58CE38EE2070F75Fd0 (or the corresponding c7t58CE38EE2070F75Fd0)<\/li><li>replacement: c3t5000CCA0A972A496d0 (WDC Ultrastar 960GB)<\/li><li>replaced via:<br>zpool remove work c7t58CE38EE2070F75Ed0<br>zpool add work cache c3t5000CCA0A972A496d0<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>4TB storage HDD<br><ul><li>One disk was mistakenly removed (c0t5000C500629ECE8Bd0) from the same raiz2 pool, so the resilvering process was reset and now two hot spares are resilvering (hot spare c0t50000399E80853F5d0). That raidz2 array cannot take another failure during the resilver.<ul><li>accidentally removed: c0t5000C500629ECE8Bd0<\/li><li>hot spare: c0t50000399E80853F5d0<\/li><li>The removed disk was still marked as `REMOVED` in zpool. I cleared this:<br>zpool clear work c0t5000C500629ECE8Bd0<\/li><li>This left the disk online with the spare so that the raiz2-5 array had 11 disks. So I attempted to offline the drive so that it could be re-added as a new hot spare, but this caused a resilver despite the hot-spare always remaining active.<ul><li>After the resilver, I followed <a href=\"https:\/\/docs.oracle.com\/cd\/E19253-01\/819-5461\/gcvdi\/index.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ZFS Docs Example 4\u201310<\/a> to remove the offlined (healthy) drive and add it as a spare, which worked successfully:<br>zpool detach work c0t5000C500629ECE8Bd0<br>zpool status work<br>zpool add work spare c0t5000C500629ECE8Bd0<br>zpool status work<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>failed: c0t5000C500629EA857d0<\/li><li>hot spare: c0t50000399E8017F19d0<\/li><li>replacement: c0t5000039A6810D65Dd0<ul><li>I detached the failed drive:<br>zpool detach work c0t5000C500629EA857d0<\/li><li>Hot spare had resilvered, so I added this as a new hot spare via the <a href=\"Nexenta-Drive-Replacement_75727823.html\">Nexenta Drive Replacement<\/a> steps<br><br><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":55,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:53.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:53.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

<\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-rtdb-build%2Fbo-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-rtdb-build%2Fbo-2\">\n                            Ligo : RTDB build\/boot debugging\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Aug 11, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-june-2021%3A-the-rtdb-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>June 2021: The RTDB machine was failing to PXE boot and thus could not initiate a build PXE request from Foreman.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-2021-06-18-tcpdump-d\">2021-06-18 TCPdump debugging<\/h3><p>I ran TCPdump from Foreman while the RTDB was 1) powered off and 2) attempting PXE boot:<\/p><ul><li>MAC addresses sending PXE requests during (1):<br><p>e4:f0:04:bf:99:78<\/p><p>f4:8e:38:0a:80:c8<\/p><p>e4:f0:04:bf:9b:58<\/p><p>f4:8e:38:0a:7f:f4<\/p><p>e4:f0:04:bf:92:98<\/p><\/li><li>MAC addresses sending PXE requests during (2):<br><p>e4:f0:04:bf:92:98<\/p><p>e4:f0:04:bf:99:78<\/p><p>f4:8e:38:0a:80:c8<\/p><\/li><\/ul><p>None of these addresses corresponded to the RTDB PXE address&nbsp;e4:43:4b:52:b1:50. And, the three MAC addresses during PXE boot also occurred when the RTDB was off, so the RTDB's PXE discover request was definitely not being received by Foreman.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-2021-06-22-ligo-swit\">2021-06-22 LIGO Switch config<\/h3><p>Eric suspected that the LACP port settings on the switch could be causing the problem given the bond0 configuration of the RTDB (Mode 5 802.3ad which requires switch-side LACP configuring). We changed the switch settings as below and attempted PXE boot:<\/p><p>Network configuring of RTDB bond:<\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">BEFORE<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">AFTER<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>net-ec-001# sh run int te 1\/0\/60<br>interface TenGigabitEthernet 1\/0\/60<br>description LIGO DB<br>channel-group 60 mode active type standard<br>no fabric isl enable<br>no fabric trunk enable<br>fabric neighbor-discovery disable<br>lacp timeout long<br>sflow enable<br>sflow sample-rate 131072<br>no shutdown<br>!<br><br><br>net-ec-001# sh run int te 2\/0\/60<br>interface TenGigabitEthernet 2\/0\/60<br>description LIGO DB<br>channel-group 60 mode active type standard<br>fabric isl enable<br>fabric trunk enable<br>fabric neighbor-discovery disable<br>lacp timeout long<br>sflow enable<br>sflow sample-rate 131072<br>no shutdown<br>!<br><br><br>net-ec-001# sh run int po 60<br>interface Port-channel 60<br>vlag ignore-split<br>description LIGO DB<br>switchport<br>switchport mode access<br>switchport access vlan 3401<br>spanning-tree shutdown<br>no shutdown<br>!<\/p><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>net-ec-001# sh run int te 1\/0\/60<br>interface TenGigabitEthernet 1\/0\/60<br>description LIGO DB<br>switchport<br>switchport mode access<br>switchport access vlan 3401<br>spanning-tree shutdown<br>no fabric isl enable<br>no fabric trunk enable<br>fabric neighbor-discovery disable<br>sflow enable<br>sflow sample-rate 131072<br>no shutdown<br>!<br>net-ec-001# sh run int te 2\/0\/60<br>interface TenGigabitEthernet 2\/0\/60<br>description LIGO DB<br>switchport<br>switchport mode access<br>switchport access vlan 3401<br>spanning-tree shutdown<br>fabric isl enable<br>fabric trunk enable<br>fabric neighbor-discovery disable<br>sflow enable<br>sflow sample-rate 131072<br>no shutdown<br>!<br>net-ec-001# sh run int po 60 <br>interface Port-channel 60<br>vlag ignore-split<br>description LIGO DB<br>switchport<br>switchport mode access<br>switchport access vlan 3401<br>spanning-tree shutdown<br>no shutdown<br>!<\/p><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>RTDB then successfully sent a PXE DHCP Discover request:<\/p><ul><li>tcpdump confirmed RTDB MAC address:<br><p>15:29:36.566712 ethertype IPv4, IP (tos 0x0, ttl 128, id 0, offset 0, flags [none], proto UDP (17), l<\/p><p>ength 576)<\/p><p>0.0.0.0.bootpc &gt; 255.255.255.255.bootps: [udp sum ok] BOOTP\/DHCP, Request from e4:43:4b:52:b1:50, length 548, xid 0x4b52b150, Flags [Broadcast] (0x8000)<\/p><p>Client-Ethernet-Address e4:43:4b:52:b1:50<\/p><p>Vendor-rfc1048 Extensions<\/p><p>Magic Cookie 0x63825363<\/p><p>DHCP-Message Option 53, length 1: Discover<\/p><p>Parameter-Request Option 55, length 36:<\/p><p>Subnet-Mask, Time-Zone, Default-Gateway, Time-Server<\/p><p>IEN-Name-Server, Domain-Name-Server, RL, Hostname<\/p><p>BS, Domain-Name, SS, RP<\/p><p>EP, RSZ, TTL, BR<\/p><p>YD, YS, NTP, Vendor-Option<\/p><p>Requested-IP, Lease-Time, Server-ID, RN<\/p><p>RB, Vendor-Class, TFTP, BF<\/p><p>Option 128, Option 129, Option 130, Option 131<\/p><p>Option 132, Option 133, Option 134, Option 135<\/p><p>MSZ Option 57, length 2: 1260<\/p><p>GUID Option 97, length 17: 0.68.69.76.76.88.0.16.74.128.90.181.192.79.71.48.51<\/p><p>ARCH Option 93, length 2: 0<\/p><p>NDI Option 94, length 3: 1.2.1<\/p><p>Vendor-Class Option 60, length 32: \"PXEClient:Arch:00000:UNDI:002001\"<\/p><p>E..@......8..........D.C.,......KR.P.....................CKR.P..........................................................................................................................................................................................................c.Sc5..7$................()*+236:;&lt;BC........9...a..DELLX..J.Z..OG03]...^....&lt; PXEClient:Arch:00000:UNDI:002001.........................................................................................................................................................................................................................<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/li><li>the PXE boot initialized but failed with dracut-initqueue timeout due to `initramfs unpacking failed junk in compressed archive partition table`, plus some other errors<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-resolving-build-issu\">Resolving build issues<\/h3><p>Next steps with Foreman:<\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102826012\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"7\">Change the bond configuration in Foreman on the RTDB Host entry to be Mode 0 (so that no LACP config is needed)<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"8\">Create a new Foreman partition table for the RTDB disk hardware (447GB SSD mirror). Calculating sizes of partitions (GB):<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102826012\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"9\"><p>&gt;&gt;&gt; total=447<\/p><p>&gt;&gt;&gt; boot=2.048<\/p><p>&gt;&gt;&gt; swap=192.\/2<\/p><p>&gt;&gt;&gt; root=total-boot-swap-10<\/p><p>&gt;&gt;&gt; root<\/p><p>338.952<\/p><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"10\">Build still failed (same errors)<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"11\">Create a new Foreman Provisioning Template for RTDB<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102826012\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"12\">this may require specifics for the NICs\/bond setup<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"16\">Revise partition table<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102826012\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"17\">dracut fails after attaching the disk, which made me think that the sizes of partitions could be a problem<br>\"[sda] .... logical blocks (480 GB\/447 GiB)<br>...<br>\"[sda] Attached SCSI disk\"<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"18\">so I reduced the root partition by 50 GB (to 288.952 GB). This got the build a few lines further to `sda: add path (uevent)` and then another error: iscsid: can't open InitiatorName configuration file \/etc\/iscsi\/initiatorname.iscsi<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"20\">This was a red herring though since the RTDB Host in foreman didn't have the new partition table selected for provisioning. I changed this for the Host and confirmed the provisioning setup at <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/unattended\/provision?spoof=10.136.28.240\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/unattended\/provision?spoof=10.136.28.240<\/a>. But the boot still failed at the same step.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li><span>The NVMe raid array still existed and so might be causing problems during the build when the server attempts to use the partition table. I reset the boot option from BIOS to UEFI and cancelled the Foreman build request, then booted from the previous SL7.9.<\/span><ul><li><span>The mdadm array still existed:<br>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# mdadm --detail --scan<br>ARRAY \/dev\/md\/0 metadata=1.2 name=<a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>:0 UUID=0e9a8b5c:2c89a1b5:36fbc4e5:c1bb433f<\/span><\/li><li><span>Removing previous NVMe mdadm raid array:<br>mdadm --stop \/dev\/md0<br>mdadm --remove \/dev\/md0<br>mdadm --detail --scan<\/span><\/li><li><span>see also <a href=\"https:\/\/kogitae.fr\/mdadm-how-can-i-destroy-or-delete-an-array-memory-storage-backup-and-filesystems.htm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/kogitae.fr\/mdadm-how-can-i-destroy-or-delete-an-array-memory-storage-backup-and-filesystems.htm<\/a><\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>Reattempting the build: I needed to re-enter the OS settings for the RTDB Foreman host (OS to SL7.8, SL7.6 media, kickstart-ligo-rtdb) and re-enabled BIOS boot in the BIOS menu. The build still failed at the same step (mounting\/accessing the sda SSDs).<br><\/span><\/li><li>I removed<span> the SSD OS raid: System Setup \u2192 Devices \u2192 AHCI Controller BOSS-S1 Configuration Utility \u2192 Delete RAID config and Erase Physical Disk, then attempted rebuild.<br><\/span><ol><li><span>This led to the second SSD (sdb) to be recognized during build, but the build still failed afterwards.<\/span><\/li><li><span>I recreated the RAID as before.<\/span><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><span>Again, I reattempted the build after breaking the RAID 1 since I had not disabled RAID Mode in BIOS Embedded SATA settings (RAID \u2192 UEFI). This failed with the same errors.<\/span><\/li><li><span>Enabling network interfaces em1 and em2<\/span><ul><li><span>Added in grub boot options in SL7-Kickstart-RTDB provisioning template: added `ixgbe.allow_unsupported_sfp=1` to the bootloader --append line.<\/span><\/li><li><span>The interfaces still were not detected. I edited added `options ixgbe allow_unsupported_sfp=1` to \/etc\/modprobe.d\/ixgbe.conf\/, which brought the interfaces up after reloading:<br>modprobe -r ixgbe<br>modprobe ixgbe<br>ifup em1<br>ifup em2<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>It turns out that the kickstart change was not reflected in the actual kickstart send to RTDB (<a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/unattended\/provision?spoof=10.136.28.240\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/unattended\/provision?spoof=10.136.28.240<\/a>).<\/span><ul><li><span>Instead, this kickstart file was not actually enabled for the RTDB Host's puppet environment (`production`, not `ligo`). All servers (compute, RTDB, login) are in `production` puppet env, not `ligo`. This was how Foreman was initially set up, though note that the custom provisioning templates and partition tables were set to be for the `ligo` env and thus were never in use by any servers.<\/span><ul><li><span>To check this, go to a Host \u2192 Edit \u2192 Operating System \u2192 Provisioning templates \u2192 Resolve.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>I changed the provisioning template to be for the `production` puppet env, which allowed the template to be Resolved.<\/span><\/li><li><span>I reenabled RAID 1.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>On the next build, the server then loaded em1 and em2. It booted to SL7.3 anaconda shell but failed due to \"ValueError: <\/span><span>new value non-existent xfs filesystem is not valid as a default fs type\"<\/span><br><ul><li><span>I had seen this error before when building compute nodes when the Foreman Host's OS settings were inconsistent. See also<\/span><span> <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/solutions\/697913\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/solutions\/697913<\/a> (comments about Satellite\/Foreman) and <\/span><span><a href=\"https:\/\/bugzilla.redhat.com\/show_bug.cgi?id=1169034\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/bugzilla.redhat.com\/show_bug.cgi?id=1169034<\/a><br><\/span><\/li><li><span>I changed the Database Host Group OS defaults to match the working settings, but the boot still failed.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>The newly-enabled provisioning template was pointing to the old (SL7.3) repo on Foreman. I changed this to be the newer (SL7.6) repo (<a href=\"http:\/\/nat01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/scientific\/7.6\/%24arch\/os\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/nat01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/scientific\/7.6\/x86_64\/os<\/a>).<\/span><ul><li><span>This proceeded without the error. But the partition table could not be set up.<\/span><\/li><li><span>This issue ended up being a typo in the partition table from earlier testing.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><span>After boot:<\/span><\/p><ul><li><span>network.service was failed. `ip addr show` showed that the interfaces were all named eth* instead of em*, so the network config could not be applied.<\/span><ul><li><span>The rename was due to the Provisioning Template specifying `biodevname=0` (see <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/documentation\/en-us\/red_hat_enterprise_linux\/7\/html\/networking_guide\/sec-consistent_network_device_naming_using_biosdevname\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/documentation\/en-us\/red_hat_enterprise_linux\/7\/html\/networking_guide\/sec-consistent_network_device_naming_using_biosdevname<\/a>)<\/span><\/li><li><span>I changed this in the Template, but instead of forcing a rebuild, I changed `biosdevname=1` (from =0) in \/etc\/grub2.conf and \/etc\/default\/grub, and rebooted. The network came up properly with the standard em* interface names.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span>This failed to load puppet, since the Puppet\/Foreman setup wasn't included in the Template (and it's omitted in the LIGO Kickstart 2.0 template as well)<\/span><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":58,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:54.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:54.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

<h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-10-09%2F11-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-10-09%2F11-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-10-09\/11 NFS disk failures\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Oct 16, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-problemusers-reporte\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-problem\">Problem<\/h2><p>Users reported slow\/hanging SSH and editor sessions.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<\/h2><p>One disk failed on the NFS server on 10\/09 (note that this disk reported slow IO on June 15):<\/p><pre>--------------- ------------------------------------  -------------- ---------\nTIME            CACHE-ID                              MSG-ID         SEVERITY\n--------------- ------------------------------------  -------------- ---------\nOct 09 21:09:37 4a87fc22-a473-e84e-8efa-8652ffe2abcc  ZFS-8000-D3    Major     \n\nHost        : stor-nas02b\nPlatform    : PowerEdge-R720\tChassis_id  : GD64P22\nProduct_sn  : \n\nFault class : fault.fs.zfs.device\nAffects     : zfs:\/\/pool=work\/vdev=9d261cd9a7b69096\n                  faulted and taken out of service\nFRU         : \"SLOT 04 \" (hc:\/\/:product-id=DELL-MD3060e:server-id=:chassis-id=50080e5207db2000:serial=Z1Z5VBMT:part=SEAGATE-ST4000NM0023:revision=GS0D\/ses-enclosure=0\/bay=4\/disk=0)\n                  faulty\n\nDescription : A ZFS device failed.  Refer to http:\/\/illumos.org\/msg\/ZFS-8000-D3\n              for more information.\n\nResponse    : A hot spare will be activated if available.\n\nImpact      : Fault tolerance of the pool may be compromised.\n\nAction      : Run 'zpool status -x' and replace the bad device.\n<\/pre><p><br><\/p><p>The two ZeusRAM ZIL drives were marked as faulted (\"external device fault\") on 10\/11 (see <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/LIGO\/2020-06-10+Replacing+ZeusRAM+drives+on+NAS#id-2020-06-10ReplacingZeusRAMdrivesonNAS-ZeusRAMZILs\" rel=\"nofollow\">ZeusRAM ZILs<\/a> \u2013 these were the two old ZeusRAM drives that hadn't failed yet). The other ZIL mirror (two SSD ZIL drives) remained active without issues.<\/p><pre>--------------- ------------------------------------  -------------- ---------\nTIME            CACHE-ID                              MSG-ID         SEVERITY\n--------------- ------------------------------------  -------------- ---------\nOct 11 03:15:13 6e11c5f8-9739-6b2b-ee67-dca6c7d308be  DISK-8000-6R   Critical  \n\nHost        : stor-nas02b\nPlatform    : PowerEdge-R720\tChassis_id  : GD64P22\nProduct_sn  : \n\nFault class : fault.io.disk.device-errors-exceeded\nAffects     : dev:\/\/\/:devid=id1,sd@n5000a720300b74de\/\/scsi_vhci\/disk@g5000a720300b74de\n                  faulted but still in service\nFRU         : \"SLOT 03 \" (hc:\/\/:product-id=DELL-MD3060e:server-id=:chassis-id=50080e5207df3000:serial=STM0001B1DEC:part=STEC-ZeusRAM:revision=C025\/ses-enclosure=1\/bay=3\/disk=0)\n                  faulty\n\nDescription : A disk device has experienced too many device errors.\n\nResponse    : An attempt has been made to take the disk out of service. If the\n              device is part of an active ZFS pool, the device still may be in\n              service.\n\nImpact      : Optionally degraded redundancy and performance.\n\nAction      : Determine the cause of the fault using fmdump -V -u \n              and schedule a repair service.\n\n--------------- ------------------------------------  -------------- ---------\nTIME            CACHE-ID                              MSG-ID         SEVERITY\n--------------- ------------------------------------  -------------- ---------\nOct 11 03:10:20 f53ead5f-324d-68e0-ffc7-b0dcae5e3611  DISK-8000-6R   Critical  \n\nHost        : stor-nas02b\nPlatform    : PowerEdge-R720\tChassis_id  : GD64P22\nProduct_sn  : \n\nFault class : fault.io.disk.device-errors-exceeded\nAffects     : dev:\/\/\/:devid=id1,sd@n5000a720300b74dd\/\/scsi_vhci\/disk@g5000a720300b74dd\n                  faulted but still in service\nFRU         : \"SLOT 12 \" (hc:\/\/:product-id=DELL-MD3060e:server-id=:chassis-id=50080e5207df3000:serial=STM0001B1DEB:part=STEC-ZeusRAM:revision=C025\/ses-enclosure=1\/bay=12\/disk=0)\n                  faulty\n\nDescription : A disk device has experienced too many device errors.\n\nResponse    : An attempt has been made to take the disk out of service. If the\n              device is part of an active ZFS pool, the device still may be in\n              service.\n\nImpact      : Optionally degraded redundancy and performance.\n\nAction      : Determine the cause of the fault using fmdump -V -u \n              and schedule a repair service.<\/pre><h2 id=\"bkmrk-solution\">Solution<\/h2><ul><li>A hot spare took over for the failed disk drive and is being resilvered<\/li><li>I attempted to remove the failed ZeusRAM mirror (logs-mirror-7) from the pool:<br>NMS \u2013 Data Management \u2013 Datasets \u2013 Work \u2013 logs-mirror-7 -- Remove<br><ul><li>This failed, along with `zpool detach work &lt;disk-name&gt;` and `zpool remove work &lt;disk-name&gt;`<\/li><li>I tried `zpool offline work &lt;disk-name&gt;`, but this caused stor-02b to hang and eventually failover to stor-02a.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Failover:<ul><li>stor-02a came online and took over `work` via failover, but 02b remained offline. This caused ~15 minutes of downtime for NFS (~15:51-16:05)<\/li><li>Note: the originally faulted ZeusRAM drives (logs-mirror-7) were online without faults, and the SSD ZILs (logs-mirror-9) were faulted (\"too many errors\")<ul><li>maybe the ZeusRAM drives didn't themselves fail, but they encountered some other issue during resilvering (hence their \"<em>external<\/em> device fault\"?), and then taking the mirror offline caused issues for the SSD mirror as 02b went offline.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Since interacting with logs-mirror-7 caused 02b to go offline, I'm not going to change settings on either of the ZIL mirrors until 02b is back online and ready for failover.<\/li><li>02b came back online at ~18:10; it had rebooted after a crash at 15:50<ul><li>Debugging: there is a 67 GB kernel dump file; see <a href=\"https:\/\/serverfault.com\/a\/248058\/527559\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">how to debug<\/a> and <a href=\"http:\/\/kristof.willen.be\/node\/1100\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">debugging tips<\/a> for Solaris<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Restoring logs-mirror-9<ul><li>I manually onlined the SSD ZILs (logs-mirror-9) since NMV wouldn't allow it from \/data\/datasets\/volumes\/work\/:<br>zpool online work c3t58CE38EE20B4EC73d0<br>zpool clear work c3t58CE38EE20B4EC73d0<br>zpool online work c7t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0<br>zpool clear work c7t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0<\/li><li>Note: this restarted the resilvering process even though the faulted data disk (or the hot spare) was not impacted, though the progress from the previous resilvering should be kept (~133 GB, 11%) since I don't believe the hot spare gets cleared in between resilvering.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-related-articles\">Related articles<\/h2><p><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":59,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:54.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:54.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

1 update on production compute node ex-0001 using playbooks<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-deployment\">Deployment<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-phase-1\">Phase 1<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" This still failed.<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"157\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">I stopped\/removed and restarted the nagios-server container. This brought the nagios website back up, but it was wasn't loading the configuration files<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"158\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">I stopped and started the nagios service in the container, and this loaded the config files.<\/span><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"159\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">But I think there are still some problems reading in the previous config, see \"unhandled problems\"<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"160\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Disk usage map<\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"161\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">DUC was failing after docker01 restarted; I exec-ed into the container and reload httpd via `apachectl -k graceful` but this still failed. I stopped and removed the container and reran the start script. In the container, I started httpd via `httpd`. The DUC disk usage map then worked again.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"97\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Check for yum-cron disabled<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"34\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Promote the QA env to Production<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-phase-2\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Phase 2<\/span><\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"35\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Update first set of nodes with Condor 9.0 in the new lifecycle env and preserve host-based condor authn in the condor config, and initiate a soft-reconfigure of condor:<br>yum update -y condor --nogpgcheck<br><\/span><\/span>sed -i 's\/# use security:host_based\/use security:host_based\/g' Our address was '10.136.28.201', and server's address was '10.136.28.213'. Check your ALLOW settings and IP protocols.<\/p><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"177\">Ran condor_reconfig, condor_restart, and then rebooted comp-ad-001, but issues persist. Eventually resolved, see below<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-debugging\">Debugging<\/h2><p>The update succeeded but led to the authentication errors as above, which stopped jobs from running and broke communication between the submit, execute, and manager servers (including the submit and execute nodes still running v8.8). I tried various configurations to resolve or work around the problems (e.g., allowing ANONYMOUS condor access) but none of these succeeded. I then chose to go with the supported IDTOKEN authn method that was blessed by Condor; originally, I had planned this for a later update to make this update simpler, but trying to make the non-idtoken method worked seemed to be more complicated than that.<\/p><ul><li>I emailed Greg Mendell from the CIT LIGO computing lab (see his responses [1] and [2] below).<\/li><li>I followed Greg's guide that they used for CIT, at <a href=\"https:\/\/ldas-jobs.ligo-wa.caltech.edu\/~gmendell\/testCondor\/README.InstructionsForUpdatingCondorTo9.0.0.txt\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/ldas-jobs.ligo-wa.caltech.edu\/~gmendell\/testCondor\/README.InstructionsForUpdatingCondorTo9.0.0.txt<\/a> (requires LIGO auth)<\/li><\/ul><p>The required steps were then:<\/p><ol><li>Propagate the POOL password file (generated on the Manager when it updated v9.0) from the Manager to all submit\/execute nodes<\/li><li>Change the condor config settings in Puppet to remove references to the old HOST_BASED authn model, as well as disable the default TOKEN-based authn model for v9.0 (since this model is close to the desired setup but it adds a blanket of different configurations, some of which can cause other authn problems depending on the setup. Greg had to disable this for CIT)<\/li><li>Create a new condor security config file to reflect the desired authn settings<\/li><li>Reload Puppet and Condor on all updated servers<\/li><li>Check authn between all updated servers and the Manager<\/li><li>Update the remaining nodes to v9.0 and repeat the steps above.<\/li><\/ol><p>Resolving the issue:<\/p><ol><li>I copied the POOL file from the Manager to my NFS homedir (read-protected).<br># comp-ad-001<br>cp \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL<ol><li>I tested this on comp-hd-001 after stopping Puppet and changing the config files to match Greg's setup<br>\/bin\/cp -f \/ligo\/home\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/POOL \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL<br>condor_reconfig<\/li><li>I thought SELinux could be a problem, but the context was preserved after it was copied (ls -lZ POOL)<\/li><li>I needed to do condor_reconfig on the Manager, and then again on the submit server. Then the authn worked:<br><p>[root@comp-hd-001 bfc5288]# condor_ping -address \"&lt;10.136.28.213:9618&gt;\" -table READ WRITE DAEMON<\/p><p>Instruction Authentication Encryption Integrity Decision Identity<br>READ none none none ALLOW unauthenticated@unmapped<br>WRITE IDTOKENS AES AES ALLOW condor_pool@<br>DAEMON IDTOKENS AES AES ALLOW condor_pool@<\/p><\/li><li><p>This was was reflected on the Manager:<\/p><p>[root@comp-ad-001 bfc5288]# tail -f \/var\/log\/condor\/CollectorLog | grep -w 10.136.28.201<\/p><p>SECMAN: Succesfully sent DC_SEC_QUERY classad to &lt;10.136.28.201:7894&gt;!<\/p><p>SECMAN: Succesfully sent DC_SEC_QUERY classad to &lt;10.136.28.201:28150&gt;!<\/p><p>SECMAN: Succesfully sent DC_SEC_QUERY classad to &lt;10.136.28.201:32423&gt;!<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>I tested on a compute node comp-ex-0001, which succeeded. I rolled these changes into Puppet and Ansible<ol><li><a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/htcondor\/-\/commit\/a8bc02df52e8f032f80b363026076c5c027f1556\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Config changes<\/a> (disabling all of the blanket config options and adding the specific config options from CIT)<\/li><li>Ansible playbook to run:<br><p>sed -i 's\/use security:host_based\/# use security:host_based\/g' \/etc\/condor\/config.d\/00-htcondor-9.0.config &amp;&amp; sed -i 's\/use security:recommended_v9_0\/# use security:recommended_v9_0\/g' \/etc\/condor\/config.d\/00-htcondor-9.0.config<br>condor_reconfig<\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Done in #2<\/li><li>Done in #2<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/commit\/c0c133bc622f4d8f81952a1b332bcb482249c175\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Ansible playbook to ping a condor authn request<\/a> succeeded for all updated servers<\/li><li><a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/condor-token-update.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Playbook<\/a>:<br>---<br>- hosts: execute<br>gather_facts: false<br>remote_user: root<br>become: true<br>tasks:<br>- name: Update condor<br>shell: yum update rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/POOL<\/a> \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL<br>- name: Disable all host-based authn for condor and disable the blanket recommend authn settings<br>shell: sed -i 's\/use security:host_based\/# use security:host_based\/g' \/etc\/condor\/config.d\/00-htcondor-9.0.config &amp;&amp; sed -i 's\/use security:recommended_v9_0\/# use security:recommended_v9_0\/g' \/etc\/condor\/config.d\/00-htcondor-9.0.config<br>- name: Initiate a soft reconfigure for condor<br>shell: condor_reconfig<br>- name: Run puppet<br>puppet:<\/li><\/ol><p>All hosts could then authenticate with the Manager.<\/p><p>I submitted the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/workflow-tests\/-\/tree\/master\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Condor DAG test<\/a>, which ran successfully on all servers when launched from both submit nodes.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Other:<\/p><ul><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">ex-0186 wasn't included in the playbooks to update compute nodes, so I did the above steps manually without issues.<\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">I had disabled notifications for Nagios due to the above issues (a missing nagios library was causing &gt;1000 alerts to be queued to be sent to Slack). <a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"ros5549\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~ros5549\" data-linked-resource-id=\"88408756\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">Robert Sand<\/a> resolved this by fixing the plugins in the nagios container, and the alerts cleared.<\/span><ul><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">The snmp libraries weren't installed, so they were set up again in the container via:<br>yum install net-snmp-util<br>(unzip and untar nagios plugin files in \/root)<br>cd nagios-plugins-2.3.3<br>.\/configure<br>.\/make install<br><\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">service nagios stop<br>\/usr\/local\/nagios\/bin\/nagios -d \/etc\/nagios\/nagios.cfg<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cleanup\">Cleanup<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-verification\">Verification<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"115\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">docker01: check all containers and restart if needed (see <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images<\/a>)<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"116\">login nodes: d<span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">isable condor startd <\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"117\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Health check<\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"11\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Puppet<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"12\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">CVMFS<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"477\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Condor<\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"14\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">submit nodes<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"15\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">execute nodes<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"16\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">manager<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"17\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">NFS mounts:&nbsp;<\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">\/ligo\/software\/<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"118\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Service check<\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"119\"><span
