class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"162\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Influxdb \/ collectd<\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"102825993\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"181\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">not entirely normal; some hosts are sending from domain gwave.ics.PSU.edu instead of .gwave.ics.psu.edu. This has been a problem historically, no clean solution yet<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"163\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Nagios<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"121\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Disk usage map<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"183\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">re-enable Nagios notifications<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-future\">Future<\/h3><ul><li>reboot comp-ex-0185 (the \/ligo\/software host) since I did not reboot it during maintenance (had only one change: kernel.x86_64 0:3.10.0-1160.31 \u2192 kernel.x86_64 0:3.10.0-1160.35)<\/li><li>for condor updates: test with updating not just execute node, but ideally also Manager (Collector and Negotiator) and Submit<\/li><li>create more functionality tests of condor, maybe with code that tests essential LIGO libraries\/builds<\/li><li>maybe move ansible-playbook tests\/checks to another repo exclusively for maintenance (rather than with the main Puppet setup)<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Emails from Greg Mendell:<\/p><p>[1]<\/p><p>From <a href=\"https:\/\/htcondor.readthedocs.io\/en\/latest\/admin-manual\/security.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/htcondor.readthedocs.io\/en\/latest\/admin-manual\/security.html<\/a><\/p><p><span>\"If authentication did not happen or failed and was not required, then<br>the user is given the name unauthenticated@unmapped.\"<br><br>In my case, I believe there was an incompatibility between<br><br>&nbsp;SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION<br><br>and the ALLOW statements.<br><br>The quick fix is:<br><br>1. To not have:<br><br>&nbsp;use security:host_based<br><br>in any of the condor config files, and also not have,<br><br>&nbsp;use security:recommended_v9_0<br><br>In the latter case, make sure the \"use security:recommended_v9_0\" line<br>is commented out in<br><br>\/etc\/condor\/config.d\/00-htcondor-9.0.config<br><br>(The 00-htcondor-9.0.config file with use security:recommended_v9_0 is<br>installed by Condor 9.0.)<br><br>2. Instead, use the setting as per my instructions on all hosts:<br><br>SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS= FS, IDTOKENS<br>SEC_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS = FS, IDTOKENS<br><br>SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION = REQUIRED<br>SEC_DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION = REQUIRED<br>SEC_DEFAULT_INTEGRITY = REQUIRED<br><br>SEC_READ_AUTHENTICATION = OPTIONAL<br>SEC_READ_ENCRYPTION = OPTIONAL<br>SEC_READ_INTEGRITY = OPTIONAL<br><br>SEC_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION = OPTIONAL<br>SEC_CLIENT_ENCRYPTION = OPTIONAL<br>SEC_CLIENT_INTEGRITY = OPTIONAL<br><br>ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR = root@*, condor@*, condor_pool@*<br>ALLOW_DAEMON = condor@*, condor_pool@*<br>ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR = condor@*, condor_pool@*<br>ALLOW_WRITE = *<br>ALLOW_READ = *<br><br>The main point is to have SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION = REQUIRED but the<br>also have compatible ALLOW statements, specifically the user based one,<br>ALLOW_DAEMON = condor@*, condor_pool@* to get the DAEMONs to authorize<br>user condor.<br><br>Otherwise, the exceptions are to allow read and client operations to<br>occur without authentication.<br><br>But any deviation from the above (which I worked out with the condor<br>team) can cause mismatches to occur, resulting in the error messages you<br>see in the logs.<br><br>3. You can also see what the \"use\" macros do by running condor_config_val:<br><br>-bash-4.2$ condor_config_val use security:host_based<br>use SECURITY:HOST_BASED is<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR=$(CONDOR_HOST)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_OWNER=$(FULL_HOSTNAME) $(IPV4_ADDRESS) $(IPV6_ADDRESS)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_READ=*<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_WRITE=$(FULL_HOSTNAME) $(IPV4_ADDRESS) $(IPV6_ADDRESS)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_DAEMON=$(FULL_HOSTNAME) $(IPV4_ADDRESS) $(IPV6_ADDRESS)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR=$(CONDOR_HOST)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR_SCHEDD=$(ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR) $(FLOCK_NEGOTIATOR_HOSTS)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_WRITE_COLLECTOR=$(ALLOW_WRITE) $(FLOCK_FROM)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_WRITE_STARTD=$(ALLOW_WRITE) $(FLOCK_FROM)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_READ_COLLECTOR=$(ALLOW_READ) $(FLOCK_FROM)<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ALLOW_READ_STARTD=$(ALLOW_READ) $(FLOCK_FROM)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # To smooth upgrades from 8.8.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; LEGACY_ALLOW_SEMANTICS = TRUE<br>-bash-4.2$ condor_config_val use security:recommended_v9_0<br>use SECURITY:recommended_v9_0 is<br># Make it easy to detect if this metaknob was set.<br>SECURITY_MODEL = 9.0<br><br># Assume that FS and IDTOKENS are in SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS,<br># which they are by default.<br>use security:strong<br><br># This allows anyone who can access port 9618 to READ, which lets<br># condor_status and condor_q work over the network out of the box.<br>SEC_READ_AUTHENTICATION = OPTIONAL<br>SEC_READ_ENCRYPTION = OPTIONAL<br>SEC_READ_INTEGRITY = OPTIONAL<br><br>ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR = $(1:condor)@* condor_pool@* $(2:root@*) $(3+)<br>ALLOW_DAEMON = $(1:condor)@*&nbsp; condor_pool@*<br>ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR = $(1:condor)@* condor_pool@*<br>ALLOW_WRITE = *<br>ALLOW_READ = *<\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>[2]<\/p><p><span>You do not need to create any tokens to use these settings:<br><br>SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS= FS, IDTOKENS<br>SEC_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS = FS, IDTOKENS<br><br>So going with IDTOKENS for internal authentication is the way to go with<br>condor 9.0.<br><br>You also need to set,<br><br>SEC_PASSWORD_FILE = \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL<br>SEC_TOKEN_POOL_SIGNING_KEY = \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL<br><br>or if you are not using the POOL file, then point to whatever password<br>file you have, e.g.,<br><br>SEC_PASSWORD_FILE = \/etc\/condor\/condor_cred<br>SEC_TOKEN_POOL_SIGNING_KEY = \/etc\/condor\/condor_cred<br><br>If you do not have \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL or<br>\/etc\/condor\/condor_cred, you can create by running,<br><br>&nbsp;condor_store_cred -f \/path\/to\/password\/file<br><br>and storing the output on all hosts.<br><br>The other thing you many need to do is shutdown all of condor, then<br>bring up the central manager first, and then bring up the other hosts,<br>so that they can then successfully authenticate.<br><\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div> Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 04 16 NFS Planned Outage 75727730
string(9046) "{"id":2880,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 04 16 NFS Planned Outage","slug":"2020-04-16-nfs-planned-outage","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-04-16-nf\">Ligo : 2020-04-16 NFS Planned Outage<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-04-16-nf-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-04-16-nf-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-04-16 NFS Planned Outage\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Oct 26, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-issuethe-nexenta-nfs\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><strong>Issue<\/strong><\/p><p>The Nexenta NFS server had a planned outage for a reboot and a test of changes to enable failover. The outage was coordinated with the LIGO group, so no workflows or sessions were interrupted. This was performed without Nexenta support.<\/p><p><strong>Summary<\/strong><\/p><p>Prior to the outage, I enabled two settings in the Nexenta Management Viewer:<\/p><ul><li>I added the active server (stor-nas02a) to the SSH Bound Hosts for the inactive server (stor-nas02b) via the Nexenta Management Controller CLI. These changes are reflected in Settings \u2013 Network.<\/li><li>I enabled the HA cluster automatic failover for the inactive server (stor-nas02b), changed from Manual. This was done in NMV \u2013 Settings \u2013 HA Cluster.<\/li><\/ul><p>I rebooted the active server (2a). The failover was processed by the newly-active server (2b) after ~120sec; NFS was online after ~250sec.<\/p><blockquote><p>2a reboot at 14:12:20; processed fully by 2b at 14:14:19, NFS up by 14:16:35; 2a online at 14:19:36 (heartbeat to 2b)<\/p><\/blockquote><p>After waiting for both systems to come fully online, I rebooted the now-active server (2b). The failover was processed after ~75sec; NFS was online after ~150sec.<\/p><blockquote><p>2b reboot at 14:26:05; processed fully by 2a at 14:27:22, NFS tested by 14:28:XX; 2b online at 14:32:32 (heartbeat to 2a)<\/p><\/blockquote><p>Users started running jobs ~5min after both servers were fully restored after the second reboot. There were no warnings or problems in either systems' logs related to failover.<\/p><p>2b had a repeated warning about a failed ssh-bind-hosts connection:<\/p><pre>FAULT: Description : Unable to reach ssh-bound host '10.194.1.4'<\/pre><p>This corresponded to a defunct IP (presumably from before these controllers were in use for LIGO), which was commented out in \/etc\/hosts but remained in 2b's NMV ssh-bind-hosts table (unlike 2a's table, though 2a also had the corresponding IP 10.194.1.5 commented out in \/etc\/hosts). So, I removed this IP from 2b's NMV table. This resolved the issue.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper\"><a class=\"confluence-embedded-file\" href=\"\/download\/attachments\/75727730\/outage_log_2a.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1587087905306&amp;api=v2\" data-nice-type=\"PDF Document\"      <span><a href=\"150339963.html\">CCstar\/GWave 1.5 OPs transition checklist<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-xcat-node-ima-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-xcat-node-ima-2\">\n                            Ligo : xCAT node image management\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-ross-mick\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Ross Mickens<\/span>, last modified on Mar 31, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-ligo-stateless-i\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The ligo stateless images are managed using a simplified version of the image tree process that is used for RC.&nbsp;<\/p><p>Link to reference: XXX <a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"rlm6137\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~rlm6137\" data-linked-resource-id=\"88408743\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">Ross Mickens<\/a> need to fix<\/p><p><strong>Repositories <\/strong>are managed via the RC repos server. Maintenance is described here: <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=125698060\">How to update or add repositories for RC (provisioning)<\/a>.&nbsp;<\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-images-and-image-nam\">Images and image names:<\/h1><p>There are several node types on Ligo. Below is a list of the osimages and known differences.&nbsp;<\/p><p>xCAT osimage table contains lists and scripts to maintain and complete software installs and configurations.&nbsp;<\/p><p>These include pkglist, otherpkglist, exlist, postinstall, postscripts, and synclist.&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"relative-table wrapped confluenceTable\" style=\"width: 70.2995%;\"><colgroup><col style=\"width: 15.5872%;\"><col style=\"width: 74.2958%;\"><col style=\"width: 10.0627%;\"><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope=\"col\" class=\"confluenceTh\">Osimage Type<\/th><th scope=\"col\" class=\"confluenceTh\">Description<\/th><th scope=\"col\" class=\"confluenceTh\">Stateless\/ful<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rcoky8-compute<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">*This is the first compute image that we built. It is bloated and should be removed<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">stateless<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-base<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">This is the base image that the others are based on. It does not exist in the osimage table but consists of list and script files that are used by xcat for other osimages.&nbsp;<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">stateless<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-ligo<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">This is the base plus the stuff for the live analysis that uses the <strong>kafka <\/strong>stuff to pull in the proprietary LIGO data.<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">stateless<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-cc<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">This is the base plus the stuff for the <strong>GPU <\/strong>drivers and <strong>excludes <\/strong>the proprietary LIGO bits<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">stateless<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-login<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">This is a head node or login node image. This image includes things not needed on compute nodes - such as texlive. Since this node is exposed to the internet, it also has the splunk and Nexsus agents.&nbsp;<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">stateless<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-xcat<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">This is a stateful VM that we are developing to replace the dedicated xCAT hardware node. <strong>BETA<\/strong><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">stateful vm<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-stashcache<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Still in development. Stateless\/stateful image? Not exposed to the users?&nbsp;<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>??<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-rtdb<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Still in development. Stateless\/stateful image. Not exposed to the users?&nbsp;<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">??<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">rocky8-docker<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Still in development. Stateless\/stateful image. Not exposed to the users?&nbsp;<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">??<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><br><\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":66,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:54.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:54.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: Nexenta Drive Replacement 75727823
string(16489) "{"id":2884,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Nexenta Drive Replacement","slug":"nexenta-drive-replacement","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-nexenta-drive\">Ligo : Nexenta Drive Replacement<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operational-Guides_15271632.html\">Operational Guides<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-nexenta-drive-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-nexenta-drive-2\">\n                            Ligo : Nexenta Drive Replacement\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Oct 27, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-general-nexenta-supp\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-general-nexenta-supp-1\">General Nexenta Support<\/h1><ul><li>Documentation: <a href=\"https:\/\/nexenta.com\/products\/documentation\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/nexenta.com\/products\/documentation<\/a><\/li><li>Support: <a href=\"https:\/\/support.nexenta.com\/Portallogin\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/support.nexenta.com\/Portallogin<\/a> (note the username must have a \".ti\" extension)<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-standard-hard-drives\">Standard hard drives<\/h1><p>This describes how to replace normal storage hard drives in the LIGO Nexenta system. This involves the <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Nexenta Management Viewer<\/a> (NMV) and the ZFS zpool CLI. Most of this procedure does not involve ZFS directly, since the NMV operations call ZFS commands under the hood.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-dell-self-dispatch\">Dell self-dispatch<\/h2><p>Request a self-dispatch for a disk on Dell TechDirect (<a href=\"https:\/\/techdirect.dell.com\/Portal\/CreateDispatch.aspx\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/techdirect.dell.com\/Portal\/CreateDispatch.aspx<\/a>). Previous dispatches are in the <a href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/product-support\/servicetag\/0-QjNhQjJXM3V5dlBCUkN4cVRQWmxrdz090\/overview\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"> server's history at Dell<\/a>.<\/p><p>Fill out a self-dispatch request. A template request is:<\/p><ul><li>Service tag: <span class=\"form-control sc-no-border\">GDH5P22<\/span><\/li><li>Description: disk failure<\/li><li>Troubleshooting performed: <span class=\"form-control sc-no-border\">One HDD failed out of ZFS pool due to disk failure. Requesting replacement HDD. See attached ZFS status file for degraded ZFS pool status.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p>The ZFS status log should be collected and attached (either by copy-pasting from the email alert into `cat &gt; $(date +%Y%m%d)-zpool-status-hdd.txt` locally, or generated on the Nexenta server itself via `zpool status work &gt; ~\/$(date +%Y%m%d)_zpool-status.txt` and SCPed).<\/p><p>Received email alerts that ZFS ZIL SSD was faulted and taken out of service: c0t5000A720300B74DDd0. This is the third of four ZIL log cache disks currently faulted (see SR1051892545) so the ZFS pool is in a degraded and potentially unstable state. Drive faults were verified in Nexenta NMV. Output of pool status is attached. Please see SR 1025854030 for a prior instance log cache drives being replaced on this system (the failed drives were ZeusRAM drives in that SR). The replacements in that previous SR were part number 5VHHG (2.5 WI SSD) and 2x 3PTKC (3.5 to 2.5 Carrier), due to unavailability of ZeusRAM drives.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-replace\">Replace<\/h2><ol><li>Identify the failed drives in NMV:<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<ol><li>The failed drives will appear as \"no lun (retired)\" in the slot specified by the NMV failure alert<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Flash the LEDs on the failed drives in NMV<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<\/li><li>Physically remove the failed drive<\/li><li><p>Confirm the drive is removed in NMV:<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<\/p><\/li><li><p>Install the new drive in the same slot as the removed failed drive<\/p><\/li><li><p>Confirm the new drive is recognized in NMV:<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<\/p><ol><li><p>The new drive will be in the same slot entry as the failed drive.<\/p><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><p>Record the new drive ID<\/p><\/li><li>If a hot spare has already taken over for a failed drive (and is resilvering\/resilvered), then:<ol><li>Detach the (offline) failed drive:<br>$ zpool detach work c0t5000C500629F1403d0 &amp;<\/li><li>Check that the failed drive is removed from the pool, and that the hot spare has taken its place (which will decrement the number of hot spares):<br>$ zpool status<\/li><li>Add the new disk as a new hot spare in NMV:<br>Data Management \u2192 Datasets \u2192 Volumes \u2192 Work \u2192 \"Hot Spares\" \u2192 select the newly-added disk \u2192 \"Apply\"<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>If the hot spare did not take over the failed drive, or there is some other issue with the drive, then:<ol><li>Software-replace the failed drive with the corresponding new drive ID in NMV:<br>Data Management \u2192 Datasets \u2192 Volumes \u2192 work \u2192 find the failed disk and select \"Replace the device\" \u2192 select the newly-added disk<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p>Repeat for each drive.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-verify\">Verify<\/h2><ul><li>Check the status of the pool:<br>$ zpool status<ul><li>If you added the new drive as a spare, there will be no resilvering.<\/li><li>If you added the new drive as a replacement for the failed drive, then the pool should start resilvering (rebuilding):<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><hr><h1 id=\"bkmrk-zfs-intel-log-%28zil%29-\">ZFS Intel Log (ZIL) Drives<\/h1><p>This describes how to replace the ZIL hard drives in the LIGO NAS Nexenta system. These drives are used for caching written data before syncing to the main storage pool; they are an intermediate that protects against data loss during an outage. They were initially discontinued ZeusRAM drives (flash with a capacitor in case of power failure), but are now entirely standard SSDs.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-dell-self-dispatch-1\">Dell self-dispatch<\/h2><p>Request a self-dispatch for a disk on Dell TechDirect (<a href=\"https:\/\/techdirect.dell.com\/Portal\/CreateDispatch.aspx\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/techdirect.dell.com\/Portal\/CreateDispatch.aspx<\/a>). Previous dispatches are in the <a href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/home\/en-us\/product-support\/servicetag\/0-QjNhQjJXM3V5dlBCUkN4cVRQWmxrdz090\/overview\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\"> server's history at Dell<\/a>. You may try on-lining the drive in NMV beforehand, which may or may not succeed depending on the drive's fault reason.<\/p><p>If onlining fails, then submit a self-dispatch. A template request is:<\/p><ul><li>Service tag: <span class=\"form-control sc-no-border\">GDH5P22<\/span><\/li><li>Description: <span class=\"scDataGrid\">Nexenta ZFS ZIL<\/span> disk failure<\/li><li>Troubleshooting performed: <span class=\"form-control sc-no-border\">Received email alert of a faulted ZFS L2ARC log cache drive. Drive fault verified in Nexenta NMV. Attempted to online the drive in ZFS, but this failed due to drive errors. Output of pool status is attached.<\/span><\/li><li>Replacement drive type: Solid State Drive \u2192 <span>SSD, 800GB, SAS, 2.5 inch, Read Intensive, SanDisk, (Enterprise Class)<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p>The ZFS status log should be collected and attached (either by copy-pasting from the email alert into `cat &gt; $(date +%Y%m%d)-zpool-status-hdd.txt` locally, or generated on the Nexenta server itself via `zpool status work &gt; ~\/$(date +%Y%m%d)_zpool-status.txt` and SCPed).<\/p><p>Received email alerts that ZFS ZIL SSD was faulted and taken out of service: c0t5000A720300B74DDd0. This is the third of four ZIL log cache disks currently faulted (see SR1051892545) so the ZFS pool is in a degraded and potentially unstable state. Drive faults were verified in Nexenta NMV. Output of pool status is attached. Please see SR 1025854030 for a prior instance log cache drives being replaced on this system (the failed drives were ZeusRAM drives in that SR). The replacements in that previous SR were part number 5VHHG (2.5 WI SSD) and 2x 3PTKC (3.5 to 2.5 Carrier), due to unavailability of ZeusRAM drives.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-prepare\">Prepare<\/h2><ul><li>Identify the failed drives:<br>$ zpool status &lt;pool name&gt;<br>$ cfgadm -al<\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-replace-1\">Replace<\/h2><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Disable syncing of the pool to the ZILs:<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zfs get -r sync &lt;pool name&gt;<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zfs set sync=disabled &lt;pool name&gt;<\/span><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Note: do this for each pool and subpool. The subpools may or may not inherit the sync status from the parent pool. Check each time with:<br>zfs get -r sync work<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Wait and check that there is zero IO to the ZILs using NMV - Settings - Disks, or through CLI:<br>zpool iostat &lt;pool name&gt; 1 <\/span><ul><li>Example iostat command to track the ZIL mirrors only:<br>zpool iostat | head -n 3 &amp;&amp; zpool iostat -v work 5 | egrep 'mirror'<\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">If there is still I\/O, that means ZIL is still being used, and some datasets still have sync=standard. <\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">This may take several minutes.<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Remove the ZIL device from the pool using NMV \u2013 Datasets. Select \"remove device\" button next to the ZIL. If this does not work, it can be done from command line with<br>zpool detach &lt;pool name&gt; &lt;device name&gt;<\/span><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">This may not work due to the device being \"in-use\" by the pool (even if there is no IO for it). If so, try:<br>zpool remove &lt;pool name&gt; &lt;device name&gt;<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Confirm the ZIL has been removed:<br>zpool status &lt;pool name&gt;<\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">If re-using the ZIL, you could unconfigure it, but this is not necessary:<br>cfgadm -al&nbsp; # get device name<\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">cfgadm -c unconfigure 'device'&nbsp; # using device name from cfgadm -al<\/span><\/li><li><p><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Otherwise, physically remove the ZIL and install the new disk.<\/span><\/p><\/li><\/ul><h2 style=\"margin-left: 0.0px;\" id=\"bkmrk-configure\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Configure<\/span><\/h2><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Use cfgadm to find the new disks:<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">cfgadm -al&nbsp; # the new disk may show up as \"configured\" even if it's new<br><\/span><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">If creating an entirely new ZIL mirror from two new disks, then do:<\/span><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Create one mirrored logging device from two replacement SSDs in NMV - S<\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">etup - Volume - &lt;pool name&gt; grow. Select the two SSDs, select mirror and log.<\/span><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Note: adding the mirror using `grow` may not work if the pool is still in-use. In that case, use:<br>zpool add work log mirror &lt; disk1 &gt; &lt;disk2&gt;<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">If adding a single new disk to an existing ZIL, then do:<\/span><ul><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Add the new disk to the existing ZIL:<br>zpool attach work &lt;new disk&gt; &lt;old disk&gt; <\/span><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Inspired from <a href=\"https:\/\/askubuntu.com\/a\/1303462\/931761\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/askubuntu.com\/a\/1303462\/931761<\/a><\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Reset the syncing to activate the new logging device:<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zfs get -r sync &lt;pool name&gt;<br><\/span><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">zfs set sync=standard &lt;pool name&gt;<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Repeat for each new mirror.<\/span><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-verify-1\">Verify<\/h2><ul><li>Check the status of the new mirror(s) with:<br>zpool status<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                        <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-comments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Comments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <table border=\"0\" width=\"100%\">\n                                                        <tr>\n                                <td>\n                                    <a name=\"comment-117670612\"><\/a>\n                                    <font class=\"smallfont\"><p>In order to be able to run the <strong><code>zpool detach<\/code><\/strong> command, you must ssh into the nexenta as <strong><code>admin<\/code><\/strong> rather than <strong><code>root<\/code><\/strong>.<\/p><p>Once you have a shell as the admin user, elevate to root using the <strong><code>su<\/code><\/strong> command.&nbsp; Then your <strong><code>zpool detach<\/code><\/strong> command will work.<\/p><\/font>\n                                    <div align=\"left\" class=\"smallfont\" style=\"color: #666666; width: 98%; margin-bottom: 10px;\">\n                                        <img src=\"images\/icons\/contenttypes\/comment_16.png\" height=\"16\" width=\"16\" border=\"0\" align=\"absmiddle\">\n                                        Posted by mrg225 at Oct 28, 2021 15:16\n                                    <\/div>\n                                <\/td>\n                            <\/tr>\n                                                    <\/table>\n                    <\/div>\n                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":67,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title is blank after consecutive number removal...Auto-Title applied: Ligo : LIGO - Network Layout (Including Hostnames/IPs)string(46390) "{"id":2885,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"Ligo : LIGO - (Including Hostnames\/IPs)<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo---networ-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo---networ-2\">\n                            Ligo : LIGO - Network Layout (Including Hostnames\/IPs)\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div This was after a blade swap with ex-0050, so maybe the reseating helped with the SEL errors.<\/li><li>It rebooted without problems, so I updated the BIOS and iDRAC firmware.<\/li><li>The server booted up, but did not have network connectivity. It was not recognized in Foreman and could not be rebuilt from Puppet.<ul><li>Running `ip addr show` did not show the em1 NIC<\/li><li>Syslog showed errors for em1:<br><span># \/var\/log\/messages<br><\/span>Network: Bringing up interface em1: Error: connection activation failed: no suitable device found for this connection (device lo is not available because device is strictly unmanaged)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>A new TSR showed that NIC 1 Port 2 was down (Port 1 was up)<\/li><li>I updated the NIC firmware and rebooted<\/li><li>The server had network connectivity and em1\/em2 showed up with `ip addr show`, but Puppet was failing. I rebooted the server, and Puppet ran successfully.<\/li><li>A new TSR showed that Port #2 was still down, but there were no errors.<\/li><li>I updated the node to be in-line with other compute nodes:<br>yum --exclude=*kernel*,*condor* update<\/li><li>Voltage errors returned. Motherboard replaced.<\/li><li>Server failed to PXE boot. The node needed to have its BIOS boot mode changed from UEFI to BIOS.<\/li><li>The server booted to OS. I requested a rebuild from Foreman, but this failed.<\/li><\/ul><h4 id=\"bkmrk-comp-ex-0165\">comp-ex-0165<\/h4><ul><li>CMC firmware update for CMC-3021HQ2 (<a href=\"https:\/\/10.136.30.121\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/10.136.30.121<\/a>):<ul><li>Following the procedure here: <a href=\"https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/kbdoc\/en-in\/000134801\/how-to-update-the-m1000e-components-from-the-cmc-web-interface\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/www.dell.com\/support\/kbdoc\/en-in\/000134801\/how-to-update-the-m1000e-components-from-the-cmc-web-interface<\/a><ul><li>Update the passive CMC<\/li><li>Failover the CMCs via Chassis Overview \u2192 Troubleshooting \u2192 Reset Components<\/li><li>Verify functionality<\/li><li>Update the newly-passive CMC<\/li><li>Failover the CMCs so the originally-active CMC is active again<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>After the CMC firmware update and server BIOS\/iDRAC update, the TSR showed no further errors and the system was attempting to PXE network boot. I cleared the SEL log. It was not recognized in Foreman.<\/li><li>I downloaded and mounted the SL7.8 network-install image from <a href=\"http:\/\/ftp.scientificlinux.org\/linux\/scientific\/7.8\/x86_64\/iso\/SL-7.8-x86_64-netinst.iso\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/ftp.scientificlinux.org\/linux\/scientific\/7.8\/x86_64\/iso\/SL-7.8-x86_64-netinst.iso<\/a>. I booted from the virtual ISO and began the installation.<\/li><li>Based on the NIC firmware from 0049, I cancelled the installation and instead updated the NIC firmware first. I restarted the ISO installation.<\/li><li>The ISO installation failed, and the PXE boot still failed. The node needed to have its BIOS boot mode changed from UEFI to BIOS.<\/li><li>The server booted to its OS (SL7.5). Puppet runs and yum-update would fail due to package conflicts. I requested a rebuild from Foreman, but this failed.<br><ul><li>It had an old subscription-manager activation key from Foreman (since it had missed the update that changed the key to <span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">CCV-LIGO_production_all<\/span>). I registered the server under the correct activation key:<br><p class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\"><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO_production_all\"<\/span><\/p><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">I deleted the Host from Foreman and re-registered the server (see <a href=\"Provisioning-LIGO-servers_63111169.html\">Provisioning LIGO servers<\/a>), but the rebuild still failed.<\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"ng-binding ng-scope\">I updated the system to SL7.8 and updated all other non-kernel packages. Like other compute nodes, I excluded the OSG-version of Condor due to configuration discrepancies. The server appears operational and can run Condor jobs again (as of 2021-02-19).<\/span><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":69,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                 <h1 id=\"bkmrk-update-staging\">Update Staging<\/h1><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"1\"><span DATE&gt;<br><br>Hello,<br><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span><p>The Penn State Gwave computing cluster is scheduled for maintenance &lt;ENTER DATE&gt;. The maintenance will begin at &lt;START TIME&gt; and is expected to conclude by &lt;END TIME&gt;.<\/p><p><br>This will include &lt;SUMMARIZE UPDATE ITEMS&gt;. The following services will be unavailable during this window:<\/p><ul><li>HTCondor (jobs will be temporarily held immediately before the maintenance window)<\/li><li>SSH access to <a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>&lt;ANY OTHER ITEMS&gt;<\/li><\/ul><p>Please contact me if you have any questions.<\/p><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br><\/span><\/span><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-qa-node\">QA node<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"5\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Update a QA node<br><\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"6\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Debug<\/span><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br><\/span><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-download-on-producti\">Download on production nodes<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"7\">Promote desired Foreman CCV from QA to Production lifecycle environment<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"8\">Download the packages on all nodes (<a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/update-download.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">update-download<\/a> playbook)<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-tasks-for-the-day-be\">Tasks for the day before maintenance<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"9\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Send reminder email the day before maintenance. Title: <span class=\"_15gqBTUta5ZVWkGNTkvx90\">PSU Gwave Cluster maintenance on &lt;DATE&gt;<\/span><br><\/span><p>Hello,<br><br>This is a reminder that the PSU Gwave cluster maintenance will begin tomorrow at &lt;START TIME&gt; until &lt;END TIME&gt;. Any condor jobs that are still running will be held during this window and will be resumed afterwards.<br>I will send an update once the maintenance is complete.<br><br><\/p><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"10\">Schedule downtime in nagios to stop alert notifications on <a href=\"http:\/\/docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:8080\/nagios\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:8080\/nagios\/<\/a>: Host Groups \u2192 Compute \u2192 Schedule downtime for all services in this hostgroup (select 'Schedule Downtime For Hosts Too' at the bottom)<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-update\">Update<\/h1><p>First update a fraction of the complete condor pool: the condor manager, one login node, and a quarter of the compute nodes (see Partial deployment). After debugging any issues and running health checks, proceed with the rest of the cluster (Full deployment) and any other maintenance tasks.<\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"669\">Refresh Condor repo in Foreman: <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/products\/2\/repositories\/96\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/products\/2\/repositories\/96<\/a><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"670\">Check for Condor 9.0.10 package here: <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pulp\/repos\/LIGO\/Library\/custom\/LSC-Stack\/HTCondor\/Packages\/c\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pulp\/repos\/LIGO\/Library\/custom\/LSC-Stack\/HTCondor\/Packages\/c\/<\/a><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"673\">If so, recreate CCV-LIGO and promote to QA to test in parallel to the regular update<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-partial-deployment\">Partial deployment<\/h3><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"449\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Hold all Condor jobs (repeatedly, since some jobs have PERIODIC_RELEASE enabled):<br>while true; do condor_hold -all; sleep 30; done<\/span><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"450\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Update subset of condor pool (<a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/update-drain-reboot.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">update-drain-reboot<\/a> playbook):<br><\/span><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"125698102\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"451\"><span Title contains numbers at the end: LIGO RPM repositories for system install 150340210
string(10319) "{"id":2890,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"LIGO RPM repositories for system install","slug":"ligo-rpm-repositories-for-system-install","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-rpm-repo\">Ligo : LIGO RPM repositories for system install<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operational-Guides_15271632.html\">Operational Guides<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-rpm-repo-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-rpm-repo-2\">\n                            Ligo : LIGO RPM repositories for system install\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span>, last modified on Apr 05, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-we-use-the-same-http\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>We use the same HTTP server for node images for LIGO as we do for production RC repos.&nbsp; We use repos.2e.hpc.psu.edu as the repo server in both cases.&nbsp; For more info on RC repos see: <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=125698060\">How to update or add repositories for RC (provisioning)<\/a><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-updating-repos-on-re\">Updating repos on repos.2e.hpc.psu.edu<\/h2><p>login to the repo server and become root.&nbsp; Run the ligo sync script:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[root@repos ~]# \/storage\/icds\/tools\/sbin\/syncrepos-ligo\nSyncing Ligo repos...\nSyncing ligo-github_git-lfs....\nUpdating Subscription Management repositories.\n.\n.\n.\nSyncing Rocky8-baseos....\nUpdating Subscription Management repositories.\nRocky Linux 8 - BaseOS                           16 kB\/s | 4.3 kB     00:00\nRocky Linux 8 - BaseOS                          2.7 MB\/s |  13 MB     00:04\nSyncing Rocky8-powertools....\nUpdating Subscription Management repositories.\nRocky Linux 8 - PowerTools                      479  B\/s | 4.8 kB     00:10\nRocky Linux 8 - PowerTools                      1.1 MB\/s | 6.1 MB     00:05\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>This should sync stuff from the internet to the repos we have laid out under \/storage\/repos\/live\/ligo.&nbsp; We'll want to create a snapshot to point the installs to.&nbsp; From prodsch I do:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[gbs35@prodsch ~]$ \/storage\/icds\/tools\/sbin\/vsnapshots.py -c Repos -p \/xcat_install\/repos -e never\nPassword for svc_2e_vast:\nCreated snapshot:\n+------+---------------------------+------------------------------------------------+---------------------+-----------------------------+----------------------+----------+\n|   ID | Name                      | Title                                          | Path                | Created                     | Expiration           | Locked   |\n+======+===========================+================================================+=====================+=============================+======================+==========+\n|  809 | Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32 | Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32(\/xcat_install\/repos) | \/xcat_install\/repos | 2023-04-05T17:07:33.033761Z | 3000-01-01T00:00:00Z | False    |\n+------+---------------------------+------------------------------------------------+---------------------+-----------------------------+----------------------+----------+\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>You'll need to enter the 2E Vast service account password from Lastpass and it'll take a snapshot.&nbsp; In this case Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32 is the name of the snapshot.&nbsp; Now we need to create the directory to use for LIGO stuff.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Normally the LIGO stuff looks under \/storage\/repos\/ligoprod.&nbsp; Before we update that we'll create a ligotest directory with symlinks to the proper snapshot to do this I did:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[root@repos ~]# cd \/storage\/repos\n[root@repos repos]# rm -rf ligotest; mkdir ligotest\n[root@repos repos]# cd ligotest\/\n[root@repos ligotest]# \/storage\/icds\/tools\/sbin\/set-ligo-repos Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\nlinking to ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/...\n[root@repos ligotest]# ls -alF\ntotal 0\ndrwxr-xr-x  2 root root 4096 Apr  5 13:18 .\/\ndrwxr-xr-x 35 root root 4096 Apr  5 13:17 ..\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   65 Apr  5 13:18 Rocky8-appstream -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/Rocky8-appstream\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   62 Apr  5 13:18 Rocky8-baseos -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/Rocky8-baseos\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   61 Apr  5 13:18 Rocky8-devel -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/Rocky8-devel\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   66 Apr  5 13:18 Rocky8-powertools -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/Rocky8-powertools\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   54 Apr  5 13:18 cuda -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/cuda-rhel8\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   49 Apr  5 13:18 epel -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/epel8\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   54 Apr  5 13:18 iDRAC -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/iDRACTools\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   54 Apr  5 13:18 icds_stuff -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/icds_stuff\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   57 Apr  5 13:18 influxdb -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/influxdb\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   68 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-github_git-lfs -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-github_git-lfs\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   75 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-github_git-lfs-source -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-github_git-lfs-source\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   62 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-htcondor -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-htcondor\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   67 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-lsc_backports -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-lsc_backports\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   62 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-lsc_epel -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-lsc_epel\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   65 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-lsc_pegasus -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-lsc_pegasus\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   68 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-lsc_production -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-lsc_production\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   65 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-lsc_testing -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-lsc_testing\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   57 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-osg -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-osg\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   64 Apr  5 13:18 ligo-shibboleth -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/ligo-shibboleth\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   53 Apr  5 13:18 xcat-core -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/xcat-core\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   52 Apr  5 13:18 xcat-dep -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/xcat-dep\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   52 Apr  5 13:18 zfs -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/zfs\/\nlrwxrwxrwx  1 root root   57 Apr  5 13:18 zfs-kmod -&gt; ..\/.snapshot\/Repos-2023-04-05_13.07.32\/live\/ligo\/zfs-kmod\/\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Once we feel good about these repos, we can copy ligotest to ligoprod like:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[root@repos ~]# cd \/storage\/repos\n[root@repos ~]# rm -rf ligopostprod\n[root@repos ~]# mv ligoprod ligopostprod\n[root@repos ~]# cp -a ligotest ligoprod<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>The LIGO RPM repos are now updated and available to build images on LIGO<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":73,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

              <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-hardware-repl-2\">\n                            Ligo : Hardware Replacement Procedure\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Feb 04, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-%28see-also-creating-o\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>(See also <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=18225340\">Creating Operational Service Reports (OSRs)<\/a> for general hardware Jira instructions.)<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Any hardware debugging and replacement should be recorded in <a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/secure\/Dashboard.jspa\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Jira<\/a>, using the `LIGO` label in the ticket.<\/p><p>All LIGO-related tickets can be viewed with these filters:<\/p><p><a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/issues\/?filter=12201\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Open tickets<\/a>:  <\/p><div class=\"jim-error-message jim-error-message-table\">\n    <table class=\"aui\">\n        <tbody>\n                <tr><\/tr>\n\n        <tr>\n                            <th>type<\/th>\n                            <th>key<\/th>\n                            <th>summary<\/th>\n                            <th>assignee<\/th>\n                            <th>reporter<\/th>\n                            <th>priority<\/th>\n                            <th>status<\/th>\n                            <th>resolution<\/th>\n                            <th>created<\/th>\n                            <th>updated<\/th>\n                            <th>due<\/th>\n                    <\/tr>\n\n        <tr>\n            <td colspan=\"11\">\n                <div class=\"aui-message aui-message-warning\">\n                    <p class=\"message\">\n                        <span class=\"icon-in-pdf\"><\/span>\n                        Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.\n                    <\/p>\n                     <a class=\"jira-link\" href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/secure\/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&amp;jqlQuery=filter%3D12201&amp;src=confmacro\">View these issues in Jira<\/a>                 <\/div>\n            <\/td>\n        <\/tr>\n        <\/tbody>\n    <\/table>\n<\/div>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/issues\/?filter=12600\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Closed tickets<\/a>:  <\/p><div class=\"jim-error-message jim-error-message-table\">\n    <table class=\"aui\">\n        <tbody>\n                <tr><\/tr>\n\n        <tr>\n                            <th>type<\/th>\n                            <th>key<\/th>\n                            <th>summary<\/th>\n                            <th>assignee<\/th>\n                            <th>reporter<\/th>\n                            <th>priority<\/th>\n                            <th>status<\/th>\n                            <th>resolution<\/th>\n                            <th>created<\/th>\n                            <th>updated<\/th>\n                            <th>due<\/th>\n                    <\/tr>\n\n        <tr>\n            <td colspan=\"11\">\n                <div class=\"aui-message aui-message-warning\">\n                    <p class=\"message\">\n                        <span class=\"icon-in-pdf\"><\/span>\n                        Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.\n                    <\/p>\n                     <a class=\"jira-link\" href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/secure\/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&amp;jqlQuery=filter%3D12600+&amp;src=confmacro\">View these issues in Jira<\/a>                 <\/div>\n            <\/td>\n        <\/tr>\n        <\/tbody>\n    <\/table>\n<\/div>\n<p><br><\/p><p>Non-hardware issues should be recorded in the <a href=\"Cluster-Operations-Maintenance-Log_78807468.html\">Cluster Operations Maintenance Log<\/a>.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-scan-for-hardware-is\">Scan for hardware issues<\/h2><ul><li>The <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/idrac_getsel.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">idrac_getsel playbook<\/a> can be used to scan for LIGO cluster issues by running this command from within the `ligo_puppet_control_repo\/ansible` folder:<br>ansible-playbook --ask-vault-pass -f 128 -i production playbooks\/idrac_getsel.yml --extra-vars lookback_days=30<ul><li>Change `lookback_days=X` to scan for issues within the last X days)<\/li><li>This writes the error, service tag, and node name for node with warning\/critical errors in the last X days<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-create-a-jira-ticket\">Create a Jira ticket (fields that are not listed are optional)<\/h2><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Field<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Value<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Project<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">\"Roar Operations and Support (SUPPORT)\"<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Issue Type<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">\"Service Report\"<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Summary<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">&lt;node hostname and service tag&gt; (e.g. \"comp-ex-0129 2YN0HQ2\")<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Assignee<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Select `Assign to me` to begin; change this whenever updating the ticket workflow<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Date of error<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">&lt;the date from the Service Event Log&gt;<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Error Reported<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">&lt;Text from the Service Event Log&gt;<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Rack Location<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>One of the LIGO racks. This is not displayed from iDRAC, so go based on the node number:<br>AW30: comp-ex-00{01-48}<br>AW31: 49-96<br>AW32: 96-144<br>(no AW 33)<br>AW34: 145-186, all admin servers<br>AW35: Nexenta server and enclosures<\/p><\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Service Tag<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">&lt;input from idrac_getsel playbook output&gt;<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Troubleshooting Completed<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">a description of the most recent troubleshooting (e.g. \"Node drained and powered off\"). Update this whenever changing the ticket workflow with the most recent troubleshooting step performed<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Node Name<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">hostname of the server (e.g. \"comp-ex-0001\"). This will already exist for nodes that have had previous errors, so type the name and select the previous one if it exists<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Labels<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">\"LIGO\"<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Component Type<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">type of hardware that is suspected to be faulty<\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-ticket-workflow\">Ticket workflow<\/h2><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"wrapped confluenceTable\"><colgroup><col><col><col><col><\/colgroup><tbody><tr><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Name<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Status<\/th><th colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTh\">When to change<\/th><th class=\"confluenceTh\">Ticket Assignee<\/th><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Open<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">ticket was just created<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">after node is drained\/shutdown<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">operations tech<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\"><p>Waiting For Tech<\/p><\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">node has been drained, shut down, and is ready for maintenance<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">after the first round of maintenance is completed and\/or a parts dispatch is submitted<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">hardware tech<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Waiting On Vendor<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">a parts dispatch has been approved<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">after the parts have been installed<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">operations or hardware tech<\/td><\/tr><tr><td class=\"confluenceTd\">Verify<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">the parts have been installed and the node powers on<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">after the node is confirmed to POST properly (move to Under Observation) or fails to POST (move to Waiting For Tech\/Vendor)<\/td><td class=\"confluenceTd\">operations or hardware tech<\/td><\/tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">Under Observation<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">node POSTs and appears functional<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">after a week of uptime without issues<\/td><td colspan=\"1\" class=\"confluenceTd\">operations tech<\/td><\/tr><\/tbody><\/table><\/div><p><br><\/p><p>Conventions<\/p><ul><li>If a node has multiple errors, create separate tickets and address the most major one (e.g. motherboard failure) first<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n There are <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/tree\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">playbooks in Git<\/a> for utilities such as checking CVMFS mounts and rebooting servers that are in OOM.<\/p><ul><li>To run a basic command, use the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/run_cmd.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">run_cmd playbook<\/a>. The syntax to run, for example, `hostname -i` on all execute servers is:<br>ansible-playbook --ask-vault-pass -l execute playbooks\/run_cmd.yml -e '{\"cmd\":\"hostname -i\"}'<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li>&nbsp;Debugging local ansible issues<br><ul><li>SSH failure:<ul><li>An error may occur during the first run of a playbook when connecting to remote hosts: \"Using a SSH password instead of a key is not possible because Host Key checking is enabled and sshpass does not support this. Please add this host's fingerprint to your known_hosts file to manage this host.\"<\/li><li>This can be avoided by creating an ansible.cfg startup file with the following entry and running the playbook from the .cfg directory:<br>[defaults]<br>remote_tmp = \/tmp\/$USER\/.ansible\/tmp<br>host_key_checking = False<br>inventory = production<br>... or by entering $ export ANSIBLE_HOSTKEY_CHECKING=False.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":75,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:55.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

`nohup.out` files sometimes have restrictive permissions that prevents their transfer as root. `nohup.out` is a temporary logging file for the user to track, e.g., the output from Makefile, and string(10021) "{"id":2895,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 01 27 RHEL7 sudo security patch","slug":"2021-01-27-rhel7-sudo-security-patch","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-01-27-rh\">Ligo : 2021-01-27 RHEL7 sudo security patch<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                             <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-01-27-rh-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-01-27-rh-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-01-27 RHEL7 sudo security patch\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Feb 01, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-a-security-exploit-i\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>A security exploit issue for RHEL7\/8 was announced on LIGO and OSG mailing lists.<\/p><p>See the <a href=\"https:\/\/nvd.nist.gov\/vuln\/detail\/CVE-2021-3156\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">official issue<\/a> and OSG's security email below:<\/p><blockquote><p>Dear <span class=\"markeqzpg8k1j\">OSG<\/span> <span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">Security<\/span> Contacts,<br><br>A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability that could lead to privilege escalation described in CVE-2021-3156 [1] has been discovered in 'sudo' [2]. The vulnerable code was introduced in July 2011 and affects all legacy versions of sudo from v1.8.2 to v1.8.31p2, and all stable versions from v1.9.0 to v1.9.5p1, using default configurations. The <span class=\"markeqzpg8k1j\">OSG<\/span> <span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">Security<\/span> team considers this vulnerability to be of CRITICAL severity.<br><br>Patched Versions:<br><br>RHEL\/CentOS7: sudo-1.8.23-10.el7_9.1 [3][4]<br>RHEL\/CentOS8: sudo-1.8.29-6.el8_3.1 [5]<br><br>Other operating systems and distributions are also likely to be exploitable.<br><br>WHAT ARE THE VULNERABILITIES:<br>The vulnerability is exploitable by any local user. The attacker does not need to know the user's password, nor be a part of any sudoers list. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to privilege escalation.<br><br>WHAT YOU SHOULD DO:<br>How to Check: As a non-root user account, run the following:<br>sudoedit -s '\\' `perl -e 'print \"A\" x 65536'`<br>A vulnerable system will segfault or show a similar error indicating memory corruption.<br><br>If your system has local user accounts, update to the latest version of 'sudo' available for your operating system. After updating, run the command in \"How to Check\" above to verify the patch. If a patch is not yet available for your system, a mitigation using 'systemtap' has been described in the RedHat announcement for this issue [2]. The <span class=\"markeqzpg8k1j\">OSG<\/span> <span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">Security<\/span> team recommends updating as soon as possible.<br><br>RELATED LINKS<br><a title=\"Original URL: https:\/\/wiki.egi.eu\/wiki\/SVG:Advisory-SVG-CVE-2021-3156. Click or tap if you trust this link.\" href=\"https:\/\/nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com\/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwiki.egi.eu%2Fwiki%2FSVG%3AAdvisory-SVG-CVE-2021-3156&amp;data=04%7C01%7Cbfc5288%40psu.edu%7Cc0a229e1bddd4dbd309608d8c303c87c%7C7cf48d453ddb4389a9c1c115526eb52e%7C0%7C0%7C637473768393866910%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&amp;sdata=%2FryUaqKNiLMJyNNltPvbaywi1Itmx%2Fw38h%2FKBuvo%2Blk%3D&amp;reserved=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/wiki.egi.eu\/wiki\/SVG:Advisory-SVG-CVE-2021-3156<\/a><br><a href=\"https:\/\/ubuntu.com\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/ubuntu.com\/<\/a><span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">security<\/span>\/CVE-2021-3156<br>https:\/\/<span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">security<\/span>-<a href=\"http:\/\/tracker.debian.org\/tracker\/CVE-2021-3156\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">tracker.debian.org\/tracker\/CVE-2021-3156<\/a><br><a href=\"http:\/\/mirror.centos.org\/centos-8\/8\/BaseOS\/x86_64\/os\/Packages\/?C=M;O=D\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/mirror.centos.org\/centos-8\/8\/BaseOS\/x86_64\/os\/Packages\/?C=M;O=D<\/a><br><br>REFERENCES<br>[1] <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/<\/a><span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">security<\/span>\/cve\/CVE-2021-3156<br>[2] <a href=\"https:\/\/blog.qualys.com\/vulnerabilities-research\/2021\/01\/26\/cve-2021-3156-heap-based-buffer-overflow-in-sudo-baron-samedit\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/blog.qualys.com\/vulnerabilities-research\/2021\/01\/26\/cve-2021-3156-heap-based-buffer-overflow-in-sudo-baron-samedit<\/a><br>[3] <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/errata\/RHSA-2021:0221\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/errata\/RHSA-2021:0221<\/a><br>[4] <a href=\"https:\/\/lists.centos.org\/pipermail\/centos-announce\/2021-January\/048252.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/lists.centos.org\/pipermail\/centos-announce\/2021-January\/048252.html<\/a><br>[5] <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/errata\/RHSA-2021:0218\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/errata\/RHSA-2021:0218<\/a> (RHEL8)<br>[6] <a href=\"http:\/\/mirror.centos.org\/centos-8\/8\/BaseOS\/x86_64\/os\/Packages\/?C=M;O=D\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/mirror.centos.org\/centos-8\/8\/BaseOS\/x86_64\/os\/Packages\/?C=M;O=D<\/a><br><br>Please contact the <span class=\"markeqzpg8k1j\">OSG<\/span> <span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">security<\/span> team immediately at <span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">security<\/span> at <a href=\"http:\/\/opensciencegrid.org\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">opensciencegrid.org<\/a> if you have any questions or concerns.<br><br><span class=\"markeqzpg8k1j\">OSG<\/span> <span class=\"markbm6tgb8je\">Security<\/span> Team<\/p><\/blockquote><h3 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-servers\">LIGO servers<\/h3><ul><li>The LIGO servers needed to be patched, as they showed vulnerability:<br># sudoedit -s '\\' `perl -e 'print \"A\" x 65536'`<br>Segmentation fault<\/li><li>The patch was installed via yum (the package was already available through the SL repo, so no Foreman deployment was necessary), for all servers on the network (compute, login, docker, condor-admin, foreman, RTDB, nat, and test compute)<\/li><li>The patch was verified:<br># sudoedit -s '\\' `perl -e 'print \"A\" x 65536'`<br>usage: sudoedit [-AknS] [-r role] [-t type] [-C num] [-g group] [-h host] [-p prompt] [-T timeout] [-u user] file ...<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-stewart-%28lenovo-mini\">Stewart (Lenovo mini-summit)<\/h3><p>Since the Lenovo mini-summit machine is not in a repository manager, it needed to be patched via a local rpm.<\/p><ul><li>Stewart did not have network access to the source rpm (at <a href=\"https:\/\/centos.pkgs.org\/7\/centos-updates-x86_64\/sudo-1.8.23-10.el7_9.1.x86_64.rpm.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/centos.pkgs.org\/7\/centos-updates-x86_64\/sudo-1.8.23-10.el7_9.1.x86_64.rpm.html<\/a>)<\/li><li>The rpm was downloaded onto a LIGO server and then moved to Stewart via the \/ligo\/analysis-1\/ NFS mount<\/li><li>The rpm was installed via yum:<br>yum localinstall \/gpfs\/summit\/LIGO\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/sudo-1.8.23-10.el7_9.1.x86_64.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/gstlalcbc\/sudo-1.8.23-10.el7_9.1.x86_64.rpm<\/a><\/li><li>The patch was verified:<br># sudoedit -s '\\' `perl -e 'print \"A\" x 65536'`<br>usage: sudoedit [-AknS] [-r role] [-t type] [-C num] [-g group] [-h host] [-p prompt] [-T timeout] [-u user] file ...<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n modified on Jan 13, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-chad-hanna-and-the-l\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Chad Hanna and the LIGO group reported that ssh was not working, \/home directories were not loading, and that they couldn't access files.<\/p><p>The system was pingable, and Gary was able to SSH in, but with an extended waiting time (5+ minutes). Gary found that the storage said that a license had expired, but this ended up not being part of the issue.<\/p><p>Eric connected to the active NAS server (10.136.28.101) and restarted the system, which resolved the problem. However, failover from stor-nas-001a over to stor-nas001b did <strong>not<\/strong> occur as expected, so there was an file system outage.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Related issue: <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=58621953\">2019-11-05 LIGO Storage Storage\/CNFS Issue<\/a><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":79,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:56.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:56.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
