               <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"106627090.html\">LIGO R&amp;D Projects<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Real-Time-Data-Analysis_106627094.html\">Real-Time Data Analysis<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-dell-poweredg-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-dell-poweredg-2\">\n                            Ligo : Dell PowerEdge R840 Database\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jul 20, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-page-covers-the\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>This page covers the initial provisioning of the R840 server (the Real Time DataBase \"RTDB\") in Nov\/Dec 2019. This was not tracked in Puppet\/Foreman and so became unsustainable and defunct; this page remains as history and pointers for future configurations.<\/p><p><strong>Initial Setup<\/strong><\/p><ul><li>Apply RAID 1 to the two 500 GB SSDs<\/li><li>OS setup<ul><li>Start a remote console through iDRAC<\/li><li>Mount a local ISO (Scientific Linux 7.7) via Connect Virtual Media. Note that the NICs were not accessible, so it had to be the offline ISO<\/li><li>Boot from the ISO via Boot - Virtual CD\/DVD\/ISO<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>OS configuration<ul><li>Remove any partitions<\/li><li>Disable kdump<\/li><li>Minimal installation, with tools for: Debugging, Development, Security, and Sysadmin<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Hostname rtdb-01.ligo.gwave (RealTime DataBase)<\/li><li>Changing root password to match the rest of the LIGO nodes<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Network Configuration<\/strong><\/p><p>The two NICs were not recognized by the system as they were labeled as unsupported. To work around this, the following two files were edited (<strong>bold<\/strong> for edits):<\/p><ol><li>\/etc\/sysconfig\/grub<br><span class=\"TextRun BCX2 SCXO41291556\" style=\"color: windowtext;\"><span class=\"NormalTextRun BCX2 SCXO41291556\">GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=\"<span class=\"TextRun SCXO77006903 BCX2\" style=\"color: windowtext;\"><strong><span class=\"SpellingError SCXO77006903 BCX2\">ixgbe.allow_unsupported_sfp<\/span><\/strong><span class=\"NormalTextRun SCXO77006903 BCX2\"><strong>=1<\/strong> ... \"<\/span><\/span><br><\/span><\/span><\/li><li>\/etc\/modprobe.d\/ixgbe.conf\/<br><strong>options ixgbe allow_unsupported_sfp=1<\/strong><\/li><\/ol><p>See <a href=\"http:\/\/people.binf.ku.dk\/~hanne\/b2evolution\/blogs\/index.php\/2015\/03\/04\/ixgbe-failed-to-load-because\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">here<\/a> for this fix.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Network Bonding<\/strong><\/p><p>For combined network capacity and failover, the two NICs (em1 and em2) were bonded using 802.3ad Dynamic link aggregation (mode 4). A bonding profile and two slave profiles (one for each NIC) were created, following the procedure outlined <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/documentation\/en-us\/red_hat_enterprise_linux\/7\/html\/networking_guide\/sec-Network_Bonding_Using_the_Command_Line_Interface\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">here<\/a> and the parameters <a href=\"https:\/\/access.redhat.com\/documentation\/en-us\/red_hat_enterprise_linux\/7\/html\/networking_guide\/sec-using_channel_bonding\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">here<\/a>. For more detail about bonding protocols, see, e.g., <a href=\"https:\/\/serverfault.com\/questions\/446911\/what-are-the-differences-between-channel-bonding-modes-in-linux\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stackexchange<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.linuxfoundation.org\/networking\/bonding\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">linuxfoundation<\/a>.<\/p><ol><li>Start the bonding service:<br>$ modprobe bonding<br>$ lsmod | grep bonding<\/li><li>Create the bonding profile at \/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts\/ifcfg-bond0<br><br><code>DEVICE=bond0<\/code><br><code>NAME=bond0<\/code><br><code>TYPE=Bond<\/code><br><code>BONDING_MASTER=yes<\/code><br><code>IPADDR=10.136.28.240<br>DNS1=128.118.25.3<br>DNS2=130.203.1.4<br>GATEWAY=10.136.29.254<br>MTU=1500<\/code><br><code>PREFIX=23<\/code><br><code>ONBOOT=yes<\/code><br><code>BOOTPROTO=none<\/code><br><code>BONDING_OPTS=\"miimon=100 mode=4\"<\/code><br><code>NM_CONTROLLED=\"no\"<\/code><br><code>IPV6INIT=no<\/code><br><br>Note: miimon specifies how often (in ms) MII link monitoring occurs. The IP prefix was obtained from the subnet of another 10.136.28.X node.<\/li><li>Create the bonding slave profiles, one for each NIC. These files are identical except for the first two lines (em1 and bond0-slave1 for the first NIC; em2 and bond0-slave2 for the second NIC): \/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts\/ifcfg-em1<br><br><code>DEVICE=em1<\/code><br><code>NAME=bond0-slave1<\/code><br><code>TYPE=Ethernet<\/code><br><code>BOOTPROTO=none<\/code><br><code>ONBOOT=yes<\/code><br><code>MASTER=bond0<\/code><br><code>SLAVE=yes<\/code><br><code>NM_CONTROLLED=\"no\"<br><br><\/code><\/li><li>Start the slaves and the bonding:<br><code>$ ifup em1<\/code><br><code>$ ifup em2<\/code><br><code>$ ifup bond0<\/code><\/li><li>Check the status of the network bond:<br><code>$ more \/proc\/net\/bonding\/bond0<\/code><br><code>$ more \/sys\/class\/net\/bonding_masters<\/code><br><code>$ ip link<\/code><\/li><\/ol><p><strong>NVME RAID Configuration<\/strong><\/p><p>The six 4TB NVME drives were configured for RAID 10 (three mirrors) for performance (6x read, 3x write). Some of these steps are outlined <a href=\"http:\/\/xmodulo.com\/setup-raid10-linux.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">online<\/a>.<\/p><ol><li>Using mdadm:<ol><li>Install <a href=\"https:\/\/linux.die.net\/man\/8\/mdadm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">mdadm<\/a>.<\/li><li>Check status of drives: <code>$ mdadm -E \/dev\/nvme[0-5]n1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #since RAID isn't setup yet, this should say 'No md superblock detected on \/dev\/\/nvme[0-5]n1'<\/code><\/li><li>Create the RAID array as <code>md0<\/code>: <code>$ mdadm --create --verbose \/dev\/md0 --level=10 --raid-devices=6 \/dev\/nvme[0-5]n1 --spare-devices=0<\/code><\/li><li>Watch status: <code>$ watch mdadm --detail \/dev\/md0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #the 'Resync Status' completion will be progressing<br><\/code><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>After mdadm finishes setup, provision the file system (XFS):<br><ol><li><code>$ mkfs -t xfs \/dev\/md0<\/code><\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><p><strong>CA Certificates<\/strong><\/p><p>The <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/SEC\/Certificates\">ICDS procedure<\/a> for setting up certificates was followed, with some modifications.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Registration with Foreman <\/strong><\/p><ul><li>Activation keys:<br>rpm -Uvh <a href=\"http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/pub\/katello-ca-consumer-latest.noarch.rpm<\/a><br>subscription-manager register --org=\"LIGO\" --activationkey=\"CCV-LIGO\"<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-raid-reconfiguration\">RAID Reconfiguration<\/h3><p>SSD RAID configuration (unchanged)<\/p><ul><li>BIOS Settings:<ul><li>N\/A<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Device Settings:<ul><li>AHCI Slot 3: BOSS-S1:<ul><li>RAID 1<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p>NVMe RAID configuraiton<\/p><ul><li>BIOS Settings:<ul><li>SATA settings: Embedded SATA \u2192 RAID Mode. Reboot.<\/li><li>NVMe settings: NVMe Mode \u2192 RAID<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Device Settings:<ul><li>Dell EMC PERC S140<ul><li>Controller Management \u2192 Convert to RAID Capable Disk \u2192 Windows RAID \u2192 NVMe \u2192 Select All \u2192 Apply<\/li><li>Virtual Disk Management \u2192 Create Virtual Disk \u2192 RAID 5<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":80,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:56.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:56.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

string(7336) "{"id":2900,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"LIGO Collaboration Services","slug":"ligo-collaboration-services","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-collabor\">Ligo : LIGO Collaboration Services<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-ligo-r%26d-p-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"106627090.html\">LIGO R&amp;D Projects<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-collabor-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-collabor-2\">\n                            Ligo : LIGO Collaboration Services\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on May 03, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-how-to-documentation\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>How-to documentation for miscellaneous services for the LIGO Collaboration.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-international-gravit\">International Gravitational Wave Network (IGWN) Computing Wiki (public)<\/h2><p>The GWave cluster has public-facing documentation at the <a href=\"https:\/\/computing.docs.ligo.org\/guide\/computing-centres\/psu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">International Gravitational Wave Network (IGWN) wiki<\/a>.<\/p><p>To make changes to the wiki, you will need `Developer` access to the LIGO Gitlab repo <a href=\"https:\/\/git.ligo.org\/computing\/guide\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.ligo.org\/computing\/guide<\/a>.<\/p><ul><li>Clone the repo, and make any PSU GWave edits in `guide\/docs\/cc\/psu.md`<\/li><li>To view your changes as generated html docs, you will need to replicate the Gitlab html build CI locally. This can be done with pip and conda:<br>conda create --name gitlab-ci python=3.7<br>conda activate gitlab-ci<br>cd guide<br>python -m pip install -r requirements.txt<br>mkdocs build --strict --verbose<br><ul><li>mkdocs will display any errors in the changes. Once there are no errors, the resulting html files are viewable in `guide\/site\/`<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-low-latency-rep\">LIGO Low-Latency replay data streams<\/h2><p>The GWave cluster is configured to receive old gravitational wave data that is being \"replayed\" continuously for the purposes of testing analysis pipelines.<\/p><p>See the <a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/DASWG\/O3Replay\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">LIGO Wiki entry<\/a> for more details.<\/p><p>Checking the status of the stream for enabled nodes (currently, the login nodes and ex-0183 and 0184): `watch -n 0.5 smlist`<\/p><p>For more detailed documentation, see <a href=\"Real-Time-Data-Analysis_106627094.html\">Real-Time Data Analysis<\/a>.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-file-sharing-for-lig\">File sharing for LIGO users<\/h2><p>Users can allow other LIGO collaborators (who have LIGO credentials, but don't have a cluster account) to view files in their LIGO home directory (\/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/user.name\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/user.name\/<\/a>) on the cluster via the ldas-jobs shared userdir service. <\/p><p>Viewable files are contained in \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a><a href=\"http:\/\/user.name\/public_html\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">user.name\/public_html\/<\/a>, with permissions:<\/p><ul><li>775 for public_html\/<\/li><li>at least 711 for <a href=\"http:\/\/user.name\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">user.name\/<\/a><\/li><li>at least +r for files in public_html\/<\/li><\/ul><p>For a given user.name, the files can be viewed online at https:\/\/ldas-jobs.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/~user.name\/<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-querying-ldap-server\">Querying LDAP server ldap.ligo.org<\/h2><p>LIGO IAM intended to begin requiring any LDAP queries to be authenticated on 2021-08-23. The two Gwave login servers query LDAP to allow LIGO users to SSH using their LIGO credentials (see <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/hiera\/role\/login.yaml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">SSSD puppet config<\/a>); this is recorded on the <a href=\"https:\/\/docs.google.com\/spreadsheets\/d\/1sMOuXmQKvrD8odALI4OIEalsgYYpduYKNTp6APFP1C8\/edit#gid=0\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">LDAP query spreadsheet<\/a>.<\/p><p>In advance of this, a kerberos keytab was installed as an LDAP authn mechanism (see&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/AuthProject\/Ldapbind\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">keytab guide<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/git.ligo.org\/computing\/helpdesk\/-\/issues\/1333\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">keytab request<\/a>, and <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/commit\/b004b3579ccb6dcb56084494d677135545d37e97\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">installation commit<\/a>). The keytab allowed for successful queries but is currently untested for sssd query requests since the authn rollout was delayed.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":83,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:56.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:56.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                                          <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-gwave-1.5-%2F-c-2\">\n                            Ligo : Gwave 1.5 \/ CC Star \/ xCAT project Testing and Verification\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-ross-mick\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Ross Mickens<\/span> on Jan 17, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-is-an-outline-o\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <div class=\"panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"panelContent\">\n<p>This is an outline of items to ensure a systematic approach to the bring-up and configuration of the xCAT system components.&nbsp;<\/p><p>These include:<\/p><ol><li>compute nodes<\/li><li>Switch reconfiguration<\/li><li>Storage additions<\/li><\/ol><p>The goal is to ensure the functional state of each subcomponent as we build on layers of complexity.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Assumptions<\/p><p>1) Nodes and switches are racked and cabled in an organized and described manner<\/p><p>2) Storage elements are in place&nbsp;<\/p>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><p><style type=\"text\/css\">\/*<![CDATA[*\/\ndiv.rbtoc1689171755187 {padding: 0px;}\ndiv.rbtoc1689171755187 ul {margin-left: 0px;}\ndiv.rbtoc1689171755187 li {margin-left: 0px;padding-left: 0px;}\n\n\/*]]>*\/<\/style><\/p><div class=\"toc-macro rbtoc1689171755187\">\n<ul class=\"toc-indentation\">\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-network-functional%3A%C2%A0\">Network Functional:<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-compute-functional%3A\">Compute Functional:<\/a>\n<ul class=\"toc-indentation\">\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-first-portion\">First Portion<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-second-portion\">Second Portion<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-storage-additions%3A\">Storage Additions:<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-vendor-criteria-deta\">Vendor Criteria details<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-burn-in\">Burn-in<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-service-nodes-transi\">Service Nodes transition to xCAT support (Post-release)<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"#bkmrk-next-steps\">Next Steps<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<\/div><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-network-functional%3A%C2%A0\">Network Functional:&nbsp;<\/h1><p>Ethernet switches are being moved to new rack locations. We want to ensure the names, ips and DNS reflect the new positions.&nbsp;<\/p><p>We need to verify the changes (old IDs do not work, and new ID do work) in:<\/p><ol><li>xCAT tables (switches, switch, nodepos, object removal\/addition)<\/li><li>prodxcat's DNS<\/li><li>PSU DNS (* )<\/li><li>Switch Config details<\/li><\/ol><h1 id=\"bkmrk-compute-functional%3A\">Compute Functional:<\/h1><p>Compute nodes are reachable and show all hardware components.<\/p><p>The first part of this list are items that are only needed for the initial compute node bring-up.&nbsp;<\/p><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">The second part of this list is items that will be used during any changes to system firmware or system tools (xCAT, ipmitool, racadm).&nbsp;<\/p><h2 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-first-portion\">First Portion<\/h2><ol><li>onsite: verify power on and no Amber lights&nbsp;<\/li><li>leaf switches \u2013 detect uplinks on ports per leaf switch (Rob See)<\/li><li>power cycle nodes to launch pxe with xcat discovery<\/li><li>boot into genesis image<\/li><li>nodes pingable in genesis<\/li><li>idracs reachable from xCAT<\/li><li>idracs permissions valid for xCAT server (i.e. rinv)<\/li><li>nic to name convention (udev rules)<\/li><\/ol><h2 id=\"bkmrk-second-portion\">Second Portion<\/h2><ol><li>BMC OOB test cases (), stuff like rvitals output or rinv node firm and ensure all useful information is displayed<ol><li>xCAT Remote Power (rpower)Confluent nodepower<\/li><li>xCAT Remote Vitals (rvitals) Confluent nodesensors<\/li><li>xCAT Remote Beacon (rbeacon) Confluent nodeidentify<\/li><li>xCAT Remote Inventory (rinv) Confluent nodeinventory<\/li><li>xCAT Remote Inventory (rinv firmware data) Confluent nodefirmware<\/li><li>xCAT Remote Console - SOL (including POST) Confluent nodeconsole (including POST)<\/li><li>xCAT rspreset Confluent nodebmcreset<\/li><li>xCAT reventlog Confluent nodeeventlog<\/li><li>xCAT rsetboot Confluent nodeboot Confluent nodesetboot<\/li><li>xCAT rspconfig Confluent nodeconfig Confluent nodehealth Confluent nodemedia<\/li><li>xCAT SNMP trap verification (This is not needed if we have another SNMP trap target)<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>in-band parallel command test cases (xCAT plus others)<ol><li>psh, pscp, pping, fping, prsync<\/li><li>ssh keys with xCAT mgt node<\/li><li>other permissions<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>boot nodes into the stateless image (The details below only apply if the current compute image doesn't work)<ol><li><s>need to include IB install and function check at this level as well (assume adding IB to the stateless image)<\/s><ol><li><s>Does IB link at the correct speeds, bus width, etc.&nbsp;<\/s><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>syslog configuration<\/li><li>Console log<\/li><li>Image contains all packages<ol><li>rpm -qa standard list of pacakges<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Image agents are running properly<ol><li>ps -ef or systemctl<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Configuration updates<ol><li>SNMP config file, etc<\/li><li>Network config updates (post script changes)<\/li><li>How do we manage this list of configuration files that might be changed<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Security-related logging<ol><li>splunk agent<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>duo 2FA<ol><li>this will need to be checked manually against the node image<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>EAD, authentication and least privilege&nbsp;<ol><li>log in with a low-level account and attempt to elevate (sudo)<\/li><li>authentication<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>storage mounts including home, work, group, scratch<ol><li>how is it mounted (nfs, native, etc)<\/li><li>need to detail how to change mounts to the VAST location<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Consistency check - firmware, OS, Kernel, image build, dmidecode, \/proc, hyperthreading<ol><li>NHC updates should cover this<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Add nodes to Scheduler (HT Condor )<\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-storage-additions%3A\">Storage Additions:<\/h1><p>This is an additional IP connection to the VAST storage.&nbsp;<\/p><p>Can we use compute node to begin the transfer of data from nextena to the VAST location<\/p><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-vendor-criteria-deta\">Vendor Criteria details<\/h1><p>Identifying hardware problems as early as possible is important to allow for warranty service before launch.<\/p><p>We expect compute nodes to be consistent across node types, particularly hardware configuration and firmware levels.<\/p><p>This list only applies to the initial node bring-up, or in the case of a node replacement.<\/p><p>Portions of these items only apply later as they pertain to verifying nodes are aligned to the correct\/current code levels. This is captured in the Functional items above.<\/p><ol><li>uEFI<\/li><li>iDRAC<\/li><li>Memory and CPU config<\/li><li>Network devices (ethernet adapters, iDRAC network)<\/li><li>HDDs<ol><li>Configure local disk storage ( \/localscratch )<\/li><li>health checks<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li><s>IB devices<\/s><\/li><li>dmidecode checks (CPU microcode levels)<\/li><li>Storage connectivity (VAST, Lenovo GPFS)<\/li><li>Service Tag Configuration Audit (particularly on hardware changes or replacements)<\/li><li>Node Health Check Integration ?<\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-burn-in\">Burn-in<\/h1><p>Introduce load to verify hardware behavior under load.&nbsp;<span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\">In particular, we want to look at CPU, Memory, and network on a per-node basis.<\/span><\/p><p><s>Local storage is less important as we are running stateless node images.&nbsp;<\/s><\/p><p><s>This list will be used during any changes to the Best Recipe or Gold OS image.<\/s><\/p><p>Use discretion to avoid test cases that will not apply. This is meant as a tool kit of all possible test scenarios, but only those that apply to a particular change can be used.<\/p><ol><li><s>Functional Throughput test for IB<\/s><ol><li><s>ib_write_bw testing<\/s><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Local LinPack or MPI to stress CPU and memory (Ron)<\/li><li>Storage<ol><li>HDD stress test (maybe not stress but a review of SMART data)<\/li><li>Network file system access (1GB\/s home and work, 2.5GB\/s group)<\/li><li>GPFS file system connectivity<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Power Cycle test<ol><li>With hardware consistency check (This is achieved incidentally as we work through other aspects of configuration - be mindful of errors or boot failures)&nbsp;<\/li><li>limit to response rate (e.g. turn off\/on when I send them)<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>network link status<\/li><li>network link failover test (delayed until network moved to redundant model)<\/li><li>network bandwidth test&nbsp;<\/li><li><s>IB stress test<\/s><\/li><li>HTCondor Job test<ol><li><s>Can SLURM do node health checks during regular business between jobs?<\/s><\/li><li><s>CPU Linpack run<\/s><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>GPU Job Test <s>Linpack, power consumption<\/s><\/li><li><s>Rack Level Power Consumption measurements<\/s><\/li><li><p>Acceptance: Ron Tapia and Chad Hanna<\/p><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-service-nodes-transi\">Service Nodes transition to xCAT support (Post-release)&nbsp;<\/h1><p>This is where we will break out the various nodes for separate functions and test the installation and function of additional services.&nbsp;<\/p><p>This should also include redundancy checks per the requirements for High Availability of services.<\/p><ol><li>Login\/submit Nodes<\/li><li>docker<\/li><li>stashcache<\/li><li>rtdb<\/li><li>web<\/li><li>Monitoring and Administration tools<\/li><\/ol><h1 id=\"bkmrk-next-steps\">Next Steps<\/h1><ul><li>Detail descriptions of tools and expected outcomes for each item.<\/li><li>Detail process procedures.<\/li><li>Discuss signoff\/handoff to Operations<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n string(7846) "{"id":2904,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 06 10 Replacing ZeusRAM drives on NAS","slug":"2020-06-10-replacing-zeusram-drives-on-nas","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-10-re\">Ligo : 2020-06-10 Replacing ZeusRAM drives on NAS<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-10-re-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-10-re-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-06-10 Replacing ZeusRAM drives on NAS\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Feb 17, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-i-followed-the-proce\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>I followed the <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/LIGO\/Nexenta+Drive+Replacement\" rel=\"nofollow\">procedure<\/a>&nbsp;for replacing ZILs for the two failed ZeusRAM drives.<\/p><p>Before:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>I tested write performance on head and execute nodes:<br>LABEL=ex&nbsp; #the node label: ex(ecute) or hd(head)<br>TEST=100x1M_{write\/write_nocache}&nbsp; <br>for x in {1..10}; do dd if=\/dev\/zero of=\/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/dd.out\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/dd.out<\/a> bs=1M count=100 <strong>oflag=dsync<\/strong> &amp;&gt;&gt; \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/nas_profiling\/log_enabled\/20200610_%24%7BLABEL%7D_%24%7BTEST%7D_nocache.out\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/nas_profiling\/log_enabled\/20200610_${LABEL}_${TEST}_nocache.out<\/a>; sleep 10; done;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #omit oflag to use cache<\/li><li>...and read:<br>TEST=100x1M_read_nocache<br>echo 3 | sudo tee \/proc\/sys\/vm\/drop_caches&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; #clear RAM cache of dd.out file<br>for x in {1..10}; do dd if=\/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/dd.out\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/dd.out<\/a> of=\/dev\/null bs=1M count=100 &amp;&gt;&gt; \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/nas_profiling\/20200610_%24%7BLABEL%7D_%24%7BTEST%7D.out\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/bfc5288\/nas_profiling\/20200610_${LABEL}_${TEST}.out<\/a>; sleep 10; done;<\/li><\/ul><p>Removing failed drives:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>I disabled logging as described in the procedure:<br>zfs set sync=disabled work<\/li><li>I monitored the IO to the ZILs using<br>zpool iostat | head -n 3 &amp;&amp; zpool iostat -v work 5 | egrep 'mirror'<ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>The ZIL IO decreased but was nonzero, so in the meantime I installed the two 900GB SSDs into JBOD2 tray 2 slots 5 and 8 (matching the cache drives in both Tray 1s in JBOD1 &amp; 2). I did not configure these yet.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>I removed the failed drives, which removed the two previous ZeusRAM mirrors, leaving the two remaining ZeusRAM drives as separate ZILs.<\/li><\/ul><p>Creating a new log mirror from the new SSDs:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>I installed the two 400GB SSDs in place of the removed ZeusRAM drives. I created a log mirror from the two drives:<br>zpool add work log mirror c3t58CE38EE20B4EC72d0 c3t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0<\/li><\/ul><p><span class=\"confluence-anchor-link\" id=\"bkmrk--2\"><\/span> <a href=\"#bkmrk--2\">ZeusRAM ZILs<\/a>: creating a new log mirror from the old, but functional, ZeusRAM drives:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>After ~30 minutes zpool iostat and NMV continued to display decreased, but nonzero, IO.<ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>I attempted to do zpool-detach, but this failed since they still belonged to the pool.<\/li><li>I did zpool-remove instead, which removed the the drives from the pool.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>I created a new log mirror for the two drives:<br>zpool add work log mirror c0t5000A720300B74DDd0 c0t5000A720300B74DEd0<\/li><li>I verified that the new mirrors were recognized and functional using zpool-status and zpool-iostat.<\/li><\/ul><p>Afterwards:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>I found that the logging was not fully disabled (hence the reduced, but nonzero, IO to the ZILs throughout the procedure):<br>$ zfs get -r sync work<br><p><code>work sync disabled local<\/code><br><code>work\/.nza-reserve sync disabled inherited from work<\/code><br><code>work\/CIFS sync standard local<\/code><br><code>work\/nfs sync standard local<\/code><br><code>work\/nfs\/ligo sync standard local<\/code><\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>Note: work logging was disabled, but it was still enabled for work\/nfs\/ligo.<\/li><li>I disabled logging for each group<br>zfs set sync=disabled work\/nfs\/ligo ....<\/li><li>I verified that this brought the IO to the new ZILs to zero.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>While logging was disabled, I tested read\/write performance on head and execute nodes.<\/li><li>I reenabled logging:<br>zfs set sync=standard work<br>zfs set sync=standard work\/nfs<br>zfs set sync=standard work\/nfs\/ligo<\/li><li>I tested read\/write performance on head and execute nodes.<\/li><li>I added the two 900GB SSDs as L2ARC caches. This could not be done with NMV (the settings wouldn't update) so instead with CLI:<br>zpool add work cache c3t58CE38EE2070F72Ed0<br>zpool add work cache c3t58CE38EE2070F75Ed0<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":87,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

Title contains numbers at the end: CCStar Execute Node Config Notes 131370027
string(10424) "{"id":2907,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"CCStar Execute Node Config Notes","slug":"ccstar-execute-node-config-notes","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ccstar-execut\">Ligo : CCStar Execute Node Config Notes<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-cluster-de-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Cluster-Design_15271629.html\">Cluster Design<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ccstar-execut-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ccstar-execut-2\">\n                            Ligo : CCStar Execute Node Config Notes\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-ron-tapia\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Ron Tapia<\/span>, last modified on Feb 02, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-files-needed-are\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The files needed are gathered under ~ron.tapia\/ccstar on the ligo cluster.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-ssd\">ssd<\/h2><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; 1. sssd is installed<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; 2. copy sssd.conf<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;on comp-ex-0186:<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; cd \/etc\/sssd<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; scp sssd.conf root@<a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0183\/etc\/sssd\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0183:\/etc\/sssd\/<\/a><br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;on comp-ex-0193:<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; systemctl restart sssd<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; yum install oddjob-mkhomedir<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; authselect select --force sssd with-mkhomedir&nbsp;<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; systemctl enable --now oddjobd.service<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;yum install sssd-krb5.x86_64<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;yum install sssd-ldap.x86_64<br><br>I was able to login to<code> comp-ex-0183<\/code> as ron.tapia using my LIGO credentials. I'm not sure if <code>sssd-krb5<\/code> is required.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-cvmfs\">CVMFS<\/h2><ol><li>updated \/etc\/yum.repos.d\/ligo.repo (<code>~ccstar\/ligo.repo<\/code>)<\/li><li>Installed cvmfs<\/li><li>gathered config in <code>~\/ccstar\/ccstar.cvmfs.tgz<\/code><\/li><\/ol><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On comp-ex-0183:<br><br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; yum install cvmfs cvmfs-config-osg cvmfs-x509-helper<br>cd \/etc\/condor\/config.d<br>tar xvzf \/tmp\/ccstar.cvmfs.tgz<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;cvmfs_config setup<br><br><a href=\"http:\/\/stashcache.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">stashcache.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a> was not resolving, so I had to add it to \/etc\/hosts<br>This should not be necessary when using the normal nameserver.<\/p><p>Once I ran `ligo-proxy-init ron.tapia` to get an x509 certificate, I was able to access frame data via CVMFS. It wasn't without the proxy (good!)<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-testing-cvmfs\">Testing CVMFS<\/h2><p><br><\/p><p>A basic test is:<\/p><p><br><\/p><pre>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ls &nbsp; \/cvmfs\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.osgstorage.org\/test_access\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.osgstorage.org\/test_access\/<\/a><\/pre><p><br><\/p><p>That should be accessible to anybody. To test the ability to read LIGO frames, you need a LIGO login.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-condor\">Condor<\/h2><ol><li>Copied \/usr\/local\/bin\/* from comp-ex-0186.<\/li><li>Edited <a href=\"http:\/\/genCondorConfig.pl\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">genCondorConfig.pl<\/a> to add ccstar config.<\/li><li>Copied the updated version to ~\/ccstar\/<a href=\"http:\/\/genCondorConfig.pl\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">genCondorConfig.pl<\/a>.ccstar<\/li><\/ol><p>yum install &nbsp;condor condor-classads condor-externals condor-procd python3-condor&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>Condor configuration:<\/p><p>00_config_local.config &nbsp; -- general config&nbsp;<br>00-htcondor-9.0.config &nbsp; -- comes with condor, commented out \"use security:recommended_v9_0\"<br>01_execute.config &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;-- congirure as \"execute node\"<br>10-llnode.conf &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; -- redundant, sets \"use ROLE:Execute\", but that is done in 01_execute.config.&nbsp;<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Other commands are overridden by 99_nopreempt.config (\"use POLICY:Always_Run_Jobs\")<br>10-security.config &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; -- security stuff, mentions: \/etc\/condor\/passwords.d\/POOL<br>20_slot_weight.config &nbsp; &nbsp;-- would have to parse<br>60_job_memory.config &nbsp; &nbsp; -- sets RESERVED_MEMORY and RESERVED_SWAP, also \"CGROUP_MEMORY_LIMIT_POLICY = soft\"<br>70-singularity.conf &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;-- basic singularity config<br>70-test_label.config &nbsp; &nbsp; -- hmm<br>99_nopreempt.config &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;-- sets \"use POLICY:Always_Run_Jobs\"<br>99_z_gwave.config &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;-- extra config<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I tar'd everything on a random execute node to ~\/ccstar\/condor.config.d.tgz. On comp-ex-0183, I did:<\/p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; cd \/etc\/condor\/config.d\/<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; tar xvzf \/tmp\/condor.config.d.tgz<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; rm 10-llnode.conf 70-test_label.config<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; rm *~<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; systemctl daemon-reload<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; systemctl enable condor<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; systemctl start condor<\/p><p>Condor &nbsp;was not able to start because it couldn't resolve <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ad-001.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ad-001.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>. I added it to \/etc\/hosts.<\/p><p>The condor config expects a \/localscratch directory:<\/p><pre>[root@comp-ex-0186 ~]# ls -al \/localscratch\/<br>total 4<br>drwxr-xr-x. &nbsp;4 root &nbsp; root &nbsp; &nbsp; 33 Jul &nbsp;8 &nbsp;2022 .<br>dr-xr-xr-x. 21 root &nbsp; root &nbsp; 4096 Jan &nbsp;6 16:25 ..<br>drwxr-xr-x. &nbsp;5 condor condor &nbsp; 52 May 14 &nbsp;2021 condor<\/pre><p><br><\/p><p>The node name should have a leading zero, so I set the node name:<\/p><p>hostnamectl --transient set-hostname comp-ex-0183<br><br>At this point, I was able to see the ccstar node in the cluster. On comp-hd-001:<\/p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; comp-hd-001:~\/ccstar&gt; condor_status | grep comp-ex-0183<br><a href=\"mailto:slot1@comp-ex-0183.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; slot1@comp-ex-0183.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a> &nbsp; &nbsp;LINUX &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;X86_64 Unclaimed Benchmarking &nbsp;0.000 183839 &nbsp;0+00:00:00<br><br><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-testing-condor\">Testing Condor<\/h2><p><br><\/p><p>I was able to succesfully run a job on comp-ex-0183 using condor. At first I had trouble reading frames, but that was because my x509 certificate is in:<\/p><p><br><\/p><pre>       \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/ron.tapia\/.ligoproxy\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/ron.tapia\/.ligoproxy<\/a><br><br><\/pre><p>This would have worked on a machine with a shared \/ligo\/home directory.<\/p><p>I modified my job so that it transferred the proxy file and told condor where to find it and then I was able to read frames.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-singularity\">Singularity<\/h2><p><br><\/p><p>yum install apptainer.x86_64<br>yum install tzdata<br><br><\/p><p>I did not change \/etc\/apptainer\/apptainer.conf. It looked very similar to \/etc\/singularity\/singularity.conf on the old execute nodes.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-testing-singularity\">Testing Singularity<\/h2><p>I was able to successfully run a test job that reads frames running under the container: \/cvmfs\/<a href=\"http:\/\/singularity.opensciencegrid.org\/lscsoft\/gstlal:master\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">singularity.opensciencegrid.org\/lscsoft\/gstlal:master<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>My test jobs are under &nbsp;<\/p><p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ~ron.tapia<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/ron.tapia\/ccstar\/test_job\/test-01\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">\/ccstar\/test_job\/test-01<\/a><br><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":90,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 05 12 NFS Hard Mount test 78807226
string(7176) "{"id":2908,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 05 12 NFS Hard Mount test","slug":"2020-05-12-nfs-hard-mount-test","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-05-12-nf\">Ligo : 2020-05-12 NFS Hard Mount test<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-05-12-nf-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-05-12-nf-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-05-12 NFS Hard Mount test\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on May 19, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-this-was-a-test-of-c\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>This was a test of changing the LIGO NFS mount settings from soft to hard to resolve IO errors resulting from file corruption problems (empty files being written when filled files are required during workflows).<\/p><p><br><\/p><hr><p>2020-05-08<\/p><p>I offlined six nodes for testing (condor draining\/off and disabling puppet).<\/p><p>Procedure:<\/p><ul><li>I edited \/etc\/auto.ligohome on these nodes to change the soft mount option to hard.<\/li><li>I unmounted NFS manually for the two ligohome directories:<br>umount -fl stor-nas-001.gwave.ics.psu.<a href=\"http:\/\/edu\/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/home\/dce.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">edu:\/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/home\/dce.psu.edu<\/a><br>umount -fl stor-nas-001.gwave.ics.psu.<a href=\"http:\/\/edu\/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/home\/ligo.org\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">edu:\/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/home\/ligo.org<\/a><\/li><li>I reloaded the ligohome directories, which mounted them through autofs:<br>less \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/<\/a><br>less \/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/dce.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">dce.psu.edu\/<\/a><\/li><li>I checked that the hard mount option was live with `nfsstat -m`.<\/li><li>The change took a few minutes to propagate, during which time home directory files couldn't be accessed.<\/li><li>I onlined the six nodes.<\/li><\/ul><p>I created <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/ligohome_remount.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Ansible<\/a> <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/ligohome_check.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">playbooks<\/a> to automate these changes and check NFS mount options.<\/p><ul><li>I used these playbooks to set hard mounts for all compute nodes (but not login nodes). Users and jobs were not interrupted.<\/li><li>I left one core workflow running over the weekend.<ul><li>Note the core workflows now experience IO errors when they reach ~75% completion (which is when IO-intensive jobs begin running), presumably due to the ongoing NFS rebuild since these workflows didn't receive as many IO errors before the rebuild began.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><hr><p>2020-05-12<\/p><p>I planned with a grad student (\"GS\") to run a different IO-heavy workflow alongside the core workflow at 16:00.<\/p><p>I had another grad student prepare a different workflow to submit around 14:00. The core analysis reached ~75% completion but wasn't receiving IO errors. But, the grad student started getting IO errors around 14:30.<\/p><ul><li>I suspected she was running on a head node, which she confirmed. This indicated that the hard mounts were likely solving the IO errors since the core workflow continued without any errors or job failures.<\/li><li>Other users were having issues on the head nodes (e.g., git-pull not working, logging in\/out, hanging file editors)<\/li><li>One user built a workflow on a head node and submitted it to compute, but it failed. This was due to an ImportError, presumably because the build on the head node failed.<\/li><li>I had another user submit an already-built workflow, which ran without errors alongside the core workflow.<\/li><\/ul><p>At this point, it was clear that the hard mount was stopping the IO errors that would have otherwise been occurring on compute nodes. The head nodes were still on soft mount, so they were susceptible to IO errors since NFS was being used intensively by the running workflows.<\/p><p>I changed the head nodes to have hard mounts, which stopped the IO errors for users. I proceeded with the test of GS's workflow alongside the core workflow around 16:30, which both completed without any errors.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>As of 5\/19\/2020, numerous other workflows have run&nbsp;(including four simultaneously), and no IO errors, corrupt files, or hanging sessions have been reported.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":91,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

<\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n
