                            <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-17-nf-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-17-nf-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-06-17 NFS and Login01 maintenance\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Oct 26, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-i-cleared-out-the-%7E1\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>I cleared out the ~15TB that were written during the <a href=\"2020-06-15-Login01-Condor-and-NFS-rapidly-filling_78807714.html\">2020-06-15 Login01 Condor and NFS rapidly filling<\/a> event:<\/p><ul><li>cd \/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/apps\/cvmfs\/<\/li><li>UNNEEDED_DIRS=$(ls -latr | awk '{ if( $6 == \"Jun\" &amp;&amp; $7 &gt;= 14 &amp;&amp; $7 &lt; 16) print $9 }')<\/li><li>for i in $UNNEEDED_DIRS; do echo $i &gt;&gt; ~\/removed_caches.txt; rm -rf $i &amp; done<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p>But, issues were still present:<\/p><ul><li>Most of the running DAGs (~7 out of ~10) were proceeding very slowly, or failing due to being unable to connect to NFS:Error from <a href=\"mailto:slot1_1@comp-ex-0154.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">slot1_1@comp-ex-0154.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>: Failed to open '\/ligo\/home\/<a href=\"http:\/\/ligo.org\/rachael.huxford\/O3\/snr_chi2_o3b\/all_bins_mutli_dag\/relaunch_env\/logs\/gstlal_save_lnpdf_snr_chisq_41A02-14816539-0.out\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">ligo.org\/rachael.huxford\/O3\/snr_chi2_o3b\/all_bins_mutli_dag\/relaunch_env\/logs\/gstlal_save_lnpdf_snr_chisq_41A02-14816539-0.out<\/a>' as standard output: No such file or directory (errno 2)<br>And:<br><br># ShadowLog<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): Can no longer talk to condor_starter &lt;10.136.29.161:9618&gt;<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): Trying to reconnect to disconnected job<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): LastJobLeaseRenewal: 1592414014 Wed Jun 17 13:13:34 2020<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): JobLeaseDuration: 2400 seconds<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): JobLeaseDuration remaining: EXPIRED!<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): Reconnect FAILED: Job disconnected too long: JobLeaseDuration (2400 seconds) expired<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): Exiting with JOB_SHOULD_REQUEUE<br>06\/17\/20 14:12:44 (14818946.0) (443527): **** condor_shadow (condor_SHADOW) pid 443527 EXITING WITH STATUS 107<br><br><\/li><li>I suspected the nodes had stale NFS mounts or a related lingering issue from the NFS event, so I tried remounting NFS:<ul><li>Many (~half at any one time) of the nodes were not responding to Ansible-ssh (for checking CVMFS and for remounting NFS)<\/li><li>I tried draining these nodes and then doing Ansible-ssh, but the problem jumped to other nodes after the draining.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>The NFS server had this log entry on June 15 after the event:<pre>Connect failed: IO::Socket::INET: connect: timeout nfs<\/pre><\/li><\/ul><p>Because of this, I decided to remount NFS on the client nodes and restart NFS (failover to 02a).<\/p><p>I also decided to reboot login01 concurrently since it began having issues communicating with execute nodes through Condor (see above) that began during the NFS event.<\/p><p>Procedure:<\/p><p>Login01:<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>shutdown node<\/li><li>wait for NFS to failover to 02a<\/li><li>boot node after nfs failover is complete<\/li><\/ul><p>NFS<\/p><ul style=\"list-style-type: square;\"><li>reboot 02b after login01 has shut down<\/li><li>wait for NFS to failover to 02a (automatic)<\/li><li>remount clients (execute nodes) after failover is complete<\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><hr><h2 id=\"bkmrk-2020-08-11-actual-ca\">2020-08-11 Actual cause of the data writes<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-revisiting-the-issue\">Revisiting the issue<\/h3><p>After speaking with another graduate student, it turns out that the core gstlal_pipeline analyses normally write ~10-15 TB during the analysis, which is then reduced to 3-8 TB at the end of the analysis. So, even though this analysis (a subthreshold search for BNSs) was not their core pipeline analysis, the analysis output of ~15 TB is not unusual. So, I hypothesized that those 15 TBs were likely just normal intermediate data output, not erroneous frame caching.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-true-cause-of-the-is\">True cause of the issue<\/h3><p>I confirmed this hypothesis by checking the NFS disk map, which showed ~13 TB contained in an intermediate data directory (IFO injections):<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image confluence-thumbnail\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"250\" src=\"attachments\/78807743\/87326770.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/78807743\/87326770.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"87326770\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"2020-08-11_BE_13TB_usage.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"78807743\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"3\"><\/span><\/p><p>I checked with the graduate student running the analysis, and it turns out that they had specified a much larger IFO injection bank than normal. This is likely the cause of the huge IFO injection directories \u2013 an analysis with the usual injection bank would have written much less of these files.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-resolution-of-the-is\">Resolution of the issue<\/h3><p>We cleaned up the entire analysis directory so the grad student could rerun the analysis. We coordinated the rerun after the grad student fixed IFO injection banks, and the analysis ran to completion and cleanup without huge disk usage.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                                            <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-attachments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Attachments:<\/h2>\n                        <\/div>\n\n                        <div class=\"greybox\" align=\"left\">\n                                                            <img src=\"images\/icons\/bullet_blue.gif\" height=\"8\" width=\"8\" alt=\"\">\n                                <a href=\"attachments\/78807743\/87326770.png\">2020-08-11_BE_13TB_usage.png<\/a> (image\/png)\n                                <br>\n                                                    <\/div>\n                    <\/div>\n                    \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":92,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 07 13 Resolving collectd hostname reporting issue 106135591
string(4820) "{"id":2910,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 07 13 Resolving collectd hostname reporting issue","slug":"2021-07-13-resolving-collectd-hostname-reporting-issue","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-07-13-re\">Ligo : 2021-07-13 Resolving collectd hostname reporting issue<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-07-13-re-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-07-13-re-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-07-13 Resolving collectd hostname reporting issue\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Jul 13, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-hosts-would-sometime\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><p>Hosts would sometimes send collectd metrics with partially uppercase domain characters (e.g., comp-ex-0182.gwave.PSU.edu instead of comp-....-.gwave.psu.edu). This could sometimes happen after a reboot; the root cause wasn't determined. This would cause missing dashboard data for the server in Grafana, and would cause the averaged cluster dashboards to be incorrect since the uppercase domain servers would be omitted from the average.<\/p><p>Potential solutions could be to add regex filters to each dashboard in Grafana, or reconfigure the metrics in Influxdb, but these would require a lot of tooling and wouldn't resolve the root cause. So, I tested out reconfiguring the collectd hostname:<\/p><ul><li>I manually specified the collectd hostname on one node that had the uppercase domain issue (ex-0182):<br>[root@comp-ex-0182 bfc5288]# sed -i \"s\/.*#Hostname.*\/Hostname \\\"${HOSTNAME}\\\"\/g\" \/etc\/collectd.conf &amp;&amp; systemctl restart collectd<br>[root@comp-ex-0182 bfc5288]# grep 'Hostname' \/etc\/collectd.conf<br>Hostname \"<a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0182.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0182.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>\"<\/li><li>This caused the server to again report metrics from the lowercase hostname, so it showed up in InfluxDB\/Grafana again. So, I added these changes to the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/profile\/collectd.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">collectd config entry in Puppet<\/a> (as cdhostnameconf to create a new collectd.d\/ file).<\/li><li>Servers began reporting correctly<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":93,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: LIGO System Monitoring 87326993
string(14079) "{"id":2911,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"LIGO System Monitoring","slug":"ligo-system-monitoring","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-system-m\">Ligo : LIGO System Monitoring<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-administra-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Administrative-Information_15271685.html\">Administrative Information<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-system-m-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-ligo-system-m-2\">\n                            Ligo : LIGO System Monitoring\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Sep 13, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-monitoring-servicest\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-monitoring-services\">Monitoring Services<\/h1><p>The PSU LIGO cluster is monitored via Grafana (Collectd-InfluxDB-Grafana stack) and DUC. The services are provided via a <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/foreman01-images\/-\/tree\/master\/httpd-host\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">custom webserver container<\/a> that hosts Grafana, DUC disk usage, and a userdir service to share home directory files with the LIGO collaboration. Routing is provided via a reverse proxy from the external foreman01 server hostname through to the internal docker01 server hostname.<\/p><p>General Puppet status can be monitored using <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Foreman<\/a>.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-grafana%3A-cluster-sta\">Grafana: Cluster Status, Usage, and Storage<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-access\">Access<\/h3><ul><li>Via the LIGO VPN: <a href=\"https:\/\/10.136.29.192:3000\/grafana\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/10.136.29.192:3000\/grafana\/<\/a><\/li><li>Via LIGO shibboleth authentication (including users at PSU and other institutions): <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.ext.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/grafana\/dashboards\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.ext.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/grafana\/dashboards<\/a><ul><li>For admin\/dev users: accounts must be made individually by an admin, and the user can then sign up for access using the invite link<\/li><li>LIGO-authenticated users: accounts are generated automatically through Shibboleth when a new user logs in<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-design\">Design<\/h3><p>The instance of Grafana is provided by a <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images\/-\/tree\/master\/grafana\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">customized Grafana container<\/a>. The database is provided by a <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images\/-\/tree\/master\/influxdb\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">customized Influxdb container<\/a>. Metrics are gathered via collectd installed on each node (configured in a <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/psu_ligo\/-\/blob\/development\/manifests\/profile\/collectd.pp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Puppet profile<\/a>).<\/p><p>There are three main folders of dashboards to fit different purposes:<\/p><ul><li>`Admin`: development dashboards, for admin-users only<\/li><li>`Dev`:&nbsp; development dashboards, for admin- and editor-users only<\/li><li>`General`: production dashboards, for all users and LIGO-authenticated users. Note: these dashboards are in \"production\" as they are visible to any LIGO-authenticated user<\/li><\/ul><p>To deploy new production dashboards, the general workflow is:<\/p><ul><li>Experiment with your dashboard in `Admin` or `Dev`<\/li><li>Finalize your changes in `Admin` or `Dev`<\/li><li>To deploy a new dashboard (not an individual panel):<ul><li>Go to your development dashboard's settings<\/li><li>Select Save As... \u2192 (select `General` in the Folder dropdown) \u2192 Save<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>To deploy individual panel(s) to the production dashboards:<ul><li>Go to your development dashboard<\/li><li>Click on the panel you want to deploy \u2192 select `More` \u2192 select `Copy`<\/li><li>Go to the desired production dashboard<\/li><li>Click `Add panel` (upper right) \u2192 select `Paste copied panel`<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-other\">Other<\/h3><ul><li>Issues:<ul><li>Accessing dashboards with LIGO-auth (i.e., through the reverse proxy) may have panels with \"Network Error: Request-URI Too Long(414)\", while accessing the same panels on the same dashboard with direct access (i.e., the docker01 host on LIGO VPN) works without errors.<ul><li>To fix this, I changed an option for the Variable query method: Grafana Settings - Data Sources - InfluxDB-Collectd - Custom HTTP Headers - (change HTTP Method to POST). See <a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/grafana\/grafana\/issues\/19731#issuecomment-629557676\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/github.com\/grafana\/grafana\/issues\/19731#issuecomment-629557676<\/a><\/li><li>The alternative (going to Settings - Variables - $COMPUTE - Selection Options - Custom all value - \".*\" ) caused incomplete\/inaccurate displays of CPU Usage when the using the \"All\" variable.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>InfluxDB<ul><li>Collectd metric data are stored via an InfluxDB container. The retention policy on the dataset was 45 days, adjusted to 90 days on 2021-05-07. To adjust the retention policy to 90 days (e.g. to manage disk usage):<br>ssh docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<br>docker exec -it influxdb_grafana influx<br>&gt; USE collectd<br>&gt; ALTER RETENTION POLICY collectd_ret ON collectd DURATION 90d REPLICATION 1 SHARD DURATION 12h DEFAULT<br>(then enter ctrl-p ctrl-q to gracefully exit the container without stopping it)<\/li><li>See <a href=\"https:\/\/docs.influxdata.com\/influxdb\/v1.7\/query_language\/database_management\/#modify-retention-policies-with-alter-retention-policy\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">docs for more info<\/a> on retention policy management<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><h2 id=\"bkmrk-nagios%3A-pinging-stat\">Nagios: pinging status<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-access-1\">Access<\/h3><p>Web access to the LIGO Nagios page is via <a href=\"http:\/\/docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:8080\/nagios\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:8080\/nagios\/<\/a>. Username and password access is needed to access the page, as defined in the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images\/-\/blob\/master\/nagios\/Dockerfile\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dockerfile<\/a>.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-design-1\">Design<\/h3><p>The design for Nagios is based upon the configuration for the ICS Operations Nagios configuration.&nbsp; System configuration files modified are:<br><br><\/p><ul><li>\/etc\/nagios\/objects\/commands.cfg (configuration of slack notification commands)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/objects\/contacts.cfg (slack notifications for hosts and services)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/objects\/templates.cfg (contact template for slack notifications)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/objects\/localhost.cfg (removal of localhost system checks)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/nagios.cfg (add directory for compute node and network switch cfg files, turned on US\/Eastern timezone, and set use_regexp_matching=1)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/conf.d\/compute.cfg (nodes comp-ex-001 to comp-ex-100, hostgroup, and ping service definitions)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/conf.d\/compute-100.cfg (nodes comp-ex-101 to comp-ex-184 definitions)<\/li><li>\/etc\/nagios\/conf.d\/switches.cfg ( brocade and dell switch definitions along with hostgroup and ping service definitions for network switches)<\/li><li>\/etc\/httpd\/conf.d\/nagios.cfg (added timezone environment variable for US\/Eastern timezone)<\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-other-1\">Other<\/h3><p>To stop the nagios service on the container use the `service nagios stop` command. To restart the nagios service use the `\/usr\/local\/nagios\/bin\/nagios -d \/etc\/nagios\/nagios.cfg` command.<br>The `service nagios start` will not use the correct nagios.cfg file.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-duc%3A-storage-map-of-\">DUC: Storage Map of Home Directory Data<\/h2><p>A clickable map of the space utilization of the LIGO Nexenta NFS server is provided via <a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/zevv\/duc\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">DUC<\/a>, similar to <a href=\"https:\/\/ldas-gridmon.ligo.caltech.edu\/diskusage\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Caltech's LIGO DUC setup<\/a>.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-access-2\">Access<\/h3><ul><li>Via the LIGO VPN: <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.29.192:3001\/cgi-bin\/duc_ui.cgi\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/10.136.29.192:3001\/cgi-bin\/duc_ui.cgi\/<\/a><\/li><li>Via LIGO shibboleth authentication (including users at PSU and other institutions): <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.ext.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/diskusage\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.ext.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/diskusage<\/a><\/li><\/ul><h3 id=\"bkmrk-design-2\">Design<\/h3><p>The NFS indexing can be run simply as a <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images\/-\/blob\/master\/duc\/Dockerfile.index\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">DUC container<\/a> (note: it will take days\/weeks to index the top-level home directories. For example, it took ~120 hours to index when the Nexenta system was 66% full).<\/p><p>Reference the <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/docker01-images\/-\/tree\/master\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">README<\/a> for more information on running the containers.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-idrac%3A-hardware%2Fserv\">iDRAC: hardware\/server status<\/h2><p>Individual systems can be accessed by logging into their iDRAC browser interface. The IP is listed as management (\"mgt\") in the <a href=\"Complete-Node-List_63111240.html\">Complete Node List<\/a> (e.g., 10.136.31.{1-184}).<\/p><p>Multiple systems can be accessed by logging into the blade enclosure that contains the system. The blade enclosure IP is listed as blade_mgt in&nbsp; (e.g., 10.136.30.{111-122}).<\/p><p>Hardware issues can be monitored by accessing the iDRAC System Event Log (SEL). This has been automated with an <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/idrac_getsel.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Ansible playbook<\/a> on the PSU Gitlab. The playbook will create .txt files containing all critical errors in the nine days, one file per server. No files are generated if there are no critical errors.<\/p><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-software%2Fservices\">Software\/Services<\/h2><h3 id=\"bkmrk-cvmfs\">CVMFS<\/h3><p>CVMFS access can be tested by loading a remote file on the cluster, e.g.:<\/p><blockquote><p><code>$ FrChannels \/cvmfs\/<a href=\"http:\/\/oasis.opensciencegrid.org\/ligo\/frames\/O3\/hoft\/L1\/L-L1_HOFT_C00-12527\/L-L1_HOFT_C00-1252732928-4096.gwf\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">oasis.opensciencegrid.org\/ligo\/frames\/O3\/hoft\/L1\/L-L1_HOFT_C00-12527\/L-L1_HOFT_C00-1252732928-4096.gwf<\/a><\/code><\/p><\/blockquote><p>CVMFS status can be assessed across the cluster using an <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/blob\/development\/ansible\/playbooks\/cvmfs_remediation_with_reboot.yml\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Ansible playbook<\/a>&nbsp;on the PSU Gitlab. The playbook will ping all nodes, test CVMFS, reset CVMFS if it is unresponsive, and then drain and reboot nodes that remain unresponsive.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-htcondor\"><strong>HTCondor<\/strong><\/h3><p>Information about the cluster's setup of HTCondor and its monitoring can be found on <a href=\"Using-HTCondor_67731459.html\">Using HTCondor<\/a>.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":94,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:57.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

<\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2022-05-03-ld-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2022-05-03-ld-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2022-05-03 ldas-jobs SSL cert renewal\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on May 05, 2022\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-certificate-for-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The certificate for the ldas-jobs.gwave.ics.psu.edu service expires May 5 2022 (ldas-jobs provides a service noted in <a href=\"LIGO-Collaboration-Services_101548050.html\">LIGO Collaboration Services<\/a>).<\/p><p>We followed the standard cert renewal process in <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/SEC\/Certificates\">Certificates<\/a>, with the following customizations:<\/p><ul><li>Instead of `hostname` in all of the commands, we used ldas-jobs.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/li><li>Common Name (CN): ldas-jobs.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/li><\/ul><p>The require certs are:<\/p><ul><li>.crt certificate only<\/li><li>root\/intermediate .cer<\/li><li>intermediate\/root (reverse) .cer<\/li><\/ul><p>The ldas-jobs service is run via a webserver container (see <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/foreman01-images\/-\/tree\/master\/httpd-host\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/ligo-infra\/foreman01-images\/-\/tree\/master\/httpd-host<\/a>), so the cert files must be added to the container repo. Building the Dockerfile will add the cert files to a new container image, which can then be run via `runContainer.sh`.<\/p><ul><li>We symlinked the new certs to be copied as the existing filenames that are ADDed in the Dockerfile<\/li><li>We stopped the old container and started the new one; the ldas-jobs service was restored in ~5 seconds<\/li><\/ul><p>However, a user reported that the grafana service at ldas-jobs.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/grafana was down. After investigation, it turns out that the previous container was running ldas-jobs, grafana, and duc-cgi with httpd shibboleth, not just ldas-jobs. So, the new container we created for ldas-jobs left Grafana and duc-cgi unavailable down.<\/p><p>So, I did the same symlink process above for the httpd-host container after copying the required SSL files into `\/root\/foreman01-images\/httpd-host\/userdirs-cfg\/`. The required files were:<\/p><ul><li>intermediate\/root (reverse) .cer<\/li><li>.crt certificate only<\/li><li>.key<\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":96,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 91226640

development environment for running Ansible to run system checks and deploy changes:<\/p><ul><li>Follow all steps at <a href=\"https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/tree\/development\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.psu.edu\/psu-ligo\/ligo_puppet_control_repo\/-\/tree\/development<\/a><\/li><\/ul><p>Daily\/weekly checks for server health should be done routinely, following this general process:<\/p><ul><li>Check the <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Foreman dashboard<\/a> for \"Out of sync hosts\" or \"Hosts in error state\"<\/li><li>Check whether the node is down due to hardware via <a href=\"http:\/\/docker01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:8080\/nagios\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Nagios<\/a>&nbsp;or <a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/browse\/SUPPORT-2537?filter=12201\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">Jira<\/a>. If it isn't, then proceed:<\/li><li>Check the cluster resource status with <a href=\"LIGO-System-Monitoring_87326993.html\">LIGO System Monitoring<\/a>. Select an individual node to see if it has any resource problems<\/li><li>Connect to individual nodes via SSH or iDRAC for debugging (see <a href=\"Complete-Node-List_63111240.html\">Complete Node List<\/a> for IPs and iDRAC .mgt addresses)<\/li><\/ul><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Operational Tasks<\/p><div class=\"table-wrap\"><table class=\"relative-table wrapped confluenceTable\" Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 03 10 Nexenta CPU hanging and disk issues 92799640
string(5447) "{"id":2917,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 03 10 Nexenta CPU hanging and disk issues","slug":"2021-03-10-nexenta-cpu-hanging-and-disk-issues","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-10-ne\">Ligo : 2021-03-10 Nexenta CPU hanging and disk issues<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-10-ne-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-03-10-ne-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-03-10 Nexenta CPU hanging and disk issues\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Mar 15, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-users-reported-slow-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Users reported slow or failing jobs (\"framecpp\" errors). Users were running from \/ligo\/analysis-1\/ and \/ligo\/software\/ but still having job failures.<\/p><p>Checks:<\/p><ul><li>CVMFS was healthy on all nodes<\/li><li>Nodes were not in swap<\/li><li>Nexenta CPU was &gt;80%, with high read patterns<\/li><\/ul><p>I held jobs by user to see which workflow was causing the high read pattern. During this, I failed-over \/ligo\/home from stor-nas02b to 02a via NMV.<\/p><ul><li>Note: the faulted SSDs in logs-mirror-9 switched device names during the failover:<br>c3t58CE38EE20B4EC72d0 \u2192 c3t58CE38EE20B4EC73d0<br>c3t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0&nbsp;\u2192 c7t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0<\/li><\/ul><p>Afterwards, the errors persisted. One user found that they were using \/ligo\/home instead of \/ligo\/software\/, and another user found that their \/ligo\/analysis-1\/ jobs were referencing many files on \/ligo\/home\/ (this was a new, abnormal workflow, so this issue hadn't happened before).<\/p><p>During the failover and error process, the SSD log mirror-9 had both drives fault, and one cache drive was marked as faulte. One ZeusRAM drive remained failed. Since the SSD failures were dubious (they were installed &lt;1 year ago), I onlined the SSD mirror-9 drives and monitored them for further errors (none so far):<\/p><ul><li>Onlined the SSDs and cleared the faults:<br>zpool online work c3t58CE38EE20B4EC73d0<br>zpool clear work c3t58CE38EE20B4EC73d0<br>zpool online work c7t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0<br>zpool clear work c7t58CE38EE20B4EC7Ad0<\/li><\/ul><p>The latter user made changes to the analysis Makefile so that it would copy the files to-be-read to \/ligo\/analysis-1\/ and resubmitted. This resolved the issue Nexenta CPU usage and their job failures:<\/p><ul><li>In the analysis makefile, they changed:<br><span class=\"codespan__pre-wrap\"><code>cd $(ORIGINAL_DIR)\/gstlal_svd_bank &amp;&amp; ls | grep \"SVD\" | lalapps_path2cache | sort &gt; $(WORK_DIR)\/svd_bank.cache<br>to:<\/code><\/span><span class=\"codespan__pre-wrap\"><br><code>cp -r $(ORIGINAL_DIR)\/gstlal_svd_bank . &amp;&amp; <\/code><\/span><span class=\"codespan__pre-wrap\"><code>cd gstlal_svd_bank &amp;&amp; ls | grep \"SVD\" | lalapps_path2cache | sort &gt; $(WORK_DIR)\/svd_bank.cache<\/code><\/span><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":100,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: xCAT Master install 150340192
string(9298) "{"id":2918,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"xCAT Master install","slug":"xcat-master-install","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-xcat-master-i\">Ligo : xCAT Master install<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-3\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-operationa-4\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Operational-Guides_15271632.html\">Operational Guides<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-xcat-master-i-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-xcat-master-i-2\">\n                            Ligo : xCAT Master install\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-gary-skou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Gary Skouson<\/span> on Apr 03, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-the-xcat-master-is-n\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>The xcat master is needed to install and bring the other nodes online.&nbsp; It contains the DHCP server, the DNS and the PXE\/tftp services for the cluster.<\/p><p>Most of the nodes in the cluster are stateless and can be booted from the xCAT master node with not software installed locally.&nbsp; The xCAT master needs to be installed so it can boot from the local disk.&nbsp; However, we can reuse many of the bits we use to create the stateless nodes.&nbsp;<\/p><p>I ran into problems installing stateful nodes without copying the contents of the Rocky8 DVD with copycds.&nbsp; In theory we could bypass this by including the proper bits in the Rocky8 mirror stuff we keep. For now, once we have the new xcat master up, you'll want to download the rocky8 dvd and do something like:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre># cd \/root\n# wget https:\/\/download.rockylinux.org\/pub\/rocky\/8\/isos\/x86_64\/Rocky-x86_64-dvd.iso\n# copycds -o -p \/install\/rocky8 Rocky-x86_64-dvd.iso<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>You don't necessarily need the -o, but it keeps copycds from creating \"extra\" osimage definitions that you aren't going to use.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>I created a new osimage definition.&nbsp; This should be preserved in the xcat tables, so you shouldn't need to recreate it:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>[root@ligoxcat ~]# lsdef -t osimage rocky8-xcat\nObject name: rocky8-xcat\n    exlist=\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligobase.exlist\n    imagetype=linux\n    osarch=x86_64\n    osdistroname=rocky8-x86_64\n    osname=Linux\n    osvers=rocky8\n    otherpkglist=\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligobase.pkglist,\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligoxcat.pkglist\n    permission=755\n    pkgdir=\/install\/rocky8\n    pkglist=\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/min.pkglist\n    postinstall=\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligobase.postinstall,\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligoxcat.postinstall\n    postscripts=syslog,remoteshell,syncfiles,rocky8\/run-postscripts,nodespecific\/run-postscripts\n    profile=service\n    provmethod=install\n    synclists=\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligobase.synclist,\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/ligoxcat.synclist\n    template=\/install\/icdsligo\/rocky8\/definitionfiles\/service.rocky8.tmpl\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>I also did a node definition.&nbsp; It's also in the xcat tables, so you shouldn't need to recreate it:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre># lsdef ligo-xcat1\nObject name: ligo-xcat1\n    arch=x86_64\n    currchain=boot\n    currstate=install rocky8-x86_64-service\n    groups=xcatmaster,all,vm\n    hostnames=ligo-xcat1\n    installnic=mac\n    ip=10.6.200.13\n    mac=00:50:56:9d:fe:82\n    netboot=xnba\n    ondiscover=nodediscover\n    os=rocky8\n    postbootscripts=otherpkgs\n    postscripts=syslog,remoteshell,syncfiles,rocky8\/run-postscripts,nodespecific\/run-postscripts,rocky8\/install_vm_node_pkgs\n    primarynic=mac\n    profile=service\n    provmethod=rocky8-xcat\n    status=installing\n    statustime=04-03-2023 13:59:24\n    updatestatus=syncing\n    updatestatustime=03-29-2023 08:30:10<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>To install the ligo-xcat1 node you need to stick the proper MAC address in the xcat mac table if it has changed, or if you're installing another node as the xcat master with a name of ligo-xcat1.<\/p><p>Once that's done you'll want to set the node to do a pxe boot and set the node image type:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre># nodeset ligo-xcat1 osimage=rocky8-xcat<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>Boot the node and it should do a pxe boot and then kickstart, run some postscripts and then come up&nbsp;<\/p><p>By default I've left off the regular cron jobs to pull\/push git stuff, however, the \/install\/icdsligo and \/install\/xcat_db_backup directories should be filled with a git clone from git.&nbsp; You'll need to populate the git cron jobs manually for now.&nbsp; I didn't want to have two cron jobs that were stepping on each other for the xcat tables stuff.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>By default the proper xcat RPMs should be installed and the postgres database should be configured for xCAT.&nbsp; The tables should start empty.&nbsp; They'll need to be populated by hand from the git repo.<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre># restorexCATdb -p \/install\/xcat_db_backup\/xcatdb-ligoxcat\/<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>That should run for a minute and then you should be good to do lsdef to see all the usual definitions.&nbsp; None of the xcat commands will work yet, since we're not the actual xcat master yet.&nbsp; We need to update the IP address and hostname to make that work.<\/p><p>Here are some steps to follow:<\/p><ol><li>Turn off the cron jobs on the current xcat master and update the hostname\/ip address to something else:<ol><li>You'll want console access to the xcat master to do this<\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>update the hostname\/ip address for the&nbsp;<em>new<\/em> xCAT master:<ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">for ligo set the hostname to ligoxcat<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre># echo \"HOSTNAME=ligoxcat\" &gt;&gt; \/etc\/sysconfig\/network\nhostname ligoxcat\nhostnamectl set-hostname ligoxcat<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Set the IP address to 10.6.200.12 for ligoxcat<\/p><ol><li>You can try network manager commands or edit the \/etc\/sysconfig\/network-scripts file<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Reboot to make sure things come up correctly.&nbsp;<\/li><li>Try some xcat commands&nbsp;<ol><li>rpower status<\/li><li>generate some images you'll need to boot nodes<\/li><li>Try booting a test node<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":101,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2020 06 15 Login01 Condor and NFS rapidly filling 78807714
string(8122) "{"id":2919,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2020 06 15 Login01 Condor and NFS rapidly filling","slug":"2020-06-15-login01-condor-and-nfs-rapidly-filling","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-15-lo\">Ligo : 2020-06-15 Login01 Condor and NFS rapidly filling<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" class=\"aui-page-panel\">\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--2\">\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log\">\n                        <ol id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-15-lo-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2020-06-15-lo-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2020-06-15 Login01 Condor and NFS rapidly filling\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Jun 15, 2020\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-issuea-graduate-stud\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-issue\">Issue<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><p>A graduate student reported that Condor was not responding on login01 around ~20:00 on Sunday 6\/14. I checked it and found that the jobs were running, but the job tracking (condor_q) was intermittent. I didn't check the condor logs at this time.<\/p><ul><li>Condor error:<br>&gt; condor_q -dag<br>Failed to fetch ads from: &lt;10.136.28.201:9618?PrivNet=GWAVE&amp;addrs=10.136.28.201-9618+[--1]-9618&amp;noUDP&amp;sock=27159_64bb_180&gt; : comp-hd-001.gwave.<span class=\"mention--highlight\">ics<\/span>.PSU.EDU<\/li><\/ul><p>At the same time, I found that NFS usage had grown from 80% to 87% (of 200TB, so ~15TB compressed) in ~30 hours. NFS network traffic was high (&gt;200MB\/s, regular peaks &gt;1GB\/s). Nexenta was sending many critical alarms for \"slow disk I\/O.\"<\/p><ul><li>NFS writes: average of ~10GB\/min written for &gt;24 hours<\/li><li>61 critical alarms for slow disk I\/O from 06:58-17:49 on June 15<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-cause\">Cause<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><h3 id=\"bkmrk-condor\">Condor<\/h3><p>I looked at the issue on 6\/15, and found multiple errors in login01's Condor logs:<\/p><blockquote><p># SharePortLog<\/p><p>SharedPortClient - server response deadline has passed for 27159_64bb_180 as requested by TOOL on &lt;10.136.28.202:32553&gt;<\/p><p>SharedPortClient - server response deadline has passed for 27159_64bb_180 as requested by NEGOTIATOR &lt;10.136.28.213:9618?addrs=10.136.28.213-9618+[--1]-9618&amp;noUDP&amp;sock=11270_dc6f_3&gt; on &lt;10.136.28.213:33511&gt;<\/p><p>SharedPortServer: server was busy, failed to connect 957177_8964_4483203 as requested by SCHEDD &lt;10.136.28.201:9618?CCBID=10.136.28.213:9618%3faddrs%3d10.136.28.213-9618+[--1]-9618%26noUDP%26sock%3dcollector#4316&amp;PrivNet=GWAVE&amp;addrs=10.136.28.201-9618+[--1]-9618&amp;noUDP&amp;sock=27159_64bb_180&gt; on &lt;10.136.28.201:1069&gt;: primary (fcaaae8850874925b2d12da0e171d3b708bdb0ae849e2c01d4a4034ea7535fa9\/957177_8964_4483203): Connection refused (111); alt (\/var\/lock\/condor\/daemon_sock\/957177_8964_4483203): Connection refused (111)<\/p><p>SharedPortClient - server response deadline has passed for 27159_64bb_180 as requested by STARTD &lt;10.136.29.122:9618?CCBID=10.136.28.213:9618%3faddrs%3d10.136.28.213-9618+[--1]-9618%26noUDP%26sock%3dcollector#4677&amp;PrivNet=GWAVE&amp;addrs=10.136.29.122-9618+[--1]-9618&amp;noUDP&amp;sock=13484_7b1d_3&gt; on &lt;10.136.29.122:37844&gt;<\/p><\/blockquote><p>I found that the Sched daemon was killed and restarted:<\/p><blockquote><p>06\/14\/20 21:34:52 ERROR: Child pid 957177 appears hung! Killing it hard.<\/p><p>06\/14\/20 21:34:53 DefaultReaper unexpectedly called on pid 957177, status 9.<\/p><p>06\/14\/20 21:34:53 The SCHEDD (pid 957177) was killed because it was no longer responding<\/p><p>06\/14\/20 21:34:53 Sending obituary for \"\/usr\/sbin\/condor_schedd\"<\/p><p>06\/14\/20 21:34:53 restarting \/usr\/sbin\/condor_schedd in 10 seconds<\/p><p>06\/14\/20 21:35:03 Started DaemonCore process \"\/usr\/sbin\/condor_schedd\", pid and pgroup = 3597236<\/p><\/blockquote><p>But all the expected condor processes were running.<\/p><h3 id=\"bkmrk-nfs\">NFS<\/h3><ul><li>I monitored the file growth on NFS by writing basic df statistics to file:<br>$ while true; do df -k \/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/ | tail -n 1 &gt;&gt; 20200615_df.out; sleep 30; done &amp;<\/li><li>I held the DAGs of one user at ~14:20, which stopped the NFS network traffic and file growth.<ul><li>One of the DAGs auto-released at ~14:50, at which point the NFS usage increased again, suggesting that the issue was with that DAG.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>I examined the disk usage for the working directories for the two DAGs, but found that one was &lt; 1GB and the other (the one causing NFS traffic) was &lt;100GB.<\/li><li>I realized that the problem was likely due to CVMFS cache files being fetched by the DAG, which was not progressing due to job failures (a few 10s of jobs had completed, whereas &gt;1000s completions are expected in this time frame).<ul><li>I checked the CVMFS alien cache on NFS (in \/volumes\/work\/nfs\/ligo\/apps\/cvmfs), and found many cache directories for the past few days. The recent ones were ~100 GB each.<\/li><li>I checked the sizes of the caches created since June 14:<br>ls -latr | awk '{ if( $6 == \"Jun\" &amp;&amp; $7 &gt;= 14) print $9 }' | xargs du -sh&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; # executed inside the alien cache directory<ul><li>This showed all 142 of the recent directories were ~100GB each.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>The DAG had autoreleased several times during this time and the NFS traffic picked up each time, confirming that it was the culprit.<\/li><\/ul><h1 id=\"bkmrk-resolution\">Resolution<strong><br><\/strong><\/h1><p>I removed the DAG. I will be cleaning up the alien cache and checking the DAG logs to see how the caching issue began. The Condor problem on login01 hasn't been resolved.<\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":102,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:58.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

        <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-%2Adraft%2A-xcat--1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-%2Adraft%2A-xcat--2\">\n                            Ligo : *DRAFT* xCAT Management Server Install Checklist\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-ross-mick\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Ross Mickens<\/span>, last modified on Apr 06, 2023\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-expand%2Fcollapse-all-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p><br><\/p><a id=\"bkmrk-expand%2Fcollapse-all--1\" href=\"#bkmrk--1\">Expand\/Collapse All sections<\/a>\n<script type=\"text\/javascript\">\nAJS.toInit(function ()\n{\nAJS.$('#toggleAll').click(function() {\njQuery(\".expand-control\").each(function(){ jQuery(this).trigger(\"click\");})\n});\n});\n<\/script><h1 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-introduction\">Introduction<\/h1><div class=\"panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"panelContent\">\n<p>This checklist is meant to be used for setting up a new xCAT management server.<\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(29,28,29);\">This checklist is meant as a step-by-step guide for converting a node in the LIGO cluster to a newly configured xCAT management server.<span>&nbsp;<\/span><\/span><\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(29,28,29);\">It will get the server up to the point of allowing node discovery. <\/span><\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(29,28,29);\">This should allow a user to build the xCAT management server, implement any changes and verify the basic functionality of the services provided by the xCAT management server.&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-repos-for-ccstar-%2F-g\">Repos for CCStar \/ gwave1.5 images<\/h1><div class=\"panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"panelContent\">\n<p>Rocky Linux 8<\/p><p><a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.rockylinux.org\/rocky\/repo\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/wiki.rockylinux.org\/rocky\/repo\/<\/a><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>EPEL<\/p><p>metalink=<a href=\"https:\/\/mirrors.fedoraproject.org\/metalink?repo=epel-8&amp;arch=%24basearch&amp;infra=%24infra&amp;content=%24contentdir\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/mirrors.fedoraproject.org\/metalink?repo=epel-8&amp;arch=$basearch&amp;infra=$infra&amp;content=$contentdir<\/a><\/p><p>dnf install epel-release epel-next-release<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>HT Condor<\/p><p><a href=\"https:\/\/htcondor.readthedocs.io\/en\/latest\/getting-htcondor\/from-our-repositories.html\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/htcondor.readthedocs.io\/en\/latest\/getting-htcondor\/from-our-repositories.html<\/a><br>yum install <a href=\"https:\/\/research.cs.wisc.edu\/htcondor\/repo\/current\/htcondor-release-current.el8.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/research.cs.wisc.edu\/htcondor\/repo\/current\/htcondor-release-current.el8.noarch.rpm<\/a><br><br>CVMFS<br><a href=\"https:\/\/cernvm.cern.ch\/fs\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/cernvm.cern.ch\/fs\/<\/a><\/p><pre><code>dnf install https:\/\/ecsft.cern.ch\/dist\/cvmfs\/cvmfs-release\/cvmfs-release-latest.noarch.rpm<\/code><br><br>GDS - Nvidia GPUDIRECT storage<br><a href=\"https:\/\/docs.nvidia.com\/gpudirect-storage\/troubleshooting-guide\/index.html#troubleshoot-install\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/docs.nvidia.com\/gpudirect-storage\/troubleshooting-guide\/index.html#troubleshoot-install<\/a><br><br>LALSuite<br><a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/LALSuite\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/LALSuite<\/a><br><br>yum install lalsuite<br><br>LDAS tools<br><span style=\"color: rgb(33,37,41);\"><a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/LDASTools\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/LDASTools<\/a><\/span><br><br>GraceDB <br><a href=\"https:\/\/git.ligo.org\/lscsoft\/gracedb-client\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/git.ligo.org\/lscsoft\/gracedb-client<\/a><br><br><span style=\"color: rgb(33,37,41);\"><a href=\"http:\/\/software.ligo.org\/lscsoft\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/software.ligo.org\/lscsoft<\/a><\/span><br><br><a href=\"https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/NDSClient\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/wiki.ligo.org\/Computing\/NDSClient<\/a><br><br><br><br><\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-description\">Description<\/h1><p><br><\/p><div class=\"panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"panelContent\">\n<div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-error confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>NOTE: the hostname in this example might not match depending on the previous function of your xCAT test mgt server.<\/p><p>The example below uses t-sc-0001 as the test server for xCAT mgt install and t-sc-0004 as the xCAT compute node to be discovered.<\/p><\/div><\/div>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-checklist\">Checklist<\/h1><p><br><\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"186\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-install-rocky-linux-\">Install Rocky Linux 8<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><ul><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">This was completed by using the ISO image, attached to the system via a USB key (image using rufus) or using the iDRAC remote media function.&nbsp;<\/p><\/li><li>It may be necessary to change the boot order.&nbsp;<\/li><li class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span style='font-family: SFMono-Medium , \"SF Mono\" , \"Segoe UI Mono\" , \"Roboto Mono\" , \"Ubuntu Mono\" , Menlo , Courier , monospace;letter-spacing: 0.0px;'>Once the node installation is complete, go to the next step.&nbsp;<br><\/span><\/p><\/li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"148\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-configure-nics\">Configure NICs<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><ul><li><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">Production Management Network (Because of routing we just need to configure one address).<\/code><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Verify you are using the correct IP<\/p><\/li><li><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>ifcfg-eno1...<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">NAME=eno12399np0\nDEVICE=eno12399np0\nONBOOT=yes\nBOOTPROTO=static\nDEFROUTE=yes\nIPADDR=10.6.200.11\nPREFIX=24\nGATEWAY=10.6.200.1\nDNS1=128.118.25.3\nMTU=1500<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"152\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-configure-hostname-%28\">Configure hostname (note change this to a new hostname but stay consistent with the rest of the steps)<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><ul><li>Production&nbsp;<\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">echo \"HOSTNAME=ligoxcat\" &gt;&gt; \/etc\/sysconfig\/network\nhostname ligoxcat\nhostnamectl set-hostname ligoxcat<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><ul><li><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">Toggle network (note your ssh connection will be lost, best to do this from console (rcons,nodeconsole,iDRAC)<\/code><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">ifdown eno1; ifup eno1;<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\">\n <div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl hide-border-bottom\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\">\n  <b class=\"code-title\">example output<\/b><span class=\"collapse-source expand-control\" style=\"display:none;\"><span class=\"expand-control-icon icon\">&nbsp;<\/span><span class=\"expand-control-text\">Expand source<\/span><\/span><span class=\"collapse-spinner-wrapper\"><\/span>\n <\/div>\n <div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl hide-toolbar\"> \n  <pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence; collapse: true\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">Connection 'System eno1' successfully deactivated (D-Bus active path: \/org\/freedesktop\/NetworkManager\/ActiveConnection\/1)\nConnection successfully activated (D-Bus active path: \/org\/freedesktop\/NetworkManager\/ActiveConnection\/3)\nConnection successfully activated (D-Bus active path: \/org\/freedesktop\/NetworkManager\/ActiveConnection\/4)<\/pre> \n <\/div>\n<\/div><p>You should now be able to ssh into the machine at the address you set above.&nbsp;<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\">Now ssh into the node.<\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">ssh root@10.6.200.11<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p><br><\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"346\"><span style=\"font-size: 16.0px;font-weight: bold;letter-spacing: -0.006em;\">Configure DNS resolution (xCAT acts as the local cluster dns with additional upstream DNS) <a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"rlm6137\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~rlm6137\" data-linked-resource-id=\"88408743\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">Ross Mickens<\/a> - need to update nameserver ips<\/span><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>PRODUCTION Version vi \/etc\/resolv.conf<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"># cluster dns to mgt node\nsearch gwave.ics.psu.edu ext.gwave.ics.psu.edu ics.psu.edu hpc.psu.edu\nnameserver 10.6.200.11  \n# PSU dns to internet\nnameserver 128.118.25.3<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"347\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-we-need-to-map-a-fil\">we need to map a file shares from VAST (This needs to be updated for LIGO)<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><ul><li class=\"auto-cursor-target\">TODO UPDATE THIS LIST<\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>VAST mounts required as of 11\/10\/2021<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">vast2e-ip.hpc.psu.edu:\/xcat_install\/xcat_prod   \/xcat_prod      nfs     rw,nosuid,noatime,vers=3,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,namlen=255,hard,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,local_lock=all  0  0\nvast2e-ip.hpc.psu.edu:\/home                     \/storage\/home   nfs     rw,nosuid,noatime,vers=3,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,namlen=255,hard,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,local_lock=all  0  0\nvast2e-ip.hpc.psu.edu:\/work \/storage\/icds   nfs     rw,nosuid,noatime,vers=3,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,namlen=255,hard,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,local_lock=all  0  0\nvast2e-ip.hpc.psu.edu:\/icds-prod \/mnt\/repos      nfs     rw,nosuid,noatime,vers=3,rsize=65536,wsize=65536,namlen=255,hard,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,local_lock=all  0  0\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><ul><li class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Example to confirm storage mounts<\/li><\/ul><div id=\"bkmrk-example%3A-use-%22-df--t\" class=\"expand-container\"><div id=\"bkmrk-example%3A-use-%22-df--t-1\" class=\"expand-control\" aria-expanded=\"true\"><span class=\"expand-icon aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-chevron-down\"><\/span><span class=\"expand-control-text\">Example: Use \" df -Th \" and \" ls -l \/rstorage\/ \" to confirm the storage mount is correct.<\/span><\/div><div id=\"bkmrk--2\" class=\"expand-content\"><p><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"115\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-install-additional-p\">Install additional packages<\/h3><div class=\"code panel data-theme=\"Confluence\">dnf makecache\ndnf install -y&nbsp;dhcp-server bind expect httpd nfs-utils&nbsp;perl-XML-Parser&nbsp;chrony&nbsp;\ndnf group install -y \"Development Tools\"<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"146\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-add-snmp-rpms\">add snmp rpms<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><ul><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><s><code class=\"bash plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\"><code class=\"bash plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">For RHEL8.3 the RPMs are already built under \/rstorage<code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">\/software\/xcat\/net-snmp\/<\/code>RPMS\/&nbsp;<br><\/code><\/code><\/s><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">cd \/rstorage\/software\/xcat\/net-snmp\/RPMS\/\ndnf install net-snmp-*.rpm -y<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><code class=\"bash plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\"><code class=\"bash plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">**OR** In order to rebuild you will need to do the following steps<br><\/code><\/code><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\">\n <div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl hide-border-bottom\">\n  <b class=\"code-title\"><\/b><span class=\"collapse-source expand-control\" style=\"display:none;\"><span class=\"expand-control-icon icon\">&nbsp;<\/span><span class=\"expand-control-text\">Expand source<\/span><\/span><span class=\"collapse-spinner-wrapper\"><\/span>\n <\/div>\n <div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl hide-toolbar\"> \n  <pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence; collapse: true\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">yum install -y git&nbsp;rpm-build\n\ndnf install bzip2-devel chrpath elfutils-devel elfutils-libelf-devel libselinux-devel lm_sensors-devel mariadb-connector-c-devel openssl-devel perl perl-devel python3-devel rpm-devel\n\n# Try using the tarball here&nbsp;https:\/\/hpc.lenovo.com\/downloads\/snmp\/&nbsp;or&nbsp;$ git clone https:\/\/git.centos.org\/rpms\/net-snmp.git\n\ncd&nbsp;net-snmp\ngit checkout c8\ncp&nbsp;SOURCES\/* ~\/rpmbuild\/SOURCES\nrpmbuild -ba SPECS\/net-snmp.spec --define&nbsp;'netsnmp_check 0'&nbsp;&nbsp;--undefine&nbsp;'_disable_source_fetch'\n\ncd ~\/rpmbuild\/RPMS\/x86_64\/\ndnf install net-snmp-*.rpm -y<\/pre> \n <\/div>\n<\/div><\/li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"129\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-check-that-the-%2Fetc%2F\">Check that the \/etc\/sysconfig\/selinux contains SELinux=disabled. If not use vi or another editor to modify the file.&nbsp;<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">grep SELINUX= \/etc\/sysconfig\/selinux\n# SELINUX= can take one of these three values:\nSELINUX=disabled<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"188\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-turn-off-firewall-fo\">Turn off firewall for setup<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl disable firewalld\nsystemctl status firewalld<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"132\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-configure-ntp-%28chron\">Configure NTP (CHRONY) to point at ntp servers&nbsp;<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\">\n <div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl hide-border-bottom\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\">\n  <b class=\"code-title\">vi \/etc\/chrony.conf<\/b><span class=\"collapse-source expand-control\" style=\"display:none;\"><span class=\"expand-control-icon icon\">&nbsp;<\/span><span class=\"expand-control-text\">Expand source<\/span><\/span><span class=\"collapse-spinner-wrapper\"><\/span>\n <\/div>\n <div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl hide-toolbar\"> \n  <pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence; collapse: true\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">pool ad.psu.edu iburst\nserver clock-utc.ntp.psu.edu iburst\nserver clock-trdc.ntp.psu.edu iburst\nserver clock-cbdc.ntp.psu.edu iburst<\/pre> \n <\/div>\n<\/div><p><br><\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"135\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-setup-basic-hosts-fi\">Setup basic hosts file (Ensure it has the following lines for self, storage node, service nodes and bitbucket)<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>PRODUCTION Version vi \/etc\/hosts<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">127.0.0.1   localhost localhost.localdomain localhost4 localhost4.localdomain4\n::1         localhost localhost.localdomain localhost6 localhost6.localdomain6\n10.6.200.11 ligoxcat.gwave.ics.psu.edu ligoxcat\n10.192.1.52 bitbucket.int.aci.ics.psu.edu Bitbucket\n10.6.64.11 repos.2e.hpc.PSU.EDU repos\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"136\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-restart-xcat-mgt-ser\">Restart xCAT mgt Server (Note this is not needed if SELINUX was already disabled).<\/h3><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"223\"><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">exit the ssh session and reconnect using rcons, nodeconsole (nodeconsole t-sc-0001), or iDRAC console<\/code><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"224\"><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">reboot the server<\/code><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"225\"><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">Once the server restarts ensure that the only network interfaces that are up are those that we defined above (eno1 and eno1.4011).<br>If there are other ips that are not suppose to be there, ifdown those interfaces (i.e. ifdown eno2)<\/code><br><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>Example of desired output from \"ip route\"<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@ligoxcat1 ~]# ip route\ndefault via 10.6.200.1 dev eno12399np0 proto static metric 100\n10.6.200.0\/24 dev eno12399np0 proto kernel scope link src 10.6.200.11 metric 100<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">&nbsp;<\/code><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"352\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-configure-ethernet-s\">Configure ethernet Switches for SNMP support.&nbsp;<br><br><\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">xCAT will use the ethernet switches for discovery. In general, this requires that the user in advance set\nup an ip address and basic snmp functionality.\n\n1. SNMP configuration \nWe use snmp version 3. \nBecause of an xCAT limitation the auth password and encryption password must be the same value. \nAES128\nMD5\n\n2. lldp\nIt is recommended that lldp protocol in the switches is enabled to collect the switch and port information for compute node during discovery process.\n\n3. spanning tree\nIt is also recommended that spanning tree be set to portfast or edge-port for faster boot performance.\n\nPlease see the relevant switch documentation as to how to configure these items.<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"342\"><span>&nbsp;<\/span><\/li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"139\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-install-xcat\">Install xCAT<\/h3><ul><li><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Internal repos exists at repos.2e.hpc.psu.edu under \/storage\/sys\/configs\/repos\/yum.repos.d<br><\/span><\/code><\/li><li><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\">Details on management of these repos canbe found at <a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/pages\/viewpage.action?pageId=125698060\">How to update or add repositories for RC (provisioning)<\/a><\/span><\/code><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Add the following repo file to add xcat repos<\/p><div class=\"panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"panelContent\">\n<p>[root@ligoxcat1 ~]# cat \/etc\/yum.repos.d\/xcat.repo<\/p><p><br>[xcat-core]<br>name=xCAT 2 Core packages<br>baseurl=<a href=\"http:\/\/repos.2e.hpc.psu.edu\/live\/xcat-core\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/repos.2e.hpc.psu.edu\/live\/xcat-core\/<\/a><br>enabled=1<br>gpgcheck=1<br>gpgkey=<a href=\"http:\/\/xcat.org\/files\/xcat\/repos\/yum\/latest\/xcat-core\/repodata\/repomd.xml.key\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/xcat.org\/files\/xcat\/repos\/yum\/latest\/xcat-core\/repodata\/repomd.xml.key<\/a><\/p><p>[xcat-dep]<br>name=xCAT 2 depedencies<br>baseurl=<a rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/\/repos.2e.hpc.psu.edu\/live\/xcat-dep\/<\/a><br>enabled=1<br>gpgcheck=1<br>gpgkey=<a
