data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"340\"><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-once-the-xcat-repo-i\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Once the xCAT Repo is configured, run the install.<br><\/span><\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>Run xCAT install...This will take several minutes<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">yum install xCAT.x86_64 -y\n. \/etc\/profile.d\/xcat.sh<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\"><br><\/span><\/p><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"259\"><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-configure-database--\">Configure database - Install and Configure PostgreSQL<\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">yum install postgresql* perl-DBD-Pg -y<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"263\"><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-migrate-xcat-config%3A\">migrate xcat config:<\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl stop xcatd\npgsqlsetup -i -V \n# use \"ligocluster\" for the password<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"264\"><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-use-an-editor-to-adj\">Use an editor to adjust the address that xcatd uses to access the PostgreSQL database. It needs to be changed to \"127.0.0.1\"<br><br><\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@mgt-test ~]# cat \/etc\/xcat\/cfgloc\nPg:dbname=xcatdb;host=127.0.0.1|xcatadm|ligocluster<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"234\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-verify-the-switch-to\">verify the switch to pgsql and modify database directory<\/h3><ul><li><p><span style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\">Check the xcatdb have been switched to pgsql by running \"lsxcatd -a\"<\/span><\/p><p><span style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\"><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"140\" src=\"attachments\/131368790\/131368795.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/131368790\/131368795.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"131368795\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2021-7-22_15-51-41.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"131368790\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"29\"><\/span><br><br><\/span><\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\">Check the current working directory for the Postgresql data.<\/span><\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\"><br><\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@mgt-test ~]# sudo -u postgres psql -c \"SHOW data_directory;\"\ncould not change directory to \"\/root\": Permission denied\n   data_directory\n---------------------\n \/var\/lib\/pgsql\/data\n(1 row)<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>Ignore the message \"could not change directory to \"\/root\": Permission denied\"<\/p><\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\"><br><br><\/span><\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Stop postgresql service and modify the configuration files to point to the xcat db location<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl stop postgresql\nmkdir \/install\/pgsql_db\nrsync -av \/var\/lib\/pgsql\/ \/install\/pgsql_db\/<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Copy&nbsp;\/usr\/lib\/systemd\/system\/postgresql.service to&nbsp;\/etc\/systemd\/system\/postgresql.service. Then use an editor to modify the Environment line as below.&nbsp;<\/p><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-error confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>I think there is a mistake here - the edit below is needed in the copied file under \/etc...<\/p><\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>Using an editor modify the line in \/usr\/lib\/systemd\/system\/postgresql.service for Environment=PGDATA<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\"> Environment=PGDATA=\/install\/pgsql_db\/data\/<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>Using an editor add or modify the line in \/install\/pgsql_db\/data\/postgresql.conf for data_directory<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">data_directory = '\/install\/pgsql_db\/data\/'\n#data_directory = 'ConfigDir'        # use data in another directory\n                                     # (change requires restart)<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Reload, and restart postgresql service.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl daemon-reload\nsystemctl start postgresql<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">Check that the working directory for the Postgresql data has changed.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">sudo -u postgres psql -c \"SHOW data_directory;\"\ncould not change directory to \"\/root\": Permission denied\n         data_directory\n  ------------------------\n  \/install\/pgsql_db\/data\n  (1 row)<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>Ignore the message \"could not change directory to \"\/root\": Permission denied\"<\/p><\/div><\/div><\/li><li>Reference link :&nbsp;<a style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\" href=\"https:\/\/xcat-docs.readthedocs.io\/en\/stable\/advanced\/hierarchy\/databases\/postgres_configure.html#modify-postgresql-database-directory\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/xcat-docs.readthedocs.io\/en\/stable\/advanced\/hierarchy\/databases\/postgres_configure.html#modify-postgresql-database-directory<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"235\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-restart-xcat\">Restart xcat<br><br><\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl restart xcatd<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div>Confirm the host change using lsxcatd -a<br><br><span style=\"color: rgb(64,64,64);\"><span class=\"confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size\"><img class=\"confluence-embedded-image\" draggable=\"false\" height=\"140\" src=\"attachments\/131368790\/131368795.png\" data-image-src=\"attachments\/131368790\/131368795.png\" data-unresolved-comment-count=\"0\" data-linked-resource-id=\"131368795\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"attachment\" data-linked-resource-default-alias=\"image2021-7-22_15-51-41.png\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\" data-linked-resource-content-type=\"image\/png\" data-linked-resource-container-id=\"131368790\" data-linked-resource-container-version=\"29\"><\/span><\/span><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"40\"><h3 class=\"auto-cursor-target\" id=\"bkmrk-edit-xcat-site-table\">Edit xcat site table&nbsp;<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">The editor is vi by default, the editor can be changed. Check man tabedit for how to customize the editor.&nbsp;<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">If you need another editor, you must do a yum install for that editor (yum install nano -y)<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">tabdump is the equivalent of cat for the xCAT tables<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><span class=\"n\">values can also be changed using chdef (&nbsp;chdef -t site domain=\"<a href=\"http:\/\/test.icds.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">test.hpc.psu.edu<\/a>\" )<\/span><\/p><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">verify the values listed below are correct for your setup. This example is valid for testing the xCAT install within the test cluster.<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">DO NOT MODIFY THE TOP LINE OF THE TABLES<\/p><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">Once edits are complete, save and exit the file.<\/p><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">tabedit site AND verify these settings, you can ignore the other items<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>PRODUCTION Version for prodxcat<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#key,value,comments,disable\n\n\"master\",\"ligoxcat\",,\n\n\"domain\",\"gwave.ics.psu.edu\",,\n\n\"forwarders\",\"10.6.200.11,128.118.25.3\",,\n\"nameservers\",\"10.6.200.11\",,\n\n\"dhcpinterfaces\",\"eno1,!remote!\",,<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-error confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>We found that we need to remove the timezone from the site table, as it causes problems elsewhere.&nbsp;<\/p><p>\"timezone\",\"America\/New_York\",,<\/p><\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>Configure ntp with xCAT<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@mgt-test~]# chdef -t site extntpservers=ad.psu.edu,clock-utc.ntp.psu.edu,clock-trdc.ntp.psu.edu,clock-cbdc.ntp.psu.edu\n1 object definitions have been created or modified.\n[root@mgt-test~]# makentp\nconfiguring management node: rhea.test.hpc.psu.edu.\nWill configure chronyd instead.\nCalling ... gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#key,username,password,cryptmethod,authdomain,comments,disable\n\"system\",\"root\",\"cluster\",,,,\n\"ipmi\",\"root\",\"Calvin1\",,,,<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>CLI method<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">#node,switch,port,vlan,interface,comments,disable\n\"24perswitch\",,\"|\\D+(\\d+).*$|(($1-2001)%24)|\",,,,\n\"12perswitch\",,\"|\\D+(\\d+).*$|(($1-3001)%12)|\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0187\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"0\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0188\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"1\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0189\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"2\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0190\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"3\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0191\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"4\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0192\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"5\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0193\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"6\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0194\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"7\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0195\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"0\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0196\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"1\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0197\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"2\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0198\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"3\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0199\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"4\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0200\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"5\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0201\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"6\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0202\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"7\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0203\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"8\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0204\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"9\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0205\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"10\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0206\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"11\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0207\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"12\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0208\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"13\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0209\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"14\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0210\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"15\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0211\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"8\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0212\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"9\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0213\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"10\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0214\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"11\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0215\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"12\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0216\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"13\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0217\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"14\",,,,\n\"comp-ex-0218\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"15\",,,,\n\"ccstaraw35\",\"net2e-aw35-leaf1\",\"|\\D+(\\d+).*$|(($1-441)%15+16)|\",,,,\n\"ccstaraw36\",\"net2e-aw36-leaf1\",\"|\\D+(\\d+).*$|(($1-441)%25+16)|\",,,,\n &nbsp; &nbsp;<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"298\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-set-the-correct-nic-\">Set the correct NIC from which the DHCP server provides service.&nbsp; (is this section redundant? )<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><ul><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">This is the management network that the other nodes will boot from. The \"!remote!\" allows for DHCP to ranges other than the default range<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">chdef -t site dhcpinterfaces=eno1,'!'remote'!'<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ul><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"299\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-define-dynamic-ip-ra\">Define dynamic IP ranges for discovery (Networks table)<\/h3><ul><li><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\">This inputs the following ip ranges into the networks table.&nbsp;<\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\">You can verify these settings using tabdump or tabedit on networks<br><a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"rlm6137\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~rlm6137\" data-linked-resource-id=\"88408743\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">Ross Mickens<\/a> MTU for nodes without IB, gateway for idRAC network<br><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/li><li><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>for PRODUCTION, tabedit networks and add the following<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@prodxcat \/]# tabdump networks\n#netname,net,mask,mgtifname,gateway,dhcpserver,tftpserver,nameservers,ntpservers,logservers,dynamicrange,staticrange,staticrangeincrement,nodehostname,ddnsdomain,vlanid,domain,mtu,comments,disable \n\"10_136_80_0-comp\",\"10.136.80.0\",\"255.255.254.0\",\"!remote!\",\"10.136.80.1\",\"10.6.200.11\",\"10.6.200.11\",,,,\"10.136.80.229-10.136.80.250\",,,,,,,\"1500\",,\n\"10_136_0_0-iDRAC\",\"10.136.82.0\",\"255.255.254.0\",\"!remote!\",\"10.136.82.1\",\"10.6.200.11\",\"10.6.200.11\",,,,,,,,,,,\"1500\",,\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"302\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-add-nodes-to-nodelis\">Add nodes to Nodelist<\/h3><ul><li><br><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\"><br><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\">need to adjust to add existing node range as well&nbsp;<\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">nodeadd comp-ex-[0187:0218] groups=ipmi,compute,compute-ip\nnodeadd comp-ex-[0187:0218]-mgt groups=idrac,compute-idrac\n\nnodeadd comp-cc-[0441:0455] groups=ipmi,compute,ccstar-ip,ccstaraw35\nnodeadd comp-cc-[0456:0480] groups=ipmi,compute,ccstar-ip,ccstaraw36\nnodeadd comp-cc-[0441:0480]-mgt groups=idrac,ccstar-idrac\n\n## add switch hosts definitions\nnodeadd net2e-aw[35,36]-leaf1 groups=switch\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">nodeadd comp-ex-[0002:0016] groups=ipmi,compute,compute-ip\nchdef comp-ex-[0002:0016] arch=x86_64\n###define arch since we will add these via mac\n\nnodeadd comp-ex-[0002:0016]-mgt groups=idrac,compute-idrac\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"303\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-add-switch-ips\">Add Switch IPs<\/h3><ul><li><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl status named<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><br><\/span><\/p><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\">verify it is working by looking for the name of a compute node<br><\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">nslookup comp-ex-0187<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeHeader panelHeader pdl\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\"><b>example output<\/b><\/div><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@mgt-test ~]# nslookup t-sc-0001\nServer:         127.0.0.1\nAddress:        127.0.0.1#53\n\nName:   t-sc-0001.test.icds.psu.edu\nAddress: 10.6.88.101<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span class=\"auto-cursor-target\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><br><\/span><\/p><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"308\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-setup-dhcp\"><span class=\"n\" style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(23,43,77);\"><span style=\"color: rgb(0,0,0);\"><span class=\"n\">Setup DHCP<\/span><\/span><\/span><\/span><\/h3><ul><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">This command will create a new DHCP configuration file with a network statement for each network the DHCP daemon<br>should listen on.<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">makedhcp -n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">This command will define all nodes to the DHCP server for nodes that xcat has determined the mac address on.&nbsp;<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">makedhcp -a<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><code class=\"bash plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">Restart dhcp service<\/code><br><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl restart dhcpd<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span>check the status of dhcpd<br><\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">systemctl status dhcpd<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"309\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-configure-conserver\">Configure conserver<br><br><\/h3><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">makegocons\nsystemctl status goconserver&nbsp;<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"310\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-discover-nodes\">Discover Nodes<\/h3><div class=\"confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-warning\"><span class=\"aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-error confluence-information-macro-icon\"><\/span><div class=\"confluence-information-macro-body\"><p>IMPORTANT: Be sure to check with other users on the cluster before doing this. If a node is rebooted while doing this it can change the iDRAC address, or destroy the image on that node.&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/p><\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ul><ol><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\"><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0.0px;\">For testing within the test cluster, you need to disable DHCP on the original xCAT management server (rhea in the example) so that the *new* test server (mgt-test in the example) can answer dhcp requests without&nbsp;interference.<br><\/span><\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@rhea ~]# systemctl stop dhcpd\n[root@mgt-test ~]# systemctl restart dhcpd<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">ensure the only IPs present on your newly installed xCAT server are those assigned above. If additional interfaces received DHCP responses, down those interfaces.&nbsp;<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@mgt-test ~]# ifdown eno2&nbsp;<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><li>To test that discovery is working properly it is best to have 2 terminals open: one on <span>the original xCAT management server (rhea in the example) <\/span>, one on the newly installed xCAT server.<ol><li>From RHEA, you can use nodeconsole or rcons to monitor the \"discovery\" test node<\/li><li><p class=\"auto-cursor-target\">From your newly installed xCAT server you can monitor responses from the services:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@mgt-test ~]# tail -f \/var\/log\/messages<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><\/li><\/ol><\/li><li>Reboot the desired node to boot from the network to check that discovery is working properly. You should see genesis load, bmcsetup run, and the node hostname changed to the desired test node name. Because of how SOL loads you may only see some of this output on the first boot via the SOL console. Additional output may be available via the iDRAC's Virtual Console.<\/li><\/ol><p><span>&nbsp;<\/span><\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"332\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-notes-on-discovery-i\"><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">Notes on Discovery in PROD.&nbsp;<\/span><\/h3><\/li><\/ul><ol><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">For PROD, we want to do this very systematically so that we catch any errors quickly without creating a lot of clean-up.<\/span><\/li><li><span class=\"placeholder-inline-tasks\">I suggest powering on nodes in this order to ensure the initial discovery is working properly before we get to far along:<\/span><ol><li>Rack1, node1 : Rack1, node2 : Rack1, node24 : Rack2, node1 : Rack3, node1<\/li><li>Once we've completed this step nodes can be turned on or restarted asynchronous for discovery.<\/li><\/ol><\/li><\/ol><p><br><\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"131368790\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"328\"><h3 id=\"bkmrk-complete---begin-ini\">Complete - Begin initial node verification test and O\/S installs.<\/h3><\/li><\/ul><p>PLACEHOLDER FOR GENESIS IMAGE:<\/p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">mkdir \/tmp\/foo<\/code><br><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">cd \/tmp\/foo<\/code><br><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">zcat&nbsp;\/tftpboot\/xcat\/genesis.fs.x86_64.gz | cpio -idmv<\/code><br><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">tar xvfz \/storage\/icds\/software\/iDRACTools\/iDracStuff.tgz<\/code><br><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">find . | cpio -o -c -R root:root | gzip -<\/code><code class=\"java value\" style=\"text-align: left;\">9<\/code><span>&nbsp;<\/span><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">&gt; \/tmp\/<\/code><code class=\"java keyword\" style=\"text-align: left;\">new<\/code><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">.img.gz<\/code><br><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">cp \/tmp\/<\/code><code class=\"java keyword\" style=\"text-align: left;\">new<\/code><code class=\"java plain\" style=\"text-align: left;\">.img.gz&nbsp;\/tftpboot\/xcat\/genesis.fs.x86_64-icds.gz<\/code><\/p><h1 id=\"bkmrk-stuff-i-added-on-tes\">Stuff I added on testxcat:<\/h1><p>I ran wanted to add AD stuff, but the RPMs were out of sync with what we have on the rest of the cluster, so I copied over the icds_repos.repo and did a yum update.<\/p><p>Then I walked through the add AD ldap page:&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/x\/ZYG0Bg\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/x\/ZYG0Bg<\/a><\/p><p>After LDAP stuff worked and SSSD was allowing me to login, I thought it best to reboot to make sure things worked after the reboot.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-set-up-custom-stuff-\">Set-up custom stuff in \/install<\/h2><p>We need to add our \"custom\" stuff to the \/install tree for xcat.&nbsp; It's all in git, so I created a branch called \"test\" for the test cluster.&nbsp; I've made some changes to that code and then cloned that stuff to \/install\/icds<\/p><p>We'll need some symlinks in \/install to point stuff at our postscripts etc.<\/p><p>\/install\/custom\/commonfiles&nbsp;\u2192 \/install\/icds\/rhel83\/commonfiles<\/p><p>\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles&nbsp;\u2192 \/install\/icds\/rhel83\/definitionfiles<\/p><p>\/install\/postscripts\/icds \u2192 \/install\/icds\/rhel83\/postscripts<\/p><p>\/install\/postscripts\/nodespecific&nbsp;\u2192 \/install\/icds\/rhel83\/nodespecific<\/p><p>I created the cron job to update the files from the test branch when there are changes:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>*\/1 * * * * \/install\/icds\/git-cron-xcatscripts\/update-xcat-from-git.sh<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><h2 id=\"bkmrk-configure-more-xcat-\">Configure more xcat stuff so osimages work<\/h2><p>Add postscripts to the xcatdefaults entry in the postscripts table:<\/p><div class=\"code panel pdl\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"codeContent panelContent pdl\">\n<pre class=\"syntaxhighlighter-pre\" data-syntaxhighlighter-params=\"brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence\" data-theme=\"Confluence\">[root@testxcat ~]# tabdump postscripts | grep defaults\n\"xcatdefaults\",\"syslog,remoteshell,syncfiles,icds\/run-postscripts,nodespecific\/run-postscripts\",\"otherpkgs\",,\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>I created an os definition file called test-compute:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>test-compute:\n    objtype=osimage\n    exlist=\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/base.exlist\n    imagetype=linux\n    osarch=x86_64\n    osdistroname=rhel8\n    osname=Linux\n    osvers=rhels8\n    otherpkglist=\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/compute.pkglist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/mlnx.pkglist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/ood.pkglist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/gpfs.pkglist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/swst-build.pkglist\n    permission=755\n    pkgdir=http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/iDRAC\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/MLNX\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/rhel83-baseos\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/rhel83-appstream\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/codeready-builder-rhel-8\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/icds_stuff\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/epel\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/cuda\/,http:\/\/10.6.80.11:80\/test\/gpfs_rpms\/\n    pkglist=\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/base.pkglist\n    postinstall=\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/base.postinstall,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/compute.postinstall\n    profile=compute\n    provmethod=netboot\n    rootimgdir=\/install\/netboot\/icds-test\/x86_64\/test-compute\n    synclists=\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/base.synclist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/compute.synclist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/gpfs.synclist,\/install\/custom\/definitionfiles\/ood.synclist\n\n<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>You can define the osimage with \"cat test-compute | mkdef -z\"<\/p><p>I created images for test-compute and test-gpu.<\/p><p>The cleanimages and regen scripts don't quite work for the test cluster, so I generated the images by hand with genimage and packimage.<\/p><p>Once you have an image generated, you can run nodeset for the nodes and as long as they've been added to xcat, rebooting them should boot an image.<\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-clean-up-exports\">Clean up exports<\/h2><p>By default xcat sets \/tftpboot and \/install as nfs exports allowing everyone to mount them.&nbsp; I updated \/etc\/exports to:<\/p><div class=\"preformatted panel\" style=\"border-width: 1px;\"><div class=\"preformattedContent panelContent\">\n<pre>\/tftpboot 10.6.0.0\/16(rw,no_root_squash,sync,no_subtree_check)\n\/install 10.6.0.0\/16(rw,no_root_squash,sync,no_subtree_check)<\/pre>\n<\/div><\/div><p>You'll need to run \"exportfs -r\" to have the nfsd redo the exports, adding -v shows what's happening.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                                            <div class=\"pageSection group\">\n                        <div class=\"pageSectionHeader\">\n                            <h2 id=\"bkmrk-attachments%3A\" class=\"pageSectionTitle\">Attachments:<\/h2>\n               Ligo : Miscellaneous Projects\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" string(12203) "{"id":2922,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 06 30 Nexenta disk replacement","slug":"2021-06-30-nexenta-disk-replacement","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-30-ne\">Ligo : 2021-06-30 Nexenta disk replacement<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-30-ne-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-06-30-ne-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-06-30 Nexenta disk replacement\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Jul 01, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-prepareidentify-the-\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <h2 id=\"bkmrk-prepare\">Prepare<\/h2><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"19\">Identify the failed drives in NMV:<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"20\">The failed drives will appear as \"no lun (retired)\" in the slot specified by the NMV failure alert<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"21\">Flash the LEDs on the failed drives in NMV<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"22\"><s>Offline the failed drives in ZFS:<\/s><br><s>$ zpool offline &lt;pool name&gt; &lt;drive name&gt;<\/s><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"23\">this caused a the resilver to restart, so this should NOT be done in the future. Just use `zpool detach work &lt;drive&gt;`<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"24\"><s>Confirm the failed drives are offline in NMV<\/s><br><s>Data Management \u2192 Datasets \u2192 Volumes \u2192 work<\/s><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><h2 id=\"bkmrk-replace\">Replace<\/h2><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"25\">Physically remove the failed drive<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"26\"><p>Confirm the drive is removed in NMV:<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<\/p><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"27\"><p>Install the new drive in the same slot as the removed failed drive<\/p><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"28\"><p>Confirm the new drive is recognized in NMV:<br>Settings \u2192 Disks \u2192 jbods<\/p><ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li data-inline-task-id=\"29\"><p>The new drive will be in the same slot entry as the failed drive.<\/p><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"30\"><p>Record the new drive ID<\/p><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"31\">If a hot spare has already taken over for a failed drive (and is resilvering\/resilvered), then:<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"32\">Detach the (offline) failed drive:<br>$ zpool detach work c0t5000C500629FA6E3d0 &amp;<\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"33\">Check that the failed drive is removed from the pool, and that the hot spare has taken its place (which will decrement the number of hot spares):<br>$ zpool status<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"34\">Wait for the new disk to appear in Data Management \u2192 Datasets \u2192 Volumes \u2192 Work \u2192 \"Hot Spares\"<ul class=\"inline-task-list\" data-inline-tasks-content-id=\"103546962\"><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"42\">Drive did not appear. Reseated, then got alert that it failed to attach:<br><pre>Fault class : fault.io.disk.attach-failure\nAffects     : dev:\/\/\/:devid=id1,sd@n5000039a480afd59\/\/scsi_vhci\/disk@g5000039a480afd59\n                  faulted but still in service\nFRU         : \"SLOT 53 \" (hc:\/\/:product-id=DELL-MD3060e:server-id=:chassis-id=50080e5207db2000:serial=7040A01RF6QE:part=TOSHIBA-MG04SCA40EN:revision=DJ01\/ses-enclosure=0\/bay=53\/disk=0)\n                  faulty<\/pre><\/li><li class=\"checked\" data-inline-task-id=\"43\">Moved drive to right-adjacent slot (from slot 53 to 56, from #4 to #7 in jbod 2 tray 5).<\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"44\"><span>&nbsp;<\/span><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li data-inline-task-id=\"38\">Add the new disk as a new hot spare in NMV:<br>Data Management \u2192 Datasets \u2192 Volumes \u2192 Work \u2192 \"Hot Spares\" \u2192 select the newly-added disk \u2192 \"Apply\"<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p><br><\/p><p>Nexenta Viewer GUI was giving 503 errors, corresponding to various errors in \/var\/log\/nmv.log:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">2021-07-01 14:00:08,006 dbus.proxies ERROR Introspect error on :1.<a href=\"http:\/\/209446\/Root\/Network\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">209446:\/Root\/Network<\/a>: dbus.exceptions.DBusException: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include:<br>the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.<br>2021-07-01 14:00:08,007 nza ERROR com.nexenta.nms::\/Root\/Network::get_nmv_props(): Cannot introspect object com.nexenta.nms(\/Root\/Network): org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Did not receive a reply. Pos<br>sible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.<br>2021-07-01 14:00:08,007 nmv.jobs.sslCertificate ERROR Unable to retrieve appliance settings<br>Traceback (most recent call last):<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/site-packages\/nmv\/jobs\/sslCertificate.py\", line 31, in run<br>props = nms.network.get_nmv_props()<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/site-packages\/NZA\/__init__.py\", line 1165, in __call__<br>return self.conn.call(self.path, self.suff, <a href=\"http:\/\/self.name\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">self.name<\/a>, *args, **kwargs)<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/site-packages\/NZA\/__init__.py\", line 1309, in call<br>return (pool or super(NMSLocalConnection, self).call)(path, suff, name, *args, **kwargs)<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/site-packages\/NZA\/__init__.py\", line 1331, in call<br>return (conn and conn.call or call)(path, suff, name, *args, **kwargs)<br>File \"&lt;string&gt;\", line 3, in call<br>File \"\/usr\/bin\/nmv.py\", line 262, in call<br>return call(self, *args, **kwargs)<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/site-packages\/NZA\/__init__.py\", line 1093, in call<br>return getattr(self.dbus.get_object(<a href=\"http:\/\/self.name\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">self.name<\/a>, path), name)(*args, **setdefault(params,<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/vendor-packages\/dbus\/bus.py\", line 244, in get_object<br>follow_name_owner_changes=follow_name_owner_changes)<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/vendor-packages\/dbus\/proxies.py\", line 259, in __init__<br>self._pending_introspect = self._Introspect()<br>File \"\/usr\/lib\/python2.6\/site-packages\/NZA\/__init__.py\", line 967, in _Introspect<br>self._introspect_error<br>NZAConnectionFailed: Cannot introspect object com.nexenta.nms(\/Root\/Network): org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\"><br><\/p><p>I tried disabling and enabling the nms\/nmv\/nmcd services (as in <a href=\"2019-12-20-nas02a-NMS-failure_66977830.html\">2019-12-20 nas02a NMS failure<\/a>), which disabled nmv and nmcd but not nms, which was failing to stop, with logs in \/var\/svc\/log\/application-nms:default.log:<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">LICENSE WARNING: the appliance has outstanding license related alarm(s)<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">[ Jul 1 14:17:21 Stopping because service disabled. ]<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">[ Jul 1 14:17:21 Executing stop method (\"\/lib\/svc\/method\/nms stop\"). ]<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">Stopping NMS daemon (24703) ...<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">NMS daemon (24703) stopped (terminated)<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">[ Jul 1 14:21:03 Method \"stop\" exited with status 0. ]<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">[ Jul 1 14:21:21 Method or service exit timed out. Killing contract 898397. ]<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">[ Jul 1 14:21:22 Method or service exit timed out. Killing contract 898397. ]<\/p><p style=\"margin-left: 30.0px;\">....<\/p><p>I restarted the server from CLI (since NMV was still unavailable): `reboot`. This caused the server to reboot as expected but the NFS export did NOT fail over to stor-nas-b (likely due to stor-nas-b having `Failover mode` set to manual (in <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.28.102:8457\/settings\/rsfcluster\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/10.136.28.102:8457\/settings\/rsfcluster\/<\/a>) which is not desired). This caused downtime of ~10 minutes instead of ~5 minutes.<\/p><p>The export came back after the reboot, and the nms\/nmv\/nmcd services were running as normal, and the NMV GUI was working.<\/p><p>The disk still had `fault.io.disk.attach-failure` alerts (should be disk c0t5000039A480AFD59d0). I rebooted stor-nas-a from NMV, causing a proper failover to stor-nas-b. The disk still would not show up in <a href=\"http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\/data\/datasets\/volumes\/work\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/10.136.28.100:8457\/data\/datasets\/volumes\/work\/<\/a>.<\/p><p>One of the ZIL log cache SSDs was marked as faulted. I attempted onlining the device, but this failed.<\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><br><\/p>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":105,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:59.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:59.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"
Title contains numbers at the end: 2021 08 02 Replacing Nexenta ZIL drive 110952462
string(6001) "{"id":2923,"book_id":115,"chapter_id":0,"name":"2021 08 02 Replacing Nexenta ZIL drive","slug":"2021-08-02-replacing-nexenta-zil-drive","html":"\n\n    \n        <title id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-02-re\">Ligo : 2021-08-02 Replacing Nexenta ZIL drive<\/title>\n        <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"styles\/site.css\" type=\"text\/css\" id=\"bkmrk-\">\n        <meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text\/html; charset=UTF-8\" id=\"bkmrk--1\">\n    \n\n    \n        <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-\">\n            <div id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log--1\" id=\"bkmrk-ligo-ligo-event-log-1\">\n                            <li class=\"first\">\n                                <span><a href=\"index.html\">Ligo<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"LIGO_15271623.html\">LIGO<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                    <li>\n                                <span><a href=\"Event-Log_66977824.html\">Event Log<\/a><\/span>\n                            <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-02-re-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-2021-08-02-re-2\">\n                            Ligo : 2021-08-02 Replacing Nexenta ZIL drive\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span>, last modified on Aug 02, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-for-sr-and-replaceme\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>For SR and replacement details, see <span class=\"aui-message aui-message-warning jim-error-message jim-error-message-single\">\n        <span class=\"icon-in-pdf\"><\/span>\n     <a href=\"https:\/\/jira.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/browse\/SUPPORT-2407?src=confmacro\">SUPPORT-2407<\/a> - Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.\n    <\/span>\n<\/p><ul><li>I found the new disk in NMV \u2192 Settings \u2192 Disks, and seeing which drive had the highest Device sd number (sd 127 and 128 for the new drive virtual and physical disk, respectively): c4t5000CCA0A9714102d0 (virtual) and c4t5000CCA0A9714101d0 (physical)<\/li><li>I disabled syncing to the ZILs and verified the ZIL I\/O went to zero:<br><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs set sync=disabled work<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs set sync=disabled work\/nfs<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs set sync=disabled work\/nfs\/ligo<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs get -r sync work<\/p><p>NAME PROPERTY VALUE SOURCE<\/p><p>work sync disabled local<\/p><p>work\/.nza-reserve sync disabled inherited from work<\/p><p>work\/CIFS sync standard local<\/p><p>work\/nfs sync disabled local<\/p><p>work\/nfs\/ligo sync disabled local<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zpool iostat | head -n 3 &amp;&amp; zpool iostat -v work 5 | egrep 'mirror'<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/li><li>I attempted to add a new mirror from the old ZIL and the new SSD, but this failed (presumably because the old ZIL was still a part of the pool):<br><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zpool add work log mirror c4t5000CCA0A9714101d0 c4t58CE38EE20F2668Ad0<\/p><p>invalid vdev specification<\/p><p>use '-f' to override the following errors:<\/p><p>\/dev\/dsk\/c6t58CE38EE20F2668Bd0s0 is part of active ZFS pool work. Please see zpool(1M).<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zpool add work log mirror c4t5000CCA0A9714101d0 c4t58CE38EE20F2668Ad0 -f<\/p><p>cannot open '-f': no such device in \/dev\/dsk<\/p><p>must be a full path or shorthand device name<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zpool add -f work log mirror c4t5000CCA0A9714101d0 c4t58CE38EE20F2668Ad0<\/p><p>invalid vdev specification<\/p><p>the following errors must be manually repaired:<\/p><p>\/dev\/dsk\/c6t58CE38EE20F2668Bd0s0 is part of active ZFS pool work. Please see zpool(1M).<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/li><li>Instead of trying to create a new mirror, I added the new SSD to the existing SSD ZIL that was still active in the pool (inspired by <a href=\"https:\/\/askubuntu.com\/a\/1303462\/931761\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/askubuntu.com\/a\/1303462\/931761<\/a>), which properly added the mirror:<br>zpool attach work c4t58CE38EE20F2668Ad0 c4t5000CCA0A9714101d0<br>zpool status work<\/li><li>I renabled syncing:<br><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs set sync=standard work\/nfs\/ligo<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs set sync=standard work\/nfs<\/p><p>admin@stor-nas02b:~# zfs set sync=standard work<\/p><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":106,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:59.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:59.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

                    <\/li>\n                                                <\/ol>\n                    <\/div>\n                    <h1 id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-rtdb-producti-1\" class=\"pagetitle\">\n                                                <span id=\"bkmrk-ligo-%3A-rtdb-producti-2\">\n                            Ligo : RTDB production RAID configuration\n                        <\/span>\n                    <\/h1>\n                <\/div>\n\n                <div id=\"bkmrk-created-by-bryce-cou\" class=\"view\">\n                    <div class=\"page-metadata\">\n                        \n        \n    \n    \n        \n    \n        \n        \n            Created by <span class=\"author\"> Bryce Cousins<\/span> on Aug 23, 2021\n                        <\/div>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-loosely-following-ht\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>Loosely following <a href=\"https:\/\/linuxhint.com\/install-zfs-centos7\/\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/linuxhint.com\/install-zfs-centos7\/<\/a><\/p><ul><li>Install the ZFS repo:<br>yum install <a href=\"http:\/\/download.zfsonlinux.org\/epel\/zfs-release.el7_9.noarch.rpm\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/download.zfsonlinux.org\/epel\/zfs-release.el7_9.noarch.rpm<\/a><\/li><li>Edit \/etc\/yum.repos.d\/zfs.repo to disable DKMS repository and enable kABI repository<\/li><li>Install ZFS<br>yum install zfs<\/li><li>Enabled ZFS services:<br>systemctl enable zfs.target<br>systemctl enable zfs-mount.service<\/li><li>Restart<\/li><li>Attempted to create ZFS pool, but failed since drives were still associated with an mdadm array:<br><p># zpool create rtdb-zfs raidz2 nvme0n1 nvme1n1 nvme2n1 nvme3n1 nvme4n1 nvme5n1<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme0n1 is in use and contains a linux_raid_member filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme1n1 is in use and contains a linux_raid_member filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme2n1 is in use and contains a linux_raid_member filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme3n1 is in use and contains a linux_raid_member filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme4n1 is in use and contains a linux_raid_member filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme5n1 is in use and contains a linux_raid_member filesystem.<\/p><\/li><li>Clearing drives:<ul><li>wipefs failed since drives were still active:<br><p>wipefs --all \/dev\/nvme0n1 \/dev\/nvme1n1 \/dev\/nvme2n1 \/dev\/nvme3n1 \/dev\/nvme4n1 \/dev\/nvme5n1<\/p><p>wipefs: error: \/dev\/nvme0n1: probing initialization failed: Device or resource busy<\/p><\/li><li>The devices were not in use:<br><p>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# lsof | grep -i nvme{0-6}<\/p><\/li><li>Forced wipefs succeeded:<br><p>wipefs --all --force \/dev\/nvme0n1 \/dev\/nvme1n1 \/dev\/nvme2n1 \/dev\/nvme3n1 \/dev\/nvme4n1 \/dev\/nvme5n1<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme0n1: 4 bytes were erased at offset 0x00001000 (linux_raid_member): fc 4e 2b a9<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme1n1: 4 bytes were erased at offset 0x00001000 (linux_raid_member): fc 4e 2b a9<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme2n1: 4 bytes were erased at offset 0x00001000 (linux_raid_member): fc 4e 2b a9<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme3n1: 4 bytes were erased at offset 0x00001000 (linux_raid_member): fc 4e 2b a9<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme4n1: 4 bytes were erased at offset 0x00001000 (linux_raid_member): fc 4e 2b a9<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme5n1: 4 bytes were erased at offset 0x00001000 (linux_raid_member): fc 4e 2b a9<\/p><\/li><li>zpool-create still failed:<br><p>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# zpool create rtdb-zfs raidz2 nvme0n1 nvme1n1 nvme2n1 nvme3n1 nvme4n1 nvme5n1<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme0n1 is in use and contains a unknown filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme1n1 is in use and contains a unknown filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme2n1 is in use and contains a unknown filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme3n1 is in use and contains a unknown filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme4n1 is in use and contains a unknown filesystem.<\/p><p>\/dev\/nvme5n1 is in use and contains a unknown filesystem.<\/p><\/li><li>lsblk showed the drives were still associated with raid. Confirmed with mdadm. Stopping the mdadm array succeeded:<br>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# mdadm --detail --scan<br>ARRAY \/dev\/md\/<a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>:0 metadata=1.2<br>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# mdadm --stop \/dev\/md\/<a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>\\:0 <br>mdadm: stopped \/dev\/md\/<a href=\"http:\/\/rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">rtdb-01.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a>:0<br><p>[root@rtdb-01 bfc5288]# zpool create rtdb-zfs raidz2 nvme0n1 nvme1n1 nvme2n1 nvme3n1 nvme4n1 nvme5n1<\/p><p><br><\/p><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Creating subvolumes with appropriate permissions (100000 for standard LIGO\/IGWN users; 80013 for rtdb_superusers group) (related: <a href=\"https:\/\/unix.stackexchange.com\/a\/381078\/382668\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/unix.stackexchange.com\/a\/381078\/382668<\/a>):<br>zfs create rtdb-zfs\/admin<br>chgrp 80013 \/rtdb-zfs\/admin\/<br>chmod g+rwsx \/rtdb-zfs\/admin\/<br><br><p>zfs create rtdb-zfs\/user<br>chgrp 100000\/rtdb-zfs\/user\/<br>chmod g+rwsx \/rtdb-zfs\/user\/<\/p><\/li><\/ul>\n                    <\/div>\n\n                                        \n                                                      \n                <\/div>             <\/div> \n            <div id=\"bkmrk-document-generated-b\" role=\"contentinfo\">\n                <section class=\"footer-body\">\n                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on Jul 12, 2023 10:22<\/p>\n                    <div id=\"bkmrk-atlassian\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.atlassian.com\/\">Atlassian<\/a><\/div>\n                <\/section>\n            <\/div>\n        <\/div>     \n","priority":107,"created_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:59.000000Z","updated_at":"2023-08-15T15:23:59.000000Z","created_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"updated_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"draft":false,"markdown":"","revision_count":1,"template":false,"owned_by":{"id":6,"name":"mkh5089","slug":"mkh5089"},"editor":"","tags":[]}"

id=\"bkmrk-%28resolved-as-of-2021\" class=\"wiki-content group\">\n                    <p>(RESOLVED as of 2021-06-14, see <a href=\"2021-06-Resolving-Foreman-DHCP-issues_100532322.html\">2021-06 Resolving Foreman DHCP issues<\/a>)<\/p><p><br><\/p><p>During system update preparation, comp-ex-0186 was unsubscribed from Foreman's production activation key and subscribed to the development and QA activation keys, which removed the server's Host object from Foreman. So, the Host needs to be recreated to be added back to Foreman to be managed again.<\/p><ul><li>Following <a href=\"Provisioning-LIGO-servers_63111169.html\">Provisioning LIGO servers<\/a>: cleared ex-0186 subscriptions and removed it from Foreman with hammer-cliRe-registering ex-0186 with Foreman: this is required since it was re-subscribed to the dev\/QA AK.<ul><li>Started creating a new Host on Foreman with same OS and interfaces:<ul><li>Interfaces:<ul><li>em1<ul><li>MAC address:&nbsp;a8:99:69:8c:cb:36<\/li><li>IPv6 address: fe80::aa99:69ff:fe8c:cb36<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>em2<ul><li>MAC address: a8:99:69:8c:cb:38<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>But Foreman fails due to:<br>DHCP conflicts removal for <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a> task failed with the following error: ERF12-0635 [ProxyAPI::ProxyException]: Unable to delete DHCP entry for a8:99:69:8c:cb:36 ([RestClient::BadRequest]: 400 Bad Request) for proxy <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:9090\/dhcp\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu:9090\/dhcp<\/a><ul><li>This is apparently a bug with Foreman v1.15.3 based on <a href=\"https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19634\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/projects.theforeman.org\/issues\/19634<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/theforeman\/foreman\/pull\/4555\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/github.com\/theforeman\/foreman\/pull\/4555<\/a><\/li><li>Full traceback on Foreman from \/var\/log\/foreman\/production.log:<br>2021-06-02 17:52:58 5d304735 [app] [I] should just be one)<\/li><li>3 nodes down for hardware<\/li><li>3 nodes unable to connect to foreman or initiate puppet run.<ul><li>Note: the only common denominator between these nodes is that they all have been freshly rebuilt from Foreman (49 and 165 due to motherboard replacements; 186 was rebuilt as a QA compute node)<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>3 nodes not syncing to foreman<ul><li>this was a cert issue. There were no certs for the servers on Foreman, while all other compute nodes had a cert for their hostname, e.g.:<br>[root@foreman01 bfc5288]# puppet cert print <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><br>Error: Could not find certificate for <a href=\"http:\/\/comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">comp-ex-0186.gwave.ics.psu.edu<\/a><\/li><li>We proceeded with these steps to clear and generate new certs: <a href=\"https:\/\/stackoverflow.com\/a\/40041639\/9161344\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/stackoverflow.com\/a\/40041639\/9161344<\/a>. After signing the cert requests and running puppet on the client servers, the three nodes were synced with Foreman again.<\/li><li>We expect that this was due something occurring on Foreman during the reboot, since Foreman was rebooted and nothing changed on the client-side during the outage.<br><ul><li>We think that since these three servers having been rebuilt, their new hostname certs had not been persisted to disk on Foreman. So, after we rebooted Foreman for the outage, those certs must have been lost and needed to be regenerated.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>So, we should consider rebooting Foreman again and see if we get the same issue.<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>stashcache provisioning<ul><li>check that the Foreman PXE boot spoof is similar to that of the RTDB<\/li><li>check sda disklabel, partitions, etc. Also specify the sda disk for \/boot<\/li><li>check NAT01 httpd server which may be needed to serve the SL7 image<\/li><\/ul><\/li><li>Actions<ul><li>documentation based on the outage. For Foreman: make a checklist for rebooting (e.g. systemctl services, puppet functionality, etc.)<\/li><li>continue stashcache provisioning<\/li><li><a class=\"confluence-userlink user-mention\" data-username=\"mrg225\" href=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\/display\/~mrg225\" data-linked-resource-id=\"558920\" data-linked-resource-version=\"1\" data-linked-resource-type=\"userinfo\" data-base-url=\"https:\/\/confluence.int.aci.ics.psu.edu\">MYLES R GOODWIN<\/a> look into NAT01 httpd server<\/li><li>fix provisioning documentation<ul><li>make clear the order of new foreman role creation: create host group, create partition table (and associate it with the SL7 OS) (I think a new Provsioning Template isn't needed), start host creation, somehow get the MAC address (like from Myles' Foreman discovery image) and enter MAC address into host, finish host creation<ul><li>check the PXE kickstart for the server via <a href=\"https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/unattended\/provision?spoof=10.136.29.245\" class=\"external-link\" rel=\"nofollow\">https:\/\/foreman01.gwave.ics.psu.edu\/unattended\/provision?spoof=10.136.29.245<\/a><\/li><li>attempt PXE boot<\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><p>*** &lt;2022-05-09 Mon&gt;
